text: bottle. hazy dark golden color with frothy head. aroma is wheat, banana, citrus and resin. semi sweet taste, but slightly bitter aftertaste. med-full bodied. lively carbonation. hidden abv. highly drinkable
Bottle, 50 cl @ O¬íConnor¬ís, Uppsala. Nice Weisse, not too sweet and with some bite in it.

A light amber beer with a fruity aroma. Refreshing melon and peach taste with hops. Moderately sweet. Very nice, I could drink this all day in the summer.

500 ml Bottle. First beer I didn¬ít finish for a long time.
Pours with a claudy dark, gold with a very nice white head. Nose is yeast, wheat and soe citurs. Taste of lots of hops, cereals and yeast. Huu not my beer.

From tap at Naiv, Frankfurt. Pours slightly hazy pale amber with a long lasting off-white head. Aroma of hop, malt, floral and fruit notes, apricot, orange, and peach, and alcohol. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, average carbonation. Finish is very dry, slightly bitter and fruity.

Hazy dark orange color with white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity and banana. Taste is medium sweet with some alcohol finish. Very nice weissen bock. You can get different notes everytime you taste it. Good.

It¬ís pretty yummy. Smells floral and a little burnt orange rind, with a lighter amber pour than we expected. The taste is a little wheaty but more malty- very clean and refreshing, and a little piney. Only slight hop bitterness towards the end. Good for washing down late night post scan Popeyes and cuddling with your booboo.

Bardzo dobre, nieoczywiste piwo. W aromace czuƒá ananasa, cytrynƒô, ale te≈º nuty jasnego chleba. W smaku jest s≈Çodkie, chlebowo-owocowe, praktycznie bez goryczki i o ≈õrednim wysyceniu. Bardzo pijalne, ale nie przypomina a≈º tak bardzo ko≈∫laka.

20170506 HOME; 50 cl Bottle; BB 05.01.18; bottle date 05.01.17. Beer with a nice good white foam layer. Colour is yellow-orange with a fine cloudiness. With more yeast and proteins the beer becomes even light amber. Aroma is malty (even some wheat) with light citrus-like hoppiness and some yellow fruit. Taste is somewhat malty (even slightly biscuit like) with some sweetness. After a very small sourness starts the hop bitter which becomes light dry. Besides this also yellow fruit with e.g. citrus like tones.

Bottle from Whole Foods in Upper Arlington: cloudy amber with sturdy white head. aroma of yeasty, fruity, grass. tastes are along those lines with light banana, clove. wheat, citrus, peach, light hoppy. none of the abv. creamy palate. pretty great.

Pours with a good amount of white foam. Color is that of typical wheat beer. Earthy and fruity aroma has banana, pine needles, forest ground, rainwater, slight hints of vanilla, cream and some other aromas. The aroma is complex. Palate is soft and rich, but not too rich. It literally massages one¬ís mouth. Sweet and hot milk -like taste has hot milk, some bitterness from hops, dates, some mint, rainwater, tea with honey and milk. The taste is also complex. A very excellent wheat beer that becomes a favorite and is highly recommended.

From decervecitas. In Bavaria glass. Watching Los Soprano 6x12-13. Really refreshing and original, with lots of fresh and addictive grassy, even flowerly, hops that completely hide its high ABV. Great price!

Bottled @ El Gran Sol, Tenerife. Pours deep golden with huge head. Vivid, strong hoppy, honey, spicey aroma with the same notes in taste finishing in long lasting, sweet finish. Heavy on body, softly carbonated. Complex, delicious beer.

Flot hvede√∏l med gyldenfarve og flot langt hvidt skum. Duften er indbydende med banan, g√¶r, citrus, gr√¶s og en smule eksotisk frugt. Smagen g√∏r mig forvirret. Overdreven s√∏dme fra hvedemalt og humlen. Bitterheden er for svag til at give modspil. Fremst√•r parfumeret.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Lovely, essential beer... I¬ím just a young beer nerd but I¬íve had nothing similar! An interplay of wheat with a slew of fruity tones. The only thing missing for me is a bit of bitterness to offset that, perhaps a little on the perfume side. But that this beer is refreshing as all heck

Ar: Lemon and peach, with a touch of banana, black pepper, and clove; sweet, airy, doughy malt, nice fresh-bread accent. Ap: Clear gold; large white head, looks like whipped egg whites; good retention, leaving big, glassy bubbles. T: Lemon and orange hops; mingles with a low sweetness and a smooth banana flavor; fresh malt, light and airy; medium-low bitterness; finish has cloves and more banana, with a touch of peach skin and some chalkiness. P: Medium body with high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: A very well-done strong wheat ale; the lemon notes from the hops are nice, mingling nicely with the firm banana and spice flavors and aromas.
Bottle. Cloudy amber, offwhite head. Aroma has yeast, light banana and fruity hops. Sweet flavour, yeasty, fruity.

Nice label but not all information on the bottle.
Cloudy amber beer with nice fine cream-colored head, smell is fruity, hoppy, fizzy, taste is also hoppy, very good, not bitter, hops are dominated, 
(I have 0.5l bottle with filling date 16.11.16 and best-before 16.11.17)

Bottle. Hazy orange beer with small, durable white head, good lacing. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, grapefruit, grape, clove, some soap, yeasty. Taste is medium sweet and bitter, fruits, cloves, some soap, spices. Medium+ body, quite oily texture, average carbonation. Very unusual and tasty weizenbock.

500 ml served in Wei√übier glass. Pours pale golden with Weizen typical foam head. Complex aroma. Grapefruit, lemon, papaya, maple syrup, mango. Fruity, hoppy bitter and sweet taste. Lively carbonated. Normal Weizenbier texture. Medium body. Long lasting fruity aftertaste, bitter finish. Very refreshing! Alcohol well hidden. Overall can be described as an Weizenbier/Pale Ale crossover. Very interesting and great! I like it even more than the Aventinus of Schneider Wei√üe.

Hazy orange golden coloured beer with a fine, white, medium to big sized, good lasting head. Aroma of grain, fresh hops, tropical fruits, mango. Taste of fruity orange, bitter almond, grapefruit, wheat medium sweet medium bitter overall. Quite light bodied for the abv, average carbonation, sticky texture. Lovely and lighthearted Weizen Bock.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden with a white head. The aroma is lightly hoppy with citric fruits along with sweetish malt. Medium to full body with a medium carbonation a medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor is malty (sweet grains, honey) with nice hoppy notes (oranges, some bitterness), spices and some alcohol.

citrus, cereal, heavy cloying sweetness, thick feel, full body, 
pale, golden, hazy,

Bottle in cologne germany. Hazy orange with white head. Heavy spice, with clove, also boozy citrus. Much hoppier than the original. Good bite. Slightly tart. Medium full body. Good, a twist on the original.
i just love this beer since first time i tasted it. i made a few month pause, and when i tasted it again, it was like meet again old love. subjective.

0,5l bottle. Thick hazy dark orange colour with long lasting white head. Aroma: Oh my. A pine, fresh citrus aroma dominates but you can smell a hiding but recognisable smokey (ham) tone. With some time the soft banana, yeasty caracter shows itself. Not harsh overall but very complex. Taste: Oh my again. A sweet (biscuit, pineapple juice) start, with malty caracter but the hoppy tone rules the overall feel. Has a lots of herbs and spices in the sip. The mouthfeel is hoppy but isn¬ít getting too bitter, moderate. Has a soft and silky texture. Medium body with soft carbonation. Long, very gentle, bitter/sweet finish. It¬ís like a 75% IPA mixed with 25% Hefeweizen. Amazing beer.

Dark golden, only slightly hazy. Big and frothy white head, good retention and lacing. Aroma has citric and apple notes among a soft yeasty base, plus the slightest spiciness. Taste shows dough/white bread, wonderfully refreshing citric notes, green apple, slight clove. Finish shows a hint of herbal bitterness. Average sweetness and bitterness, incredibly balanced for a weizen. Medium bodied with classic weizen carbonation, which means smooth and refreshing; most notably, this does not feel at all like a weizenbock, the abv is incredibly well hidden. Overall, this may not be super complex but it just drinks so quickly and smoothly. The epitome of refreshing
Clear golden liquid with white head. Hay, flowers, soap. Tastes same, caramel, medium sweet, light+ bitter, light sour. Medium body, average carb, astringent.

Aroma: citrus, raw apple, mold, straws. Appearance: golden, clear, rocky head, white foam, lasts. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, bitter, astringent,
Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma of citrus a little soapy wheat, Taste is spicy, citrus, malty, caramel, bitterish, refreshing. Alcohol well hidden.

Bottle, 0.5l. Hazy orange pour with three finger soapy white head. Pretty good retention. Absolutely beautiful smell, bursting with hops, earthy, lots of citrus, slightly grassy. This is shaping up to be something really special.

Medium body with regular carbonation, maybe a bit on the soft side. Medium texture. Taste is nicely balanced, there¬ís the malt sweetness, hoppy bitternes and a bit of tart notes thrown into the mix. Has more characteristics of an APA rather then hefe, but still has that grassy, herbal mouthfeel. Really nice. Aroma of malts, slight caramel, hops, citrus, grass, earthy. Peppery. Fruity notes. Subtle sweetness on the tongue. ABV is not noticeable, very smooth brew, refreshing and easy drinking. Average finish, a bit dry, pleasantly hoppy bitter.

Overall, very tasty.

Yellow color, huge head. Smells banana and mango, grassy floral hops - very strong smell. Intensive taste, medium to high bitterness, low to medium dryness, citrus, alcohol notes. Long aftertaste. Very impressive.

Bottle. (As Schneider & Brooklyner Hopfen-Weisse) Murky Cloudy Orangey Brown in colour. Malty; wheat malts, caramel. Fruity; lots of orange citrus, banana. Yeasty. Spicy; coriander and cloves. Hoppy; grassy hops. Warming alcohol. Wheaty citrus fruit spicy throughout. Fairly sweet. Finishes quite dry. A rather hoppy Weizenbock. Nice Beer! (2011-03-12)

Bottle from Erzengel. Cheers, Gabriel! Aroma: Banana, cloves, bread, light sulphur. Appearance: Pale body, low head. Taste: Lightly hoppy, bananas, cloves, light alcohol. Palate: Sweet finish, low carbonation, medium body.

Cloudy and murky yellow pour into New Glarus Hefe glass. Aroma is lemons, cloves and bananas. Spicy and musty basement aroma. Earthy and some ginger in the flavor. Long grainy and mildly spicy finish.

Aroma is spicy, earthy hops, wheat, fruity, it smells good. Appearance is brownish gold, white head, hazy. Taste is spices, fruity, wheat, barnyard, tart, nice. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, spicy wheat dry aftertaste. Overall, much different from the Aventinus, but still decent nonetheless.

500mL bottle. Pours hazy gold with a large frothy white head. Aroma is wheat, clove, honey, coriander, spice, grassy hops, and a little soap. Taste is honey, sweet caramel, spice, banana, yeast, wheat, light soap, and faint citrus. Bitter, grassy hop finish. Initial sweetness is well-balanced. Full body. Moderate carbonation. Keg @Schneider Weisses Brauhaus, Munich. 03-08-2016.

On tap. more hoppy than expected, the happiest heffe, ever. the bitterness explode in your mouth like and ipa.

50cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Wazig oranje met witte schuimkraag. G: Sinaasappelschil, koriander, citroensnoepjes en florale toetsen. S: Tropisch fruitig, licht kruidig, banaan, en een licht hopbittertje. Wat alcoholwarmte. M: Gevaarlijk doordrinkbaar met medium carbonatie.

IT pours like liquid sunshine, rich golden and a brilliant crisp head, The mouthfeel is full and rich of billowing sugars, but I noticed a sharp tart edge on it that just brought it back a bit. What a delightful beer.
Golden, hazy. Fruity, sweet aroma with loads of coriander. Palate medium, low carbonation. Tropical fruit, vanilla husk and a nice estery semi-dry finish. Very well brewed, a great one.

50cl bottle from biere-import. Hazy dark gold color. Thin to medium white head. Light to medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium body. Aroma and flavour is hops, spices, banana, caramel, alcohol, vanilla, malt.

Bottle. Dark hazy yellow/orange. Huge head with great lacing. Aroma of floral hops, grass and lemons. Just a small hint of yeast and banana. Taste is lemons, oranges, malt, a tiny dose of bananas and a very long and bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel with good carbonation. Very refreshing, very balanced, very satisfying. Alcohol is extremely well hidden. A unique Weizenbock that is equal parts dangerous and awesome.

500 ml bottle from Greenwhich Union. Pours cloudy dark orange with plenty of yeast floating, head is small, white. Very nice aroma, mostly tropical fruits with a hint of alocohol. Taste is mostly of ripe fruits, sweet on the tounge and lingering umami on the palate. Heavy, full-bodied beer. Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 First time on tap at Szimpla, Berlin. At time of the review at home, 50 cl. bottle. Cloudy and even a bit murky dark yellow (near to orange) with a frothy and long lasting white head. Aroma is tropical fruits (especially mango and banana), floral hops, citrus, honey -- its smell is very strong and very nice even though it is much too ¬ísweet¬í. Taste is spicy and fruity at the same time (ripe fruits of course, almost ¬ímuch too ripe¬í): mostly bitter with sweet notes and it is also possible to taste the alcohol. It burns a bit. What a sharp beer. Palate is very satisfying though. You really feel satisfied when you drink this. It is almost full bodied (or medium to full) and oily to creamy textured. Carbonation is average. Finish is long. Is there a such thing as ¬ísour bitterness¬í? If there is, this is it. I am a Weizen Bock fan, and this is really a strong one. Not my everyday drink but when I want to ¬ífeel¬í it (I don¬ít know what is ¬íit¬í) I would prefer to drink this one. Yeah baby. I am a bit drunk now. :D

Aroma forte
Espuma fraca
Sabor levemente picante
Colora√ß√£o densa amarelada... turva

0.5 l bottle from Alko somewhere in Finland. Appearance is dark yellow, cloudy and with a nice head. Aroma has tar. Taste is sweet combined with tar. Does not taste hoppy in a usual way and no bananas either. Luckily I¬ím Finnish so I don¬ít mind the taste of tar. Interesting....but in a good way.

Aroma is bananas and a lot of hoppy grassines, floralness and citrus. Pours lively yellow with frothy head but not the best retention. In taste malty/wheaty, yeasty, spicy (cloves), with strong hoppiness which adds citrusy and grassy flavors. Heavy yet somehow crisp, ends with moderate grapefruity bitterness. Full body, rather high carbonation, decent drinkability, minimal alcohol touches. All in all the massive amount of hops provides a surprising, but very interesting and tasty twist. The grassiness/herbs/flowers are slightly overbearing, but nevertheless it¬ís neat.
Bottle @ home. Aroma of banana, wheat malt and flowery hops. Hazy amber with lasting white head. Taste is light bitter and moderate- sweet. Medium body, oily feel, banana/hoppy finish.

(bottle)
Aroma:peach,citrus fruit,banana
Appearance;yellow color,very hazy,medium-sized dense white head.
Taste:medium dry,flavour of banana,peach,citrus fruits,dry finish.
Palate:medium body,quite silky,medium caronation.
Overall:Nice one,i don¬ít taste the abv at all,tastes like strongly-hopped saison.

Hazy yellow color with big frothy head. Aroma of hops, citrus, grapefruits, spices and wheat. Malty taste with bread, citrus, herbs, little yeast and spices. Strong wheat beer that is easy to drink yet rich in flavor. One of the best Germans i have ever had from an amazing brewery, they never disappoint. Prost!
Excellent bubble with low clarity which tells me this has lots of protein with it. Great beer overall.

$4.99 pint+ bottle from World Market, CHO. Pours hazy deep golden/light orange with a large golden head. Aroma is wet dog, citrus, grasses, banana. Taste is orange juice, bitter grasses, yeast, toasted crust. Not my favorite.

Botella en una @Cata. 16/10/16 BBD:27/06/17
Color amarillo, sabor trigo, citrico, lupulo, rica.
50cl bottle. A little too much hop for my taste, but it¬ís not bad at all! The Schneider Brewery always surprises me!

14/20 such an unusual beer, big taste of bananas, initial taste a bit odd but nice aftertaste. Strong. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy orange-golden with a white, well-retaining head. Impressive amount of sediment suspended throughout the beer. Citrus, banana, and a hint of clove on the nose. Heavy mouthfeel for the style. Mild carbonation. Citrus flavor dominates and persists through to the finish. Banana notes as well. Fruity sourness attempts to compete with the sweetness.

[backlog] 07-11-15 // 500ml bottle at home. Pours a murky dark orange beer. Hoppy nose. Strong yeasty body, with some banana. But then overweighs a nice tropical fruity hoppiness. Light bitter. Complex and really good.

bottle. Hazy orange with medium white head. Aroma: citrus, grape, banana, yeast, bubblegum. Taste: citrus, honey, forest fruit, juicy. Medium to full body. Dry finish. Good bitterness and fresh hoppiness make it very interesting beer.

Piwo lekko metne w zlotym kolorze z biala dosc trwala piana. W aromacie sa dojrzale owoce jak mango, brzoskwinie i cytrusy. W smaku jest na pewno dosc slodko i karmelowo, sa banany, pomarancze i drozdze. Wysycenie i goryczka na srednim poziomie. Alkohol pimimo sporej dawki wogole niewyczuwalny. Bardzo dobry przedstawiciel swojego gatunku.

Translucent, nearly opaque matte golden yellow with a mid sized white head that dissipates abruptly. Potent aroma with notes of peach, orange, citrus, yeast, caramel, and hops. Full bodied and eminently smooth. Initial taste is fruit forward peach and orange coalescence with perhaps vanilla as well, and finish is a rather sweet citrus vanilla flavour accompanied by a slight hop. Robust and flavourful, but slightly too sweet and malty for my liking.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 1st February 2017 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a rather dull and cloudy orange copper colour with a two finger white head that had decent retention and eventually settled to a thin creamy layer and left nice lacing. Aromas were strong floral and herbal notes with orange pith and orange peel and a touch of bready malts. Tastes quite similar to the aroma with strong orange pith and orange juice flavours followed by grapefruit, floral, herbal and grass with a hint of spice, mango and bitterness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall I can see why others might enjoy Tap 5, but for me, I¬ím on the fence with this one; maybe even leaning slightly towards buying it again as it is very easy to drink and does not feel anywhere near the 8.2% abv. My main conflict was the strong floral aromas and flavours which were not my favourite.

Keg @ Salt Horse, Edinburgh. (Ratings backlog) - Pours orange and hazy. Nose is tropical fruits, heavy lilt vibes. Taste is more hoppy than i expected from the nose big resin, orange, toffee, spicy, pepper, banana, cloves also a touch of smoke right at the back end.

Deep hazy golden orange pour. Thick and attractive lasting head - bright white. 

Aroma is straight forward citrus and alcoholic fruit. Complex wheat. Mango. Alcohol. 

The first thing I taste is medium alcohol followed by a crisp bitterness. Very appealing flavor - there¬ís a lot there.

Very easy to drink - light clean feeling on the palate. 

Great beer, will certainly drink it again.

Orange color with haze and long head. Interesting hoppy aroma with notes coming from the wheat: clove and fruity. Balanced taste, maybe a bit sweet. Medium body with a really nice mouthfeel. Really good beer.

Deze weizener is zeer bijzonder. In het aroma komen koriander, citroenschil en mout sterk door. Deze zaken komen ook terug in de smaak, evenals wat kauwgombal, perzik en natuurlijk hop. Door het hogere alcoholpercentage zit er een diepere laag in dit bier dan in de meeste soortgenoten.

Bottle. Very cloudy apricot pour with a white head. Aroma is rich and fruity, citrus, mango, nectarine, some slight alcohol presence. Taste is rich and fruity as well, some tropical fruits, mango, touch of citrus, some spices, slightly herbal as well, lots going on. A really flavourful and complex beer, especially for the style. Easily one of the best German wheat beers I¬íve had.

On tap at Schneider Brauhaus, Muchen. Cloudy yellow color, big persistent lacing creamy white head. Great smell with loads of hops, spices, soap, alcohol. Aroma is unexpectedly resembling a belgian tripel (Chimay) with light fruity notes (plum apricot peach) wheat yeast and spices (nutmeg, cinnamon) abundant hops maybe american lots of dough alcohol (dry-pen) soap/lavender. Taste is well balanced and ends up decisely bitter. Floral long finish mild dry alcoholic. Full body thick texture. This is a double IPA weizen wise, an heavy hit.

Bottle. Pours hazy darker golden thin lacing. Hoppy aroma, cloves, and bready. Medium sweet taste. Light to medium bitter finish. A bit of alcohol present on the tongue. Medium-light body. thin texture, a bit sticky. A strong wheat beer with good flavor, not my favorite type of wheat. .

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Bottle at home. Clody golden, well made, floral in taste. Some forest berrries in the nose, light to moderate bitternes. Very drinkable when chiled properly, especially on hot, sommery days. Would have again every time.

Well made, a little bitter for me. But after north american wheats, these German wheats are amazing. Schneider pub in Munich.¬†

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Schneider Br√§uhaus. Aroma is all hops; smells just like a pale ale. Taste has got a lovely bittersweet pine hop flavour but with plenty of mango and apple from the wheat. This is really lovely, though it probably shouldn¬ít be under weizenbock considering the golden colour and hop forward taste.

De la colaboraci√≥n entre Schneider Weisse(GER) y Brooklyn Brewery(U.S.A) esta ¬ìMeine Hopfenweisse (TAP 5)¬î una cerveza Weizenbock de estilo base con 8.2% de alcohol pero lupulada como si se tratara de un estilo americano, Schneider Weisse es considerada una de las mejores cervecer√≠as fabricantes de cervezas de trigo, muchas de sus etiquetas est√°n en un rango de calificaci√≥n por este beer de 90 a 100, esta cerveza colaborativa es una de ellas, con 99 en estilo y 98 en el general, el estilo b√°sicamente es una Wissen fuerte(ya sea obscura o clara) combinada con el cuerpo de una Bock o en este caso una Doppelbock por el contenido alcoh√≥lico, los l√∫pulos americanos en esta cerveza ser√°n un distintivo √∫nico ya que no es algo com√∫n y el perfil generalmente debe ser maltoso con las propiedades de la levadura fenolica, vamos a probar esta particular Wissenbock.
En apariencia tiene una corona de espuma cremosa, abundante y duradera, de perlas compactas a amplias muy cristalinas, el liquido tiene un incre√≠ble tono dorado claro con bastante turbiedad que causa destellos hacia tonalidades naranjas, la carbonataci√≥n que se puede apreciar es media, el cuerpo en las paredes del cristal es pleno y deja marca.
En el aroma es √∫nica, de inicio se aprecia una buena cantidad de l√∫pulos, dando notas a lima lim√≥n que no es tan com√∫n, mandarina, toronja, ligeramente frutal como a durazno, pi√±a y platano, especias son perceptibles, predominantemente coriandro, las maltas tambien son evidentes y el trigo arroja du car√°cter.
En el sabor a diferencia de cualquier cerveza de trigo alemana destaca primero el l√∫pulo dando aspectos florales a lima lim√≥n que es raro pero no es desagradable, mandarina, durazno, en menor medida herbal, platano tambien se aprecia pero ya lo aporta la levadura y la malta, el sabor del grano aunque no esta en primer plano su sabor no esta tan alejado en intensidad a el l√∫pulo y nos brinda un dulzor para sacar adelante el amargor, hay especias presentes como coriandro que le da cierta frescura, el alcohol llega a estar presente en el paladar y lengua pero no aporta calor en la garganta, el retrogusto es duradero y c√≠trico, alcoh√≥lico que cierra muy bien, una cerveza √∫nica y compleja, que tiene bien merecida su califiicacion en Ratebeer.

Aroma: lemongrass, low esters, almost undistinguishable phenolics. Gentle bread. Pleasant, not overbearing. 
pale, cloudy, white foam, good retention. Taste similar to aroma, more lemongrass taste, gentle hoppy grass taste, low alcohol taste that is not overbearing. Pleasant- very drinkable. light- medium body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long finish that is slightly sweet and low bitterness. 
Overall: A bit different, quite impressive and nicely drinkable.

Color amarillo p√°lido con capa de espuma blanca de m√°s de tres dedos de grosor, muy persistente. Carbonataci√≥n media (no tan alta como en otras cervezas de trigo). Aroma a levadura y jengibre (potente, profundo). En boca sabe a trigo y jengibre (no s√© por qu√©, pero he probado alguna cerveza con jengibre y si bien habitualmente no suelen funcionar, esta cerveza s√≠ funciona, ¬°y de qu√© manera!). 8,2% incre√≠blemente disimulados. Distinta del resto de cervezas de trigo y eso siempre es un plus. Muy disfrutable.
Hefetr√ºbes Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Fruchtig, Zitrus, tropische Fr√ºchte, etwas s√º√ülich, malzig, hefig, sehr s√ºffig.

Kullankeltainen, paksu poreileva vaahto. Houkutteleva tuoksu. Eritt√§in maukas vehn√§olut, ei kitkeryytt√§ havaittavissa k√§yt√§nn√∂ss√§ juurikaan. Todella loistava kes√§- ja terassiolut. Toimi kalan kanssa.

Hazy golden with big white head; aroma is fruity banana with spicy notes from the yeast, a lot of grassy hops; taste is medium to very sweet, very fruity, some spiciness, hops quite strong, oily hoppy spiciness, perfume like, some bitterness in the spicy finish

Bottle bought at maruhn in eberstadt. Light apricot colored. Smells of banana, apricot and hops. Same notes in the aftertaste as well. The overall taste is the full Spektrum of Weizen notes, just a bit heavier on the hops. Great beer for a great price.

Bottle @ Schneider Weisses Brauhaus. Hazy deep gold pour with a creamy white head. Nose is quite fruity. Banana and a bit of clove. Peach and peach fruit salad. Mild grass. Nice estery character. Flavor is well balanced. Fruity and sweet without being flabby or cloying. Mild citrus and grass complements the nutty banana. Bready finish. Medium body, a touch oily. Moderate carb. Good.
Very good brew, remarkably cheap for this kind of complex beer. Outstanding! +++

Fawn head, hazy caramel golden body. Aroma; fresh hops, sweet malts, coriander, clove, ginger, caramel and cinnamon.
Taste; sweet bockish malts, coriander, clove, ginger, caramel and cinnamon, cream and milk notes - some alco on wood. Heavy finish. Solid body. Maybe too tasty. Overwhelming spiciness and sweetness, it¬ís too much, but I assume it¬ís meant to be this way.
[50cl in high weizenglass at Cafe Abseits]

Intense golden color, full of foam with faint yellowish sheen. The aroma is quite sweet, with a malt, caramel, ripe banana, orange, apricot and honey but then hops change the cadence and introduces a torrent of grass and pine intense but not runaway, combined with secondary notes of clove, cinnamon mild flowers and lemon leaf. To a sweet taste spectrum, drawn by the slightly roasted malt with hints of banana and roasted apple and pear memories soft, white grape and honey. From here resuscitate the grass and flowers of hops, with a slight touch of yeast, which give way to a final mixture of citrus, herbs, hot spices, ripe fruit and alcohol, all masterfully assembled and balanced. Bouncing with the warmth of alcohol, leaving robust footprint.

Tap at Schneider weisse brauhaus in Munich. Pours cloudy amber. Aroma of banana and wheat together will double IPA like peach, apricot and citrus. Moderate bitter taste with a touch of sweetness. Nice big juicy mouthfeel. Loved it, my favorite beer from 2016 Munich trip.
World class Weissebier. Has typical banana, peach and tropical aromas. Pours cloudy yellow with a decent size head. The flavours are banana, caramel and floral aftertaste.

Bottle, 500ml. Opaque murky golden/amber with a frothy to minimal offwhite head. Pungent aromas of caramel, floral hops, citrus, honey, peppermint, herbs. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter. Rich hoppy, malty and citrus character into a spicy hoppy finish. Unique and exqusite.

Bottle, 500ml. A cloudy amber beer with a small white head and lots of small sediments. Aromas of citric hops, floral hints and very fresh wheat. Taste is moderately to medium bitter and medium to heavy sweet. Fizzy carbonation, moderate astringency and a nice aftertaste of wheat that is very hoppy.

Bernsteinfarben tr√ºb mit wei√üem Kopf, Aroma stark hopfig mit grasigen und fruchtigen (Kirsche) Hopfenaromen, das Weizenbiertypische Hefe- und Bananenaroma tritt stark in den Hintergrund. Im Geschmack dominiert die fruchtige Hopfennote - eine echte Hopfenbombe. Den hohen Alkoholgehalt sp√ºrt man erst wenn das Genusserlebnis schon vorbei ist. Super !!!

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 DER Stylekracher!!! Geruchlich kommen sowohl die Bananen/Nelkenaromen, als auch die harzig w√ºrzigen Hops gut zur Geltung. Im Mund dann kr√§ftig, schwer, s√§uerlich, angenehm bitter und w√§rmend alkoholisch. Insgesamt √ºppigst aromatisch. Da bleibt keine Knospe verschont üòç.EIN KLASSIKER!!!! Gl√ºcklicherweise mittlerweile f√ºr schlappe 1,20¬Ä bundesweit erh√§ltlich.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Das ist das perfekte Wei√übier. Der Alkoholgehalt ist beim Trinken vergessen. Schmeckt toll nach Zitrusfr√ºchten und Hopfen.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Not the first time I¬ím having this, but the first time rating. Grass and spring-like nose, but the heavy bock is already noticeable. Full body with a creamy soft texture, charming carbonation. Powerful without the ABV becoming too apparent. Sweet palate. Not a beer to drink fast. Good!

50cl bottle. Hazy light golden with a huge white head, couldn¬ít pour the whole bottle in a reasonable time (but I was dining and I was also very hungry). Aroma is wonderful, typical weizen aroma with added hoppy fruitiness, makes me drool. Taste is also good but somehow less "fresh" with maybe a bit too much sweetness. Pleasant finish, fruity aftertaste, light bitterness. Excellent.

Sweet bready malty with notes of banana, wheaty, light citric lemon notes, light spices, fruity finish.

from bottle, poured a deep murky light orange colour with a white head. nose of fresh baked bread, ripe banana, yeast, oranges, peel bitterness, grains, and even a slight peach sweetness. taste has a slight alcoholic notice. tasty weizen beer

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours murky brownish orange. Nose is loads of sweet fruits, even berries, peaches, yeast. Taste is similar sweet and fruity. Solid Schneider but not really my favourite style of weizen. It is a bit odd of being so fruity and sweet. Tap 6 fits my taste better.

500ml bottle. Hazy yellow color with one finger head. Wheat, fresh pineapple, peaches and other tropical fruits aroma. Really powerful and nice. The taste is very similar with the peaches coming out a little more than the rest of the flavors, some cloves, and the tropical fruit. What a good beer.
On tap. Slight foam, no lacing, alcohol presence subdued. Though not sure this is a "98" beer, good to drink and worth the detour. Fits in my range of bitterness, will try again
Bottle. Pale amber color, hazy liquid, white hear. Very nice smell of candied fruit. Aroma of oranges (dominant), yeast, wheat (background). Alcohol is hidden. Great stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Bottle from LCBO. Pours basically opaque murky golden yellow with small off-white head that fizzes away rather quickly. The aroma is, uuh, so nice, wheaty grains and stone fruits, pineapple, mango and peaches, grass, and perhaps even a hint of alcohol. Tastes fruity and malty sweet with very nice tropical fruit and somewhat grassy hop character. Full body, thin but crisp carbonation, malty finish with little lingering grassy-leafy-citric bitterness. So nice, would love to have it again. 

Had a chance to have it again, and it is as good as last time. I¬íve got nothing else to add : )

A german, amber hefe-wei√übier with white head. Aroma is complex yeast, spice, hops, malt, bisquit. Taste is light bitter sweet.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 Pivo nabavljeno preko web-shopa...osobni dojam je da je to kao da je netko spojio p¬öeniƒçno pivo s IPA pivom...
Cloudy beige pour. Smells herbal and complex, tastes herbal and quite yeasty, good hop bite without astringency, well done of course Schneider.

0.5L bottle. Cloudy dark orangey colour with a two finger white head. Aroma is fresh, hoppy, citrus, tropical fruits, grapefruit, banana, spices, little bit of wheat and yeast, there¬ís some sourness too and just a hint of alcohol. Taste is hoppy, citrus fruit flavours, grapefruit, lemon, banana, yeast, cloves. For 8.2% the alcohol is incredibly well hidden. Slightly bitter sour finish. Well carbonated, medium bodied. Great beer.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, dark orange colour with a big, white head. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, caramel and wheat. Taste of grassy hops, tropical fruits like citrus, grapefruit and peaches, caramel and some alcohol. Light sour with a fruity and bitter finish. Full body with medium carbonation. Very good.

0.5l bottle

Dark orange color. Head eventually disappears. Some sediments. Hoppy smell and taste.

Hazy amber with little white head. Aroma is light fruits, grass, citrus, floral hops. Taste is fresh sourness with mild bitterness and not much else. Body is full and the beer has a nice mouthfeel. Overall very good and very refreshing. The hoppiest Weizen I ever had.
How : bottle Appearance : cloudy orange with a medium to small white head. Aroma : ripe apples, floral, caramel, herbs. Palate : medium body, average to low carbonation.
Dark golden appearance with little head. Complex tastes of caramel, wheat, earth and herbs. Heavy body, good carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of tasty hops. Very tasty!

Flasche gekauft bei Bierlieb in Berlin. Orange, fester Schaum 
Riecht sehr fruchtig, Pfirsich, Hopfen, Weizen. Geschmack Orange, Hefe, etwas Banane, ein bisschen Grapefruit. Etwas alkoholisch, etwas bitter.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Bottle LCBO: amber, hazy beer with small white /orange head. Bright aromas of tropical fruits- citrus and pineapple- with grassy hops and spice. Taste is similar with banana. UPDATED: APR 2, 2016 Shared bottle at home. Pours cloudy deep golden with big white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, peaches, citrus, some floral notes, grass and esters. Tastes slightly sweet with balancing bitterness. Medium bodied, slightly bitter finish.
Amazing beer. Strong citrus aroma, alcohol is barely noticeable. Good head retention. Very refreshing.

Pours with a nice but quickly dissipating head, murky orange in color, smells of pineapple and other tropical fruits, banana, some of the alcohol coming through in the nose, or maybe those are the grassy/hoppy aromas? It¬ís well carbonated but full on the palate, the taste is thick, sweet, but with the hops cutting through with some fruit & citrus to balance it out. Overall - delicious!

Aroma of wonderful grassiness citrus. Cloudy orange body with quickly dissipating head. Strong lemony hop taste. Palate fizzy and fruity. Wonderful unique beer to savour. Would be great food pairing with bratwurst and other German fayre.
Aroma og humle i stor stil. Den smager ikke s√• meget af klassisk hvede men er helt forrygende i humlen.
Pretty good bock. Aroma is hoppy; citric, floral. Taste is the same, plus some powerful wheat malt presence. Excellent carbonation balance. In general, what a good bock should be all about.
Bottle at csakajo. Hazy yellow colour with a medium head. Nose is slight grass with some tropical fruits. Taste is slight grass with some tropical fruits. Nice hoppy weizen.

Mooi goudblond troebel bier met oranje gloed en romige witte schuimkraag. Bloemig en fruitig aroma. Lekkere zachte en volle smaak. Een combinatie van witbier en hop. Apart maar heerlijk verfrissend. Perzik, nectarine, beetje sinas, banaan. Warme afdronk, heel licht bittertje. Lekker !!
From bottle, pours murky orange with a white head.¬† Aromas of hops, fruits and citrus.¬† Heavy hop taste with sweet fruits, citrus, banana and a slight bitter finish.¬†¬† Great beer.

Nez: Froment, floral

One of the best beers I¬íve had. Hoppy weiss beer ... it¬ís like a dream come true to me!
Keg at brewdog Edinburgh. Pours hazy orange, nose is pineapple, smoky toffee, taste is similar, light sweetness, tropical.
aroma: banana, moss, forest; cloudy, very heavy for a weizen, high carbonation. Interesting combination of hop+typical weizen taste. Quite unbalanced, but good overall.

Big bottle poured into a 19 oz. pilsner glass. Lovely, cloudy yellow redolent of yeast and wheat. This is a wonderful, full bodied, high ABV and hoppy wheat beer. True enough, it has a bit of the dreaded banana flavor, but also malt, citrus and a mild spiciness. ¬íSpic(K)iness? Damn spell checker gave me an error on ¬íspicieness¬í and ¬íspicyness¬í, either of which seem prefferable to spiciness. And damn it, I like 2 ¬íff¬ís in prefferable. Homogenized piffle! In any event, this is one of the finest weisse style brews I¬íve ever had, showing a slight, but excellent cross-breeding of the traditional stlye with a bit of crafty hopping. On my ¬íA¬í list.

Cloudy ochre, tall dense head leaving a thick film on beer. Aroma of nectar, honey, tropical fruit, melon, blossom. Great. Medium to full body. Oily. The flavour combines the labour of american hops with fruity & spicy yeastiness. Very like a strong wheat IPA. Still it remains a Hefe in profile. An unbeatable thing.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wheat, banana, hops, citrus and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, wheat and banana; ends slightly bitter with hops, citrus and spices.

Overall:

This beer is superbly complex with an interesting mix of flavours. The hops really add a distinct balance to the wheats.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Cerveza de trigo con un estupendo sabor a l√∫pulo, con un punto de amargor muy bueno. Tiene bastante cuerpo y un gas muy fino. Tiene el sabor de las cervezas de trigo alemanas pero con la novedad del amargor. Muy buena. Se bebe muy bien

Weizen Bock meet IPA. I¬íve tried batches where the aroma was simply wonderful and others where there is this grassy my hop are too much or not fresh... The body is consistently malty deliciousness. It is a nice companion to my best friend Aventinus...

This is a fruit juice! I shared a bottle during a beer tasting with friends. Granted - we had already had several fruity beers before this and maybe were getting close to an overdose, but between the 6 of us we were not able to finish 0.5L. It¬ís soo sweet and soo fruity! These are qualities that I usually really like, but this beer showed me that it¬ís possible to overdo it. Too much! The aroma is full of aroma hops with some very spicy (coriander) yeast mixed in. You don¬ít even notice the alcohol beneath this fullscale sensory attack!
This is real weizen + ipa. The combination of hop and yeast is just amazing. It¬ís cheap, it¬ís tasty, it¬ís perfect.

Laranja escura, turva. Espuma abundante e persistente. Aroma c√≠trico e floral, com notas amadeiradas. Sabor √°cido, levemente amargo, com notas de banana, abacaxi, madeira, chocolate e grama verde. Retrogosto amargo com final alco√≥lico.

Bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge. Cloudy, cloudy dark orange, almost ochre. Small white head. Exciting aroma, a mix of the tropical fruit and spice of a Hefeweizen with fresh grassy, floral hop. The hop aroma wins (just). Taste has a bitter/sour kick overriding the sweetness. Sublime... but the the finish is a bit unbalanced and leaves an odd taste in the mouth. Not sure what this beer wants to be, but it¬ís fluidity is its charm. Very, very well done.
Buena cerveza, sabor denso (que no fuerte) y diferenciador. Sabrosa y rica en matices en la boca.

Tap at Watering Hole. Pours a hazy amber gold with a soapy white head. Clove, banana, chocolate and caramel. Some other cinnamon and nutmeg hints as well. Rich and full-bodied with a average carbonation. Sweet, but balanced with a bit of sourness on the finish. Great stuff.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Frisch hopfig fruchtig, hefig. Erscheinung: dunkles, oranges, tr√ºbes Bier, flacher, wei√üer Schaum. Geschmack: Hefig, leicht s√º√ü, angenehm bitter, w√ºrzig. Nachgeschmack: leicht bitter, leicht alkoholisch. Gesamt: hervorragendes Weizen.

Tap @ Schneider Weisses Breuhaus in Munich. Murky yellow/brown colour. Hoppy, wheat aroma. Deep bittersweet orange taste. Fruity, herbal with spicy notes. A bit heavy with hoppy aftertaste. Hoppy strong weizen - very nice.

500ml bottle (thanks Mart). Cloudy orange color. Medium size, bubbly white head, stays. Sweet, orange, citrus, bit of plastic, fruity in aroma. Sweet, wheat, fruity, mango, hops in taste. Sharp dry end. Hops and fruity in aftertaste. Weird but nice. Congratulations martjoobolut for 2000 ratings!
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Wow. Virkelig en l√¶kker og sp√¶ndende √∏l. Tilpas humletsmag. Frisk og indbydende.

Dal colore dorato, molto opalescente e non proprio pulito, con schiuma fine, bianca e persistente. Al naso arriva molto fruttata (banana) e con buone note acidule, di pane bianco e vinose. Al palato √® abbastanza corposa, con una buona carbonazione. In bocca ancora fruttato e con buoni accenni citrici (limone). Finale leggermente amaro.

Hazy golden yellow beer, medium to small white head. Nose is fruity, pineapple, banana, mild spice and hop notes, caramel sweetness. Flavor is banana, wheat, pineapple, spice. Finish is dry and fruity, hoppy bitter. Lingering dryness, hops and fruit, citrus, lemon peel. Unexpected finish, spicy and dry, but this somehow works. Very nice and different.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 Rating 2k. Bottle (from firma bier). Pours golden with whiteish head. The head stays for some moments. Aroma is fruits, citrus, apricots, some sweetness, banana. Flavor is sweet, soapy, fruits, citrus, tropical fruits, mango, peach, apricot, wheat. Finish is dry and citric bitter. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew.
≈öwietne. Zapach i smak powala. Alkohol nie wyczuwalny to dodatkowo wielki plus.

500ml bottle bought at Winerack in Sai Kung.
Looks: Cloudy hazy straw golden honey colour with a lots of yeast particles; Two finger head with crumpety white foam which lasted for 3 minutes; Very good sticky lacing and quite active carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment malt, with strong fresh pineapple, light passion fruits, banana, vanilla, light metallic, caramel, strong wheat and tartness, honey, sugar, strong cloves, cinnamon, spices, strong yeast, lemon and light grass. The nice aroma can be smelt from a foot away.

Taste: Strong sweet moderate malt, with strong pineapple, strong honey, strong molasses, moderate wheaty tartness, strong caramel, light cloves, strong spices, strong yeast, strong lemon, quite strong bitter hops and sharp grass. Wow!

Body: Close to medium body. Slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Pretty strong maltyness in a thick and smooth body. Lots of pineapple ester and honey here as if this is a Heller Bock. Wheatyness is here but took a backseat. Tastable spices, good yeastiness and strong lemon to round. Exciting!

Hoppiness: Strong honey, strong cinnamon and spices, strong lemon and sharp grass in nose and taste; Bitterness is quite strong for a lasting, high astringent sweet-bitter finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Fruity, nice sweet and bitter to mouth.

Comments: This is a totally different beast from Tap 6 Aventinus, but just as brilliant: refreshing pineapples and strong honey aroma and taste, coupled with nice clovey spice, sweetness, solid body and maltyness, and a head strong hoppiness which have you think this is Heller Bock, Marzen and IPA being rolled into one. Great tasting and highly recommended!
From tap at Delerium Amsterdam. Rokerig/kruidnagel weizen gruwelijk lekker. Backlog from 2015/03/22.
He probado las tap de (1-7), esta es mi preferida. Por mucho. Incluso es mi favorita... El sabor se mantiene en tu boca todo el dia

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 From a 500ml bottle om 5/10/2015. Pours a murky greeny brown with almost no head and masses of yeast. The nose features zesty citrus and ripe fruit, spice and hops.In the mouth, there¬ís lots of ripe sweet fruit, particularly banana and pear, bready malt, with lots of spice and nice zesty hop bitterness. The texture i thick and the carbonation soft. Wow. This really is a different and quite brilliant wheat beer - it exhibits great structure, character and complexity. I will definitely be having more of this. Rating 4.2.

Re-rate on 29/5/2016. I¬íve been drinking this regularly. It¬ís now my fave wheat beer bar none. Amazingly refreshing, oh so complex and like no other beer I¬íve had. Truly magnificent stuff.
Opaque light gold, medium white head. Spicy and earthy noble hop aroma - wonderous! Balanced bitter and yeasty Hefe sweet. Finishes warming. Very nice.

Draft. Cloudy dark yellow, very good foam. Aroma: yeast and hops, banana and clove, a little citrus and white porto. Taste slightly sweet, banana and light sweetness, a bit of wine and hop bitterness, very good!

√Åmbar turbio y espuma marfil compacta. Aromas florales, manzana oxidada toque c√≠trico. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce afrutado, ciruela verde, ligero c√≠trico y final de amargor seco moderado con presencia suave de alcohol.

0,5 l. bottle from Beervana. Thank you my beautiful wife, Natalia. Pours a bright but cloudy amber color with a big white frothy head that diminishes slowly and leaves a fine creamy film. Gorgeous, incredible aroma. Intense fruity, yeasty and spicy nose. I get notes of banana, clove, coriander, caradamom, vanilla, guava, loquats and custard apple. German noble hop, herbal, touches with lots of what and bready malts in the backbone. Some bubblegum and a fresh hint of spearmint. Otherworldly. It doesn¬ít get more complex than this without losing balance. Complex fruity and semi-bitter taste. Explosive spiciness in the tongue. Banana and oher ripe fruits like peaches and apricots start unleashing more massive biscuit and cake flavors that show what a massive malty backbone this brew has. Intense but without a trace of booze. Strong, bold retronasal. Medium body but I cannot stress enough how drinkable it is for and 8,2% ABV. Medium carbonation. Incredible. This is a different kind of Weizen Bock. One of the most complex beers I¬íve tried and so incredibly drinkable at the same time. This one is superior than Aventinus. Worldclass German beer from a top brewer!

Maker: Weissbierbrauerei G. Schneider & Sohn, Kelheim, Germany ***
Beer: Schneider Weisse Tap 5 Meine Hopfenweisse (bottled, unfiltered, 500ml) ***
Style: Weizenbock (Imperial Cloudy German Wheat) ***
ALC.VOL.: 8.2% ***

Colour: Hazy deep orange, with a huge, frothy off-white head. ***
Nose: Potent mix of overripe banana, sour citrus and clove. Yeast. ***
Texture: Full body, hardly watery. Modest carbonation. ***
Taste: Fruity at the start: a whole fruit basket of banana, pear, kiwi, melon, with a citric note on top. Alcoholic, too - and increasingly so towards the middle, with banana now dominating the fruit front. Finish is caramel, banana, some lemon, yeast. After taste of moldy banana, caramel. ***

Impressions: Impressive, highly drinkable strong cloudy wheat that blends fruit flavors, hops and the inevitable alcoholic note surprisingly smoothly. A particular recommendation for the friends of the Bavarian "banana wheat" style.

110715. I¬íve had this beer for a while but it is still a few months before the BBD of 13/10/15. Quite a high ABV at 8.2% for a German beer, don¬ít usually see them this high. Had this one sitting around the fire on a cold waters night. Cloudy and hazy looking with a massive head of puffy white foam. 

From the first sip you get a big hit of alcohol. The alcohol dulls whatever other flavours may be there. Strong banana and bubblegum aroma. When I poured the rest of the beer into the glass it was a really dirty muddy brown colour but it eventually settled and cleared.

I didn¬ít really enjoy this as much as I have enjoyed the other Schneider & Sohn beers that I have had, not sure if it as the heavy alcohol taste or what. It was still okay just not great. I bought this bottle from The Wine Emporium at Newstead.

pours a dirty orange with a medium white head and some lacing. sprucy hops in the nose, which transform a typical weizen banana into a pineapple. rather sweet; bock sweetness contrasts nicely with hoppy bitterness. lemon detergent towards the finish. alcohol warmth is rather well hidden, but becomes more noticeable as the beer warms up. very interesting.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2016 Piece of art. Bright orange and cloudy with nice white top. Excellent look! Smell is wonderful, on the nose perfect. Very hoppy. Cloudy orange with white head. Honey, pineapple, banana, caramel and nail polish. Fruity, sweet, tropical fruit and dry finish. Overall: Interesting. Not my cup of tea.

Pours a cloudy dark orange with a frothy white head. Nose is overripe orange, mown lawn, and some malty sweetness. In the mouth, it¬ís sweet with some yeasty banana and clove notes. Some warming alcohol notes at 8.2 ABV. Hoppy flavors are mainly orange and orange zest with some light grapefruit notes. Great complex beer with a nice hop bouquet.

Classic German Weiss beer. Golden with loose foam. Sweet and fine bitterness, creamy and thick mouth feel, strong alcohol. Fine carbonation. Cloves, banana, bubble gum, Mellon, orange and flower honey.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Orange golden color, murky, strong frothy head, nice carbonation. Insane amount of sediment (bold!). Beautiful. A: an intense fruitiness, with grapefruit, orange, some exotic fruits, pineapple and lychee mix, carrot juice, kiwi, faintest hint of lemon. Mixed together with sweet grains. Wow, incredibly inviting. After yeast deposit, beer almost turns dark, and carrot juice becomes more pronounced. T: delicately balanced fruitiness here as well. The bitter elements of each of the fruits is more pronounced, however. Starts with a sweet fruity taste that is borderline fabricated, this improves after the yeast is poured into the glass, fruitiness is really well balanced then. Develops quite an intense bitterness where the bitter tastes from pineapple, kiwi and grapefruit,-all combined in one big amalgam-, hit the palate. Aftertaste is a bit sticky and dry, with a large fruity taste sticking to the back of the mouth. Wow... Absolutely wonderful summer beer. Final note: best when it is served ice cold.

(bottle) Poured the usual orange/brown Weizen colour. Generous persistant head (to be expected since this beer is heavily hopped AND a wheat beer...)
Some citrusy/perfumy hop aromas along with caramel wheat flavours. Muddy yeast combined with subtle banana and like the others wrote, kind of earthy.
I was sceptical about the prospects for this beer, but I should have known that a brewery like Schneider knows what they are doing and was pleasantly surprised. This beer is quite high in ABV, but hides it well as hot alcohol presence was minimal. I never would have thought a bold hop presence would work in a Weizen, yet it does here!

You HAVE to try it.

Sehr sch√∂ne orange-braune opale Farbe mit sch√∂nem Schaum. Fruchtiger Geruch: Tolle Aromen eines IPA und eines Weizenbocks verbinden sich hier: ein Hauch Zitrusfr√ºchte, etwas Banane und Nelke. Dorato intenso, torbida come da stile, con bel cappello di schiuma bianca, non troppo persistente. Stupenda al naso, con le note erbacce e leggermente resinose del luppolo che si sposano a meraviglia con quelle maltate del frumento e con il lievito, che emana aromi molto fruttati, di banana, con spaziatura finale. Bottle, 500mL. Home. A brown orange beer witha medium white head ; medium retention. Fruity aroma (citrus, red berries, blackberry, tropical fruits), herbs, resin ; quince at the end. Medium sweet, dry light bitter ; refreshing ; warming background. Medium body and texture, average crabonation, fruity lasting finish (red berries) ; warming ; light dry. 50 cl bottle. Cloudy pale gold pour with frothy lasting head, fair amount of lacing. Aromas of fresh bread, cellar and ripe banana. Taste is bitter (for weizze), balanced and a bit sour. Medium carbonation with medium body. Aftertaste is bitter and long, finish with sweet and sour. Really nice all-year wheat, if you like hops.

Schneider weisse hopfenweisse

Glowing, slightly hazy, golden color with a decent head.

Offers up a fantastic nose, exhibiting floral notes, slightly herbal grass, clove and a ripe fruitiness of banana and orange peel. Grassy hops are well recognizable among a note of honey and bready yeast. Quite complex and intriguing.

Has a perfectly fitting medium carbonation with a smooth mouthfeel to it, thanks to the pleasantly present yeast.

Tastes of bread, leavy hops and a honey sweetness, balanced by a refreshing, medium hop bitterness. Its fruity flavors blend very well into slightly warming honey and biscuity malts, while the hops really amp up the whole character of the beer, pushing it gently into a floral bitterness, without denying its initial flavors. Finishes sweeter, with honey infused yeast smoothness among pepper and dried orange, hiding its higher abv perfectly.

The hoppiness adds a new dimension to the beer, elevating it into the fuller Saisons-, Tripel category. Throughout enjoyable, versatile on the palate, with a very convincable counterpart to the typical Bock sweetness.
Golden to orange color, hazy, aromas of banana and cloves, amazing head, mouth is sweet but also acid, with banana flavors and some spices.
Bottle. Cloudy straw color, white ice cream cone head. Aroma of banana and clove bubblegum, hint of pine and raisin. Taste is sweet and fruity citrus and banana, light spice. Very tasty.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2016 I love this beer. I drank this beer in the schneider restaurant in Munich. The colour is a copper and trouble. The carbonation is regular. The taste is perfect with good hop and it is tasting something like mango and sweet fruit, a perfect balance. It is a pity not to find easily this beer in Switzerland.
Rated based on notes taken 29 Apr 2012 -- I really liked this wheatbock. Great fruity aromas and flavors, sweet and deliciously balanced.

From the bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow beer with stable head. Nose is sweet grass and hops. Yeast and the typical Bockbier nose in the foreground. Taste is astringent and quite bitter Kind of Hospital taste which is Kind of a bit unpleasent. After all a nice Experiment...

Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber-orange with a soft white head that leaves behind messy lacing. Smells of malts and yeast, orange, light spice. Medium, assertive bitterness that lingers. The bitterness is a nice addition to the wonderful wheat base. Medium bodied and creamy.

Aroma is rose, grapefruit, orange blossom, mango...
Fresh, full-bodied, sizzling, with a bitter ending medium-lasting.
Bottle at home. Pours murky amber. Decent wheat beer, takes a while to get going. Some banana, hint of clove, very easy drinking for it¬ís ABV. Good but Schneider do better.

500 mL bottle. Hazy Orange gold pour, some floating bits. Medium to tall white bubbly head, lots of lacing. Fruity aroma, banana, apple, yeast, bread, cloves. Tastes is fairly spice, cloves, yeast, dough. Medium to light body and carbonation.

On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Pours is dark hazy orange with nog whote head, leaves lacing. Spicy aroma of red orange, peel, citrusy, grapefruit, clove, coriander, curcuma. Taste is citrusy, orange, fruity, slightly bitter, medium sweet, spicy, ginger. Full body, light bitter finish and warm of alcohol.

Pours a murky brownish gold with a moderate eggshell head. Strong spicy, phenolic aromas blend with spicy hops and alcohol to provide a very distinct aroma. Flavours are of clove, cinnamon, orange, wheat, and alcohol. Quite unique again. Finishes off sweet with lingering phenols.

Cor ouro velho, turva. Espuma boa e persistente. Rica em aromas....capim lim√£o....maracuj√°...casca de laranja....espetacular!!! No paladar c√≠tricos....retrogosto levemente amargo. Extremamente refrescante!!!!
Bottle. Extremely hazy, gold color with a really humongous head. Aroma was clove, fruity. Taste was really tasty, roasted grains with hints of spicy clove and fruity banana.

Poured from 500ml bottle. 

Very lightly hazy, bright amber with a 2-finger off-white head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of wheat, banana, cloves, citrus and light bread. 

Taste of cloves, wheat, banana, yeast, citrus, sweet apples, ginger and a touch of pine. Sweet , wheaty, spicy and nice. 

Medium/light body and medium/high carbonization. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orange colored, hazy with some floaters, medium lasting white head. Aroma is strong bubblegum then strong orange citrus, spicy and sweet. Taste is moderate to moderate strong sweet wheat, caramel, banana bread and cloves mixed with a strong and wonderfully refreshing citrus(orange)/sweet fruit/noble hop character with medium bitterness, decent lasting bittersweet aftertaste. Medium bodied yet thick, a bit resiny, medium carbonation. Alcohol barely noticeable only when warm. Just wow! Saphir you say...

Strong yeasty, bready, slightly sour aroma from a murky medium yellow body with a foamy white head. Very bready flavor with the yeast somewhat more subdued. When cold, this wasn¬ít a good taste, but after warming it¬ís much better. Definitely hoppy for a German beer which shows the American influence, but the base is still all German bock. Finishes with classic German malt flavor and lasting but not powerful bitterness along with a bit of banana esters. This gets better and better as you drink it. Happy German Beer Day 2015 everyone!

Cerveja impressionante. Combina caracter√≠sticas de cor, corpo e espuma de uma cerveja de trigo, com aroma de uma cerveja marcada pelo l√∫pulo. Uma cerveja de trigo com amargor suave. Vale a degusta√ß√£o.

Honestly my ultimate beer. There is so much going on here. It¬ís the absolute marriage between what we love in IPAs and Hefeweissen- big hoppy citrus notes coupled with all the sweet bubble gum goodness of a hefeweissen. There aren¬ít too many places to get this in NYC, Der Schwarzer Kolner in Fort Greene, Whole Foods on 2nd Ave., and Brooklyn Beer and soda (sometimes) From the bottle- pours a beautiful hazy deep golden color. Big frothy white head that goes away at a slow rate. The aroma is sublime, with so much nuance. I detect citrus (almost pineapple), floral, fruity notes, with yeasty stuff coming out too. With the hefeweissen hybrid you also get some banana and bubblegum in there too. The taste is equally complex with an excellent balance between the sweetness from the hefeweissen wheat and the bitterness from the heavy hops in the IPA portion of this mind blowing hybrid.Mouthfeel is super smooth with an excellent balance of CO2, it¬ís a thick fizzy beer with a long amazing finish. It really stays of your palate. This beer can stand up to heavily spiced food, but is almost best enjoyed simply by itself.
Party in my mouth! Never tasted anything quite like it. Like all the goodness of an IPA and wheat beer mashed into one flavorful masterpiece.

Fruity beer with strong fruit notes. Semi translucent, with a thick golden color. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from old house, sheffield. Cloudy amber with lots of white particles, fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity banana and clove, with something else I can¬ít place (drunk with a cold). Taste is sweet and slightly sour, finishes with a natural dry bitterness. Prickly carbonation and medium body. Very good.

golden yellow, light brown turpid colour with lot of ferment and small compact head. Smell of hops, plums and lots of bananas. The same is taste. Aftertaste is hoppy with banana notes. This beer is really specific: You adore it or hate it. Overall: complex and delisious beer.

Muito boa, uma das melhores Weiss que ja tomei!!!
Aromas de frutas, com uma do√ßura agradavel na boca, amargor equilibrado e corpo m√©dio.

Hazy golden yellow pour with medium sized off white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, cloves, yeast, citrus, slight caramel and bread dough. Taste of caramel, wheat, yeast, bready, orange peel, banana and slight butterscotch. Full bodied, oily and creamy mouthfeel, perfectly balanced, beautiful carbonation and an orange peel taste on the finish. Brilliant beer, love it!!

Bottle 50cl. Medium creamy head. Hazy dark fruit mash color. Aroma is fruit, apples, banana, wheat. Taste is sweat with rottening fruit and flowers.

stable dense ivorywhite head. murky yellow colour. aroma is cloves, strawberry, banana and citrus. taste like aroma, bit boozy with a rather bitter finish and spicy aftertaste. dense mouthfeel, soft carbonation. delicious! bottle 50cl / bbf nov-2015

Tap at Delirium Amsterdam. Hazy golden with white head. Lots of hop with grapefruit, tropical fruits, orange and pine. Very spicy with cloves. Medium sweet with light bitter finish. Light doughy feel with medium bodied.

Bottle, 0.50l, courtesy of CanCrusher. Murky golden brown color with large creamy white head, fair lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of wheat, grapefruit, ripe fruits, alcohol and herbal hops. Taste starts with sweet and sour grainy with caramel note. follows by ripe fruits, supported by rich malty backbone, spicy and warming mouthfeel and mild bitter finish. Full body, thick texture and average carbonation in palate. Bold, hoppy and tasty...

(Bottle 0.5 l) Trade with McTapps. Thanks. Dirty orange, hazy colour. Off white, medium sized, medium fast falling, a bit creamyhead. High carbonation, medium body, a bit oily texture. Aroma: yeast, banana, strong hoppy, pine, grass Taste: Moderate sweet, malty, caramel, banana, hops . Long moderate bitter finish.

Pours cloudy straw with two fingers of rocky off-white head, good retention and lacing. (4/5) Nose is banana, cloves, yeast, oranges, mild resin. (8/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderate bitter. (8/10) Medium bodied, moderate sustained carbonation and a mild bitter finish. (4/5)

An interesting wheat beer, with lots of characteristic banana and cloves, underpinned by citrus and mild piney resin. The stronger flavours work well to support the higher ABV and prevent it from being intrusive. (16/20)

An old favourite of mine. A big chunky banana hop yeasty milk shake of a brew. Looks great in the glass with its special depth of murky weissen cloudiness. Big hoppy banana weisse-beer aroma...you know exactly what your going get, and then you get more. Despite the big ABV this feels like a beer you want to just scoff, and so you should. The taste is as full of rich flavour as it is ironically refreshing, which, combined with the sumptuous viscosity and depth for this style, lends itself to act like a siren beckoning the thirsty sailors onto the rocks. I would recommend this beer not be drunk at tastings. in order to fully appreciate its experience this ought indulged in; drink at least a whole bottle to yourself.

Cloudy, muddy yellow mustard with a cm of cream, medium-coarseness tan head that fades moderately slowly. Aroma is a bit sweet-sour, some lemon-orange, lavender, honey, hints of mango and pear. Body is oily and somewhat gritty, creamy, medium-light carbonation medium-light burn. moderate coarseness. Flavor is grassy bitterness, some wholesome semi-sweet wheat bread, touch of clove and grapefruit rind with a hint of guava and brown sugar. Good, but not quite up to par with my expectations of the brewer. Perhaps weizen beers are best without the American hops...

Tem um aroma bem gostoso. Amargor na medida. Achei a carbonata√ß√£o muito alta o que prejudicou o conjunto. √â uma cerveja forte e gostosa.

Bottle. Nice orange amber color. Hoppy aroma. Not much head on this one, minimal lacing. Strange beer -- very hoppy, very alcoholic. These aspects dominate and take away from the weisse except for a bit of banana sweetness. Not particularly balanced or smooth. Will get you drunk.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 07.11.2015, pod mosteczkiem. Ladna piana na dwa palce, redukujaca sie dosc szybko do kozuszka tez na dwa, tyle ze milimetry. Barwa - po wymieszaniu sie w wysokiej, pszeniczniakowej szklanicy, umiarkowanie atrakcyjna - szaro-zolta. Fajnie widac za to "warstwowosc" swiezo po nalaniu - rozne odcienie na roznych wysokosciach. Metne. Aromat bedacy fajnym odbiciem tego, co obiecuje browar na etykiecie, czyli sa i banany, i gozdziki, i chmiele i owocowosc lesna i troszke tropikalnosci, i kwiatowo-lakowe aromaty... w smaku czuc wlasciwie wszystko wymienione, a z wrazen specyficznych dla ust a nie nosa glownie slodkosc (bananowa) z kwaskowoscia (pszeniczna) i goryczke (chmielowa). Bardzo pelne piwo, "najadliwe" slodami. Wysycenie dosc wysokie, ale bez przesady w temacie - wiekszosc pszeniczniakow ma wyzsze mam wrazenie. Smaki i aromaty ladnie zbalansowane (poza samym poczatkiem, gdy piwo bylo po prostu za zimne i w smaku dominowala kwaskowatosc). Klasa.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 [50cl thanks to ruigo] Very cloudy yellow/orange color. Nice and persistent head. Medium to low carbonation and creamy body. Aroma is very rich, strong to banana and yeast, also some notes from cloves, orange, apricot and grass. Taste is medium sweet, banana, peach, bread, cloves, cinnamon and some bitterness. Aftertaste is very long sweet and some bitter and spicy notes. Very complex weizen bock, but for me it¬ís little overrated.

Weird brown almost greenish cloudy colored beer with small foam head. The taste is insanely hoppy but still wheatish. This beer is a over powered flavorwise but still balances out somehow and works well together.

500ml bottle. Pours cloudy dark yellow with a massive white head. Unexpected aroma of pine, pineapple. Hoppy taste. Long bitter finish. Like the other strong beers by this brewery there¬ís no sign of booziness. Definitely the most unusual Schneider beer, a hefeweizen IPA.
Bottle. Deep golden copper with one finger head. Quite unique. Some hefe elements, but interestingly spicy with done hops in the finish. Enjoyable, but not in the top tier of weisenbocks.
One of the strongest Scheider waisse beers. Taste hopfs and maybe caramel , citrus cinamon pear and ananas,

Bottle 50cl. Cloudy yellow orange, large frothy off-white head, mostly lasting, good lacing; at first malty and yeasty aroma, followed by orange peel, peach, apricot, light banana, tart, cloves, bit cinnamon, perfume/floral notes; taste heavy to medium sweet and medium bitter, fruity (banana, apricot), spicy notes; full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium bittersweet aftertaste, fruity and spicy notes, bit alcoholic in the finish; a really complex and aromatic weisse, excellent!
This one is different. Cloudy yellowish brown with a lot of sediment. Hoppy aroma of pine. Mix of hops and banana flavor...like a hefeweizen/pale ale hybrid.

From 0.5l bottle, BBD: 11.11.14 Pours deep cloudy (yeasty) amber to brown liquid, big frothy white head, Aroma: hopy, wheat, banana. Taste: Palate: medium body, creamy tecture, average carbonation, long hopy aftertase, Overall: unusual combination, interesting, but could be more harmonious and complex...

Pale golden body with mild haze and scattered sediment. Aromas of fruity esters, orange zest, wheat, clove, subtle spice, grass, floral hops. Alcohol heat is a little too prevalent, coming in mid-palate. Medium to thick body with a syrupy, resinous hop bill. The nose is better than the flavor. Decent.

500ml bottle. Clear dark golden body, medium white head, good retention. Aroma of camp flowers, orange candies, banana, grains, a touch of leather. Taste of overpowering sweet malts, a little piney hops, orange, alcohol. Heavy.

Slightly hazy light gold pour, frothy white head. Nose is flowers, soft fruit and yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is sweet wheat malt, some alcohol, and soft banana. Finish plays orange zest and spicy hops. An interesting beer, but something seems not complete to me.

Excelent white beer. Very grateful aroma, you just want to drink it when you smell. Really tasty.

Bottle 0.5l at Berliner bar Belgrade Serbia.Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white head.Taste and aroma of banana, citrus, so mich hops, fresh herbal note also, vanilla, bread.Perfect balanced and very good expirement.Good one

This is outstanding. From the maker of Aventinus, another outstanding Weisenbock. Intense aromas of dried overripe fruits, banana, caramel, cloves, coriander seed, toasted grain, and hops. Attacks with waves of captivating fruitiness Amidst a backdrop of hops. All this without being cloying or ponderous like...ahem...so many American craft brews. The texture is relatively light and lively. Finishes with lightly bitter hops and toasted grain notes. Beautiful in a Weizen glass.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, huge stable off white head.
NOSE: hoppy, grains, bananas.
TASTE: hoppy, grains, bananas, weird, but ok√© combo.

Scents of newly cut grass and lemon on the pour with a puffy white head. Smoothly sweet taste and a hint of hops on the finish. Delicious. Served in a half-liter weizen glass at Cafe Baveria in downtown Wauwatosa, WI,

Couleur jaune/ambr√©e un peu trouble, l√©g√®re mousse blanche. Nez fort houblonn√© agrumes et √©pices. Gout malt√©, fruit√© agrumes, orange, √©pic√©, forte coriandre, note de clous de girofle, voir jasmin, le tout bien cr√®meux en bouche. Fin fuit√©e et notes levures.

Jun ¬í14. 0.5 l bottle from Vrutak store, Zagreb. It poured a bit hazy light orange body with small head. Elderflower and orange hop aroma, only lightly peachy. Flavor was quite weird, hoppy, yet estery with lot of yeasty chalk notes. Weirder than it may sound, hoppy notes seemed only to pronounce more elderflower. Medium bodied with longer, lightly bitter and fruity aftertaste. Alcohol was perfectly hidden, I¬ím only realizing it¬ís a bock while I¬ím writing this now! Although weird it was not bad, rather interesting brew, but I didn¬ít find it to be that good as RB average would indicate!
Very dense, rather turbid content has a pronounced fruity smell as well as taste. But it feels a strong Hops note. Beer you have to respect, and certainly beer you like it or not.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Globally hop aromas. Lots of sweet maltiness with prominent grapefruit hop notes. Undercurrents of honey. Creamy and smooth. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle sample. Hazy golden-yellowish with huge bubbly off-white head. Soapy aroma, some maltiness, floral, notes of honey and some fruitiness (mostly apricot). Very sweet flavor, soapy, honey, apricot, some hoppy notes. Light carbonation, Medium-bodied.
It has a hazy yellow-orange color, stable white head. It smells like citrus fruits, banana . It has a full body taste and medium carbonation, bitter finish.

500 ml bottle. Murky sediment filled orange yellow, fine off-white lasting foam. Aroma is citrus, wheat, yeast, floral. Taste is tangy citrus, banana, fruity yeasty, wit malt, some caramel, moderate noble hop influence. Softer carbonation, light-medium bodied. Tasty refined brew. LBW (Lagerboys Be wary)
Hoppy aroma and taste. Tastes slightly licoricey to me. The alcohol isn¬ít overpowering.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Aroma: cloves, citrus hops, herbal, weak citrus notes.
Appearance: hazy amber color, white head.
Taste: medium bitterness, citrus, pine, alcohol is well-covered.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Quite interesting doppelbock, nice citrus notes and balanced.

0,5 l, bottled 4/7/2014. Very hazy, yellow-orange with frothy, stable, white head. Heavy hoppy aroma of lemon, passion fruit, mango, grapefruit, orange and hints of banana. Very delicate and appetising! Really complex taste of banana, lemon, passion fruit, grapefruit and yeast. Full-bodied, thick and creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation and a long, medium bitter, slightly alcoholic finish. What a fantastic beer from a great brewery!

Hazy amber orange, with off-white head. Aroma is banana, spice, clove, caramel, citrus and resin. Taste is the traditional spice and clove notes of a hefeweizen, but instead of that long lingering sweet finish you get nice crisp citrus flavours from the hops. Full bodied, creamy, softly carbonated and with a short, crisp finish. Very impressed with this one. Also surprisingly light and drinkable for a beer that¬ís 8.2% ABV.
