orange color, very cloudy. white tense head. smells of banana and fruits. untypical taste for a wheat beer. starts with citrus flavors, afterwards banana and on the finish a subtle bitterness remains.

Bottle. Pours a very cloudy tan color with floaties and a moderate light tan head on there. Nose is heavy with wheat and grains, and has some hints of white fruit coming through.Taste is a little sweat and definitely wheaty, and feels just a bit heavy.

I'm a fan of IPAs and I really sharp, sometimes bitter, high alcohol brews. This selection was very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to sarkynortherner. Hazy orange ok head. Aroma is banana fruits taste same some cloves spice wheat nice bitter finish. Nice body.tasty this.

Tap at Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL. Hazy light orange pour with a soapy white head. Very nice aroma of banana, citrus, bread. Smooth soft palate. Very easy drinking and flavorful. ABV could sneak up on you with this one.

Beaucoup de bananes, p√™ches, lime, herbres fraiches, quelques √©pices tremp√© dans le miel.bonne amertume ,mais bien soyeuse, tr√®s fruit√©s,mais bien s√®che , bonne int√©gration des saveurs entre elle balancement d√©bile, superbe hybride entre une IPA et une Hefeweizen. incroyable. √Ä essayer en tout temps.
Bottle. Hazy apricot color with small head for wheat beer. Aroma is stunning: grapefruit, tropic fruits, pine. Taste is mild sweet. Aftertaste with so much nuances: hoppy, fruity, spicy. Great beer!
Very hoppy wheat beer. Wonderfully unfiltered golden color. Just the right blend of spicy, sweet, wheat...and hop bitterness.
Tried this one for the first time this summer. Perfect addition to Aventinus, and no comparable analogues so far. Aroma heavily involves you into this gem.

Bottle. Quite light brown hazy color with thick head. Aroma has yeast, malt, some fruits, spices and hops. Taste is a bit sweet with long malty and bitter finish. Flavors of malt, spices, ripe fruits and hops. Interesting.

Bottle 0,50L. Muddy, ocra colour with creamy, of-white head. Strong hoppy aroma, grassy and herbal. It also reminds me of a plum brandy. Taste starts as a mixture of light sweet and bitter. Very hoppy, notes of different herbs and plum brandy. Finish is medium bitter. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very good beer, a bit different and uncommon for Germany, but very good!

@bartlebier¬ís and oldmanriver¬ís inspiring beer seminar; nose and taste: a very odd but interesting combination: nutmeg, violet-soap, root beer, almost some kind of marzipan, some higher alcohols showing up. Interesting!

Hazy yellow colour, with sediments. Great white head with a lot of retention. Aromas is mostly banana, cloves and mango, but there are many subtle other things: spices, pine. Creamy palate and very noticeable alcohol, like brandy. Taste of banana, mango, cloves, fruits, spices. Easily, the best german wheat I¬íve tasted to this day.
Hazy yellow/golden coloured, medium sized white head. Aromatic fruity and wheaty aroma with hops there. Mild bitterness and fruity finish.

0,5 bottle consumed in Kosovo. Pours amber cloudy, sediments in the glass, white big foam. Nose is definitely fresh and pungent grass, lime juice, oregano, wheat. Mouth: bitter palate along with mild sweet notes, adventurous wheat feel mixed with grass, citrus. One of the most exciting German classic revisited with innovation and elegance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2014 500ml bottle served in a German Weizen glass. 
A: Pours a dirty murky yellow to green color forming a medium creamy and soapy off white head. Good retention. Forms a lot of chunks of soapy lacings left in the glass. 
S: Excellent mix of wheat, barley malts and hops. Very fruity with strong notes of tropical fruits, mainly green mango. Bready, grassy with some earthy notes. 
T: Weissbier backbone. Strong notes of pale malts and wheat followed by notes of tropical fruits and grassy hops. Notes of resin and earth. 
M: Medium and very smooth body. Medium carbonation. Great grassy and herby hops in the aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. I would call it an authentic "Bavarian White IPA" ;-) 
[ BA Review @ 10/18/2013 ]

Draught Schneider Weisse M√ºnchen. Hazy yellow/brown color, white head.
Bitter taste with citrus, hops, wheat, banana, grass and mango. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, wheat and grass.
Excellent weissbier with hops.

From a bottle. Pours hazy light amber with creamy white head. Smells like wheat, cereal malts, grassy hops, light citrus, some banana, and faint clove. Tastes malty and smooth with nice hops, strong malt and light yeast and banana notes. Medium body and carbonation.

The best wheat beer brewery of the world promises hops, and delivers something completely different. This is closer to a Belgian tripel in aroma and taste - a lot of fantastic yeast notes and fruitiness, as well as a wonderfully fizzy mouth feel and a rock candy-like sweetness.

Shared bottle. Pours hazy light amber with creamy white head. Aroma is wheat, cereal malts, grassy hops, light citrus, some banana, and faint clove. Flavor is malty and smooth with good hop presence and enough malt character to tone down the yeast esters and banana notes; semisweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Really well-balanced. Aroma is wheat and floral. Taste is slightly sweet and very spicy. Aftertaste is spicy as well. Low bitterness and low carbonation.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15C, adapted). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 2719121113. AROMA: a very pleasant combination of hop aromas (floral and pine) with wheat, bock-like notes (dried fruits) and vanilla phenols. APPEARANCE: amber color and hazy. medium moussy, slight ivory head with average retention. TASTE: a very rich combination of bock components (bread, vanilla), some dark fruits, with a wheat background and hop flavours (citrusy and floral). low bitterness with a somewhat dry finish, some alcohol warmth. PALATE: medium-full body with moderate carbonation. some alcohol sensation. OVERALL: a very good weizen bock with a floral hop twist.

""8.2%...one of the best wheat beers I¬íve ever had...right up there with the New Glarus Wheats (Cracked and Black). The banana-clove aspect was blended incredibly well with the Hallertau hops (dry hopped) in both the aroma and flavor. Everyone¬ís favorite between the Heffe, Weizenbock and this great collaberation. Highly recomended."

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 Hazy amber to dark orange beer with big white head. Aroma has tropical fruits, honey, banana and menthol. Flavor has resin, menthol and wheat. Palate is thick with quite high carbonation and heavy stinging of bitterness. Finish has heavy bitterness with some alcohol. Aftertaste is mentholy, resinous, wheaty, perfumous, soapy and pineappley fruity. A great weizenbock-IPA hybrid. A bit too much alcohol and soap on the finish, otherwise greatness. 8+4+7+4+15=38

Re-rated a couple of times: too stingy, too much alcohol, hops and yeast do not work together. Dropping to 7+4+7+4+13=35
Hazy straw-orange body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Light citrus, banana, bubblegum, grass, and wheat. Medium bodied, light sweetness, soft bitterness in the finish, moderate carbonation.
Hazy golden orange color with medium white head. Smells on fresh wheat, lemon, banana. Taste lemon and honey, little bitterness, pronounced alcohol, high carbonation. More honey in aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2015 Dunkel Goldgelb tr√ºb im Glas, Wei√übier typischer Schaum, s√º√ülich Malzig in der Nase, typisches Wei√übier im Antrunk, gefolgt von fruchtigen Hopfenaromen, starkes Malzbett, sch√∂nes Wei√übier

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Intenso color dorato leggermente nebuloso con spesso cappello di solida schiuma bianca. Aroma e gusto ben bilanciati tra malto, forti sentori di frutta matura e luppolo nel finale. Corpo medio, setosa, morbida e dissetante con un finale asciutto e ben delineato. Buona!
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar claro. Sabor a pi√±a, banana, levadura, ligeramente citrico, a lupulo, muy ligeramente a alcohol. Una Weizen Bock extraordinaria.

Bottle 500ml. Pours cloudy golden-orange, with yeast residue. Head is tall foamy, stable off-white. Aroma of light sweet malt, fruits, slight banana. Body is medium-thick, slightly creamy with gentle carbonation. Taste is sweet, with very gentle smooth bitterness. Slightly too sweet, and could use stronger bitter profile. Flavors of honey, fruity esters, caramel and slight banana. Alcohol flavor is present, some phenol flavors. Ends slightly bitter with some sticky sweetness. Very good beer, slightly too sweet and phenolic.

August 24, 2014. Bottled july 2014. 
Pours cloudy orange with a large white head. Aroma is banana, citrus, bubble gum, spices and light nail polish. Taste is medium sweet ripe banana and malt with a medium dry bitterness with some harshness to it, perfume notes in the finish. Medium bodied average carbonation.

Poured from 500ml bottle. Aroma of orange with a bit of grass. Appearance is a cloudy golden with thick white head. Taste is a light sour. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, with a bitter slightly dry finish. An amazingly smooth beer, it is hard to believe has 8.2% alcohol.

Bottle. Pours a dirty bronze color with a thick head that fades slowly with ample lacing. Aroma of yeast, citrus, banana, fruit and bit grassy. Taste of citrus, banana, fruity, yeast and a trace of malt in the background. Mild bitterness and a tangy finish. Moderate body, earthy, with a bit of booze peaking through. Nice beer but exactly my style.
Quite simply my favourite weissbier. A bit cloudy, a bit stronger, but it never tastes or smells completely divergent from the style.
The perfekt balance between a IPA and a weizenbock. Nice, not so bitter, Hoppy taste. Great combined flavours of honey and citrus.

In bottiglia. Colore ocra, molto velata. Schiuma persistente e abbondante. Aroma erbaceo molto intenso, chido di garofano, leggero fruttato, esteri. In bocca il corpo e medio, cereale fragrante, leggero caramello poi ancora note vegetali e erbacee. Finale in cui ricompaiono gli esteri del lievito. Ottima birra, forse non pulitissima nel finale.

Transfer from BA review on 4-7-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance- The beer pours a golden amber color with a two finger white head. The head has a decent level of retention, fading over time to leave a nice level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma is fruity and bold. The heaviest aroma is that of a more citrus nature, being heaviest of orange and tangerine, but also having notes of grapefruit hop and a bit of lemon. Mixed with the citrus, are other fruit aromas of banana as well as some apple and pear. There is a slight yeasty and bready aroma with some smells of spice. A candy like sugar aroma is also present there as well producing an overall aroma that reminds me of a fruit roll-up. Quite a delicious smell.

 Taste ¬ñ The taste begins with a wheaty and citrus sweet flavor with strong flavors of orange. Other fruit flavors of banana and apple come to the tongue with more breadiness coming along as well. Toward the middle and the end, the yeast and spice that was detected in the nose also come to the tongue. More toward the end some of the sweeter flavors begin to fade however and a somewhat funky and hay like flavor come to the tongue with an intensification of the yeast as well as some bitter grapefruit joining along. In the end a slightly barnyard, but heavily citrus and wheaty flavor is left onto linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body of the beer is average to a little thinner for a brew of 8.2 % abv with a carbonation level that is on the slightly above average side. The lower body and higher carbonation are quite appropriate for the wheaty, citrus and funky flavors of the brew and make it quite a drinkable and enjoyable feel overall.

 Overall - A rather nice brew that drinks much easier then it should (in light of its 8.2 % abv and more saision like funky flavor)s. It is a rather good drinker and one to try if you get a chance.

Orange colour, with a medium white head, thick, slowly collapsing. Smell is hoppy, resiny hops, some sourness and fruityness too, banana, apricot and even something tropical. Taste is resin, ripe fruits, wheat, some alcohol warm.
This is a great Weizenbock!

Doppelweizenbock in a series of 7 "Tap" beers by Schneider. Moussy, stable, yellowish white head, orangey peach blonde colour, hazy. Powerful aroma of orange peel, red apple, cinnamon, brown bread, cinnamon, floral hops, soap, banana, yeast, liqueur, vanilla and some oxidation which does not disturb me here. Soft fruity taste (apple, apricot, banana), creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation, yeasty with some wheat sourishness, bready and caramelly malts, supple, light spiciness in the finish with emphatic flowery hops without actually bittering, some liqueurish alcohol and powdery, fruity, dry yeastiness. Wonderful beer, another one to support Schneider¬ís good reputation.

Uber-cloudy, golden yellow, then copper at the thick parts. One finger of unstable head. Looks completely legit. An expert pour by me leaves a symphony of floating sediment.

One whiff: wow. Heavy orange rind and earthy cloves. Spicy grains of paradise. The spiciness is tempered by a succulent citrus aroma: tangerine, blood orange, pineapple. Lemon Pledge. Absolutely exploding with aromatics. [Ed. note: not literally]

Flavors are more spicy, prickly flavors; rye bread. Buffered by more citrus (lemon, orange peel, pineapple, tangerine) and coriander. It¬ís challenging! The hops kind of take a backseat, but they are there, adding a serious citrus/American hop to an otherwise very European beer.

Feels prickly and tingly. It really dances beautifully on the palate. This beer is tremendous. I haven¬ít had it (or its American iteration) in many years, and I¬ím surprised how much I still enjoy it as much as the first time I had it.

Hazy golden color with everlasting head. Rich aroma of hops. Reminds great IPA examples. Taste of weissbier with distinguise hops line. Bittersweet aftertaste of great hops. Mild in compare with Aventinus.

Geruch ist klasse Hopfig, Hefig und auch eine S√ºsse ist erriechbar. Optik stimmt, Schaumkrone ist appetitlich und auch die Farbe ist stimmig. Der Einstieg ist vielf√§ltig: eine S√ºsse, Hefe und Hopfen vermischen sich mit - diplomatisch ausgedr√ºckt - der Vollmunidkeit. Der Kritikpunkt meinerseits ist die Alkoholst√§rke. Die √úberstrahlt den Geschmack und macht f√ºr mich dieses Bier kaum trinkbar ausser zu sehr deftigen Mahlzeiten, in dem ich wiederum nicht so ein Regenbogen der W√ºrzgeschm√§cker w√ºnsche. K√∂rper und Abgang sind ebenso viellf√§ltig und f√ºr mich fliesst hier auch wieder die 8,2% negativ ein. Fazit: Ich w√ºnschte man k√∂nnte dieses Bier mit weniger PS machen, ich nehme an dies ist schwierig oder einfach nicht gewollt. Dieses Bier ist fast mehr ein Desertwein.

Bottle @ home. Large off-white and lasting head with beautiful thick lacing. Hazy pale amber color (Second pour was much more yeast hazy than the first) . Aroma of cooked ham, pine, smoked peat(!), wheat, orange, subtle ripe banana & grass. Warming alcohols. Thick, a bit cloying and smooth mouth feel. Really sweet and fruity flavor with pine, ripe banana, wheat, some cloves and red apples, and quite a lot of toffee initially and later cookies and bread. Drier finish with more pronounced banana and banana peel, plus vanilla, orange, hay, sweet caramel and some clove and grass. And warming sticky alcohols that while blending quite well with the banana peel is too evident and makes the flavor sprawling. A balanced earthy bitterness.

Smells hopy & sweet. No wheat beer smell. Poured into wheat beer glass 3 finger head untill it settles into a filtered wheat beer look its water pale thin looking and carbinated. Taste starts off seeing kinda minty like and a little banana taste from the wheat a little, then on swallow finish¬ís with a sweet hopy taste and a little banana. Not great but not horrid. Could be worse but could be better. Taste wise can¬ít tell it¬ís 8.2% smells and taste more like some high % ipa or something more then any wheat bock. Cheer¬ís.

Amazingly aromatic weissbier! Almost like an IPA from the weissbier-world. I would like to rate this as a bit odd IPA beer because of the taste, rather than a weissbier. In that category it would still manage very well. The wheaty body might be a bit odd for some.

Reviewed from notes. 
This was poured into a weizen glass. 
The appearance was a bronzed /somewhat golden yellow color with a big lush white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute leaving some really nice looking semi - thick lacing sticking all over. 
The smell had a nice banana esters with clove, and orange peel. Some light coriander comes as well. 
The taste was mainly sweet but also a nice element of spice. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation was there but nothing overbearing. There¬ís a nice spiciness rolling over my tongue. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good weizenbock that I could have again.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a big head. Typical aroma for a weizen: bananas (more) and clove. Taste of wheat malt, bread, yeasts. Low body, high carbonation. Good weizen.

Bottle to taster
This shit is bananas, B-a-n-a-n-a-s. Plus wheat, lemongrass, belgian yeast, bread, and biscuits. Cloudy yellow with a thin, creamy, white head. Very fruity, with banana, and peach juice.

Tapped at Weisses Br√§uhaus in Munich/Germany and bottled. A mind blowing floral and herbal plus some white wine and green apples nose piercing aroma awesomeness! The hoppy, a bit vinegar or white wine and banana plus green apple combination of the taste is delicious. Alcohol warming. Overall a fantastic complex brew of superb German beer craft.

Bottle. Golden, cloudy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate to full, malty ¬ñ wheaty sweetish aroma, light caramel and lots of citrus fruitiness with light banana, some hoppyness and light yeast. Body is medium to full, malty ¬ñ wheaty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, faint caramel and light fruitiness with light banana, some hoppyness, light alcohol. Finish is average, malty ¬ñ lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness and light banana, citrus hoppyness, light - some alcohol. Really nice well hopped weizen bock. Finish has bit too much alcohol considering the body. Also finish could use more fruitiness. Not for those who like Hoegaarden - ¬ìAre you afraid of the hops wit boy¬î.
Nose, sweet citrus peel, slightly marmalade. Palate follows through with peachy orange tang slight bitterness to the finish. Interesting beer.

0.5L bottle poured into glass. Very hazy amber color, with small off white head that doesn¬ít stay for long. Full body, medium-high carbonation. Strong aroma of wheat and hops. Slightly sweet. Medium bitterness. High ABV is very obvious. Overall very nice and flavorful beer.

Great combination of a good weizen with a hoppy taste. Full rich flavour. Would recommend

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Semi-opaque wheat-orange with soapy white head on pour. Solid webbing. Inviting perfume. Orange and mild banana, backed with light floral hops. Yeast and cloves tie in nicely. Intricate and fresh. Taste follows. Enjoyed.

Pours a milky orange from the bottle. Just a bit of an off-white head that dissipates rapidly, leaving a bit of lacing. The nose screams fruit, particularly banana and berries, along with citrus and malt. As you would expect, the fruit hits your tongue first. Bananas, pineapple, mango and some spice. The alcohol becomes more pronounced as it warms. There¬ís a nice sweetness to this one. Medium, chewy mouth. I¬ím not a huge fan of wheats or dopplebocks, but this is really, really good. A very nice collaboration.

Appearance: Pours a murky yellow colour with about a finger of white head that quickly dissipates leaving some lace.

Aroma: Banana, coriander, yeast and some faint hop notes. 

Flavour: Banana, nutmeg, clove, coriander, bread, other spices that blend together. 

Overall: An excellent Weizenbock with an incredible spicy component in the aroma and flavour. There is quite a bit of complexity in flavours between the contrasting fruity notes, the breadiness and the strong spicy parts. I¬ím not usually a big fan of wheat beers but this one really impressed me.

Bottle from Gooden in Taipei, drank at Rao He night market. Aroma is phenolic (cloves) with some alcohol but quite faint - presence of banana makes it very sweet. Tastes like a hefeweizen with added hops. Slightly spicy finish (though that might be from the Â§ßËÖ∏ÂåÖÂ∞èËÖ∏ I ate at the same time). Body has very foamy bubbles as expected from a hefe but kind of thin for such high carbonation. Pretty much as advertised - a hoppy hefe, if a bit too airy/foamy.

Dor√©e, trouble, avec un col de mousse blanche. Nez de levure, bl√© et banane. Go√ªt sucr√©, de bananes, de girofle et de bl√©. Complexe et ronde en bouche, avec un peu amer en finale qui se prolonge.

500ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (¬£3.40):
Strong banana & spice with faint alcohol. Background citrus & mango, orange & light hops too.. Fruity & fresh with good balance, some yeast & cloves. Nice stuff.

Cloudy orange to amber with foamy, 3cm white head that held steady until I took a sip.

Banana & cloves to start with faint alcohol. Citrus, mango & pineapple with background hops & grassy flavours feature, as does some bubblegum.

Creamy with a smooth feel & medium body helped down with moderate carbonation. The beers alcohol content was noticeable but the fruits in the taste helped mask at least some of it.

A good beer and one that benefited from the extra hops in both the taste and smell. Whilst it was a pleasant beer I think I¬íd be put off buying it all that often based on the fact that it is a lot stronger and harder to get a hold of that several other German wheat beer.

Draft at G2B (Durham). Pours clear/slight hazy gold with towering white creamy head. Aroma is distinctly wheaty - some earthiness here too. Lots of grassy notes. Fresh hop notes in the taste - not specifically fir/spruce, but slightly resinous and sweet/bitter interplay. Complex and solid. Bready/malt characteristics throughout. Higher ABV than expected, and one was enough. Loved it.

It has a thick cloudy, yeasty looking body with a tan/orange color and a tall white head. The head fades fairly fast and leaves just a small ring of foam on top. Lacing is minimal and spotty and slick. The aroma has a good wheat bready and yeasty character with hints of ripe banana and citrusy herbal hops. There is a good bit of bready/yeasty character and flavor. I get mild notes of banana, pineapple, clove and hints of orange. The hop profile is more noticeable than most Weizenbocks and adds a good balance of spicy, herbal, (almost minty) and citrus bitterness. The palate has a smooth and silky, almost oily texture with mellow carbonation.
Una cerveza perfecta al paladar la tap 6 y tap 7 tambien son esquisitas de las mejores.

Pint bottle from Wine Source. Pours hazy honey colored, medium white head, lacing doesn¬ít last. Aroma is fruity: peach, banana, with a small hops presence. Beer is moderately carbonated, velvety mouthfeel. Flavor is quite sweet. The fruit kicks in, then there¬ís the hops at the end. A really good beer, a beautiful blending of two styles, but just a tad sweet for my liking. This could be, however, because I¬íve cut most sugar our of my diet lately. A damn fine beer, anyway.
Bottle from Glug Newcastle. Pours gorgeous murky orange colour with a thin head. Quite carbonated and with strong fruity flavours. Fantastic summer beer

0.5l bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is fruits, banana, yeast and pine. Taste is slightly bitter with some sweetness. Medium body. Overall it¬ís great and balanced beer with awesome hop aroma and taste.

Vergeet je stevige maaltijd, neem een Scheider Weisse, zo dit is een stevige volle en cremige jongen. oogt vrij donker gouden, ietwat wazig met schuimige donker witte kraag. aroma van citrus, tarwe en hop.
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, licht bittertje, redelijk moutig, gras, citrus, sinaasappel, floraal, overrijpe bananen, abrikoos.
zoals al vermeld, behoorlijk romig en dik van textuur, de hoppigheid in de achtergrond komt daar wel lekker als contrast uit.
ondanks de stevigheid best te drinken.
500 ml bottle. Pours a clear gold with moderate head. Aromas of candied fruit, wheat, and light banana. Flavors apricot, tropical fruit and wheat. Late bitter/dry fruity finish. Nice
Bottle. Pours into a stein with a foam head, aroma is light citric, banana, wheat and pineapple. Taste is citrus, pineapple, a lot of sweetness and some tropical fruits. Wonderful

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 It really is what the name suggests: A hoppy Weizenbock. A decent Weizen body (as you expect from Schneider) with additional hoppy flavours which are present from the beginning, but suddently take over your taste buds in the finish. Sticky feeling, but despite the alcohol content (same as the Tap 6 Aventinus), very refreshing.

Pours a white medium and thick head, with a lasting thin layer; colour is a very hazy dark orange, almost brownish and with floating particles. Extremly fruity, floral and wheaty pafrume: smells apricots, peaches, bananas, strawberries, plums... (can smell almost any type of fruit you can imagine), ripe fruits, honey, slight funkiness. Outstanding aroma. Taste is extremly fruity, pretty much on that way: wheaty, slighlty syrupy and biscuity, with a touch of alcohol, dried fruits and piny notes. Creamy texture, average carbonation, medium bodied. Very much on the sweet side, but very very balanced, with a delicate and clean wheaty and piny finish. More of a sweet hop prensece with little biternes; piny and citrusy, a bit IPAish :D Oustanding brew, probably my favourite german wheat beer / weisse

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 Aroma of wheat, banana, orange, some tropical fruits, spices and floral hops. Flavour is light fruity sweetness with a decent bitterness in the aftertaste. Like a German Wheat IPA? One thing¬ís for sure: This is a great brew. Might be the best one I¬íve had from Schneider, and that¬ís saying a lot.

Beautiful hoppy aroma with some of the yeast characteristics coming through as well. Great hazy orange colour with a tight, white head. A hop balanced beer, with all the flavours coming together nicely to compliment each other. Very smooth mouth feel and the hops remain in the after taste.

pours a hazy hay colour with a small bubbly head, aroma includes notes of yeast, grass, banana, clove, and coriander. Tasting notes include banana, ripe fruit, spice, mild malts, and a clean bitter finish. Schneider weisse never disappoints!

Bottle shared by a friend. Aroma is hoppy, citrusy, orange, yeasty, clove; phenols. Hazy yellow colour. White head. Taste is nicely combining yeasty weizeny clove and spices with fruity, citrusy hops. Moderate to light high bitterness, almost moderate malty sweetness, caramel. Very good, easily drinkable.

Mellow citrus and apricot smell, very fruity. It has some light chicory or citrus pulp smell, very attractive. Nice medium fine white had, dark golden color, misty. The foretaste is very sweet and malty, and has strong blood orange pulp aroma/taste. The mouth feel is pretty bold, feels like having some salty taste (which make it sweeter). Aftertaste is sweet and light bitter (hops bitter), the salt still left in mouth. I feel tension on mouth skin, feel dry. When I have more sip, I feel it has some pine (which normally comes with citrus aroma, from hops) aroma, and in the middle it shows lemon acid and caramel malty (chicory and malty, which give a hint of barley wine¬ís characteristic). So basically there are 3 flavor/aroma string. One is citrus pine hoppy with malty sweet, this is like a double IPA. Two is salty lemon sour mix with apricot pulp aroma, this feels like a Gose. Third is chicory malty which feels like a thin barley wine. It¬ís quite interesting. It¬ís a Germay ale, dry hopped (which make it not very bitter, but still very hoppy). The strong malty thing just shows it¬ís double bock style. The Gose is actually another German beer style, so I think it also inherited some recipe from that. Quite interesting, enjoyable. I think I should serve it even color ( I drink it at about 11 degree C). Mouth feel is very creamy (from salt?). It¬ís also has lots of sediment at bottom.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Fermented taste with notes of fruits, citrus, ginger, hops. Medium carbonation. Bittersweet hoppy finish.

Pours slightly dark with a lot of foam. Smell is very hoppy ans fresh. Taste is refreshing with a dry aftertaste that is quickly followed by the sweetnest of the 8% ABV content. A very good greman beer

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow, nice medium head, white in colour, stable. In aroma malt, yeasts and especially bananas and hoppy (citrus and pine) aromas. In taste wheat malt, citrus fruits, yeasts (it depends how many you poured to your glass) with a medium bitterness. In finish long bitter finish. Te beer is medium bodied (quite surprising for 18.5% OG), alcohol well hidden, noticable only in gentle warming effect. Exellent brew from SW, taste just like heavier wheat IPA, very drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2015 Bottle. Pours hazy orange, lot of sediment, big white head quickly disappears. Aroma is fruity and a lot of yeast. Banana and ripe fruit. Some herbs. Taste is medium sweet, some citrus, creamy mouthfeel pleasant bitter finish to balance the big body and sweetness. Liked to try all fresh.

Re rate of fresh bottle. Pours cloudy golden with one finger white head, som sediment. Aroma is super fresh! Hops, zest, pine, resin, yeast, sweet mandarin tang. Taste is more sweet, banana, orange, pine, spices, clove, light smooth body, Really aromatic. Medium bitter slight dry finish.

0,5l Flasche. Dunkleres Bier mit einer f√ºr ein Weizen kleinen Schaumkrone. Sehr starker Duft nach Aromahopfen. Im Geschmack grasig, fruchtig und stark Hopfenbitter. Obwohl sehr gut gemacht, nicht ganz mein Bier.

500ml bottle, pours hazy golden brown, a little yeasty, caramel, biscuit, straw, malty aroma with lots of hop character in the balance. Orange & lemon citrus zesty tangy flavours, coriander, ginger come through so this has plenty of flavour. Finish is balanced well and the carbonation is just right.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Bottle. Pours dark yellow with a white head. Aroma: citrus, ginger, banana. Taste follows aroma with grass and ginger. Herbal hoppy finish. Nice weisse with a load of aroma hops.
big and bold IPA in a wheat beer style. do not cellar, drink now in a wide brimmed glass for maximum aroma. add or restrain sediment to taste.

Bottle. Hazy straw yellow with a nice white head. Full of aromas, smells just like an IPA, citrus, ginger and this slight hint of basement yeast. The taste knows well to hide the amount of alcohol, sweet and pleasant bitter. Thick texture, heavy body. Aftertaste has some ethanol, with the citrus hop aromas and heavy malt taste. 

This beer is really outstanding, hoppy and something new, great!
Smooth and light. Hazy golden orange with a whitish head. Light malt, orange and spice. Full but crisp. Much lighter than the alcohol content had me expecting.

Smells of Orange caramel, sweet delicious hoppy aromas, slight coriander. Really juicy and powerful. Cloudy orange. Flavour is big and boozy. Think i got a bit too much yeast as I carried out in my bag which is a shame but there is some bright citrussy flavours alongside the earthy taste of the yeast which makes it a bit bitter. This is an odd one, i think I will have to try anther more settled one.
Aroma lupulado intenso sobrepondo a banana e o cravo t√≠pico das cervejas de trigo.Sabor c√≠trico e herb√°ceo com corpo leve a m√©dio.√ìtima cerveja.
Pours a dark yellow with a white lacing. The aroma consists of banana, cola and clove.
An odd fellow this. Sort of a German IPA Wei√übier? Most interesting German beer I¬íve had in, well, ever? Strong hops, like a full on IPA with real wei√üe characteristics. Lovely.

50cl bottle at home. Pale orange with a full white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet- and bitterness. Wheat, citrus, grapefruit, banana, grass and some peach. A great combination of a Hefeweizen and an IPA.

Cervesa un pel t√®rbola, arom√†tica i amb for√ßa pres√®ncia d¬íalcohol.
Cerveza un poco turbia, arom√°tica y con bastante presencia de alcohol.
What to call this? A weizen IPA? Body has smooth wheat and fruits, with some hoppy bitters. Nice one.
Bij de eerste slok krijg je een vol licht romig gevoel in je mond. De smaak vindt ik lijken op bloemige heide.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 Golden color with an orange tint and a heavy white head. Floral and hints of citrus with a hint of banana and clove.
Muddy dark orange, big white head; strong apple and citrus aroma; taste of sweet apples, booze, malt; this doesn¬ít taste like a wheat beer in any way; good powerful stuff.

0.5l bottle. Hazy orange body, white head. Regular weizen notes in the aroma like ripe banana and pears but it also has a significant orange zesty, herbal hop character. Taste of banana, honey, orange zest, herbs and grass. Hard to belive that it¬ís more than 8% ABV. Can¬ít recognise the booze at all. One of the best Schneider beers I¬íve ever had.

Flowery, a bit of light caramelly sweetness, kind of a strange beer, hints of being like a weird "German IPA" like Terrapin made for a side project, but with a bit more spiciness. Interesting, not really my cup of tea overall.

Fantastic beer.
perfect balance of bitterness and sweetness.
I can drink it ever so much.

Bottle. Hazy orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of flowers, earth, clove, banana, spices and bread. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of flowers, red berries, clove, banana and earth. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice.

Dark straw/barley yellow colour with a lovely frothy a bit dark white lasting head. Rather opaque looking. Aromas of fruity esters like banana, citrus and light orange notes arise supported by faint pine and apricot notes. Floral hops and all harmonically balanced with caramel maltiness. Soft livelyness (CO2) with a nearly velvet slick texture. Medium fruity sweet with a really light sourness to it. Full bodied and a harmonic well lasting fruity ester finish. Filling beer but can see this is going really well not only on itself but also with different kinds of food. Versatile!

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 Ganz tolles Weizenbier. Bananig, hefig, zitrusm√§√üige Nase. Am Gaumen s√º√ülich mit sch√∂nem Malz und sch√∂nem Hopfen. S√º√üe dominiert, leichte BItternoten runden den Geschmack ab. Sehr s√ºffig und 1a Mundgef√ºhl.

aroma: citrus, sour, smells refreshing, a bit of caramel, slighlty malty
appearance: amber colour, hazy, creamy foam
taste: quite a thick body, citrus, clearly hoppy, but not bitter, sweet, very well balanced, no alcoholic character (surprisingly for 8,2% ABV), very drinkable

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow orange colour with a large, foamy, long lasting off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, hops, citrus, yeast, banana and wheat. Sweet and bitter with a fruity, citrus, hoppy flavor and a dry wheat finish.

Bottle. Rich gold pour with a decent yellowed-white lasting head. Nose is WOW! Fruity ripe oranges, marshmallows, lemon, mango, tropical fruit juice, ribena, sweetie jars... I can¬ít just keep sniffing it, so I need to taste. Incredibly smooth in the taste, there¬ís a "fullness" to it, with some bready notes coming through the tangerine/satsuma core. More sugary sweet flumpy marshmallows. Poured more and the rich gold is suddenly a bit more opaque as more of the wheat fills the glass. Doesn¬ít affect the taste negatively, actually cuts through some of the sweetness and gives a bit more bread to it. Really delicious ale which completely belies it¬ís ABV. I could drink and drink and drink this... and I shouldn¬ít. Marzipan, cereals... I¬ím going to run out of drink before I run out of new flavours I think... at the bottom of the bottle and now the pour is a dense thick brown colour - which likely will put some people off. Not me, I¬íve tasted it! DELICIOUS!

Bottle. Cloudy orange with a decent white head. Aroma - citrus and floral hops, yeast and fruits. Sweetish with citrus,mango and other tropical fruits, yeast, caramel and wheat, long hoppy bitter finish. Medium-bodied, complex flavors. Well-made and quite interesting.

Pours a hazy orange with a big white head that dissipates relatively quickly. Aroma is dominated by hops: floral, resin and herbs, with slight hints of banana from the weiss yeast. Flavor profile is also dominated by hops, with really nice floral hop flavor at beginning, followed by a medium sweetness, finishing with a pleasant, citrus and herby hop character that lingers for a while. Light-medium body, with an oily texture, average to fizzy carbonation, and a relatively dry, bitter finish. 

Overall, the hop clearly dominates this beer, with only slight hints of its weissbier roots. Really a fantastic beer. One of my favorites so far.
Bottle, pours a cloudy gold with a white head, hoppy taste with citrus, wheat, and banana, nicely balanced between bitter and sweet, good beer

Bottle from Beers of Europe [290414] 
Amber, hazy, thick white bubbly head
Aroma of sweet fruits, wheat, spicy hops, soft banana, tropical fruit hops, touch of orange, touch of clove, complex
Taste as aroma, tropical fruit hops, slight banana, soft pine, orange, bit aromatic, quite peppery, citrus zest, spicy, a lot going on here, alcohol well hidden, complex, super flavour
Palate - medium carb and body, fairly oily, creamy, sweet fruity malts, bitter zesty hops. Finish as main flavour, smooth, zesty hops
Overall - This was a surprise - what a great beer...certainly will be getting this again

A little more fruits then the normal weisse. Hops are quite subtle though. Creamy and refreshing. Medium bodied. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2014 Flavor of: grass, herbs, citrus. It has really strong "green" taste. It is a really interesting beer. Something to try

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Rated this just after sampling Tap 4. Looks similar - hazy golden with big-bubbled foamy head. Beyond the looks - no comparison. Tap 5 is much more full bodied and the aroma much more immediate. Alongside the banana you get orange, apricot, a bit of apple and mango, followed by bread, spices and a slightly bitter finish. Very drinkable for an 8.2% beer.

500ml bottle from Gourmondo.de. Hazy dark yellow colour, mdium rocky/frothy mostly lasting off-white head, good lacing. Aroma of banana, grapefruit, orange peel, passion fruit, dough and white pepper, well balanced between heavily malty and heavily hoppy. Taste is initially bittersweet and moderately acidic, turning into a long bitter finish with a moderately alcoholic feel. Full body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Aroma was amazing, taste decent, alcohol could¬íve been a bit less noticeable. Wonderful and somewhat different approach to wheat beer none the less.

Eye: hazy golden/amber, incredible head
Nose: despite the head, tons of citrusy and mango notes with banana at top of it
Mouth: full bodied, mix of wheat, bready notes, some alcohol and delicate hoppy finish
----
Kings of german styles faced american hybrid and won!

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2016 Draught at Weisses Brauhaus, Munich, 27.02.2016.
Orange, cloudy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Simply perfect, unique and complex aroma of citrus, ripe fruits, dried fruits, ripe banana, apricot, mango, red apples, flowers, vanilla, some spices, subtle alcohol and so much more.
Taste follows this, also amazingly complex and smooth, with a bit more alcohol.
Medium, silky mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes alcohol warming, smooth, sweet, spicy, very fruity again, hoppy.

It don¬ít has to be a super rare, over-the-top brew, this is one of my all time favourite beers! An accomplished, inspiring, unique style example like no other. Strong, but so smooth to drink and most of all a dense, complex fruit bomb. Creamy Weizenbock aromas and loads of aromatic hops in a perfect balance and even the (not too overpowering) alcohol fits in perfectly. Especially the nose is one of the most characteristic things I¬íve experienced so far since I¬ím into quality beers and every time I¬ím drinking this, I discover some new aroma. The first time I¬íve had this years ago, I was completely blown away by this smell and it didn¬ít lose anything of its magic over the years for me.

Bottle @ Altes Maedchen , Hamburg. Birra ambrata riflessi aranciati, opalescente schiuma bianca, fine, persistente. Aroma fruttato, agrumato (pompelmo ed arancia rossa), speziato di chiodo di garofano, erbaceo da luppolo aromatico. Gusto dolce abboccato, abbastaza acida, piuttosto amara. Fruttato, ritrovo il pompelmo rosa, erbaceo, resinoso, pepata. Poco corposa molto carbonata, equilibrata ed armonica.

Bottle from Gooden Taipei. Hoppy wheat-y aroma, as you'd expect. Big effervescent hefe palate with piney hoppiness. Spicy bittern finish that lingers. Nice to have the extra hoppiness in this type of beer but probably wouldn't get again.

Hazy orange with a puffy white head. Aromas of orange juice, spices and dry grain. Richly flavoured, this is a big beer with juicy orange, sour wheat, but also sweet crystalised ginger and glace fruit. Lipsmacking and tart.

Bottle from Wholefood High Street Kensington. Beautiful looking beer. Rich hazy amber, with a soft white foam head, which leaves creamy lacing on the glass. Nose is toffee and caramel and some quite acidic, spiky green leafy hops. Berry fruit, raspberry, yeasty fruity esters. Taste is all of the above and it¬ís a quite eclectic mix. Creamy caramel, yeasty fruity red berry esters, and acidic green leafy hops.
blanche de 500ml tres bonne arome fruit√© de banane et gout tres explosif et agr√©able de banane et amertume super!

500ml bottle served cool in a Shaker. Bruised spinach and cooking apple aroma. Cloudy light brown with a thin skim of off-white head. Malt sweetness roughly shouldered aside by assertive hops. Caramel, yeasty overripe fruits, and celery flavours: Something slightly soapy, but not unpleasant going on: sticky texture, bitter finish. Big alcohol kick as well. Took me an hour to drink. Probably best with some solid mid European food. Robust sipper to be savoured.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2015 Mooie oranje cremekleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, kruiden. Smaakt bitter, fris, kruiden, hop, zoetig, banaan . Iets bittere afdronk.

500 ml bottle @ "Tilt Bar", Oslo. April 02,2014.

Cloudy golden color with a white head and full carbonation.
Yeast and sweetness in my nose.
Aroma is also hop, spices,banana and citrus fruits.
A bit sweet and spiced beer with a bitter touch and finish.
Hazy gold with a big sticky head. Aroma of yeast, clove, spice, veggie, and mint. Taste sweet with overlying bitterness. Doughy, yeasty, with some banana and vegetative notes. Not a good combination.

Pours an unclear yellow. Aroma of apple juice, hops, fruity fresh, a little spicy. Taste is soft like a weissbeer and very hoppy (dry-hopped), a little sweet. Has a full taste and is very well balanced! Great brew!

Liquid is cloudy, ocher color. Minimal head. Full body, lively carbonation. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter: Aroma of honey with a hint of mustard. Reminds me of mustard and honey chicken.
Bottle. Cloudy light amber with white head. Green, skunky hoppiness, a little soapy. Tastes bitter with tropical fruit. Full-bodied, bitter, leafy aftertaste, carbonated. Good.

Great. Nice to see such a traditional brewery do a classic weisse with some extra hops. The flavor has all the elements of a hefe weisse, wheat yeast some mild sweetness and fruits. This one also has nice flowery hops with some bitterness. Not for style purists. Love it.

Interesting blend. Mainly wheat and citrus aroma. Dark yellow brown. Be carefully with the sediment in this one. Full but not too heavy palate. Smooth but carbonated. Wheat, citrus and hops bitterness hit up front. The piney and citrus bitterness linger. It¬ís a good beer and different. I haven¬ít tasted many like it.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very cloudy yellow with thick white head. Robust aroma of bananas, wheat, and yeast. Taste is more bitter than I expected. Wheat, banana and yeast and some citrus flavors. Moderate sweetness with moderate bitterness. Medium bodied. I love the Aventinus way better.

Pours a very cloudy whet color as expected. Aroma is oranges and wheat as with tast not the best wheat beer but still a good beer.

8.2% drunk to celebrate my wife passing the first stage of her driving test! Served in a weizen glass. It pours a deep gold with a thick white head. It was very clear at first but as I poured out the rest of the bottle the sediment made it becoming a cloudy somewhat muddy color. The aroma is yeasty bubblegum, light spicy cloves & subtle citrusy hops. Medium-light body with a slick mouthfeel. The taste is an intriguing mix of spicy weizen notes counterbalanced by hops. The interplay is exceedingly well executed, the hops are there but play well with the yeast notes & accentuate its fruitiness. Deftly done! Genre bending stuff from two great breweries(Brooklyn & Schneider Weisse).

Bottles- cloudy golden with large white head. Intense aroma, cloves, stewed fruit, banana, orange and wheat. Same in the taste, medium bodied, softly carbonated, touch of warming alcohol. Very good, highly enjoyable.
Nice weizen with a fruity aroma, a hint of bitterness in the end. Not bad by I prefer the vitus.

500 ml bottle. 8.2%. Pours a very cloudy gold. Thick white foamy head. Heavy lacing. Almost opaque in the glass. Large, dark floating particles.Very strong grassy aroma. Abit overpowering. Not very pleasant.
Wow. Huge hit of hops. Way too strong for my taste. Can¬ít finish it.

500 mml Bottle tasted at home on 27/02/2014. Nice weizen taste with aroma and fruit notes. The aroma is intensive for a weizenbier. Long end with a nice carbonation. It¬¥s a nice one weizen bock. Next one please!

Bottle. A hazy medium to dark blonde beer, with a huge, frothy, fully lasting white head. The aroma is lightly malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (grapefruit, pine), lightly yeasty (dough), with notes of banana, soap, lemon, orange, alcohol, pepper. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, pretty long finish with moderate bitterness, lightly alcoholic, lightly artificial/unclean. Good, but it has some flaws. As for the plus, the poweful nose, and the beautiful head, as for the minus, a surprisingly thin mouthfeel, with a somewhat artificial aftertaste.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a very hazy yellow orange with a one finger white head that continues to cling to the glass. Nose is yeast, cloves, pepper and citrus. Taste is sweet and spicy but fortunately the cloves are not as evident in the taste as in the nose and the yeast is not overpowering either.. Mouth is slick and light with decent carbonation. Spice adds a nice variation to a typical Weisse.

Bottle at Wachi. Hoppy and wheaty, lots of grass and fruit, bit herbal too. Taste is good, again grassy, herbal, wheaty.

Tap at the Brewery bar in munchen. 23/1/14. Aroma is big resin berry hop with some hot fussel alcohol and sweet berry hop notes. Clouded orange pour white lasting head. Flavour is nice mix of pine, sweet resin, berry hop and bready malts. Little bit of strawberry in the finish.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Toronto, Ontario. Pours an opaque dark gold colour with one finger of foamy white head which has great lacing. Complex aroma with notes of pineapples and some floral aroma. It tastes refreshing with notes of citrusy fruits which leads to a well-balanced hoppy finish.

Bottle from Cornelius. Murky orange brown. Foamy off white head. Wheat and tropical nose. Malty medium body with a bit of coriander and banana. Very sweet. Surprised it was 8.2%.

cloudy slightly orange colour. a lot of citrus in aroma - clementine, grapefruit and just a little bit of bread. sweet and sour with a little bit of bitternes at the end. very fresh, mostly like pomelo and grapefruit. great for refreshness,

Cloudy dark orange beer with big head on top. Aroma has wheat, yeast and lots of citrus and grassy hops. Quite sour too. Taste is sour and yeasty with some grassy hops in the end. Crispy carbonation and full body. A slight disappointment to be honest.

Bottle from Hop City, Atlanta. Fucking manna, one of my all-time favorites. Pours a hazy orange brown, little to no head. Aroma flying, yeast, citrus, sharp hoppiness. Body lively, full and effervescent, finish huge, sticky yeast character, citrus, broad yet subtle. If only this came to Oregon...

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2014 Scent of orange, lemon, and strawberry. Cloudy peach colour. Flavour of orange zest, hops, caramel, and fruit. Medium body with light carbonation. Very flavourful -- great session beer.

Schneider's Hopfenweisse Tap 5 is a uniquely interesting strong wheat beer. It has a aroma that reminds me if tropical fruit or flowers and a delicious hoppy flavor. Although 8.2 ABV, you can't taste it (making it a dangerous pleasure!) The warm, hazy amber appearance is appealing, as is the superb head retention. It has a crisp, dry finish: a great beer!

---Cheers until next time!
DMSR

Bottle 500 ml at home, into a ig weizen glass. ABV 8.2%
Dark orange colour on the body, with the typical haziness of a weizen, with tiny yeast particles floating around. Huge head, four fingers tall, white in colour. Very thick and soapy, with excellent retention. Spots of lacing left around the glass.
Initial aroma is yeast but after the thick head has collapsed, more aromas manage to surface. Spices, and not just the usual clove of a weizen, less yeast now but still there, very fruity with notes of peaches, apricots, some hops and floral notes too. Really complex.
Taste is sweet, on a tolerable level, with lots of spices again. The apricots more notable now, the peaches are following. The alcohol is very well hidden, in no case I could guess this is a 8.2% ABV beer. Malts on the finish and little grass.
Medium thick body, good carbonation. Oily palate.
Overall a very tasty beer, nice combination of the two styles, it goes down dangerously easy.

Ar√¥mes surtout houblonn√©s, le houblon est floral et fruit√©, beaucoup d¬íagrumes (citron, orange et pamplemousse) avec des fruits tropicaux (banane, ananas, mangue¬Ö). served in a weizen glass

A-thick head and a beautiful golden copper hue. has that perfect wizen cloudiness to it.

S - banana and cloves are present as well as a strong citrus (orange i think) scent that really has me licking my lips.

T/M - delicious! you can really taste the blend of the two styles in this. the hops are prominent and as it goes down you can taste the smoothness and refreshing character or the wizen. the hops slowly turn into a more alcoholic taste as it goes down. starts off as a refreshing taste and comes off boozy at the end, but not as much as you¬íd expect from 8.2 ABV

O - im impressed by the collaboration here. i had doubts about combining the two styles but they¬íve managed to pull off a pretty good beer here. I felt like the beer smelled more like a weizenbock, but tasted more like an IPA. it was a great drink for me, and i¬íd probably get a couple more bottles on my next visit to the lcbo. this beer wouldn¬ít be for everybody but its definitely worth a try if you like either of these styles.

Serving type: bottle

On tap at Schneider at Tal in Munich makes all the difference! Wonderful apricot and tropical fruit aroma. Hazy amber with abundant head that lingers. Taste of orange rind, spice, malt, wheat. Perfect palate. Dry finish. I lowered the score a bit because of previous experiences but on this day it was perfect!

Shared a 50cl bottle from Maruhn (Darmstadt). Pours a hazy pale orange colour with a fluffy head that persists. Aroma has banana, clove and yeast. Some alcohol. Average to low carbonation and medium creamy body. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet in a well balanced harmony. Overall, a very good beer that probably I need to taste at lower temperature.

Bottled , Prague , CZ , Wheat,yeast,fruit and citrusy aroma , Hazy golden orange color with bigger lacing head , Sweet taste with long bitter finish , Full body , Soft carbon , Phenomenal sample of perfectly hopped strong wheat beer.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours hazy amber with a thick medium-sized head. The aroma is a delightful, rich combination of tropical fruitiness ¬ñ peach, apricot and orange ¬ñ with wheaty maltiness and spiciness. Taste is very hoppy and spicy, also a bit sour. Initial light sweetness lasts until hops take over. Hops add plenty of bitterness but it complements rather than overshadows the usual wheat beer maltiness and estery fruitiness ¬ñ this is rich in everything ¬ñ malts, hops and yeast ¬ñ and somehow still manages to seem balanced. The palate is medium to full bodied, smooth and low to average in carbonation. Have to say this is one of my favourite beers: tasty, rich, original. Gets better every time I have this.

Schneider Weisse Tap 5 Meine Hopfen-Weisse might have the longest name in beer. Pours with a frothy head and cloudy amber appearance. Aroma is yeasty with an element of sourness. Initial taste is yeasty with a bit of funk that mutes the more pleasant wheat notes. Finish has a bit of a hop bite followed by dry. Meine Hopfen-Weisse is certainly different but not in the best way.
500 ml bottle @ home. Pours murky light golden with a huge white head. Aroma is a bit hoppy with lots of bananas. Taste is yeast, citrus and bananas.

Pours a cloudy golden colour with a huge head which retains very well. Aroma of banana and clove. With a creamy texture on the palate this beer has lots of flavour, though it is quite sour it is very pleasant indeed. A lovely wheat beer though if I were to be critical I would say it is slightly one dimensional for a beer of 8.2% abv.

Pours very hazy ginger-honey in color with a foamy white head that delivers some lacing. Aroma is my favorite part of this beer - rich, ripe tropical fruit, bread, perfume and malt. Taste is a deep roast - heavy on the roast and hops with some fruit and wheat. Some booze running through as well. Not as good as Aventinus, but reasonably enjoyable.

I dont drink many wheat beers. tropical aromas, great task but didnt like the appearance. googled it - great IBU

#2 fles bij Theemutz, snaak heerlijk zomer kruiden

What a unique Weizenbeer. Nice, hazy brown light brown color. Impressing fine and firm head. Powerful hoppy, fruity aroma, somewhere between Pale Ale and Weizenbier. Unique flavor profile. Fruit salad with some alcohol flavor. Citrus, banana, pineapple. Nothing offensive but a little to sweet and cloying for my taste.
Tap@ Beerpreuverie Horst. Troebelgeel. Zurig aroma. Smaakt fris, banaan, kruidnagel, hoppig. Heel goed.

bottle 50 cl.(shared.)

nose: Tropical Fruit and oranges and some wheat

16.9 oz bottle- Pours hazy golden with a one finger head that slowly reduce. Aroma is overly malty, sweet and cloying, where is the hops! The taste is better, but again where is the hops, sweet candy like flavor, less cloying, but not horrible. Very disappointed in this!

16.9 oz bottle. Bottled 6/3/13. Aroma is not all that great compared to most quality weizen bocks. Maybe this is too old. Smells old. Aromas of butter, hay, perfume, something cloyingly sweet. Pours hazy cantaloupe with a large fluffy white head with excellent retention. Taste is sweet with a much more bitter counterpoint than most beers of this style, courtesy of those hops. Bottled: unk

Gold apricot with a solid quilt of marshmallow foam and lots of lace. Aroma of licorice, BO, weed, some black olive and some metal. Malts, yeast, some plastic, some banana, some more yeast and bitterness. Full bodied with moderate carb and a dry finish. Meh.

How: Bottle.

Aroma: Fruity, banana, orange, hops.

Golden hazy with small white head. Wheat hoppy nose. Taste has citrus hops, banana, orange, hint of honey. Has a little booze that lasts all the way through to the finish and beyond. Has a bitter kick that doesn¬ít last. Good beer, I like the hops.

Pours in hazy light orange body with huge head. Aroma has wheat, citrus and light caramel notes, yeasty. Flavour is sweet with long lasting light bitterness. Not well balanced. Body is medium with high carbonation. Did not impress me much, probably need to re-try this.

From tap at Wei√ües Brauhaus M√ºnchen. Beer is served in an Avintinus glass. Looks like a normal Wei√übier. Aroma is very fruity, lots of exotic fruits which definitely makes it so much different. Taste is medium sweet, low bitterness, floral hops, exotic fruits. Tap 5 is very easy drinkable for a Weizenbock and has a very different flavour due to the extensive hops used. Very good beer. IMHO bottle is much sweeter.
500ml bottle. Lots of hops for a German beer, but it was more herbal and spicy than just bitter. Alcohol masked very well, went down very easy. Tasty German style malts.
(bottle) hazy copper colour with a small white head; aromas of fruit, bread, cloves, bananas; rich and balanced flavour
50cl bottle. Cloudy orange.sweet banana and citric aroma well balanced with hops character. It¬ís a raly good beer.

0.5l bottle from Csakaj√≥s√∂r. Starts wih a nice huge head having aromas of banana, mandarin and honey. Hints of other fruits, mostly citrus. Foam has charming bittersweet taste, with banana and honey dominating. Colour is hazy dark orange. Taste is dominated by banana, honey. Yet, rather complex. Alcohol is also clearly there. Hoppiness is kind of mild, stays in the background, a bit more detectale in the aftertaste. Carbonation seems to be a bit strong for me in the beginning, but then becomes milder. A very good Bavarian weissbeer that gets only a bit of hoppiness to make it more exciting and exotic, but does not destroy the usual banana-honey dominated harmony.

Bought a bottle at Bert¬ís Bierhuis. The beer has a deep golden color and a nice white head, CO2 level is excellent. In the aroma strong tones of flowers, hops and fruits. The taste is silky and very hoppy, with tones of bananas, cloves, hops and orange peels. The finish is a light sweet with a medium bitter and gives a warm mouth feeling. Conclusion: it¬ís just a brilliant beer. One of the beers I regulary buy when I¬ím at a beer store.

50cl bottle. Hazy orange with medium, white head. 
NOSE : surprisingly the hop character reminds a lot of US hops : strong citrus, zest and pine. Yeast has it¬ís characteristic banana aroma and grains are more like dough. 
SIP : Creamy with good carbonation. Full body. It¬ís sweet and creamy with lactic and yeast notes in the background. Hop fruity and herbal notes are striking right after and it¬ís quite intense. Finishing with bitter aromas of zest and pine. Still yeasty and banana/bubblegum like feeling in the background. 
OVERALL : very surprising beer. I didn¬ít know that German beers are brewed with US hops. It¬ís a great marriage if you ask me. Yeasty and hoppy. The alcohol is well hidden.

(Bottle 0,5l)
Hops, orange peel, later sweet, yeasty aroma. Cloudy orange color. Huge, rocky, white head. Very sweet, orange peel and hops bitterness. Medium-full body. Light fizzy. Light sticky texture. Sweet, astringent, light warm finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle, thnx to McTapps! Cheers! Pours a lovely, slightly hazed golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is exactly what the name of the beer says it is, hops and wheat. Light dried citrus aromas with grassy hops and subtle wheaty, fruity touches as well. Very nicely balanced. Flavor is quite bitter for a German styled beer, especially a weizen bock, but it¬ís certainly enjoyable. There is a big, hoppy presence in the middle of the flavor, followed by a malty, wheaty finish. Aftertaste is very short, alcohol is well hidden and carbonation is defintely there. Nice brew!

Prominent, fresh-tasting hops (from the dry-hopping) beautifully balances the bock sweetness, with the wheat always present in the background. Strong pear flavor reminds me of, of all things, Westmale tripel. But as much as I love all types of weizens, in this beer it¬ís almost the pedestal to showcase the hops, which stands out like an electric guitar in a three-piece rock band.

500ml bottle. pours extremely cloudy yellow with thin, firm head. aroma is heavily of yeast, lots of wheat and some toffee. very nice taste. smooth mouth feel with, again, lots of wheat and a little citrus. refreshing.

Wspaniale piwo o gestej i trwalej kremowej piance, Kolor intensywnie pomaranczowy, drewniany odcien i szary przyprzelaniu wszystkich drozdzy. Bardzo aromatyczne, pachnie chmielami amerykanskimi i jakby mieta. W smaku tresciwa i bogata slodowosc, podpiekany banan troche swiezego pszennego chleba i na koniec cytrusowe orzezwienie z lekka nuta rozgrzewajacego alkoholu. Polecam bo to wielkie piwo.
Not outstanding at all, but in all a great beer. As usual from the brewery, from those I have drunk it has hints of bananas. Very pleasing beer. Will buy again if I get the chance.

Pours a hazy burnt yellow with white head. Wheat, yeast, clove and fruit aroma. Pineapple, wheat, yeast, clove and malt flavors. Light body and yeasty clove finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma is hops, caramel, toast, earthy, herbal and floral. Taste is Medium sweet and quite bitter. Full bodied with average carbonation.

October 2010. 500 ml. bottle. Orange amber color with a white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, malt, spice and yeast. Wheat flavors with alcohol showing through and balanced by the hops.

A-thick head and a beautiful golden copper hue. has that perfect wizen cloudiness to it.

S - banana and cloves are present as well as a strong citrus (orange i think) scent that really has me licking my lips.

T/M - delicious! you can really taste the blend of the two styles in this. the hops are prominent and as it goes down you can taste the smoothness and refreshing character or the wizen. the hops slowly turn into a more alcoholic taste as it goes down. starts off as a refreshing taste and comes off boozy at the end, but not as much as you'd expect from 8.2 ABV

O - im impressed by the collaboration here. i had doubts about combining the two styles but they've managed to pull off a pretty good beer here. I felt like the beer smelled more like a weizenbock, but tasted more like an IPA. it was a great drink for me, and i'd probably get a couple more bottles on my next visit to the lcbo. this beer wouldn't be for everybody but its definitely worth a try if you like either of these styles.

Spicy banana aroma, very strong. Thick orange color, fine blanket head. Extraordinarily sharp tart citrus flavor up front, but goes soft and mellow immediately. Creamy smooth body, leaves a mark. Wheat has some amazing properties.

Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Cloudy orange beer with large frothy head. Aroma of cloves, cinnamon and banana. Taste is cloves, hops, banana and orange peel. It has a spicy warmth, smooth and full bodied on the palate. Excellent beer by an excellent brewery.

Tap at Friends of Ham, Leeds. Wow. Tasty. Had this in bottle a few times but its never taken me by surprise like this before! Spicy nutmeg cinammon bananas toffee, not enough commas to go around.

Cloudy orange/golden with a frothy head that quickly disappears. Aroma is amazing. Strong flower/orange hops, grapes, abricot and some sweet malts.
Flavor is also complex, starts very sweet orange, bit spicy, grapefruit, light sour and ends a nice fresh citrus/grapefruit hop bitterness. Bit syrupy and medium carbonation. Great beer altough a bit too sweet imo.

(Bottle): Pours a hazy yellow/orange with a small white head. Aroma of hops, zest, pineapple, mandarin and yeast. Some quite tarty, fruity flavours accompanied by notes of banana, hops, clove and hints of pineapple and a touch of alcohol presence (although you wouldn¬ít guess it¬ís 8.2%). It¬ís a beauty in my opinion, must look out for more Schneiders.

Bottle poured a pale orange, but with less of a head then I would expect. Fresh apples and orange aromas followed by clove. Big flavors of sweet candy with hints of orange and bananas, quite complex. Spicy finish. A original combination of flavors. Some of the flavors are difficult to describe.

Thanks to bartlebier! Pours a hazy dull orange with a nice off white-head. Smell is huge hops, citrus, floral, rich malt. The taste is tart fruit, caramel, banana, citrus ending dry. light/medium body with nice tight carbonation.
Yellow blond, medium carbonation. A bit malty, very hoppy and a dry finish. Also notes of herbs. Very good!
Great weizen bock, with a powerful flavour. Isn¬ít an IPA, despite its hoppy flavor. Another masterpiece and a perfect example of innovation in a very conservative country.
Fruity malt aroma. Deep pineapple, citrus flavors, tarty finish. Very pleasant hoppy white, smoothly dangerous :)

Color p√°lido, turbia, blanquecina, espuma perfecta, generosa y persistente, cerveza con mucha vivacidad. Mucho cuerpo, aunque no tanto como podr√≠a pensarse por su graduaci√≥n. Fuerte aroma a l√∫pulo para ser una cerveza de trigo, aroma muy fresco, incluso con un toque de menta. Es muy equilibrada en el gusto, sabor muy fresco, con algo de dulce del cereal pero con el amargor del l√∫pulo muy claro. No se notan los 8 grados que tiene. Retrogusto fresco, menta. Pours an average white rocky head that fully diminishes. Body is hazy yellow orange.
Aroma contains light malts (dark bread, molasses), moderate hops (flowers, orange zest, lemon, lime) and banana, grape, raisin, pineapple, honey, vanilla, licorice and cola.
Flavor is light acidic, then sweetness is added and finally bitterness comes in the mix. finish is light astringent. 
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
This is a well hopped weissbier with the aroma's and flavors of IPA but softened by the Weissbier. A combination that works!

Bottled September 13, 2013.
Appearance: The body is an ugly murky burnished golden, showing bright on the edges. The head is tall and dense with great retention, forming a creamy light tan coating. Despite the ugly color this still looks wonderful.
Aroma: Bright apple, cherry and pear come to mind with bready and chalky notes and a touch of cloves. There are some sharp either esters or carbonation that comes off a little off-putting.
Taste: The intro is malty with some peppery spice and hints of clove throughout. Apples become apparent on the mid-taste though alcohol is present, like a high alcohol cider. Deep caramel and brown sugar notes make an appearance on the finish. This is malty and fruity, but a little rough. Still very enjoyable.
Palate: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, coming off a touch sharp.
Overall: This isn¬ít the best weizenbock I¬íve had, but it¬ís darn good. The alcohol comes through a touch, but I love the fruity notes throughout.

Aroma: lots of pine, pineapple, floral, sweet wildflower honey, a bit of yeast, banana
Appearance: dark golden, cloudy, minimal head,
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, refreshing, creamy, medium finish
Aroma is almost too strong. I get olives, which is a new experience for me. Nice head, full flavor. Spices mostly. Good but for me a little too much of everything. Bottle from the Mitra in Mijdrecht.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2015 hazy yellow colour with brownish notes, huge white-off white head; extremely complex aroma and taste of bread, citrus, grass, tropical fruits (mainly mango) banana,and pine resin (as if you would have a great weizen and an IPA in parallel); this is the best weizen (not only weizen bock, but in all weizen categories) I¬íve ever tasted; excellent beer

update: some pineapple can also be felt both in the aroma and taste. I¬ím really close to say that (at least currently) I can¬ít imagine that it is possible to brew better weizen than this one. score changed from 4.9 (10/5/9/5/20) to 5.0 - if I find better weizen in the future, then I¬íll re-score it again :) 

update2 (02 04 2015): still the best :-) worth to try again and again

Poured from 500mL bottle. Hazy yellow with foamy white head. Very lively, strong yeast and wheat with notes of orange and apricot along with skunk aroma. Most comes through in the taste along with some grassy notes. Nice full body.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange to light brown with nice white head. Aroma is lots of grassy hops with some alcohol and wheat. Flavor is bitter, dry hoppy, wheat, grass, alcohol. Perfectly balanced. Incredible how well wheat and hops can go together.

0,5l fles thuis. Donker oranje geel bier troebel van bezinksel en gist, met een redelijke kraag, kwel kleiner dan ik van weissen bieren gewend ben. In de geur abrikoos van de hop, gist en alcohol. De smaak begint vooral zoet met lavendel en na verloop van tijd komt er een hopbittertje om de hoek. Het eindigt met een mooie volle afdronk. De hoofdsmaak is naar mijn mening te zoet, maar het algehele smaakverloop maakt veel goed.

bottle. orange murky. strong citrus green , slight apricotty, hoppyness on nose, bananas, wheat. body is medium, feels dry. hops in flavour, no surprise. pretty normal weiss behind it. interesting, not really a favourite though.-- bb/wp8

750ml Bottle from Northgate, before the Dark Ages. . Nose is bready malts, yeast, banana, and a mild floral note. Bold and full bodied for 8.2%, medium alcohol warmth. Medium-heavy carbonation, quite bubbly golden pour with white cap. Mouthfeel is clean, taste is banana, nice yeasty kick, finishes perfect with a hint of pine needles and resinous hoppy notes, but not off-putting. Pretty cool beer.

Poured from a 500ml bottle, pours like a weizen, very cloudy, no light passing through with a large, white head. Beautiful aroma of bananas and several spices. The taste matches the aroma, beautiful, full banana flavours, cloves, spices, some sweet malts. Rather smooth and you can¬ít taste the alcohol, though it does give it a relatively full body. Carbonation is quite high. A cracking beer again from Schneider Weisse, one of the best German beers I¬íve had, on par with Aventinus.

50cl bottle from Liebick Getr√§nke in Germering. Pours a cloudy orange colored body with an inch thick, dense and frothy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is a blast of citrus, mango, and banana with a moderately sweet wheat malt backing. A light caramel and spiciness as well. Flavor is similar. Lots of fruits up front with some grapefruits, lemons, tangerines, mangos, apricots, and banana. Some caramel and a slightly sweet wheat malt backing provides a nice balance. A light spiciness is present throughout and increases a touch towards the end with a slight clove note coming through. Finishes moderately bitter and dry with a light sweetness and plenty of fruity hops. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium-full body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, an awesome beer. It¬ís been a go to, especially on tap at Schneider Weisse, while I¬íve been in Munich for 4 months. Definitely a fantastic example of the talent at Schneider Weisse.

Good appearance, very hazy colour. Refreshing beer but after a few of these you will start to feel the stronger alcohol and bitterness to over power, not a easy drinking session for a weisse beer so I switched to Hofbrau Hefe Weizen to finish the night.

My bottle doesn¬ít say anything about Brooklyn, this just says "Schneider Weisse Hopfen Weisse" but it appears to be the same beer. Murky honey brown, with a sticky rocky cap floating on top. Aroma is intreaging, apple, massive yeast, grape, big spice, citrusy hops but not over powering. I dig this beer. Taste is sweet and sticky, loads of yeast, lemon, peach, spice. There is no wrong with this beer. Toasted wheat is so very sweet.......... lemon is dominating the after taste. Starting to pick up on big hops hiding in the beer. I could drink the hell out of this beer!!!!

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy amber pour big impressive white head, fruity with spicy wheat aroma, unexpected citrus hop in first taste, some tropical fruit action with the usual suspects of banana and clove, impressed with this.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 B√§st f√∂re passerat f√∂r tre √•r sedan. Lagrad i kylsk√•p. Ganska kr√§mig. Monsterslurry. H√§rlig weis √§ven om det tveksamt har blivit b√§ttre av att ha passerat b√§st f√∂re med tre √•r.


------- frukt i doft. Kr√§mig fruktig, lite spritig. Smakar inde det minska vete√∂l. Schenider f√∂rv√•nar 3,0.  SBWF 2013

Schneider Weisse has a unique flavor in comparison to other weizen bocks, the taste of the hops are very pronounced it¬ís identity but still pleasant. This is a beer that is in its own class among weizen bocks.

Very richly flavoured, with certainly one of the most distinct and poignant aromas I¬íve experienced in any weissbier. Looks very nice too, due to a lot of yeast in suspension. The taste is hard to nail down, I would say it¬ís sweet-ish, with a good deal of fading secondary tastes, that can be perceived (depending on the person) as herbal, honey-like and even rose jam, to name but a few. Overall it¬ís a great experience.

Poured into a bier stein from a chilled 500 mL bottle. Pours cloudy orange-amber. Generous off-white head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma is subtle wheat, sweet malts, coriander, and orange peel. Flavour is a nice balance of sweet malts and sour mash with well-polished hops giving it a pleasant and well-balanced bitterness. Long finish. Awesome wheat beer perfect for a patio on a summer day.
Bottle, thanks to McTapps. hazy golden colour with white head. Hoppy, floral and whaet. Hoppy, bitter taste, also sweet and wheat, with some citrics. Light to medium body.

500 ml bottle from the lcbo
This is just an awesome beer a lighter version of abn aventinus
Very good

Pours a clouded golden colour with a frothy, white head. That persists. Some lacing on the glass. The colour gets darker and murkier the farther into the bottle I get. Smells of hops, and citrus, with a hint of spice. Taste is that of a wheat beer. Hints of spice and citrus. I get a lot of orange. Very mild hops on the finish.Mild carbonation. Medium body. An interesting mix of hops and a white. Good stuff!

This was a fantastic beer right down to the bottle. It smelt great and wend down very smooth. As I was at the pub I was on y phone looking to see if the local bevmo had it. I recommend this to all beer drinkers!!

Nice hoppy flavour in big 0.5L bottle. Beer of the month march at the local shop. Fruity flavour, orangy golden color. Little bit green, when holding it against bright light. Lots of sediment in the bottom of the bottle which makes it taste even better.

Review from notes:
500 ml served into a Weizen glass

A ¬ñ Cloudy burnt orange, lots of sediment, with a 2 finger white head that clings to the glass leaving sheets of lacing.

S ¬ñ Peach puree, mango, clove, sweet malt, honey, banana, just a barrage of rich fruit aromas.

T ¬ñ Big dose of fruity wheat. tangy banana, peaches, lemons, citrus meld with a sweet pilsner malt. Citrus and floral hops stick to the tongue on the finish.

M ¬ñ Rich and creamy feel, full bodied.

Big yeast presence and just the right amount of hops. Very soft feel and delicious. Zero alcohol presence. Great summertime beer.

Serving type: bottle

10-04-2012
