Head: lots of off-white foam. Colour: hazy, golden orange. Aroma: flowery hops. Taste: mild bitter. Palate: mild, some bitter, overwhelming hops, lots of CO2. Overall: very good. Wheat IPA?

Pale orange cloudy pour with a soapy head. Nice aroma of spicy earthy hops with a touch of yeast. Flavor is awesomely balanced between the slight tang of the "normal" Schnieder Weisse and the spiciness of the hops. Great brew.
Poured a light amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of zesty orange and a little spice. Medium creamy body, flavour of sweet malt with residual bitterness and some clove. Interesting.

Bottle. A perfect blend of piney, resinous, citrusy and grapey hops, sharp clove phenols and soft notes of biscuits and pear. Thick, full-bodied and sweet, balanced by a strong bitterness, a resinous, citrusy, tropical hop flavour and sharp notes of clove. Some alcohol in the finish but it works rather well, since this beer is very deep flavourwise. This beer is just so well integrated and full of flavour. Amazing!

caramel, citrus, spruce, bread, clove, banana, orange, cloudy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter
Pours a golden orange with slight white foam. Last half inch of beer in bottle shaken with the yeast to produce a very foamy (brownish gray) cap on top. Yeast clouds the beer quickly to a nice hazy orange. Aromas are surprisingly subtle. Looking for banana/clove but only finding a trace. More of a caramel with citrus/pine cone effect from dry hop. Still very nice. Head falls quickly, and aromas fade with it.  Subtlest bitterness in a predominantly sweet taste with a hint of sour.  No alcohol heat despite higher ABV so great balance.  Thin bodied, creamy mouthfeel which I like, and slick finish with minimal bitterness.  Beer is a good session drink - recommend it for a try.
Aroma has the smell of orange, spices, and a hint of cinnamon. It has a very frothy head that takes a while to disappear. Great taste.
High ABV so it tastes like a lot of those high performance Belgium beers... cloudy blond color. Nice beer...

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Wow! All the praise for this beer is spot on. No need to sniff it when you take the cap off; it fills the room before even being poured. Clove, over-ripe fruits and a hint of NZ grapey hops. Smooth, rich Hefe taste rebooted by pure bready malt richness and DIPA-like hops. Noticeable but balanced alcohol, this devastating beer made my ears go hot.
Wonderful smell of different fruits + excellent bitterness. One of the best beers produces by Schneider. Had in vom fass in Weissess Brauhaus and from bottles.
Bottle from Reading Beer Festival. Poured very clear, then lots of slightly lumpy yeast fell in! Maltiness, bananas, warmth from the 8.2%, but it really doesn¬ít drink that strong. Really nice beer.
500 mL bottle into a pint glass at Reading Beer Festival 2013.  Opaque orange, with a very big head.  Nice mix of hops and wheat in the aroma.  Tasty and substantial.

Drunk in a snifter at BrauKunstLive! Festival in M√ºnchen. Schneider Weisse¬ís Tap 5 was very good. As part of the entrance ticket, it was a freebie, so I couldn¬ít turn it down. It was my first Schneider¬ís in quite some time, so I was looking forward to it. It didn¬ít disappoint. It was hoppy, somewhat lemony, only hints of bubblegum, overall very balanced and slightly bitter at the end.

Vom Fass @ Schneider Weisses Br√§uhaus. Hazy organge beer with a lot of big yeast particles floating around. Aroma has wheat, and a lot of citric hoppines. Flavour has banana, wheat, citric hops. Full bodied, well balanced and very tasty!

In nose it is has soap and fruity aromas. Good appearance for a wheat beer with amber color and cloudy. Medium head for a wheat beer probably due to alcohol. Taste it is possible to feel alcohol and its bitterness that compensate sweet malts. Little bit spicy sensation, medium body, fizzy carbonation and of course alcohol. Refreshing beer but not easy to drink to be a wheat beer.

Head: off-white, smallish, forthy. Colour: really murky beige, caramelly.

Aroma: strong grapefruit. Taste: citrus, spicy zesty bitterness in the finish.  Body is pretty thick, chewy.

This is more of an IPA (aroma, taste) than a weissbier (body).

Appearance: very very hazy, almost milky, it's a dark yellow color, very thick white head

Aroma: intense lemon, bread, clean, 

Taste: lemon, citrus, sour bread, some bitterness as well, alcohol

Palate: low carbonation, very heavy on the tongue, leaves a bit of a lemon aftertaste 

Overall: I had higher hopes for this beer, it's a little too dominated by the lemon flavor, still not bad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from ABC Beers, Den Haag. Poured a cloudy amber colour win a thin broken white head. The aroma is big yeast with a little fruit and malt. The flavour is yeasty and medicinal with a little sourness on the palate. A very drinkable.and refreshing beer.
Bottle shared from ABC beers.  Pours hazy orange with a small off white head. Aroma of grass, grapefruit, citrus, cloves.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Bottle. light orange body very cloudy everytime I smell I have different fruits in the nose apricot, orange... and then come the hops I think I have found one of my favorite beers. I wish this would be produced with less alcohol. WOW WOW WOW

Wow this is a succulent beer. Smell is of lemon dishsoap bubblegum passionfruit and grapefruit. Explosive citrus taste on the tongue. Mouthfeel gets smoother as it warms. Last pour is full of gunk which gives a refreshing bitterness to it. Outstanding

Nice clean tasting beer: light golden yellow appearance with a frothy head that quickly thinned.  Taste was a nice mix of lemon and wheat; not too much alcohol

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy golden pour.  Thin off white head.  A little sediment.  Aroma is fruity.  Some citrus notes.  Taste is clean and mild.  Some fruit notes.  Reminds me a saison, but without the farmhouse funk.  Lemon and clove come to mind on the taste. Nice medium body. Refreshingly light, with well hidden alcohol.

Bottle from Mitra Beukenweg, Amsterdam.
Pour is hazy yellow, with thick white head. So far a typical Wei√üen. There is a big amount of sediment there as well. Not sure if we are unlucky, or this is the unfiltered part. Not very appealing though.
Nose and flavour have a herby citrus. Not much banana, which I like. Slight sours and a mildly bitter finish. Quite nice actually, if you drink with eyes closed.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 0.5 l bottle from Kehlheim... Nice clody orange color, good head... Interesting strong and fruity alcohol aroma... Nice hops...Medium sourness, long intensive ending... Very good beer...

Great beer! Pours a golden beer, cloudy and sparkling liquid with a beautiful frothy white head. It smelled like lemon and clove.
I tasted a light bitterness with a short duration.
The mouthfeel was average. Light body, oily and dry texture with an average carbo. The finish was bitter and astingent.

Dark blonde, hazy, smaall dense white head. Aroma is sourish sweet, fruity with clove. Fresh, some lime in it. Whaety taste but with a good dose of alcohol. More bitter than the original weizen, it¬ís ok but the alcohol is too much dominant.

Feb 2013 ¬ñ bottle, room temp.  Flavour is unusual ¬ñ slightly hoppy taste but not bitter, definite citrus to start moving on to a rounded, slightly sour wheat flavour with a bit of sharpness.  Not a lot of carbonation for a beer of this type.  Overall, interesting but not as nice as other wheat beers I¬íve had.

Pours a hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma is grassy hops, bananas, a little sweet. Taste follows with hops, malted and spicy, grassy hay. A little sweet with a medium-high carbonation. Very good.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 Original rating  12.3.2011. Rerating 081113. Bottle at Artturi, Tampere. Pours hazy yellow with a nice head. Aroma hops, wheat. Nice balanced wheat. Not Bad.
Heel hoppig, ruikt erg hoppig en smaakt zoet met veel alchol! Is een zware weizen met veel hop in de afdronk erg lekker!

500 ml bottle. Cloudy pale gold color topped by a rocky white head. Fragrant, fruity wheat malt aroma has hints of chamomile, sweet citrus and lavender. Sweet wheat malt flavor has a touch of mild sweet grapefruit and cloves. Finishes with a bittersweet spicy hoppiness. Very tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Golden copper colour, medium white foamy head, sweet citrud sour sharp pineappel hoppy smell, citrus creamy taste soft medium bitter medium carbonation honey fruity taste a bit thick/oily

50cl bottle. Glass: Weizen. Pours a yellow-orangish colour with substantial white froth. Hops, banana, and sugar on the nose. Strange taste: hoppy, herbal, banana sweetness, and some malts. Spicy bubbles. Medium mothfeel, average carbonation. Original, nothing incredible, but not bad.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 One of my favorite beers from visit in Germany. I was looking for some
kind of German IPA, tasted this- wow. Sweet malty profile with gigatonn of hops in aroma and flavor. Drunk from bottle, so no color. Only difference from ipa/dipa was that it was high carbonated. Very dry overall, liked that. And hops was more herbal than aromatic, but in a good way. Enjoyed every sap.
Tan buena est√° que es dif√≠cil clasificarla, blanca con extra de l√∫pulo y con amargor justo para llegar a un p√∫blico mayor.

Really like this one, but not as much as the adventus. Good flavors, sticky and sugary. Almost like candy. Yeast is delightful flavor and body is enjoyable. Does not have the malt presence of the other weizen bocks that i have had. This seems more to me like a high alcohol hefe.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20091123.
Pours hazy golden color with a medium sized head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, citrus fruits, some hops and grass. Flavor of wheat, mild yeast, some citrus fruits and hay. Very nice.

Great beer that is an interesting take on the style.  Hoppier than the average German Hefe-weizen as the name implies.  I get interesting floral smells from it not unlike an English IPA, but somewhat sweeter.  Tasting notes are apricot, some citrus, and pear.  Just delicious.  The mouth-feel is thick as you would suspect from how cloudy the beer appears when poured.  Small chunks of sediment float in the glass.

(From Notes) Pours a thick pale orange color. Thick head with many craters and peaks, good retention. Excellent lacing. Aroma is very sweet as someone said almost like bubble gum. Strong flavor of cloves and banana, kind of peppery. Thick carbonation evident for mouthfeel. Can definitely taste the alcohol in it. And way to zesty for my taste.

Sieht erstmal aus wie Weizen mit Bananensaft; sehr gelblich mit unsagbar vielen festen Bestandteilen; einzig die Schaumkrone verhindert eine schlechtere Benotung. Das Aroma hingegen entsch√§digt vollauf; viel Hefe mit Nelke, Harz und Hopfen vom feinsten, toll! Gehaltvoller Antrunk mit eher w√ºrzigen, wiederum harzigen Ankl√§ngen. Kaum fruchtig nach Citrusfr√ºchten. Daf√ºr kommt nach den harzigen Nelkent√∂nen gleich eine starke Hopfenherbe auf, die zuerst fast bitter ist, aber mit jedem weiteren Schluck abebbt. Der Alkoholgehalt ist nicht so deutlich wie bef√ºrchtet. Insgesamt ein spektakul√§rer Weizenbock mit geschmacklicher Achterbahnfahrt, die unausgewogen und etwas sperrig wirkt, aber Spa√ü macht! Test vom 19.10.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,15,11,13,11,13 - 12,60

Aroma: passion fruit, orange, light pineapple, yeast, flowers, citrus, light pine and cedar.
Palate: full bodied
Flavor: pine, passion fruit, ripe peach, papaya, dried non sweet orange, with peel, yeast, malt

This is a great beer very strong and smooth. Nice aroma of a pear and some floral smell. The colour is a nice yellowish orange. It has high alcohol but a very clean taste. If you want a stiff but delicious hefewiesen try this one.
Bottle at brew, bangkok. Hazy deep orange color, some white head. Fruity, wheaty and hoppy aroma, interesting. Nice wheaty taste, yeast, fruits. Very good.

(50 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD: August 6th 2013) Pours a hazy amber with medium, white head. Good retention and lace. Aroma is malty, phenolic, slightly smoked, dusty and medicinal. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body and a warming finish. Taste is boozy, medicinal slightly acidic with bacon notes. I¬ím really puzzled by this style of beer.

Very nice. Pours a hazy gold with off white head that clings to the glass. Wheat, sweet hops and raisin hits the nose. Sweetness is surprising on the first taste. Wheat, sweet malt and caramel pop. Will probably try again.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful golden haze. Very little head, expected much more. Aroma - Candied sun-dried raisins, tropical fruit and a hint of resiny hops. Taste of coriander, pepper, hops, pine, and citrus. My beer of 2013 so far.
Pours a hazy gold with a small white head.  Smells of tropical fruit, candy, raisins.  Taste is sweet, sour, and mildly bitter - tropical fruit, crackers, apricot, grassy.
Bottle. Pours cloudy tan with a medium tan head. Floral hop aroma. Medium body with a medium wheat flavor and a bitter hop finish.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2013 Yes!  Yes! & Yes!  Picked this up at Kroger thinking it would be average as hell--just wanted something new to try.  The joke is on me, because this thing rocks!  Interesting cross-Atlantic collaboration.  Hopfen-Weisse packs so much flavor and is exceptionally smooth.  Some residual sediment is distracting, but beautiful hazy gold burns bright.  Refreshing.
Bottle 0.5l at home. Colour is clear yellow/orange with small white head. Aromas and flavour are wheat, yeast, citrus, sweetness and some alcohol.

Weissbier with the hops flavor of a pale ale or IPA.  Pours a dark, pale, cloudy straw or honey orange.  Lots of particles floating in the brew.  Aromas of wheat, citrus, tangerine, hops.  Flavors of bread, caramel, grapefruit, & orange, with hints of pineapple.  Very tasty indeed!

Belle couleur p√™che m√ªrie, avec des ar√¥mes puissants d¬íagrumes, de coriandre et de houblon. Ronde en bouche, √©tonnamment complexe mais accessible, au go√ªt elle ressemble √† un m√©lange entre une blanche bien solide, et une bitter √† la finale persistante. Bien balanc√©e, originale et d√©licieuse.

Ok, I feel I need to get something clear from the start. I¬ím not, and never have been, a washing up liquid freak. I use it, I need it, but never have I inhaled it with glee before slurping it down. So why do I love this? The Fairy element is loud and clear. Soap suds and maybe cloves, a little banana but mostly washing up liquid. Yum!

Basically, alcoholic Lilt. But astonishing. And amazing. 
During summer, I would gladly drink nothing else. (Summer where I live only lasts about two weeks though.)

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Bottle shared with McTapps. If Lindemans Kriek was my surprise of 2012, then the title 2013 goes definitely to that Schneider. HUGE citrus, fruity and very hoppy aroma which will hit you from first to last ! What a aromatic bombthis beer is ! Taste offers fruits, citrus and a bit yeast but the nose is crazy well brewed. Superb piwo !

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2014 For the looks: Milky golden-amber in colour, with a steady and creamy head. Smooth texture. Fine carbonation. The nose is absolutely awsome: It smells like an IPA: Fresh, fruity, spicy, pepper. Taste is just as great: Coriander, pepper, fresh leaves, mild hops, cloves and exotic spices. Mild, sweet and strong finish. Delicious.
Excelente cerveza. Muy refrescante. Una "extra√±a" mezcla entre una weisse y una IPA. El l√∫pulo rebosa por todos los lados. Tomada en casa, en botella de 50 cl. Una de mis favoritas.

Bottle, trade with Grima, huge thanx!
Barva: kaln√° oran¬ûovƒõ ¬ûlut√°. Pƒõna st≈ôednƒõ hust√°, pomƒõrnƒõ rychle opadaj√≠c√≠. V≈Ønƒõ: √∫¬ûasn√° ovocn√° s jemn√Ωjm n√°dechem ban√°n≈Ø a grep≈Ø. Chu≈•: pln√© tƒõlo s vy¬ö¬ö√≠m p≈ô√≠jemn√Ωm ≈ô√≠zem a obilnou chut√≠ s vanilkov√Ωm n√°dechem a vyv√°¬ûenou ho≈ôkost√≠. Skvƒõl√© pivo!
Nice beer not to my taste but still really nice great smell and taste looks great aswell

A hazy, greenish, yellowish drink with lots of sediment. Looks interesting to say the least. Aroma is herbal hops: lemongrass, eucalyptus, some pine, some floral notes; also, lime peel, honey, green mango, and milder yeasty notes. The taste is duller, more grainy, less herbal. Very interesting, but I don¬ít get a lot of "Weizenness" out of it.
Bottle. Slightly cloudy with a big head. Golden orange appearance  with a fruity wheatness. Probably my favourite wheat beer so far.

Bottle. Gift from Neko-chan. Sourish, green apples, pickled banana, and a touch of vinegar in the nose. Cloudy honey straw color with a thin head. Creamy sweetness with banana and stewed peaches, with a bit of alcohol burn; then the hops gently take over. Medium-heavy body. A fired up and warming wheat bock. Great!

Hazy color, best described as part tea, part orange juice. Smell is excellent - sweet hops with strong citrus notes.  Wow, tastes like a blue moon on steroids.  A lot of orange, hops, and sweet malt... just a tiny bit of funk on the aftertaste.  This is an excellent, excellent beer -- I think it might be techno viking¬ís grass cutting beer.  I could stay alive with this stuff.

50 ml. bottle purchased @ biernavigatie.nl. Price was very agreeable as it is usually the case with this German beers & Schneider has a solid reputation plus their Avinitus is one hell of beer. Drank @ home, poured into my Molen tasting glass because I don¬ít use it nearly enough. The beer was bottled on 03.02.2012 ¬ñ BBF 03.02.2013. This is unfortunately a tad bit past its prime but luckily still good according to the brewer. Pours a more or less apple golden with a white disappearing head. Smell is sweet banana, corn, yeast, light sugar, spices, light cloves and some light citrus (almost an American hop like touch), wow this was quite a lovely surprise. This must be even lovelier fresher. Taste is a sweet blend of banana, corn pure & slightly floral spices, some closes, light citrus in the back of the sweetness, very soft wheat, light citrus, cornstalks, natural sugar and a big portion of chewy bubblegum. Very easy to drink with still a substantial banana body, quite creamy with a fitting carbonation. Goes down very easy & smoothly. Quite a lovely surprise and an excellent beer, one of the finest brews I have had so far from Germany. I assume that this is the first authentic Weizen Bock I try, either way I have some difficulties classifying this style because every time I try a different one, it is a completely different kind of brew from the previous one. Either way this beer is absolutely lovely & wouldn¬ít mind to check out a fresher bottle. This is brilliant stuff.

Aroma simpatico che promette davvero bene: molto luppolato, agrumato con i lieviti posti da contorno. Nel bicchiere appare bionda opaca con abbastanza schiuma molto persistente che davvero non ne vuole sapere di lasciare il bicchiere. Al palato perde un p√≤ di colpi. Ingresso luppolato, subito  "spintonato" via da quel dolce violento e bananoso dei lieviti. Sgraziata! mi aspettavo di meglio. C¬í√® da dire che nasconde a perfezione l¬íalcol.

Bottle at home. Murky orange pour, thin white head. Aroma is spicy, yeasty, quite hoppy with floral hops and some forest. Flavor is sweet fruity, somewhat creamy, quite hoppy, bitter and intense. Very full flavor and body. Nice balance. Great brew.

Una cerveza sorprendente y excepcional, muy lejos de lo que se espera de una marca tan tradicional y germ√°nica. Aroma inconfundible a l√∫pulo arom√°tico, c√≠trico, muy marcado. El primer trago deja un regusto largo. Una IPA en toda regla con la particularidad de ser de trigo. Eso hace que no haya el dulce maltoso que se espera, y al final resulta un poco cansada. Buen cuerpo, turbidez habitual en el trigo y un contundente amargor.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 Bottle bought in town, pours a soupy gold-brown with a thin clingy head. Tangerine and a little grapefruit and pine on the nose. Rich, honeyed, bready and thick body with a faint hint of cloves and a little marmalade in the finish. A bit cloying, but tropical fruit hops, a light spiciness and a firm alcohol bite mostly balance it out.

I¬íve never had any Schneider beers which poured as easy as this one.  Usually its a foam to space challenge to fit their beers into the glass in a oner but this was a dream and still have a firm tight whitish head,

Zillions of lines of beading rushes to thje top of the glass. Cloudy brown yellow with some sweetness

Too bad the Schneider signature wins out her. I was expecting more bitterness.

Bottle. Pours cloudy old gold colour with a loose off white head that is short lived.  Aroma is complex  blend of yeast  cloves fruit and spices. Wonderful complex taste juicy sweet. Spicy. Citric 
Malts  floral alcohol well hidden -some undertone at the finish.  Modest carbonation. Leaves a nice afterglow. Needs to be sipped slowly and savoured.  A joy

Botella. Apariencia como una cerveza de trigo aleman. Aroma acido lupulos citricos y levaduras. Sabor buen equilibrio entre acidez y lupulos con el alcohol muy bien integrado. Decir que dependiendo de la fecha de embotellado cambia. Para beberla fresca
Bottle, courtesy of MiP. Pours cloudy dark yellow with off-white head. Clear, pleasant aroma of hop, grain, and some mild spices. Pleasant, hoppy and grainy taste with spicy finish. Yum!
Bottle. hin cloudy caramel orange with a bubbly white head. Aroma is sour fruit and hints of wheat. Flavour is jammy fruit, grapefruit IPA, with a lingering bitter jam finish. Texture is quite thin.

I was directed here under an alias name. The label on what I am drinking right now is Hopfen-Weisse Hefe-Weizen Ale at 8.2% alc./vol.  From the bottle to the glass, it is cloudy tan and dark with a very low density head(large bubbles).  Smells like an American-style IPA and the head hasn¬ít even faded away. Big whiff of hops and their array of pine and spruce zest.  Very floral as well.  Taste is a blend of American-style IPA craft-brew and traditional German Weizenbock.  Overall not bad, but just plain strange.
This is a really good beer with just the right mix of ingredients. I could easily make this my session beer during spring and summer.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Pours a beautiful, warm yellow, a soft fluff top. Aroma is a multiple experience: pumpkin, flower, wheat, icing, hop (of the harvest/European variety) - what AM I talking about? The strength is detectable and warm, the taste is fresh, juicy, tart and sweetly bitter. Like a wheat beer, but also like a DIPA. I¬ím not explaining myself properly, but the thing to take away from this review is that I loved this. It is a magnificent beer.

Bottle. Pours Cloudy Orange/Yellow with a thick white head. Aroma is of fresh hops. Grassy and citric. Flavour has textbook banana and clove but extremely well balanced with the hops. Unusual to have the hoppy bitterness to close. I loved it.

(Flasche) Es hat eine getreidig orangene Farbe, ist stark hefetr√ºb mit einer feinen wei√üen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist fruchtig, spicy, vllt Carnberry oder Stachelbeere mit einem winzigen Aroma von einer frisch aufgeschnittenen Quitte. Der Geschmack ist leicht vollmundig, etwas hefig, mit einer guten Rests√º√üe. Retronasal gleicht es dem Aroma und im Abgang gibt es sogar eine merkliche aber dezente Bittere.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 500ml on tap. Aroma is hops and pineapple, fruits. Lovely. Appearance is cloudy orange with a white head. Taste is sweet and bitter. Amazing. Has a full, bitter body. Overall a superb beer, however, not a typical Weizen. Update: 01.01.13. Added 1 point to taste, 3 points to overall. I like this one even more, superb Beer!

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2012 .5l on tap and served in a Schneider Weisse tulip glass at Weisses Br√§uhaus in central Munich. 
This cloudy beer has a well proportioned, near white head that is very durable and leaves exceptional sticky lacing.  The aroma is remarkably hoppy ... for a European beer. There is a clear weisse beer base with a strong hop presence: a hop component like an Amer. IPA. Lots of orange in the nose!
The flavor is a bit different, with much less hop presence than in the nose. It is a bit more sweet than bitter, even in the finish. Still a strong citrus flavor; mainly orange. Yeasty too. A complex mix of diverse flavors that are really well integrated. 

Exceptionally smooth feel with no harshness whatsoever. Medium body.

O: a really exceptional beer worth seeking out.  The best weisse beer I¬íve ever had. Despite the very hoppy aroma, this beer should be drinkable even for many who are not so fond of hop flavor or bitter beers.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2014 Looking forward to this for ages, not as easy to get as TAP7, even on a 200km distance of the brewery in South Germany - had to import via Bierzwerg. The flavour profile for this unusual Weisse is spectacular by conservative German standards: sweet with citrus overtones, malty-sweet body with an almost sharp/aggressive amount of upfront soapy hops and chewing gum: altogether somewhat unbalanced (cloudy, sharp simcoe? hop profile) and boozy (bottle does say "Weizenstarkbier 8,2%"), which makes it harder on the stomach. Heard this used to be more balanced and impressive but this beer still sticks out by any bland German Weizen standard...// rerates 2013-2014: grows on me depending on mood & occasion: either very soapy, pollenlike, flowery or very balanced: the batches and/or storing methods on its meandering distribution paths seem to diverge.. Quite easy to drink for a Weizendoppelbock and fully rounded.
Pours a dark muddy yellow with tonnes of sediment. Very cool. Aromas are sweet wheat and hay. Tastes are some citrus, clove...massive malty sweetness...and a boozy finish. Loved it!

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Thought this was great. Can¬ít believe it¬ís the same beer as below. Maybe that one was old.  Hoppy weissenbier is lovely. The nice cross-over between weissbier and ipa. Old review: This was way too sweet to me and I usually enjoy wheat beer every now and then. Weiss bier is not a favourite but I put it slightly over a lager. Not much hops in this either although it markets itself that way. Rate: 2.8
it tastes so good, one of the best weisse that i have the pleasure to drink!
Truck yeah. Awesome brew. Foamy head straw hue and a touch of sweet. Perfect traditional heffe taste.

orange, golden, hazy, cloudy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, lively, long finish. This is a citrus flavored, fruity hefeweizen. Stronger alcohol content at 8.2%. A pretty good beer.

Ottima weiss molto corposa e particolare. Nn troppo fruttata ma parecchio spaziata. Promossa a pieni voti! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Efter att ha druckit otaliga weiss-, pilsner och lager√∂l s√• √§r det fantastiskt sk√∂nt att dricka n√•got humligt. Fruktig och j√§stig smak med en stabil kropp och en god balans. Slutsats: riktigt gott.
Perfect clove & banana balance in this freak weisse. Strong hoppy aroma and flavour with a nice aftertaste.

This beer is hoppy by German standards, but done to perfection. Immediately the hops hit the nose when pouring. Beer pours cloudy with chunks of sediment suspended in this delicious brew. Off white head has swirls of sediment, and head stays with e drink and clings to the side of the glass. Tastebuds are stimulated by the hops, left tingling (but not overdone like some American IPAs). This a rare gem, and nobody does weizens like Schneider...

Cloudy medium to dark gold with a thick, frothy, lacy, lasting, orange head. Super strong smell of wheat and hops over a sweet malt, caramel and fruity, mango/peach and some yeast. Notes of banana. Medium thin watery body with soft carbonation. Tastes very wheaty and banana filled.Sweet Light fruity mango and citrus orange with malty caramel. The finish is long and dry and bitter with taste of wheat. Very nice to drink. A excellent wheat beer.

Loooove this beer. Quick review. Wonderful sharp citrus, lemon, apricot, light wheat, faint nail polish. Taste is excellent: orange.... no - apricot, lime, lemon, balanced yeasty spice, drying wheat is mild and almost nonexistent. Excellent all around. I love this style of brew - weisen bock?? I think not.

It looks muddy, orange and a bit green. Aroma is citrus, banana, hey. Taste is sweet, young white wine-like, really complex taste with nice balance, with a some bitterness at the end from the hops. My favorite weizenbock so far. Really cheap as well.

Another beer from Schneider that isn¬ít fooling around. This beer pack a lot of flavor and some kick as well. Rich with wheat, banana, and citrus. It would be tough to drink more than one... it¬ís just that intense for a wheat beer. Very zesty.

Bottle sample.
Cloudy yellow with a small white head.
Citrus hops aroma with fruity esters and fresh grain.
Lots of hop flavor, medium bitterness, wheat tartness and pomelo.
Dry, medium bodied, alcoholic but pleasant.
Aroma is caramel, fruits and raisins. Taste has a medium sweetness, lightly sour. Medium body, creamy, lively carbonation with a long finish. A very nice Weizen-Bock.
Pours cloudy yellow. Aras of yeast, cereal, some banana maybe some apricot. Light in the mouth with lively carbonation. Tastes mostly med sweet with some light hop bitterness.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2013 20.09.2012.  Bottle. Pours unclear orange color, with long lasting white head. Heavy mango aroma, with hints of of wheat and fruits. Very refreshing. Excelent beer. Must try again 9-3-8-3-18-41.

20.07.2013. Bottle. Hazy orange with a moderate white head. Heavy mango and elderberry aroma, also sweet and other tropical fruits. Flavor is quite the same but not as powerfull, wheaty, sweet, nice sweet mango and elderberry aftertaste. 8-3-8-4-17-40
500ml bottle. It is a very characteristic beer with a rock body, citric feelings but bread and honey and alcohol also can taste. Oily, hard drink. Foam is almost none.

Bottled @ Very malt, wheat smell and taste. Full body, little bit fruity, malt, sweet with warming tail. It¬ís definitely not a beer which you want to drink whole evening but it can be perfect beer to taste in cold times after good lunch.
Super tasty little Weizen with a ton of clove and light banana with bubblegum. Really tasty and a bit sweet with a full body and somehow easy to drink. Overall pretty much tasty
Bottle. Sampled at Brad Fest 2012 in Minneapolis, MN. Pours a hazy yellow color with white head. Wheat, lemon aroma and flavor. Nice Strong wheat

pours a cloudy orange-yellow with a very small white head, and good lacing.

smell is floral, wheat, and some banana in the back.

taste is crisp, some citrus, wheat, and hops.  ends a little lemony and a little bitter.

Tap at the Weisses Brauhaus, Munchen - 16/07/12.
Amber orange with a good white head.
Floral hops, perfume notes, citrus, orange peel, wheat and spice.
Flavours run on from the nose, wheat up front and a definate apricot taste in the mix and a little peppery in the finish.
Fullish bodied for a weisse.
So much better fresh from the tap than the bottled version!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle poured a cloudy golden orange color with aromas of spice, banana, clove, and bread.  Flavors are the same, light alcohol flavor nice beer overall.
Cloudy orange brown, thick lasting off white head. Full bodied, soft carbonated, hoppy, doughy, citrus fruity beer.
Bottle, aroma is very of haltertoo hops, flavour is very hoppy for a wisse beer, but the flavour is a full and very nice, decent offering

Beau liquide blond √† la robe voil√©e ayant une mousse qui se r√©sorbe lentement, Une dentelle qui dessine un motif d¬íexplosion solaire. De belles odeurs d¬íherbes fra√Æches, florales, avec des pointes √©pic√©es, de levures surette ou encore de tarte au citron, quelque chose de bucolique, de souvenir de visites chez ma grand-m√®re paternelle. √áa go√ªte plut√¥t autre chose. L¬íalcool est facilement perceptible en bouche tout en laissant de l¬íespace au levain, encore, parce que j¬íai une sensation aigre sur la langue et suret sur les bords. Difficile √† cerner mais, oh! combien appr√©ciable. (300-080812)
Cloudy orange pour with a thin white head. Aroma is wheat with spice, banana, and lemon. Taste is bready with citrus and a hint of banana and spice. Refreshing with no hint of alcohol. Really good.
500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy /orange colour with a big frothy head. Aromas of yeast, banana. Enjoyable beer.

Bottle @ Schneider Kelheim. I previously rated this only a 3.2 from a bottle that I picked up in Kansas City, but this was a truly different experience (dare I say, transcendental?) Very nice, completely cloudy appearance with a yellowish white head. Rich grapefruity, passionfruit, pineapple, yeasty aroma. Fucking A. That is one nice aroma. Richly tropical fruity, pineapple, big grapefruity hoppy fruity, tangy, lightly tart, mild yeasty flavor. Unbelievable fruit bouquet while still retaining some excellent wheat characteristics. Really an amazing experience that wasn¬ít surpassed by many beers during my 45 day tour of Europe. So fucking smooth for 8.2%. I could get so fucked up. This beer needs to be drank extremely fresh.
Large pillowy white head.  Banana citrus aroma. Sweet fruity flavour.  Soft finish
8.3% hazy orange colour with a good head, banana yeast aroma, fruity yeasty taste, nice.

Was not a fan, but this could have been because the beer was too old.  Banana was powerful, maybe a bit too much.  The hop aroma goes from grass to funk in seconds.  Light body. Tried at the Cunigan¬ís tasting party in 2012.
Golden colour with a large frothy white head and lace clinging to the glass. Pleasant flavour, sweet fruit hop, yeast with usual characteristics of the style. Smooth texture in the finish.

I¬ím always suspicious of strongly alcoholic Weisses, and this is, unfortunately, no exception.   Sweet-alcoholic notes predominate, followed by some light grassiness.  I almost noted Spanish moss, as if this was a homebrew.  The finish is sweet and almost cloying.  Although a well-made brew to be sure, I believe this is to strong to be an enjoyable Weisse.

Pours cloudy yellow/orange colour with a big frothy head. Aromas of yeast and bread, some esters of spice and banana, with a fruit rind note. Oily profile with leesy/yeasty note, a bit sour fruit like in the mid palate and finishes bitter. It has a slightly sweet vanilla finish to it. a very enjoyable brew.

Pours swampy light orange with half-inch of head (alcohol dampening the head).  Aroma is hefe banana, with significant lemon.  Taste really opens up with big grain aromas - lots of bread dough, lots of really sweet fruity notes, almost like the aventinus.  Hops aren¬ít bright and dominant like in an IPA but there¬ís defeinitely more citrus and more bitterness than their straight hefeweizen.  Finish is similar to a belgian blonde, with a strong funky yeast character.  Really a lot to describe in this one.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 2014-02-10
50cl. Bottle
Pours cloudy yellow/orange with white head. 
Aroma grapefruit, banana, citrus, tropical sweet fruits, honey. 
Taste awesome hoppy bitter, fruity sweet, some sour. 
Mouthfeel creamy, fresh. 
Amazing beer one of my favorites!

2012-07-19
50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy (poor in the yeast) yellow/orange with white head. 
Aroma grapefruit, banana, citrus. 
Taste is awesome hoppy bitter, some sour, some fruity sweet.
Mouth-feel creamy/oily. 
Amazing beer!

0,5 l bottle,   best before 18. Apr 2013 
hay, bread, grass, citrus, herbs, leaves, banana, alcohol, orange, cloudy, minimal head, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, creamy, oily feel, sticky, average carbonation, long finish,
Great weizenbock, clean in flavour, hazy in appearance. Schneider Weisse never dissapoints me.

Bottle, shared with Robbie. Hazy bright orange with a beautiful dense white head with golden hues. Aroma is very fruity, lots of juicy tropical notes, mild spice and mild banana. Flavours are bursting with unexpected pineapple, pear, really very quenching and appetizing. There is a little estery banana in here too, and some spicy notes, but nowhere near the proportions usually found in the style. Also, the finish has more bitterness than most WBs I¬íve tried. This was really a surprise in a good way. It pulled my senses in a few different directions. Loved it!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Wow, I love almost everything from Schneider, but this was just not my cup of tea...or beer, whatever. The aroma is a mixture of hops and bananas with some weird sweetness blended in.  the beer is golden with a white head. The beer turns to a cloudy beige when the yeast is poured in. The taste is like biting into a bitter green banana, which some may like, but I don¬ít. Medium bodied, but just odd for my tastes.

Bottle, pours hazy dark gold with a finger of white, ice cream head. Nose is apricot, clove, banana, floral hops. A bit of citrus on the tongue, more banana, fields of grass. Funky, sweet. Slight astringency. Slightly sticky, lasting finish with some hop bite. Really great, interesting take on the style.

Bottled. Pours hazy orange with a huge off-white head, leaving a nice lacework on the glass. Nose of yeast, banana,citrus, wheat and grassy notes. Sweet flavor with again yeast and citrus along with orange, caramel and banana notes. Medium bodied, average carbonation and oily texture. Ends up decent bitter. An interesting wheat,

500ml bottle. Pours deeply cloudy yellow/orange with off-white head that lasts well. Fairly citrus on the nose with a really bready yeasty note, grain and spice. More expressive on the palate with lots of banana and cloves and a hop edge. A little sticky on the palate but tasty.

The beer pours cloudy with visible chunks of sediment.  Aroma is sweet with a hint of spice. taste is wheat with a notable bitterness, some banana flavours and a yeasty sweet after-taste. full bodied palate, quite a bit heavier than most wheat beers.  On a non-technical notes, I love this beer. Very unique flavours and very memorable. I usually prefer IPA¬ís, but this beer is something special and available in Ontario which is a plus. the bitterness in the beer compliments the wheat in a very unique way, and the 8.2 alch% is nice on those hot cottage days by the dock.
The original from Bavaria, nice light brown color and small foam head. Not filtered, not too sweet.
Bottle pouts a hazy golden amber color with a nice white head.  Aromas of spice, banana, citrus.  Smooth, crisp, amazing beer

Bottle from Kris Wines. Wasn¬ít sure how this would be, a hoppy weizenbock! The initial pour is clear and orange with a super-violent carbonation, becomes a cloudy orange brown as the yeast comes out. Aroma is mostly orange citrus hop, but also some yeasty spice, almost more like a Belgian ale. Taste is very complex and multi-layered, lots of spice, a fair booze hit, yeast, some Bavarian yeast, a little creaminess, then a hoppy finish with orange, maybe passion fruit, tiny hint of grapefruit. So much going on, could have been a disaster, but I really liked it!

Pours hazy golden with visible carbonation Nice white head. Spicy aromatic nose, both hops and malt are present. Flavor is sharp on the hop bitterness, hop flavor is slightly cloying and muddles up the malt profile a bit. Astringent aftertaste, slightly medicinal. Tongue gets beat up a bit here. That aftertaste is distracting and it lingers when I burp. Reminiscent of a home brew that is not quite right. Would love to give this higher rankings but it misses the mark. Love both breweries, though.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 from bottle. pours a deep orange hazy colour with a minimal frothy head that quickly disappears. the aroma is fantastic: lots of hops mixed with the typical weissbier characteristics: banana and some yeast. but this one adds the citric and tropical fruits notes from an IPA to it. absolutely awesome! the full body, the quite creamy and the fizzy carbonation mixed with all the sweet fruity notes and the slightly bitter aftertaste make this one of the best beers around. go get it!

Hazy, dull gold pour with a thin white head. Aroma is much sweeter than expected, I saw the word "hefeweizen" and assumed it would be all banana and clove, but there is a strong caramel and burnt sugar punch to it. It¬ís almost like a banana split. Like a hefe sundae. Taste definitely has that banana note in it, but has a sort of chocolatey flavor behind it. Some clove flavor, notes of tangy wheat grain, plum, pears, and some more fruity banana esters on the finish. Palate is full, slick and creamy like any wheat-based beer should be. Very nuanced and not quite what I was expecting. I bought this hoping to explore the underappreciated hefewiezen, but ended up getting more of a pale colored weizen bock. Still quite good, though.
Colore arancio opaco, schiuma di media persistenza. Al naso luppolo e prevalentemente malto. In bocca esternamente fruttata, a volte eccessivamente...retrogusto troppo dolce.
Great taste, this beer is not filtered so you will see a lot of sediment, great taste and aroma, one of the best I ever tried.

Bi√®re blonde de 8.2 % d¬íalcool. Elle poss√®de un odorat citronn√©/orang√©. Elle poss√®de un moyen col au versement. Elle Poss√®de un go√ªt de clou de girofle ou d¬í√©pices en bouche. L√©g√®re amertume. Aspect d¬íagrumes plein la bouche. Bonne, mais¬Ö.

Rediciously recommendable beer. I have never ever, regardless of season, not enjoyed this fine brew. I am not gonna lie, but the aroma is unique and taste does indeed stand out from all other 8+ bocks I know of. If you haven¬ít tried it, for god¬ís sake; get your but out there and find it:)

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 A close contender to Schneider¬ís best (the original - Tap 7), the Tap 5 offering is arguably superior in appearance (a nice hazy lightness) and aroma but a slightly sweeter taste and longer finish make it less easy to drink in large quantities. Previously confused with Tap 6, which is darker and fuller. Still a great Schneider though.

The head is robust, the body light brown and very cloudy with pieces of hops inside. It smells yeasty aromatic hoppy. The taste is intensive hoppy a bit fruity-sweet-citrus, a little bit malty and yeasty. I love this beer! Full bodied and delicious!
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 At Weisses brauhaus Munich. Fantastic stuff. Banana clove nose, then Rich and sweet and malty flavor and then strong but balanced fresh hops come in. Serving: Tap

Draught at Port Street Beer House, Manchetser. Classic hazy orange gold shade with sticky lacing forming in the glass. Yeasty banana-rich aroma with some nice hints of fruity hops in the mix. Very crisp and fruity taste with a pronounced herbal character at times. Impressive and surprisingly easy to knock back.

Bottle. Modarate aromas of grain and cereal ofr the malt side, perfume and lemon for the hops, musty and leather for the yeast, with banana, wood, nutmeg, and alcohol in the background. Head is large, frothy/rocky white with good lacing and is fully lasting. Color is hazy amber/tan. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter, and a touch sour. Palate is medium, slick with a lively carbonation. It¬ís exactly what it claims to be, a hoppy weizen. Excellent.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a pleasantly clouded apple cider color, fluffy white head. Great aromas of banana, orange, cinnamon, strong tea and hops. Nice complex flavor, sweet, plenty of fruit flavor, banana, coconut, caramel and toasted cereal malts, and a slightly bittered hop finish. Medium carbonation and creamy on the tongue, but leaves no residual mouth feel, great quencher. Really enjoyed this one, lots of complexity.

It pours golden yellow with hints of ochre, it is almost opaque and incredibly cloudy; the head is off-white and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: banana, cloves, alcohol, hay, and sourdough bread. The taste is medium tartness that finishes with a slight alcohol; there are notes of: banana, bubblegum, alcohol, sourdough, and slight barnyard funk. The palate is medium-full bodied, low-medium carbonation, and long finish. Overall, a big-booty weisse ¬ñ nice.

Keg at Euston Tap, London. A hazy orange/golden coloured pour with a healthy white head on top. Sweet, yeasty aroma. Tastes quite sweet, yeasty, banana, citrus fruit, spice. Really rich and complex. Absolutely delicious!

Bottle at sir Williams pub ljubljana. Pours nice hazy light orange.
 The smell.... it¬ís just fantastic. Hops all over the place, after beer settles down, nice sweet maltiness. Light clove smell. 
This beer is super-sweet. Maybe it¬ís just me not completely adjusted to doppelbocks, or the time of year is wrong for this beer.  Don¬ít get me wrong, it¬ís super beer, mistake on my side for ordering this at 25 degrees celsius. Nice maltiness, but then hops hit you. It¬ís a nice hit :) this beer doesn¬ít hide its strength. Nice little alcohol kick, then a nice dry finish. Hops all over again. 
Overall this is a super-beer, but not at this time of year. This will hit my fridge the moment temperatures start to drop. Obviously you just can¬ít go wrong with Schneider-Weisse.

500mL bottle from LCBO.  Slightly hazy amber with a medium white head.  Tons of sediment on the bottom.  Aroma of apple, ginger, raisin, spice, and fruits.  Taste is full of surprises - sweet rum and spice, pineapple, booze, iced tea, cooked apples, lemon, and banana.  Almost tastes like something other than beer, to be honest.  Not bad, but I won¬ít be bothering with this one again.

A well made and balanced mixture of styles, a heavily hopped wheat bock. The IPA like bitterness of the beer seems to mitigate the sweet alcoholic heaviness typical of a wheat bock. I am sure a lot of experimentation went into finding the right balance of the styles so they compliment each other but find it they did.

This is one sexy beer. I¬ím finally starting to enjoy some of the German master beers and this is certainly one of them. Pours a murky blond mud colour, like adobe clay. Smells like wheat and citrus chewing gum. Tastes like dusty wheat with some strong alcohol and it¬ís damn good. Bottle from lick-bow.
Aroma is of fruits (bananas) and some alcohol. Taste is too sweet, not very well balanced. Good beer, nothing special here.

(500mL from LCBO) Poured cool, a murky brownish orange with a small white head which left a bit of lacing, and a lot of whitish sediment in suspension. Aroma very fruity, orange rind, tropical fruit punch (pineapple, I guess?), bread yeast, flowers, tartness. Flavour starts sweet with lots of juicy citrus fruit, a little bit of banana, wheat, light caramel, dries down a bit with yeastiness, some bitter hops and persistent fruit. Finishes balanced with a little hint of the high alcohol. Full-bodied for the style with medium-soft carbonation. A unique, deliciously refreshing and, due to the ABV, rather dangerous weisse!

Bottle 500 ml. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head and some lacing .Aroma of banana, bubblegum and grass/herbal notes. Taste is moderate sweet with a medium long lasting bitterness. Nice balance and good complexity.
Great aroma, something wierdly fresh. Pineapple? Taste varies from good to absolutely brilliant, depending on age, batch and the mood of the drinker ;)

Bottle.... It pours muddy dark orange with a medium white head....The aroma is sweet, lots wheat, yeast and some sour notes....The flavor is wheat, banana, alcohol, fruits and bitter..... nice wheat bit finish....

0,5l flaske. Fristende aroma med banan og appelsinmarmelade og fristelsen blir ikke mindre etter f√∏rste slurk. Et nydelig √∏l, velhumlet, med god munnfylde, passe s√∏dme og stor fruktighet. 8,2% mersmak.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet √òkern
Golden color, good foam.
Medium body & complexity.
Fruity and sweet- very good carbonation.
Enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

De color dorado con una gran espuma blanca. Aroma a cerveza de trigo pero lupulada ( Lupulos europeos). Sabor notas maltosas, ligeramente acida y con buenas dosis de lupulo. Final seco amargo y buen retrogusto a lupulo

From the Bottle.

aroma  of orange peal and dough like yeast, slightly spicy and floral.

Orange peel, yeast and spice on the palate, complex but refreshing at the same time. Looks murky but tastes pretty good, clean finish with just a touch of alcohol coming through.
From the bottle, pours a cloudy bright amber with a big old white head.  Citrus, yeast, caramel, orange zest all hit the nose.  Slightly bitter with a big soft sweet smooth finish.  Quite nice.

Pours a cloudy yellow with some sediment and a tall creamy white head. Aroma is wheat, banana and caramel. Taste is also wheaty with fruit, yeast and notes of caramel leading to a wheaty and fruity finish. Really good!

bottle; cloudy brown/grey with medium off-white head; aroma-yeast, caramel, banana, grapes, spices; taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, thick feel, lively, long finish, astringent, warming alcohol feel. Great brew. ugly but tasty.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2012 Bottle 0,5 l - jollybeers.net Appearance: Cloudy amber color with a medium, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma: - moderate to high - malt, orange peel, pineapple , yeasty(dough), spices, cloves, sambucus, flowers. Taste: high sweetness with a long duration. Alcohol is well hidden. Palate: Body is full, texture is creamy, carbonation is average.
Overall: even my burps smell nice. :)

500 ml. bottle as Schneider Brooklyner Hopfenweisse.  Pours a slightly cloudy yellow with a nice white head.  Aroma of yeast, grain, citrus, and spices.  Taste is yeast, wheat, citrus, hops, cloves, and corriander.  A bit sweet,  Some alcohol presence.  Very nice.

Bottled, 500ml from York Beer & Wine, York as Schneider & Brooklyner Hopfen-Weiss. Murky orange with slight head, despite a careful pour. Despite the looks, this had pieces of hop and yeast floating everywhere, the taste is still remarkably fresh. Lemony, citrusy, banana wheaty, yeasty flavour, there is a lot going on. Perhaps a touch sweet in the close, but good beer.

Weizen bock is a pretty unknown beer style to me: I¬íve only had one before, Weihenstephaner Vitus. That one was very good, kind of like a hefeweizen with everything tuned up to 11. That is what I expected of the Tap 5 as well, but it turns out that this is a different creature all together! The murky orange body is filled with particles of all sizes and doesn¬ít look that great. The head is large, consists of creamy rocks of white foam that quite quickly reduces to a long-lived layer that laces the glass well. A very strong aroma with yeast, spices, perfume, sweet fruits (the banana is a bit fainter than expected, pineapple is more evident). The taste is moderate sweet and¬Ö hey, a moderate bitter finish! That¬ís a new one! It really backs up the syrupy sweetness in a nice way. Strong flavours with lots of hoppy, yeasty and malty notes. It¬ís fruity, but hardly any banana. Also spices. The most dominant elements however are things I¬íve never picked up in a beer before! Is that blue cheese? And capers? Or is that anchovies? Olives? Que? I guess what I¬ím trying to say is that this is quite unusual, but extremely interesting! The mouthfeel is perfect: the beer is full-bodied, the texture is syrupy and the carbonation is moderate. No traces of alcohol. A highly unusual but very entertaining, tasty and more-ish beer! 
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 7 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
(Bottle 21/03-2012) Unclear yellow color, flower aroma, very fresh flower taste.

On tap at the Weisses Br√§uhaus. Cloudy orange with a big white head, aroma of yeast, fresh hops, citrus. Taste is refreshing, wheat, banana, citrus, more fresh hops, a well hidden hint of alcohol. The body is medium-full, quite creamy. A very very good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2013 Hazy orange poured to Schneider weizen glass. Aroma is floral, grass, citrus, herbs. Flavour is yeast, banana, grass, citrus, wheat, malt. Sometimes works great, sometimes maybe too heavy. Tasty with salty or smoked fish dishes.

50cl from Mi-orge Mi-Houblon. Pours a cloudy yellowy gold colour with a big fluffy white head. Nose is typical weisse banana wheaty smell with some candied orange peel, damp green fresh hop, yeasty. Mouth is fresh orange, sweet malty, slightly herby, banana and capers. Big hop character at the end. Drinkable, lasting warmth, very fresh from the hops. Smooth, slightly too sweet end. Hides its alcohol very well.

50cl bottle. Pours hazy gold/orange with fluffy bright white head that recedes quickly, light lacing. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, orange peel, complex yeast, slight alcohol - from the aroma, it seems to be more of a heavily hopped Belgian tripel than a Weiss. It's in the taste that the wheat comes through - especially in terms of the full creamy mouthfeel - citrus hops are there, slight banana and clove, big yeast complexity, slight alcohol warmth to finish. A very interesting beer that I'd certainly seek out again.
Nice orange and hazy with a big creamy head. Intensive smell of fresh hops, grapefruit and a bit yeast. tastes hoppy , citrusy, fruity, yeasty, a bit sweet and malty. Hints of banana, spices.
Too sweet. Big disappointment. I¬ím a huge fan of Tap 6, Aventinus which destroys this.

Bottle at home. Pours straw-coloured, and is pretty hazy. Nice off-white big head that reminds me of whipped egg-white. Fruity aromas, pineapple, similar you get from belgian yeast. I also smell some wet hay, wheat and feels like a proper harvest ale. The flavour also drags me to a belgian blond or tripel with this yeast-like fruityness. Still the beer feels richer and with more malt sweetness. The mouth feel is smooth and creamy and more like a weizen. I sence something perfumy, and there¬ís hint of alcohol. This beer is really rich and tasteful, but also fresh. A proper brew in my opinion.
On tap at Weisses Brauhaus in Munich. My favorite one from the Schneider sortiment. It¬ís an unique beer. It¬ís incredible how its hoppy taste fits the soft weizen body. A real tasting orgy.
Great bready aroma. Appearance is hazy orange with sediment. Taste is bready and malty, yeast, a touch of hops. Quality stuff.

One of my favorite Hefe beers. Lemony aroma with tight carbonation. Golden hue, a slightly thin body that could be more full. Very enjoyable at 8.2% too!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(bottle) cloudy dark orange amber with generous off white head. Citrus hops aroma. Flavor of caramel and wheat malt, some yeast, tangerines.

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled 9/27/2011.  Pours super hazy dark red orange color with a nice 2-3 finger dense off white head with fantastic retention that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Some nice spotty lacing on the glass; with plenty of carbonation streaming up as expected.  Aromas of big sweet lemon zest, orange peel, bubblegum, biscuit, tropical fruits, wheat, banana, coriander, herbal, light pepper, and light caramel.  Nice and well balanced aromas with good complexity.  Taste of big lemon zest, orange peel, bubblegum, wheat, biscuit, caramel, banana, clove, light pepper, herbal, and tropical fruit.  Lingering notes of citrus, tropical fruit, pepper, biscuit, herbal, bubblegum, and tangy wheat on the finish for a good bit.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a creamy and slightly slick mouthfeel.  Slightly cloying sweetness on the finish, but not too bad.  Nice balance of flavors with good complexity.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming after the finish; and this is very smooth to drink.  Overall this is a very nice and enjoyable weizenbock.  It is definitely the fruitiest wheat beer I have come across; but has a fair amount of spiciness to balance it out in the taste.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden colour creamy stable white head. Superb hop aroma, lots of fruit, apple, some peach, also hay and a spicy touch. Taste is wonderfully balanced, wheat malt and hop build an dry, spicy and subtile sweet and sour fruity compound. Very good.

Bottle bought @ Bierzwerg.de and shared @ Ekstedts bock-tasting. Pours very hazy pale golden with a huge white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, perfume-like and intense with wheat, banana, cilantro, cloves, peaches, papaya, lemon peal and hints of soap. Taste is very sweet, almost syrupy, and tiny bitter with cloves, coriander, very ripe peaches, mango, wheat bread, grapefruit juice, white pepper and some alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with a lively carbonation. Finish is sweet and spicy with wheat bread, tropical fruits and orange peal.
Bottle @ D√òE meeting. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, citrus, parfume. Taste is wheat, yeast, citrus, hops, apples, coriands. Medium body, soft carbonation. 210312

Bottle shared thx to _angst_  cons 2013-03-25
Ar: apricot, citrus flowers, mango
Ap: hazy, wee frothy head, 
F: yeasty, banan peppery, citric, faty DUX soap, grape fruit, white grape ski ns, belgian flour, perfume

500 ml bottle. Pours an almost completely opaque brown-orangeish with such a short-lasting white head, I turned my head for about 2 sec and it completely disappeared. Smells fruity. Tastes like mango, orange, apricot, and a hint of cereals. Tastes like lemon, some citrus bitterness. Bit of orange acidity in the finish. Medium to full-bodied, somewhat creamy. Good summer ale, but it may be a tad bit overrated.

Wow.... what a beer.  Pours a hazy yellow ochre color with a nice foamy head.  RIght off I get chamomile and grapefruit on the nose... very pleasant and floral.  The flavor is bursting with a slight sweet bubblegum, more chamomile, a lil pine sap and a great refreshing finish. Wow... what a beer !

50 ml bottle from Vinmonopolet.
Golden colour, looks like a mix of an IPA and a Weisse. Smells like one too. Sitrus, banana, slitghly piny and hoppy smell.
Smooth mouthfeel. Taste i slightly coriander and sitrusy, but also floral, yeasty and with a little bit of malt sweetness. Slightly bitter and hoppy finish. Really interesting, but not "weird" in any sense. Just a really good and refreshing beer.

500ml bottle. Clear yellow orange color. Foamy white head. Strong carbonation, not very drinkable. Little lace. Spicy taste, bit of alcohol. Hazy color, very cloudy body. Coriander spice aroma, creamy texture, funky yeast. Not bad, but not my thing

Bottle.  Opaque gold pour with a big head that recedes to a half inch.  Aroma contains lemon soap, a lot of peppercorn, and something that I cannot quite identify.  Taste is peppercorn, green olive, and geranium among a few other things.  I do not identify any of the usual wheat beer characteristics such as banana, clove, bubblegum, or yeasty fruitiness.  Finish is astringent.  I¬ím sorry to say that this is the first German beer I¬íve rated that I did not enjoy.

Feb12: Exciting German beer classified as double bock (see label), but here on rate beer as a wheat bock beer. Dark yellow beer with a surprisingly good hop aroma. Lots of hop aroma with citrus and grapefruit notes. A very different bock. hoppy as an IPA, but with relative low bitterness and high alcohol strength. super exciting beer. very atypical German beer.

bottled, turned up at a couple of czech beer festivals in 2011. a glorious beer - hazy grey golden with an insistent head; aroma of sherbet, lemon cheesecake and some pricky menthol; bursting with passionfruit nectar, mellow peach schnapps, banana yoghurt smoothie and rasping, herbal bitterness. seems like such an obvious and foolproof concept for a beer but is also executed to perfection

many years old bottle of Schneider & Brooklyner Hpfen-Weisse.   Pours hazy golden with visible carbonation  Nice white head.  Spicy aromatic nose, both hops and malt are present.  Flavor is sharp on the hop bitterness, hop flavor is slightly cloying and muddles up the malt profile a bit.  Astringent aftertaste, slightly medicinal.  Tongue gets beat up a bit here.   That aftertaste is distracting and it lingers when I burp.  Reminiscent of a home brew that is not quite right.  Would love to give this higher rankings but it misses the mark.  Love both breweries, though.
Excellent collaboration.  Tight, tiny bubble head with a toasty, malty nose.  Vaguely cloudy, but more golden as it airs. Lovely hoppiness cuts into the weisse sweetness.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Keg at Andrew Usher¬ís. Hazy bronze body with a lasting white head. Low carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of vanilla, lime, coriander and white pepper. Flavour of sweet vanilla, lime chutney and hay. Medium to full body with a creamy texture. Full bodied. A sweet, complex beer.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it¬ís not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!

Im Glas steht ein Prachtweizen von dunkelgelber, orangener Farbe. Einzig die Krone ist etwas klein und kurzlebig geraten. Bereits der Geruch beim Ausschank l√§sst ein Spitzenbier erwarten. Es duftet hefig weizig, sehr hopfig nach Cascade und Amarillo. Der Antrunk erfolgt ebenso. Eine abolsute Aromenbombe. Sch√∂n hefig sahnig im Antrunk, kommen schnell bombastisch gute Hopfent√∂ne a la Cascade und Amarillo hinzu, obwohl es sich hierbei um Saphir handelt!. Im Abgang zeigt sich Nelke und der ewig nachhallende Hopfen. Zur Mitte bis zum Finish √§ndert sich nicht mehr viel, es bleibt bombig hopfig, mit gutem Hefeton, lediglich einige fruchtig vergorene T√∂ne tummeln sich im Verlaufe hinzu. Wahrhaft ein Bier von absoluter Referenzklasse!

Bottle from Bierzwerg.de web shop. Hazy golden color with huge white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, lemon, floral hops, alcohol. Taste, banana, pines, clove, light bitterness in finish. Good, but not the best of my today¬ís Weizen bock tasting.

On tap at Oldenburg. Hazy golden with a frothy, creamy, large and nice lacing white head. Aroma has coriander hints, moderate malty and slightly sweet, floral hops are present. Flavour is slightly sweet at the beginning, dense on palate, coriander, banana and yeast traces. The final is floral with a moderate bitterness. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium to high. Texture is oily.

A very complicated beer.
Blur color with nice head.
Aromas and tastes of banana, earth and yeast. Sweet but in its own way.
Enjoyable, but cant drink more than 1-2.

Bottle picked up at Rick¬ís in Alexandria. Served in a tulip. Ecause we are moving and I already packed all my weizen glasses.

Pours a hazy deep golden color with a bit of a copper tint to it. The head is initially large and foamy, but falls down fairly quickly. Good lacing and a collar throughout. The nose has some really spicy German hops. Not nearly as enticing as the Brooklyn version. The flavor has some more hop spice and faint floral characteristics. Moderate malt and a touch of sweetness. A bit too boozy as well. Overall, not a huge fan of this one.

A - Poured a 500ML bottle into a weizen glass.  Cloudy orange, good amount of sediment particles dancing about, big fluffy head that stayed and went to some nice lacing throughout the glass.

A - Big floral hops cover up the hidden, banana, clove and bubble gum.  This is a beautiful smelling beer with a nice complex aroma.  The hops are mostly floral/perfume like w/some citrus underneath.

T - Floral hops, sweet grain, bubblegum and banana - Some really spicy notes that taste like a mix of yeast/hop profile.

P - Creamy, big carbonation, medium bodied - this beer feels really nice with a big full swig.

O - Fantastic collaboration of east/west and styles.  I would love to try this fresh one day.

Bottle in a Schneider Brooklyner Hopfenweisse label. Pours a dark orangish copper color with a white foamy head. Looks silky. Nose is clove and pepper with a light banana background. Lots of spice upfront. Palate is smooth with a creamy swallow and a soft bite in the finish. Flavors of banana and circus peanuts, crisp grassy hops, and the spices finish it off.

(bottle) Poured cloudy pale amber with huge white head. Nice aroma - tangy, spicy, bananas. Medium bodied with plenty of fine prickly carbonation. The flavour has a nice subtle balance of sweet and sour - there¬ís little malty sweetness offset by some slight fruity tanginess. The flavour has a dominant bite of spice and alcohol with some pleasant, although fairly subtle, hop bitterness in the finish. Overall an excellent strong wheat beer.
Pours straw yellow. Lots of white head. yeast and hop smell. Sweet and also a bit bitter taste. Hop, banana, yeast and alcohol aroma. very giid weissbier - for someone who likes hoppy beers.

Pours light green-amber with a fluffy white head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, fruity, pine, citrus. Taste is dark fruit, vanilla, solvent, wood, citrus, bitter fruit, pepper (?). Full bodied and drinkable.

500mL bottle purchased at BevMo in Natomas.  The aroma is a bit fruity with plenty of bubblegum esters.  I don¬ít get a ton of hops in the nose.  Perhaps some stale grassy hops. Perhaps there is some lemony hints, too.   Not bad, but nothing great.  Mostly hazy yellow-brown body with a foamy, strong and bubbly off-yellow head.  Starts pretty hoppy with some herbal and floral and earthy hops flavors.  Becomes a little astringent and lemony in the middle.  Almost overly carbonated.  Some yeast esters give this a little more bubble gum.  I also get some roastiness before this finishes a bit bitter.  Not sure if this is ethanolic bitterness or the noble hop bitterness.  This is very pedestrian, but it could very well be an old bottle.  The code on the back has 2 lines with the first being 11.106      1 and the second line being 0819 2718

I¬ím surprisingly getting spicy hops in the nose, along with some banana and clove notes.  pours a very cloudy, thick amber color.  Taste is hops, clove, banana, hay and spice.  Very spicy.  This is an interesting beer.  Almost like a german take on a saison.  Different and delicious.

Bottle at Schneide Weisse in Munich.
High light beige head. Light golden color. Very fruity hop aroma like nothing I ever experienced in a wheat beer before. The taste is outstanding with the hoppy fruitiness and balanced bitterness and a good sweet finnish. A fantastic blend between the american and german beer tradition.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2012 07.01.2012. 0,5l Bottle. Vinmonopolet Haugesund. Labeled Tap 5 Meine Hopfenweisse. Golden orange body with a large white head. Very dense and hazy beer. At first aroma with yeast and wheaty citrus. Strong beer with lots of alcohol and a rich body. Flavours is more smooth with rich oily mouthfeel. Not as much aromatic hops as expected, but there is some spruce and pine at the end. Very nice Weizen bock.

Bottle from Peckham¬ís Union Square. It pours cloudy yellow, with a thick white head. The nose is wheat, brown bread, spice and sweet caramel. The taste is wheat, very fruity: tinned peach, sticky apricot, pear, pineapple and dough, with a tangy-dry finish. Medium to full body and moderate carbonation. Nice, but perhaps a little bit too sweet.
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 In aroma its malts and grains.  In flavor its bananas along with a decent hoppiness for a weizenbock.  A very good weizenbock all around.

In bottle; I am hoping I just had a bad bottle as this was bad. Aroma of pine and sour citrus. Color was a nice golden yellow. Taste; same pine and sour citrus notes (two sips and down the sink it went). Really bad; I think I will try it once more.

Golden coloured beer with some small floaters. Still good if i can rely on the date on the bottle. Grassy, and slightly soapy, with a very good mouthfeel. Nice full of flavors, decent use of the hops, and good citrussy together with a very nice yeast-part.

Pale yellow liquid beneath a ample, rocky, white heat. Plenty of lacing left behind. Smells of banana, citrus, yeast and malt. Very sweet with a subtle bitterness. Fruitiness of the banana aroma makes its appearance. Slight alcohol presence. Very good beer.

Aroma: Mmmmm...VERY citrusy and fruity. Orange, grapefruit, banana, lemon/lime. Flowery as well, coriander and wheat make themselves known too. It¬ís probably the most aromatic beer I¬íve come across.

Appearance: Nothing special really. Bright coppery orange with a rocky white head which fades to a fuzzy top.

Taste: Surprisingly close to the aroma yet much like a hefe. It¬ís quite orangey bittersweet which is interesting. 40 IBU? Sure doesn¬ít seem it but that¬ís probably because it¬ís pretty well balanced. This beer reminds me of Driftwood White Bark, Westmalle tripel and the regular Schneider hefe all combined but without the flaws. Nice!

Palate: Alcohol? What alcohol? Creamy, smooth, fuzzy CO2. Nothing off about it...fantastic! Just watch how many you drink....

Overall: Recommended to me, this beer is quite the surprise given I have a thing for Belgian quads/tripels. I¬íve tried the regular Schneider hefe but this is just so much nicer and the price is great too. Fantastic!

Gemeinschaftsprojekt des Braumeisters von Schneider und jener der Brooklyn Brewery New York. Die mittlerweile zweite Auflage dieses Bieres ist auf 8000 Flaschen begrenzt und unterscheidet sich im Etikett (es fehlt das "B"). Im Geruch aromatisch nach Orange und Kiefernharz. Leicht s√º√ülich-bitterer Antrunk. Danach folgt ein Ansturm sich entwickelnder Hopfenaromen von orangig-fruchtig bis nelkig. Erst im Abgang ebbt dieser Schwall ein wenig ab um einem trockenen Bitter-Finish Platz zu machen. Nur leicht spielt eine gewisse Alkoholnote mit ins Geschehen ein. Genial. Test vom 3.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Has a nice orange color to it with thick noticeable, white head. Smells of floral and citrus. First taste is sweet, with a shock of banana-wheat sweetness. Followed by a long lasting bitter/sour taste of citrus-floral and distinct hops on the palate. You really notice the 40IBU and the 8.2% alc. after taste. Not my preference for pale-weisse bocks, but decent nonetheless.

Location/Date:Bottle on December 6th, 2011.
Appearance:Pours a golden orange haze with some bubbles.
Aroma: Aroma is sweat and wheatty and bready.
Taste: Taste is some wheat, light hop, banana on end.
Palate:Medium body, slightly slick, lively carbonation.
Summary: I previously had this beer brewed by Brookyln Brewery, and this one is just as good even with the slightly different water used.

0,5 l bottle from S√∂rspecialista, Budapest. Beautiful appearance. Orange hazy color with rocky head - as the weizenbocks. Unbelivable aroma. Epic hoppy aroma of the resin, floral, citrus and herbs. The taste - it¬ís a perfect balance of the bitterness of the hops and the sweetness of the wheat malt. Full body with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Extreme long bitter hoppy finish. This beer is epic!!! This is a wheat IPA. It¬ís one of the best beers, I¬íve ever tasted. It¬ís a perfect fruit of the exemplary cooperation between the German and American brewers. They are genious! RESPECT!

Dark orange hazy color with a tall frothy white head. Aroma of green olives as well as taste.  Very low carbonation, you can feel a bit of alchool. Not well balanced, but it¬ís a good example of weizenbock
Hazy yellowish beer, small particles bounces in glass after pouring. Has a great hoppy aroma, banana and little bit alcohol. Lots of hops for a weisse. Great beer, one of my favorites.

Es buena!!! una gran mezca entre una weizenbock y una ipa,fantastico nacio una cerveza con un olor muy intenso a banano,muy turbia (el color me encanta!!) y al paladar refrescante muy aromatica con ese toque bien firme de lupulo. Gran cerveza!!!! Recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
Une belle mousse peu un trop √©ph√©m√®re mais une belle robe jaune/orange opaque et brumeuse √† souhait.  
Odeur de banana et vanilla (si, si!).  Super!
Au go√ªt, on sent le houblon, bois√©, pas d¬íacidit√© pour une bi√®re de bl√©, √©pic√©.   Arri√®re go√ªt¬†: Alcool et √©pice

Has a zesty orange lemony aroma with some  banana and yeast. It has a pillowy 2- 3 finger head. Pours a hazy amber with lots of sediment floating around. Sweet beginning with a bitter/sour follow through. Taste hints of the 8.2% ABV. Very disappointed because I expected more of a Hefe-Weizen like beer than a hop filled beer.

Denmark, Aug-Sept 2009. Bottle from Fonefan. Hazy goldenorange color. Medium white head. Sweet malty aroma with grassy hop notes. Very balanced taste of malts and hops. Wheat ,bread, oranges, just a hint of banana, grass. Very unusual.

This is a wonderful looking beer in a glass, small chunks of wheat bouncing around against the carbonation, cloudy and full wheat texture that looks like it¬íll be right up there with the deliciously thick Schnieder Wiesse Original.  The aroma smells of a hoppy wheat, but the hops and wheat are very distinct, you get the idea of fresh quality ingredients that are both allowed to shine at the same time.  Tasting it, it is mostly hop and a mild wheat.  The strong hop on the front makes the following taste kind of weak and watery, a shame.  The endnote is very crisp, rather than heavy, this is turning out to be a light, refreshing beer.  I love anything from Schnieder and would glady buy anything they put out, that being said, I would be hard pressed to pick this on the shelf next to the Schnieder Wiesse Original or Aventinus next to it.

Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a weizen glass. Appearance is a hazy copper with a 1.5 finger width head with dark brown splotches from the yeast. Aroma reminds me of banana¬ís foster with its notes of brown sugar, bananas, vanilla, and rum. In the taste I get a fruity, raisiny sweetness that moves to an earthy, cooked banana overtone in the finish. The beer is a touch thinner in body than I would prefer, but that doesn¬ít put me off too much. Overall, this beer great. I wish it were more available around me.
500ml bottle.  Pours a very murky orange with a small, frothy head.  Aroma is banana, wheat and some citrus.  Taste has some wheat and clove to start.  Clove and banana.  Alcohol in the finish.

drank it from the bottle with the other label (tap 5 meine hopfen weisse). this one looks perfect, nice pale yellow look,. smells like grass and citrus. perfect bitterness. will recommend!

S√∂rspecialista, Budapest

Igen k√ºl√∂nleges √©s rendk√≠v√ºl finom b√∫zabak, ami figyelemrem√©lt√≥an √©s egyed√ºl√°ll√≥an koml√≥s. Azt hiszem, van egy √∫j kedvencem!
