(Bottle). Large white head on a hazy, golden beer. Herbs and tropical fruits with a slightly bitter finish. High alcohol content is pretty easily detected. Pretty good weissbier.
smelled yeasty spicey and hoppy.  tasted about the same with a bit of an alcohol finish with a nice hop kick.  Very drinkable and good

From 500ml bottle at SAQ.  Pours a hazy golden hue with a prominent and lasting bright white head, very effervescent brew. Nose is an interesting blend of straw and citrus notes, slightly grassy also.  I can¬ít help but notice a sort of ¬ícleaning product¬í smell also, like Pine-Sol, which is a tad off-putting.  Nice hop-forward flavor; leafy and resinous tastes come forth and fade into a slightly bitter finish with some spiciness and banana-like aromatics.  Bizarre mouthfeel, almost bordering on soapy, though it seems to work well for the style.  Overall, a likable take on the style, but unusual for sure.  Would like to try this on tap at its freshest.

Pours a hazy golden color with a great head. Fantastic head retention which follow to the bottom of the glass. Great aroma which is totally different from other hefeweissens. Kind of citrusy  and fresh. Moderately hopped with american hop flavors. Pleasant on the palate. Cloves and banana is present. Great body. This is my new favorite.

Location: 500 ml bottle from Colonial Wine and Spirits, 10/18/11


Aroma: The nose is rather wheaty, with a spice component, some grass, and a mix of fruity notes

Appearance: It pours a clear golden-orange color with a frothy white head that leaves drippy lace

Flavor: Sweet up-front, fruity (banana, apricot, etc), some grass hop bitterness, and some slightly acidic notes 

Palate: Medium bodied, the mouthfeel is smooth, the carbonation is soft-to-average, and the drinkability is high

Overall Impression: 
Overall, this is a really solid brew.  One of those ones that I was "sure I had rated before," but I hadn¬ít.  I sort of like when that happens with a beer of this quality, because it gives me an excuse to re-drink it besides the standard excuse of: it¬ís a damn good beer.  Anyway, I like this one quite a bit, it has some really interesting stuff going on flavor-wise, and it drinks really nicely.

Hazy orange, big fluffy white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, light banana, apricot, spicy yeast, sweetish wheat tones. Rather what you¬íd expect from a hopped up weizen. Flavour weizen malty, sweetish, fruity, slight wheaty sour, with a nice hop bitterness. Finish slight honey and citrus. Very drinkable, extremely nice.
(Bottle @ Caf√© Jos, Nijmegen)

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy orange with a big white head. Aroma is sweet fruity and spicy hops. Taste is thick wheaty and yeasty, later on some really good american piney hops, citrussy as well. Nice and easy drinkable.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur orang√©e et voil√©e. Nez de levures fruit√©es (agrumes sucr√©es, surtout de citron, moyen-l√©ger d¬íabricots, traces de bananes), l√©g√®rement √©pic√©es (clou de girofle) et aux petites notes sauvages, de houblon herbeux (herbes fra√Æches), l√©g√®rement citrique et aux notes florales ainsi qu¬íavec des notes de bl√© et de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un p√©tillement moyen-√©lev√© et une texture l√©g√®rement herbeuse. Go√ªt de levures fruit√©es (agrumes, moyen d¬íabricots, notes de mangues, faibles traces de bananes) aux notes √©pic√©es (clou de girofle, traces de poivre) accompagn√© d¬íune moyenne amertume de houblon citrique (pamplemousse) aux notes florales (une amertume pr√©sente en arri√®re-go√ªt toute la gorg√©e) lors de l¬íentr√©e en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen go√ªt de pain sucr√©, un l√©ger go√ªt de bl√© et des traces de biscuits. Parall√®lement, l¬íon retrouve un l√©ger go√ªt d¬íalcool jusqu¬íen finale, o√π l¬íamertume de houblon s¬íy intensifie en arborant un caract√®re ass√©chant, plus herbeux et avec de faibles notes r√©sineuses. Post-go√ªt  long et sec, moyen-amer de houblon herbeux, moyennement citrique et aux petites notes r√©sineuses avec un l√©ger go√ªt de levures fruit√©es (zest d¬íagrumes, noyau de p√™che) et des notes d¬íalcool.

This is one of those brews I always wanted to do a homebrew version of but was afraid to waste the fermenter space on a possible disaster. I am always glad when commercial breweries take these risks so that I don¬ít have to. It¬ís a strong German wheat, hopped up like an IPA and it tastes surprisingly similar to what you might expect. The nose is a mix of hefty banana notes with a strong whiff of herbal hops. The juicy texture of the weizenbock meshes reasonably well w/ the firm hop bitterness but it does give you kinda the sensation that someone accidentally mixed two very different beers. This is a strong beer and you can tell, it drinks almost like a barleywine due to the wheaty thickness and burns a little bit on the way down. The slight acidity and prickly carbonation are a nice tough but I am still really glad that I never wound up w/ five gallons of something like this on my hands. It¬ís an interesting experiment but not necessarily the kind of thing I ever find myself craving.

500ml bottle. Pours a super cloudy orange color with a medium white head. The aroma is lemons, some wheat and citrus funk. The flavor is dry rich fruity malts,some noble hops, banana, earthy, funky, very odd. Something akin to a banana smoothie. Quite nice.  I think the blend of some American influence on a traditional Bock is interesting but perhaps not superior to the original. Very distinct from most Weizen bocks certainly in appearance and flavor.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours opaque light brown center with golden top and bottom and big three inch bright white head.  Good lacing, medium body, and nice mouthfeel.  Taste is floral malt and hoppy grapefruit finish,
Bottle at K√∏ge √òldage. Unclear orange colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, yeast and fruit.
Bottle. Color hazy dark orange with big head. Aroma hop, grapefruit, wheat, banana, apricot. Taste bitter, hop, apricot, grapefryuit.

Meine Hopfenweissse bottle from vineyard, Belfast
Cloudy orange with thin white head and ester bananas and resinous hops and subtle clove on the nose. Pithy and wheaty with a sweet citrus finish and some banana.
Chunky orange, lots and lots of yeast Smells hoppy and grapefruits. Tastes apricot, sweet, fruity and hoppy. Full body, great co2.

Bottle at Schneider bar. Big fresh hop aroma, lemon and citrus. Taste Is hoppy with bubblegum and a wheat beer finish. The banana and cloves take a back seat here. Not sure if I¬ím that impressed, doesn¬ít quite sit right for me

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2013 50cl bottle at Schneider Brauhaus.
Thick creamy white head.  Very cloudy blond pour.  Lovely citrus hop bitterness.  Yummy!!!
Not bad, i was expecting alot more hops from this beer. I¬í m a little disapointed, but it¬ís still tasty. Still worth the 3$ i paid for it.

Pour murky orange brown with big pillowy off white head. Aroma citrus, mango, pineapple, lemon peel, floral and pine, nice hop and fruity balance. Taste pine, mango, banana, bubble gum, nice bitterness, fruity, slight floral. MF medium body nice carb. Very well done bottle was a little old but still holds up tasty stuff.

Amazingly unique offering.  Aroma: citrus, orange, wheat.  Appearance: cloudy golden orange.  Taste: almost a citrus fruit juice flavor, some yeast flavor.  Palate: strong carbonation, slightly bitter.  Overall: terrifically unique and drinkable.

500ml bottle. Cloudy golden orange with a nice strong off-white head, looks gorgeous in the right glass, the orange hues becoming darker as the glass widens. Was not expecting peach but its there right at the start, fresh and in your face, although not overly sweet, some orange zest, mild hops, overripe mango, and some banana. Well carbonated, smooth but seems a little heavy on the palate to match the fresh taste, sweet until the end, dry and boozy on the finish with a crisp bitterness. Don¬ít think i have had a beer like this before, and was definitely not expecting such an interesting combination of fruit and bitterness, not too mention hidden alcohol now that I look at the percentage. Definitely worth trying.

Pour out of bottle, hazy orange with white head, aroma has notes of citrus, orange, wheat with a touch of fruit, yeast, some slight biscuit.  Taste is a bit more simple with notes of citrus, fruity esters, some grass and pine, touch of biscuit, with a tiny bit of spice with a weird resinous type of finish. Really one-dimenional in the hop citrus department, lacking in many traditional hefeweizen elements, but it is fairly tasty.

22-AUG-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
First pour is clear orange with white head. Big bubbles makes it look like a soda. Very active head.
Second pour gives a more murky orange, and last very cautious pour leaves giant black chunks in the bottle.
Nose is orange and peach. Taste is the same. Very smooth and creamy. Not so hoppy...Is this an old brew?
Anyway delicious drink.

Murky gold liquid, foamy white head. Spicy aroma with lemon, banana, and a hint of alcohol. Predominantly sweet taste, lacking the bitterness that I hoped to find, yet still interesting and drinkable, especially because of its yeast flavors. (I would prefer less of an alcohol presence, however.) Although not entirely successful, here¬ís a fresh summer brew with the potency of a winter holiday special.

Bottle in NYC with Lyoli. Pours foggy gold with a medium, white head. Big wheat nose, some grassy hops, rich character, hints of yeast. Very sweet flavor, nicely bittered, plenty of wheat and yeast, some sugar, bread, lightly spicy. Medium to full in body with average carbonation. Warm finish, some sharp sweetness and resiny bitterness that lingers. Great stuff.
light fruit aroma,yellow,hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish.

Gros bouquet de houblons, conif√®re et melon frais dans l¬íar√¥me. Beaucoup d¬íeffervescence. En entr√©e de bouche, un peu d¬íamertume suivi d¬íun d√©luge de fruits exotiques comme ananas, mangue, kiwi. En fin de bouche, le c√¥t√© plus conif√®re se manifeste aussit√¥t nettoy√© par l¬íeffervescence. Un arri√®re go√ªt savonneux √©tait pr√©sent dans les premi√®res gorg√©es mais plus √ßa avance plus √ßa disparait. Pas de puissante amertume, plut√¥t aromatique. Fini assez sec. Belle surprise!

Poured hazy, with an orange color and an off-white, creamy foam. Aroma of  green apples, peach, melon, honey, banana, cinnamon, hops. Sweet, dense body with plenty of carbonation. Fruity, hoppy aftertaste. Really good!

Pours a brownish tinged yellow from bottle with a thin head. Massive, massive pineapple on the nose. There are some slight estery notes on the tongue. The finish is dramatic. Big pine sol hop flavor and a touch of bitterness on the finish. Not what I was expecting but in a good way.
Hmm.. Basically great, but the taste seems very light. Somewhat strong flavour of nuts and a bit of fruit also.

Hazy deep, golden beer with a very lively white  large, frothy off-white head.
Strong and interesting aroma, that¬ís wheaty and very hoppy with notes of grass and especially citrus. Flavor is caramel malty and very hoppy with spicey notes of yeast with a little tartness in the dry bitter finish. body is medium with a lively fizzy carbonation. A wheat-beer right up my alley!
Fresh floral scent of hops aromas, slightly sweet. Very floral and aromatic hop flavor, good bitterness. A dangerous beer when the liquor flavor is nonexistent. Very good!

Aged one year for fear that I couldn¬ít get it again. Pineapple hops are super bright and sweet. The high alcohol is masked nicely by the bitter and slightly sour overtones. Malt backbone is there but focus is drawn to the more peppery finish of the hops. Other notes of banana are somewhat missing. This is exactly what I want in an over-hopped Weizen. Delicious, even a year old.
Bottle from Alko Arkadia. Originally rated on 16.7.2010. Weizen with a lot of hops. Nice mix.

Bottle labelled as Tap 7 at The Caley. Murky opaque amber. Medium white head. Orange, fruity, banana and grassy hop nose. Complex, interesting. Smooth palate with caramel, cloves, some peppery spice, and an underlying grapefruit hop. Bitter finish, nicely balanced.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2012 Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Brownish orange hazy, big white head. Smells of wheat, yeast esters, hops and some banana. Taste of wheat and malts, also some yeast, nice heavy sweetness, also some banana and acid tones. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Finish has untypical but expected hops, i find nice bitterness and spice and grass. Actually lots of lots of grass. Tottally a very nice and drinkable wheat beer. 

Old rate from 18/7/2011. Bottle shared with Daje at Amundsen
Orange, small head for a weizen. Strange aroma with grass and other spice hops. No banana or citrus. Taste has some citrus acids though, good malt presence and with absolutely no real sweetness. Extremely dry. Very nice power hoppy finish. THe best part of the beer 5-2-6-4-13

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2011 0.5l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a heavy clouded unfiltered deep orange body with some big grey sediments and a big everlasting fluffy off-white head. Aroma has wheat, light yeast, orange zest, bitter hops and some alcohol. Full-bodied, average carbonation and slight sticky to oily texture. Tastes quite alcoholy and hopy with notes of yeast, lime, wheat and something that reminds me of licorice. Strange and different, and perhaps a bit to hopy and alcohol-strong to be enjoyed as the first beer in a series of many (as tonight) but definitely drinkable and tasteful. 

Rerated 21.07.2011
0.5l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. This is a really hazy and cloudy milk-orange beer with some big grey sediments and a big off-white everlaasting fluffy head. Aroma has cloves, some yeast, quite hedge- hopy and some strong alcohol notes. Lively carbonation, oily texture and full-bodied. You can really sence the alcohol here. Really bitter with hedge, orange sezt and the grass is well reprecented. Perhaps a bit to bitter and alcohol strong for me to truily enjoy it, but a well made weiz bock!

Bottle at Amundsen.
Deep hazy orange, big offwhite head.
Fresh aroma of yeast, citrus and dish soap.
Taste of bread, lemon, spices and banana. 
Good refreshing bitter after taste

50 cl bottle as ¬îTAP 5¬î, BBE 02.2012
Rather hoppy aroma has lots of tropical, exotic fruits. Not very IPA-like though, I guess there is some wheat aromas behind the hop wall. Flavour is, suprisingly, hoppy. But one can tell the wheat easily beyond the hops. Good stuff and drinkable, but I don¬ít really like hops in my weisse. They make it kind of too sweet. Neither did this pair with my homemade hamburger very well. Adding the yeast does not make this better, only kills the freshness.

500 ml  bottle purchased a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($4.79).  Pours a golden orange hue with two fingers of thick white foam and lots of floaties.  Aroma is noticeably hoppy (citrusy and spicy hops) rather than the typical banana-graininess of this style.  Also aroma notes of dark wheat bread, dark fruit, and some spice.  Flavor is also distinctly hoppy (more citrus and spice) with additional notes of tangy wheat, caramel, and sticky fruit.  Not very bitter despite the strong hoppiness.  The somewhat high ABV is nicely concealed.  Different yet highly quaffable.  (875, 583)

500ml TAP 5 Bottle.  Appearance is hazy dark orange color with plenty of foamy head.  Aroma is superb with plenty of fruity hops with hints of wheat, grains, and citrus.  Taste is wonderfully complex with the herbal and fruit hops notes taking the lead on top of a strong wheat malt backbone.  There¬ís also a grassy, piney resin quality present as well.  Hints of typical Weizen flavors come through including banana, spices, and wheat.  Palate is medium-bodied, slick texture, average carbonation, and a citrusy, tart, slightly bitter finish.  This is probably the most unique Weizen I¬íve ever tried ans certainly another amazing brew from a world-class brewery.

Bottle from German Deli in Sacramento. Pours golden with a massive long-lasting white head (use a tall Weizbier glass) and a floral fruity aroma. There is a sturdy light malt flavor with a huge yeast presence and an appropriately bitter finish. This is a traditional and very tasty brew.

Bottle 500ml @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours murky golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, alcohol, fruity and floral hops. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
500mL bottle in a Weizen glass.  Hazy golden almost orange pour with huge frothy.  Fruity aroma with hints of spice.  Sweet flavors with minimal hops.  Nice bite from the higher alcohol content.

Flavor is sweet toffee and wheat with some alcohol and grassy hops.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice hoppy wheat beer.

Appearance is cloudy orange yellow with a luscious 2 finger head.  Aroma is citrus hops first, then spice, then banana, then wheat grain.  Taste is classic hefeweizen flavors amplified; a bit more booze on the finish than a hefe and with dank citrusy hops throughout.  Body is medium, sticky and with average carbonation and a not quite dry finish.  Overall this is my wheat beer wet dream.  Super hoppy but with all of the flavors of a classic German hefe.

Pours an exceptional rich, golden orange color with a big, dense, cloud-like, cream-colored head. The aroma is a fragrant combination of lemony and herbal hops, a bit of yeasty funk, and some sour apple. The flavor is likewise a complex combination of earthy and floral hops, yeast, a wheaty tanginess, and a light, dry fruitiness. The fine, light carbonation keeps this potent combination of flavors from being too overwhelming. In the end, however, although I recognize the depth and complexity of the slightly tart, earthy, tangy assortment of smells and flavors, the combination with this flavor profile just becomes too challenging for me to enjoy fully.

Bottle from De Bierkonink. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a thick white head. Great nose- lots of banana with hallertauer hops, cloves and honey. Tastes lovely, a silky wheat beer with plenty of banana, wheaty flavour nicely balanced with the hops. I like it. There was a lot of sediment in this bottle which boosted the banana and hoppy flavours for me.

500 ml bottle from SAQ. hazy orange small white head. A: what a nose ! It¬ís herbacy, citrusy. F: body is medium finish is bitter and medium long. Don¬ít get any heat from the alcool O: Excellent will need to buy more of that one.  It¬ís complex yet supprising you don¬ít expect something that hoppy from germany.

50cl bottle of the Schneider Weisse bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a gold around the edges, steady bubbles and a very generous head. The nose has grapefruit and pine and initially not much of the banana or sweetness. However, this comes through more the longer the beer has been poured. the taste has grapefruit and orange against a toffee, cream and banana background profile. The palate has a big structure, a very rich and zingy texture and a wonderfully refreshing finish. Overall, I¬ím amazed that this combination actually works, but it does - amazing!
Very enjoyable strong and quite sweet white beer. Fine aroma without too much alcohol in taste.

It¬ís been quite awhile since I drank this, so I don¬ít remember many details except that it¬ís still my favorite weisse. Since I love strongly hopped beers, it¬ís not really a shock that this one came out on top (until now).
500 ml bottle pour.  Dirty orangish color with a medium head.  Hoppy for a traditional weisse beer as advertised.  Hoppy banana and cloves.  Nice and different.  Reminds me of a saison.

Sehr hopfiger Geruch, eigentlich wie bei einem IPA, ohne zu stark zu wirken, etwas malzig-s√º√ü. SEHR hopfiger Antrunk, stark aromatisch, der Hopfen wei√ü sich wunderbar in den Vordergrund zu stellen, eine leichte S√º√üe und starke W√ºrzigkeit stellen sich ab dem Mittelteil ein, um dann im Nachgeschmack noch einmal zuzulegen. Sehr IPA √§hnlich, dabei aber etwas milder und deutlich s√ºffiger. Trocken hopfig-w√ºrziger Nachgeschmack, hintergr√ºndig malzig. Besonders angenehm sin die verschiedene, ab dem Mittelteil agierenden Fruchtnoten. Vielen vielen Dank an den Doppelbock f√ºr dieses GENIALE Bier. 	 
Test vom 12.8.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,14,13,15,14,15 - 14,30

500ml. bottle from .LC.B.O. in Ottawa.The color is a hazy honey very thin head. The aroma is sweet fruity and hoopy. The taste also of hops and citrus fruits with a bit of a minearl taste to it. The finish is dry and bland.
Cloudy gold with a large white head. Aroma is citrus and flowers. Medium body with average carbonation. Flavours: citrus, bread. Tasty and very refreshing.

Cloudy yellow/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, yeast, spicy hops, & clove; Flavor of wheat, yeast, clove, bananas, spicy hops, and citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, unique brew - very good.

Appearance: murky mustard-yellow, with lots of muddy sediment hanging suspended as if in jelly; essentially looked like egg-drop soup with a short white head.   Aroma: floral hops over moldy banana bread.   Taste: 	bitter floral and slightly piney hop notes over banana, clove and bubblegum; there might be some wheat in there, but it¬ís hard to tell.   Finish: 	creamy, bitter, and slightly tangy.   Notes: 	Did  not care for this at all.  Appearance was very off-putting, and the initial taste nearly made me pour it down the sink.  Stuck with it, and it did get a little better as it warmed.  Palate was creamy, which was also off-putting with the flavors.  It was very much like an IPA mixed with a cream ale poured into a glass half-full of hefeweizen.  If that¬ís your thing, go for it; you will love this.  Might be one of my least favorite beers of all time.

16.9 oz. bottle. Boozy, yeasty aroma features raisin, red grape, and fruit candy scents. Pours a hazy, bright gold with a moderate amount of fast-rising bubbles and a small to moderate amount of off-white head. Produces pretty good lacing. Fruity, floral, boozy taste features peach, melon, yellow plum, and jam flavors. Dry finish. Dark fruit aftertaste. Moderate body. Lively and smooth in the palate. Good stuff; interesting and entertaining.

Bottle. Hazy orange pour with a creamy white head that fades to a ring. Aroma is citrus oranges and wheat and yeast. Taste is bread wheat and oranges with a bitter hop finish. Palate is medium and slick with a sticky dry finish. Very nice brew!

500 ml bottle. Ugly yellowish-brown color, lasting white head. Dry aroma with lots of hops and some fruity notes. Hoppy flavor with banana and alcohol. Medium-full body, medium-high carbonation. It¬ís an interesting and ambitious beer, but it doesn¬ít really do it for me.
Delicious hoppy and strong beer just right for my taste. at the same time light and heavily strong. Heavenly combination.

Cloudy dark golden with a big and lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, caramel, light banana, yeasty and rather hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and bitter finish. This retains the smoothness of the hefeweizen and combines it with the bitterness from the hops. I love hefeweizens and I love hops. The combination is a winner too. 240310

etichettata come meine hopfenweisse TAP 5.
nel bicchiere per un attimo ho creduto di aver versato succo di frutta alla pesca! ma che colore ha questa birra!? un giallo-marrone densissimo, con i lieviti che svolazzano nel bicchiere, per poi placidamente deporsi sul fondo dello stesso. una schiuma maestosa e persistente anche se la birra non √® stata versata nel weizenbecker, ma in una colonna conica. al naso arriva subito il luppolo, sembrerebbe amarillo (in una weiss tedesca!!), e poi un mix di spezie e frutta. al palato √® complicata, le spezie e il luppolo sono prepotenti e vogliono prendersi tutto lo spazio, una carbonazione non troppo decisa glielo permette e la birra rimane un p√≤ troppo pesante da bere. buona eh, sia chiaro!

Cloudy Orange with a large white head. Aroma is citrus and resin, flowers. Medium body with average carbonation. Flavours a orange, citrus, bread. Aftertaste have a moderate bitterness. Tasty and very refreshing.

Bottle:

Regular white head on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Smell hops, hop flowers, wheat, yellow fruit, banana, peach, abricot, citrus, barleys, candy sweets and hint of mollasses.
Taste is a well balanced mix of hops, hop flowers, citrus, banana, sweets, bubble gum, alcohol, malts, corn, spices.
Sweet, warm fruity aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft light creamy mouthfeel, medium body and light creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Lost notes and problems with the browser -- but, well... Terrific, albeit odd-looking Weizen Bock with a heavy emphasis on floral and citrus hops, with a taste full of bread and cloves. Terrific!

06-05-11 Bouteille de 500ml fraichement arriv√©e a la SAQ: Tr√®s belle apparence jaune-orang√©e-beige, avec une mousse abondante et une texture qui semble velout√©e. Aromes de fruits (abricots peches, bananes, poires) avec une asser forte note houblonn√©e (sapin) et une touche poivr√©e et de gomme baloune. L√©g√®rement sucr√©e, avec une moyenne amertume bien balanc√©e et une toute petite note surette en finale. Corps moyen avec une texture tr√®s int√©resante √©tant asser √©paisse, soyeuse et velout√©e en bouche. Moyenne carbonisation et finale l√©g√®rement amer et fruit√©e-gomme baloune. En conclusion, cette bi√®re se doit d¬íetre essay√©e. Tr√®s complexe avec ses notes houblonn√©es, de bananes, d"abricots, de d¬íautres fruits, de gomme balounes, de sapin et j¬íen passe. Tr√®s bien balanc√©e et se boit facilement. Finale pouvant etre am√©lior√©e.

Bottle 50 cl. bottled as schneider wisse meine hopfenweisse, tap 5. Golden, hazy with a large white rocky head. The aroma is hoppy and offcourse wheat. The taste is a bit sour and bitter with more malt but still wheat aftertaste. Not a weissbierfan, but this was quite ok.
Pours a hazy caramel hay with thick frothy white head. Aroma is a mix of hay, berry, nuts and malts. Flavor is almond, bread, banana and cereal. Body is creamy with very active carbonation.

Bottle. Murky orange-amber body with abundant sediment, medium dense creamy off-white head. Nose of faded citrus hops, caky yeast, tangy wheat, and warming alcohol. Tangy body with dusty, earthy, bitter yeast, faded citric hops, and wet hay, finishing with warm alcohol and bitter esters.

Pours a muddy orange with off white to tan head.  The aroma is a hop bomb of orange and grapefruit.  The flavor is way different from what I expected.  It tastes like orange tang with hints of sweet malt, grapefruit, and a little spice finishing with a light lingering of hop bitterness and more orange.  The orange flavor is really a bit abrasive and overpowering for me.  An interesting idea but I¬íll stick to tradition.

Whole Foods Market, DC 500ml ($5): Pours on the first pour an orange body with a a white head, but on the second pour, when all the sediment comes out, if turns into a muddy peach color. Aroma is of banana, spice, hops, and dirt. Not  a total hefeweizen aroma. Taste was a little surprising. Not as sweet as other weizenbocks I¬íve had. Way hoppier than most weizenbocks as well. There was an undertone of sweetness, but it didn¬ít dominate. Obviously the fruity notes were there. Additionally, the body was not too heavy and as such, the beer was actually substantially more drinkable than I was expecting. An excellent brew methinks.

Typical, but loverly, cloudy orange body with snow white head. Quite some yeast sediment. Nose is immediately hoppy with lots of floral notes, spruce together with dough and banana. Nice, full bodied texture giving rise to a somewhat sweet weisse taste, much more fruity than their original version. The hop-twist makes it interesting but it does misses out on the spices a little for me. Solid drink nonetheless. (2,95 EUR?, 50cl bottle)

500ml bottle as Tap 5 Meine Hopfenweisse, gift from Finn, thanks, mate! Decent white head with good duration. Body colour is hazy, golden-orange. Compact and attractive aroma of perfumed, fruity wheat. Ripe citrus fruits in flavour along with spices and flowers. Soapy impression, in a positive sense. Yeasty fruitiness to the ending. Well integrated alcohol. Innovative and a pleasant surprise (Troms√∏,11.04.2011).

50cl bottle. Pours a deep, cloudy, glowing orange gold with a very thick, though short-lived, white head that never dissipates completely and leaves a few strings and spots of lace on the glass (and also overflowed bottle upon removing cap). The aroma is sweet and fruity with touches of phenolic/clove character and some grassy and orange hops - sweeter and slightly less hop-forward than Brooklyn bottled version. The flavor is sweet and malty as well as fruity/estery and complex. The hop character is grassy and distinct and provides good balancing bitterness towards mid-palate. A delicious blend of Weizenbock and hops. The finish is somewhat dry with complex malt character (melanoidins, caramel, bread crust, wheat) also rounding it out nicely. The mouthfeel is very highly carbonated with a fairly full body. Overall, a very nice beer that is a bit different than the Brooklyn version (not *quite* as good, but still very good). Pleasant, drinkable, complex...
Pours murky dark straw color.  Thick white head that dissipates quickly.  Citrus on the nose.  Hops in the beginning, good wheat flavor throughout, finishes with some spiciness.

11 sept 2011, bottle. definitely bottle conditioned. orange metamucil colour and equally as murky. first aroma was hops but the orange and weiss bier aroma immediately dominated. there are also some sour/acidic notes. really interesting. weiss flavour all through it. hops are in beginning, middle and end and don¬ít compete w/ weiss flavours. they go back and forth. very interesting. i don¬ít normally like uber hopped german beers but this is nice. 

(original rating - 8/10 2/5 7/10 3/5 15/20 = 3.5) looks hazy like iced tea gone bad. such a beautiful, amazingly strong hop aroma! flavour is dominated by hops w/ hints of banana weiss bier flavour. hop flavour is only at the front of the beer w/ no lingering bitterness. i didn¬ít really like the first one i had b/c i compared it to the two independent styles. as an independent beer i think i really like it.
Bottle, TAP 5. Pours a light, cloudy copper with a decent head. Hoppy, citrussy aroma. Flavour is smooth, with hops and a big shot of lemon. A very good cooperative effort!

Bottled, 50 cl. Pours hazy beer, ochre in colour. A beige head. Aroma: Banana, dough, citrus, soap. Taste: Moderate sweetness, pleasant moderate bitterness. Palate: Above medium body, lively carbonation. Soapy, maybe a little staled, too. I will try this one again in the future.

Bottled.  A murky ginger coloured beer with a small off-white coloured head.  Wheaty and strong as you¬íd expect but lacking typicl banana and clove notes.  Instead it¬ís hoppy; too hoppy for its own good.  Quite flowery.  Decent in the nose but really not sure it works in the mouth.  There¬ís interest here but it¬ís dabbling too much.

Flaske 0,5l fra Alko Muonio som "Tap 5. Meine Hopfenweisse". Gyldenbrun. Middels skumdannelse til hvete√∏l √• v√¶re. Sterk aroma. Pepper & sitrus. Smaken i samme gate ispedd litt grapefrukt. Ettersmaken er litt medisinsk. Ikke helt god. Ikke s√¶rlig s√∏t. Trekker opp.

Bottle. Pours with a nice bubbly, pillowy white head.  Light cloudy orange-yellow. Loads of hoppiness in the aroma thats both fruity and citric, with an underlying fruit sweetness.  Hops shine through first, with citrus and earth, and a light woodiness in the finish. Yeasty a bit as well.  Really delicious.  Softer and medium body.

Bottle served in a flare pilsner. Cloudy orange with a good-sized white head. Good staying power and minimal lace. Aroma is pineapple, orange, lime, spicy hops, and toffee malt. Sweet flavor, followed by elements of caramel, spice, and yeast. Medium body, flat-creamy mouthfeel, light carbonation, and a short, off-dry finish. A little too sweet for me. This bottle may be past its prime.

50cl bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with an off-white head. Strong fruity and citrusy aroma. Pinapple, lime and banana. Nica malty backbone with hoppy presence and fruity flavors. Some wheat notes, light spiciness. Lively carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 28/06/11: Bottle. Hazy, orange amber with a large, long-lasting, off-white head. Aroma is lavendery and clovery perfume. Some banana, herbal hoppiness, yeast. Taste is very yeasty with herbal hoppiness, tones of pine, notes of alcohol. Not really to my liking.

12/03/11: Shared bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a disappointingly small, white head. Aroma is bananas, floral hoppiness, a bit of cloves and wheat. Taste is bananas and yeast, quite dry and bitter due to the hops. Palate feels off. Carbonated and fairly light. Not really to my liking.

pours cloudy orange with  white head. The aroma is fruity and hoppy. 
Great palate!!  perfect.  taste was not as flavorful as aroma; nothing bad just nothing to standout.

Dirty yellow colour, bubbly and loose head. Amazing aroma full of floral and sweetly grassy hops perfectly combined with sweet banana and clove aromas of the yeast. Wheat malts give nice body. Sweet, malty and freshly fruity taste with lots of hops is maybe a bit glue-like combination. Still very enjoyable. Bitterish finsih with wheat, some yeasty sourness and slightly nutty hop flavor. Almos full bodied, slick texture. Personal brew with top class drinkability.
Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is banana, hops and wheat. Flavor is malts, wheat, a hint of banana and a hoppy finish. Nice mix of weizen and IPA.

Una de blat molt disfrutable! L¬íampolla es deia Tap5 (a dif de la de la foto) i en format mig litre. No gaires graus, olor molt bona, ideal per amants de birres poc fortes o moments que vingui m√©s de gust una d¬íaquest tipus

Oluessa lillii paljon sakkaa, joten annoin sen asettua y√∂n yli. Meine Hopfen weisse on kullanv√§rinen ja ihan pikkuisen samea olut. Oluen vaahto on valkoista ja kohtalaisen runsas. Tuoksultaan se on hedelm√§inen, hiivainen ja maltainen. Happamuutta ja makeutta huokuva. Humalointikin on helppo aistia. Maultaan olut on situksisen hedelm√§inen, hieman makea, hieman alkomainen, purkkainen ja vehn√§inen. Hedelm√§isyys maussa on ainakin banaania, sitruunaa ja appelsiinia. Melkoinen sekahedelm√§kiisseli. Suutuntuma on siis kohtalaisen runsas. P√§√§see takuulla uudestaankin lasiini.

Aroma is ethanol, banana, clove. Pours a cloudy amber, lots of sediment...perhaps I roused the bottle somehow. Lots of flavor here...banana, typical hefe flavors, but with a nice lasting bitterness. Very estery. Dry mouthfeel. Very pleasant for 8.2%.

Hazy copper in the glass with a thin white head.  Aroma of spicy hops with a touch of citrus and caramel malt.  Smooth mouthfeel with appreciable hop bitterness that is well-integrated.  Finishes on a wheat-citrus note.  Interesting collaboration, well done.

hazy copper gold, thin but dense and lasting white head, full of particulates, sticky full body, high carbonation.

aroma: floral citrusy hops, tart wheat, a creamed corn note, and a hint of vinegar or alcohol.

taste: lots of vegetal bright citrusy hops, tart wheat, a cooked nutty yeast note, and a somewhat vinyl orange peel hop resin note.

a rather unique and pleasant dark fruit hop profile.
Ottima weizenbock di una delle birrerie storiche di Monaco. Assaggiata sia a Roma che al ristorante Schneider a Monaco. Un gran bel prodotto.

Saw this in the store and figured the time was now to get it. Pours a nice hazy hefe gold, nice thick white head, though not as billowing as most.

This one has a great scent, you can smell the dry hopping and it has a nice citrus spice character. Theres some traditional fruity wheaty hefe scent in here too which intrigues me to try it.

It¬ís a taste experience, it has a nice balance though its as expected a far hoppier version of the darker hefe¬ís. It starts with a typical wheat flavor and then leads into a nice bit of hops, nice and bitter.

It¬ís medium bodied and not quite the most drinkable brew. It paired nicely with some guacamole and chips.

Overall it¬ís a style thats very taboo and hard to find a decent example of but this is probably the quintiseential hopfen-weisse.

Put against the Brooklyn one they are almost equal with this one tasting slightly better an the Brooklyn one smelling and looking better.

Wow this is just amazing. The aroma is so hoppy citrusy delicious I expected it to be like an IPA or something but you drink it and it¬ís a Hefeweizen but with hints of bitterness and the hoppy of something else. Like the bastard love child of a hefeweizen and an imperial IPA. Loved it. Extra excited that it only costs 1.50¬Ä at a store near my place.

Picture waking up groggy...your special someone makes you eggs, in the ideal way of course. Homemade biscuits, bacon (a lot of bacon) and hands you a 500ml bottle of delicious orange juice...or i mean hopfen-Weiss. Orange juice in a good way. Man I got so much enjoyment out of just smelling this beer. I love it. The aromas were of course citrus, but not just any citrus. I¬ím talking the sweetest, most idea,l perfection tangerine. It even looked like orange juice with pith floating around (the beer did have a ton of sediment)  I also got apple juuice from this beer. This was like a beer- juice. It had the just right amount of hops. So well balanced. I really enjoyed this beer.  Long finish. I want to buy it by the case just enjoy it every day.
Hazy yellow appearance, frothy white head, citrus flavor with slight smell of mold, slightly sweet citrusy taste, high carbonation, long finish. A good beer.

Presentation: (Part of a 5 pack gift set with glass.) It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into the Aventinus glass that came with the beer. The label on the bottle has the abv (8.2%) and a description of the beer on the back. There is no freshness date but there seems to be a batch number or bottle code on the back label.


Appearance: It has a thick cloudy, yeasty looking body with a tan/orange color and a tall white head. The head fades fairly fast and leaves just a small ring of foam on top. Lacing is minimal and spotty and slick.

Smell: The aroma has a good wheat bready and yeasty character with hints of ripe banana and citrusy herbal hops.

Taste/Palate: There is a good bit of bready/yeasty character and flavor. I get mild notes of banana, pineapple, clove and hints of orange. The hop profile is more noticeable than most Weizenbocks and adds a good balance of spicy, herbal, (almost minty) and citrus bitterness. The palate has a smooth and silky, almost oily texture with mellow carbonation.

Notes: The hop balance gives this beer a nice complexity and interesting flavor. This is one to seek out, especially if you liked the Brooklyn version.

This beer is an excellent vacation from my usual Hefeweizens.  It¬ís basically Hefeweizen but with hops.  Really good hops.  I¬íd have to be in a certain mood to drink this beer, but it¬ís a mood I could do quite often.

excellent saaz hops, mixed with some much more fragrant hop. Hard to pick out hops, but a fair amount of citrusy. Way more hops, and moderate amount of bitterness and the finish, but the light body and refreshing keeps up.  Excellent.

500 mL bottle. First thoughts is that it doesn¬ít taste quite like the original 2007 brew. Definite sour/winy notes in the aroma with hops. Less carbonation than the Brooklyn and a bit more clear. Not too cloudy and not what you would expect from a traditional German Weisse beer. Tastes a bit off/sour but still enjoyable. Surprisingly very different in aroma and taste from the Brooklyn. Very interesting to try them side by side. Surprisingly I enjoy the Brooklyn more but both are very good. Overall: (B+)

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 Re-rate 11/2013.  Poured from bottle.  Aroma of rotting apples, hops and bread.  Cloudy dark gold, thin head.  I taste grassy, floral hops, banana, pepper, bread, citrus, dried fruit and a bit of marshmallow.  Barely a trace of alcohol.  Good stuff - first time I rated this it must have been old.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
A - very nice, full, gold and orange color
S - great smell of citruses and fresh grapefruit peels mixed with pine and herbs.
T - lovely wheat malt with a little of ginger followed by sweet ending and a perfectly balanced bitterness at the end.
M - nice and smooth carbonation with medium to full body.
D - very drinkable beer, however because of the high alcohol volume, can be treasonable.

Pours a butterscotch colour and opacity, with a head that shrinks a lot faster than your average wheatie. The aroma is incredible - fresh raspberries, grass, brown sugar and IPA hops. In the mouth it¬ís much the same, although the hefe yeast flavours (banana and bubblegum) and bready wheat soon overwhelm the hops. When I first tried this as a beer n00b I didn¬ít like it and couldn¬ít finish it; very glad I gave it another go.

13th January 2009 Cloudy orange-brown beer. Medium white head. Suprising beer - soft and wheaty with some subtle wheat beer citrus but also a definite hope prescense. Quite soft and piney and not bitter at all. Well joined up and very drinkable.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a clouded golden amber with a white head.  Bubble gum aroma with banana, berry, cotton candy, and some hoppy notes.  Herbal hops lead the flavor into bubble gum and cloves, banana, some more grassy hop notes, all over the biscuity wheat background.  A very interesting combination here.
550 ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange/gold with moderate white head.  Fruits (apricots/banana) on the nose, with spice.  Great, smooth mouthfeel.  Just a great beer that has a taste all its own.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2011 Cloudy orange, full of sediment, small white head. Crisp, sweet aroma of citrus, banana, wheat, hops, spice and caramel malt. Tastes sweet, a little hoppy, tangy to almost sour, with a sharp spiciness. Body is full, thick, oily, lightly carbonated. Good, just really heavy and strong for what I was expecting.

Bottle. Pours opaque gold with many scary yeast floaters. Aroma is hoppy, meaty, tangy, and musty. Flavor is pine, malt, graham cracker, honey, dried fruits, nutmeg, coriander. This has a thinner body than I expected.

Cloudy orange with a medium head. The aroma is full of fruity hops in many layers, with the banana and clove beneath. Flavour has all the hops up first, giving way to a more traditional weizenbock flavour halfway through, turning to the banana, clove and caramel.
this 8.2 alcohol content bottle was a little strong for me as a Lite weight. The smell is strong, Thick head, sour smell, dark color of caramel.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2010 The pour creates a thin pure whuite head that quickly dissipates leaving almost no lacing. The nose is hops and bananas. Color is hazy yellow with a tinge of brown. When this hits the papate, the weissen is obvious but not pronounced. You know it¬ís wheat but you are left wondering what this really is when the hops come on strong, real strong. Did someone mix an IPA in this? No, its the Hallertau hops. Actually, not as strong as they can be.Enjoyed on the celebration of the birth of Jesus, the Messiah.

Got this 500 ml bottle at Carl¬ís Meat Market in Kittery, ME. Pours a wonderfully cloudy orangish body with foamy white head that left somelacing. Big yeasty nose with a bit of apricot, some light clove, and some breadiness. The flavor is not quite as smooth as I was hoping for.  It¬ís more sweet and has more caramel flavor than I prefer. Finishes with a bit of spicy clove and a little too much alcohol heat. Full bodied and thick with a heavy yeast texture (which I do like). Overall a nice Weizen Bock.

Tasting from Jan¬í this year, long notes, memorable tasting!?¬íPour is soft for a hefe-weiss, a little shake to create action saw the rise of a dense, relentlessly steadfast pad of white that settled to a good inch in height. The carbonation only visible on the outermost is minute and awkward in its rise to atmosphere. The body a pale sandy chestnut and opaque, dull. Warming molten toffee and doughy, banana liqueur bang crashes some spicy, alcoholic, fruit-punch notes on the nose. Each whiff bounced out  more esters (green papaya, mango, apricot, strawberries) and confusion as it doesn¬ít meld with the toffee and liqueur...., and it smells HOT (fusels?).¬í The mouth is still reeling and the notes shorten - ¬íThe head tastes foul and needed to be cut off by a palette knife. Spicy, peppery, highly alcoholic and very, very weedy, bitter and acrid on the palate, completely unbalanced off-set only by some subliminal banana and cantaloupe flavours upfront and a fair dinkum fighting effort by some outweighed banana and pear esters very late. Body is relatively light, and it is spritzy. Phenolics are also appreciatively deflated by an awful lingering acridity of acidic, bitter weeds unknown to my palate. All over the show, finishing was a struggle!¬í - Definitely on the re-rate list, maybe I missed something, maybe I didn¬ít!!! (50cL, BB 16/12/09, The International Beer Shop, W. Leederville)

Pours a dark yellow with large white head. Intense biting aroma of fruity spicy hops and cloves. The taste is equally spicy, with a full mouthfeel and very high carbonation. Bananas, lemon, a bit grainy, caramel malt. Quite sweet and not as hoppy as expected. Very drinkable for its alcohol content. An interesting concotion, a light-colored Weizenbock with extra hops, that ends up a tad too sweet. Big bonus points however for a large German brewery doing awesome experiments like that.
Lots of citrus, banana and tropical fruit aromas. Nice body and really hoppy and spicey. Unusual beer but very good even if not very pretty.

Une fois vers√©, le liquide d√©voile une robe dor√©e et embrouill√©e.  Sa mousse blanche forme un col persistant.  Le nez est fruit√© avec des parfums de p√™che, d¬íagrumes et de l√©g√®re banane.  Une pr√©sence assez souple et fine d¬í√©pices est notable.  L¬íalcool se fait sentir, l√©g√®rement poivr√©.  Au go√ªt, les saveurs de fruits tropicaux sont d√©bordantes.  Le bl√© est go√ªteux et la levure pr√©sente.  L¬íalcool parfume de fa√ßon d√©cisive.  En bouche, le liquide a une structure moyennement forte avec une effervescence mod√©r√©e et une texture vraiment cr√©meuse.  La finale est domin√©e par des notes am√®res de houblons de dur√©e convenable qui se combinent √† une pr√©sence d¬íalcool presque chaud.

Tasted from a 500mL bottle purchased at Discount Liquor in Milwaukee.  Pours hazy golden with a thick but smooth white head that leaves an even blanket of lace.  The nose is an interesting blend of the traditional banana and clove hefeweizen with a bitter and citrus hops aroma as well.  The flavor features the hops a little bit more, but the theory is still the same with the banana and clove flavors.  The body is medium, and in signature hefeweizen style, has a sticky texture, with average carbonation and a long hops and banana finish.

50 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a weizen glass. Pours cloudy orange-golden with a modest white head. The head fades slowly to a bare cover, leaving minimal lace. The nose has a surprising hoppy bite, with pine and citrus. There is also a significant yeasty quality, with banana and spice, but this takes a back seat to the hops. The flavor is very rich, starting out with a complex sweetness but becoming progressively more bitter towards the end. There is a prominent acidic quality, probably from the hops. The finish is long and hoppy, imparting a parting shot of bitter. On the palate, it is medium-full in body with a creamy texture and average carbonation. This is a very nice beer and quite unique. It is basically a dark hefe with a strong American hop accent. I was slightly surprised that this combination worked out. It is quite strong, not the kind of brew you want to have on a hot summer¬ís afternoon, but very nice as a fall or winter warmer. 2010-12-10
Bottle 50 cl. Hazy goldenbronze colour with a white foamy head. Aroma is sweet wheat, spices and strong hop notes. Flavour is nice hop bitterness with some citrus fruit. Interesting and quite good.

Part of the Great Munich Beer Raid 2010. 5oo ML bottle in Germany. Pours a dark gold with a pure white head. Lot of alcohol present in the aroma. has som spices in there as well. Taste of cloves and other spices. Palate is very strong but not offensive. A great beer.

Please dont take my rating too serious, im a bit off with this style. 
Slightly hazy golden orangy colour. Aroma: Sweet and yeasty, mango, banana, pineapple. Taste: thick, sweet, dough, mango, banana, yeast, but with a hoppy kick. Good stuff.
Pour at Warners at the Bay Beer Festival 2010. The nicer of the 3 i had from this brewer. Plenty of spice, yeast, citrus and tropical fruits in this one. Delicious!

Bottle.  Pours hazy light orange with an average, frothy and bubbly white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (straw, hay, bread, nutty), light hops (spicy), and average esters (banana) with notes of barnyard and clove.  Flavor is heavy malt (straw, hay, bread, nutty), light hops (spicy), and average esters (banana) with notes of barnyard and clove.  Medium body, warmth, creaminess, high carbonation with a sweet texture yet dry finish.

S√∂t√©t teasz√≠n≈± folyad√©k hatalmas habkoron√°val, a gy√°rban is √©rzett gy√ºm√∂lcs√∂s √©leszt≈ëillat belesimul a Zaf√≠r koml√≥ hat√°rozottan citrusos arom√°j√°ba.
