Csod√°s ital, leny≈±g√∂z≈ë √©s nehezen megfejthet≈ë.
Bottle from Peckhams. Sweet yeasty aroma. Cloudy golden brown colour with massive foamy head. Sweet spicey lemon & mango yeasty flavour, flowery aftertaste. Distinctive.

Sprucey, intense, powerful nose even with fruity spiciness (mango, lemon, pepper). The yeast starts out in subtlety (or beneath the hops), but becomes more intense in mouth. Relatively light in body. Very dry. Thinner and less wheaty than its sibling. Pungent, ultra dry-hopped, but not quite as graceful, just decadently aromatic.

Bouteille brune de 500ml (merci slovak). La bi√®re est dor√©e trouble, beaucoup de bl√©. Belle mousse. Nez fruit√© des esters de la levures. Agrumes, banane, beaucoup d¬í√©pices. Les houblons traversent la bouche, c¬íest un choc, vraiment nouveau style, agr√©able, √©pic√©e.

0,5 l bottle, shared with Tonycaviar, bought at the brewery, called Meine Hopfenweisse.
YES, THIS BEER RULES! Poured murky-hazy amber-golden with a huge and fantastic off white head.  Veryvery complex aroma with a tons of tropical, overmatured fruits. Banana, mango and citrusses, lichie - and a huge ammount off fantastic resiny hops. I can see the little fruit-flys around the overmatured fruits on a hot summer day. And the taste... Thick body, complex flavor with a smooth mouthfeel. Fruity character with a wide malt background, the top fermentation character rules the first slip but after a second the hop cones arrive...And the power of this components numbling the palate. Chaotic rapture. Fantastic!

500ml bottle, pours cloudy golden amber with very slight foamy head and nice lace. Aroma is intense fruit and yeast. Flavor is nice sweet yeasty bread, bubblegum, bananas and apricot, with traces of spice. Nice lingering aftertaste.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2010 Bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a deep, milky straw yellow body with the mandatory large weizen head on top. Nice. Nose is clove, banana, bubblegum and hints of cereal and wheat. Very sweet in taste, with hints of nutmeg and bread. Full bodied, with traces of floral hops in the aftertaste. A very nice weissbier indeed, although I¬ím not totally feeling the "innovativeness" advertised on the collaboration with Brooklyn here; this is a pretty traditional weizen in many ways, although perhaps a bit more crafty looking and perhaps with a few small tweaks. On the other hand: it¬ís hard to tweak the weissbier format too much without ending up making a different style of beer altogether...
0.5 liter bottle. The best discovery of this summer for me. HAs all the greatness of a fantastic Weisbier. Fruity banana... yeasty and hops, hops and hops. Makes me wish it was summer again. Great!!!

500ml bottle, slight cloudy honey gold hue, with a frothy white head, yeasty, fuity, candied ripe apple, banana nose with a mild cinnamon, clove, nutmeg spicy note, with some honeyed wheat, pale malt accents, and with some tropical fruit esters in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth yeasty, fruity, ripe apple, banana, spicy nutmeg, cinnamon character with some honeyed wheat, pale, toasted malt flavours upfront, with some mild flowery hop leafy, citrusy, lemony undertones, leading towards a warming, fruity, ripe apples, spicy nutmeg, lingering hop bitterness finish.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a thin, off white head, with some lacing, over a cloudy dark god (SRM 6) body.....nose is bubblegum, banana, peach, apricot (they got loose with the esters).....taste is a multitude of fruits, including banana, peach, apricot, finishing with a bitter hop bite.....mouth feel is thick, carbonation low. This is a very different Weizen Bock. The esters are overwhelmingly in the light fruit end of the spectrum. This means the heavy malts flavors of a dark Weizen, such as plum and cherry, are completely missing. There are minimal phenolic tones.  It misses on the pale end of the Weizen spectrum also. Then it finishes with a big hop wack. BJCP 7/2/12/4/6

Bottle, German club, Brisbane
Hazy orange gold body, large dense white head hangs around, like you¬íd expect from a good weizen.
Nose is a combination, perhaps a tad odd, of tangy citrus, herbal hops with the classic banana esters and clove spice of a wiessbier.
High carbonation, plenty of body and creaminess.
Pale wheat malt sweetness is quite rich on the front palate, provides base for vanilla and peppery phenolics with some over-ripe banana flavour. Grass, herbal hops are in the mix with some odd, slightly oxidised notes of dried apricot in there lingering on the finish, with a boozy warmth.
Certainly a unique, different taken on the weizen. Quite enjoyable, but a tad disconjointed overall.

Hazy dark orange. There¬ís a lot more fruit in this one than an ordinary Schneider weisse. But what¬ís up with the flavor, there¬ís something I can¬ít put my finger on. Apart from the std banana and chewing gum notes, there is also some fruit that I guess comes from the hops, but feels more like a industrial solvent, interesting but not all pleasant. The mouthfeel is quite oily and nice.

I mean, what is this? It¬ís got so many hops in it that it tastes like an anti-fungal mouth wash. There was a hint of aniseed in there but overall it¬ís not pleasant drinking. Athlete¬ís foot, yes that¬ís it; this is the stuff the swimming pool attendant pours into that little foot-bath at the entrance to the pool. That must be what "Hopfen" means; "kills all known germs dead". But thanks to Harrisoni for letting me try this one :)

Bouteille de 500 ml. Ar√¥mes complexes de bl√©, de levure (clous de girofle) et de houblon floral. Robe dor√©e et trouble, peu de mousse et effervescence assez faible. La bi√®re pr√©sente un m√©lange original  et bien √©quilibr√© de bl√© cru, de levure de weizen (surtout le clou de girofle) et de houblon tr√®s floral. Bien malt√©e et plut√¥t sucr√©e, elle est relativement lourde en bouche (une impression que l¬íeffervescence faible contribue √† renforcer). Finale l√©g√®rement alcoolis√©e et am√®re. Int√©ressant.

Had it like "Schneider Weisse Tap 5 Meine Hopfenweisse". Cloudy orange/yellow looks with a frothy white head. Fruits, flowers and some dough in the aroma. Herbal and lightly spiced in the taste with some lightly sour feel. Round flavour. Medium/full body, soft carbonation and a light bitter finish. Very good overall.

A: aventinus glass. pours a nice hazy yellow color with a big orange hint. solid two finger white head. outstanding retention level. wonderful lacing. great amount of sediment.

S: such an amazing aroma. citrus from the wheat, citrus from the hops. nice mellow spices. wonderful lavender aroma.

T: that lavender really shines through with a soppy flavor, but in a good way. slight citrus hop tones. solid wheat presence. so unique.

M: medium body. high carbonation but nice. very crisp and smooth.

D: get this beer! it is phenomenal! so interesting, especially if you do both side by side.

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 16.7.2010.
Pours a hazy orange colour with a frothy white head. Fruity aroma of grapefruit, flowers and wheat. Wheaty flavour of sweet fruits, suprisingly high amount of hops with herbal notes. Pleasant. Medium bodied with slicky mouthfeel. Overall an interesting Weizen Bock.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 pours cloudy pale golden with a frothy white head, excellent retention and lacing. fresh cereals, crackling wheat, loads of citrus, mint and coriander, light pine, tender yet never perfumey bananas, other phenolic goodness. average carbonation, light body - oily; incredibly balanced tropical-citrusy finish. excellent - a revelation-type kind of beer.

Nice cloudy yellow color.Good amount of head a t first, but this dissipates quickly leaving only a small layer of foam across the surface of the beer.  Very nice spotty lacing left behind.

Aroma is a pleasant mix of bready yeast with some citrus - mostly orange.  Flavor has similar aspects - the bready/yeasty and citrus elements are here along a slight bitterness.  Some gentle warming from the alcohol spreads as you drink.

Very tasty brew and the higher ABV is almost completely hidden making it quite drinkable.

Would definitely drink this again.
Great beer.  Pours a cloudy amber with a thin white head.  Aroma of hop, wheat and a great balanced full mouthfeel.  This is a great beer!

pours dark yellow with a nice white head and good lacing.  The amout of suspended yeast is almost ridiculous.  aroma is citrus and yeast up front but there¬ís a hint of raspberry as well.  taste is strong with oranges and lemon with a domineering yeast presence.  the hops are big and beautiful as well. this is a forthright and powerful beer but that¬ís not to say its unbalanced.  The finish is bitter and hoppy with citrus lingering.  a very nice beer.

Draft from International Tap House in Chesterfield.  Served in a tall Paulaner glass, this hazy, dull orange-colored beer has a very thick, rocky eggshell white head.  Aroma of orange citrus, floral hops, peppery spices, Bavarian malts, and sugar.  Flavor of orange citrus, floral hops, peppery spices, Bavarian malts, yeast, paper, and bubblegum.  Medium-bodied, with a malty mouthfeel and high carbonation.  Interesting mix of sharp citrus, malts, spices, and sweetness.  Good beer.
Hazy amber.  A dank, banana aroma with some pineapple.  Taste is way sweet - almost like a cough syrup.

Brown bottle, 500 ml, gift from Karp Probst, savoured on August 27 2010; eye: orangey, hazy, no effervescence, really tiny ring of off-white head, slight lacing; nose: hops, floral, light resinous hops, orange; mouth: hops, orange, slight floral hops, dusty, short finale in orange with light presence of bubble gum, medium-light body, lightly below-average carbonation, slightly bitter, slick texture, slight acidity; overall: fine

FRAN√áAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, cadeau de Karl Probst, savour√©e le 27 ao√ªt 2010; ¬úil : orang√©e, voil√©e, pas d¬íeffervescence, tr√®s petit anneau de mousse blanc cass√©, tr√®s l√©g√®re dentelle; nez : houblon, floral, l√©ger houblon r√©sineux, orange; bouche : houblon, orange, tr√®s l√©ger houblon floral, poussi√®re, finale courte en orange avec l√©g√®re pr√©sence de gomme-baloune, corps moyen-l√©ger, carbonatation l√©g√®rement sous la moyenne, tr√®s l√©g√®rement am√®re, texture coulante, tr√®s l√©g√®re acidit√©; en r√©sum√© : bien

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 Bottle. Beautiful cloudy golden colour, huge white head. Aroma full of floaral hops, citrus and spices (mainly clove); Flavour of fruits, spices (more clove) and floral hops. Medium body, medium-high carbonisation. Great thirst quencher.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2011 Bottle. Weizenbock? Pale hazy yellowish-brown pour, some white head. Aroma is grassy and citrusy with some apricot and banana. Taste is sweet, good bitter hop finish. The hops really take over the classic german banana-clove-wheat aromas, which isn¬ít a bad thing. Palate is well carbonated. Good stuff.

Tasted this (not on the list) with friends 21.08.2010. Many thanks to Tim and Klaas for this bottle! 
Hazy darkgolden to orange color, with small white head. 
Aroma is wonderfull, hops, with spices. 
Medium body.
Taste bit sweet, fruits, spices, hops. Bit spice and hopsbitterness end. WOW what a beer ! LIKE IT.

Bottle: Pours a cloudy golden, with a fluffy white head with good lacing character. Smells of citrus and hops, flavors are HUGE hops, citrus, spice, floral notes, extremely surprising brew. Without knowing the brooklyner connection ahead of time, its very unexpected coming from the schneider label.

Bottle from the LCBO- POurs a heavily hazed dark orange with a formy eggshell cap that laces well. Intense nose of fresh hops, spices, citrus like oranges and lemon, and floral notes. The flavour profile is intense.Bitter hops give way to orange peel and lemon, and lead to yeast, spice, and bubblegum. Marked bitter finish has lots of fruitiness as well. Creamy and full bodied. Very good!

10/08/2010 - 50cl bottle @ beer tasting Gentse Biervereniging
Thanks @ Klaas for the bottle! Pours a yellow to orange, very cloudy beer. Little to almost no white head. Disappears quickly. Smell is very aromatic with spices. Mouth feeling is creamy and full. Flavour is spices, a little sweet with some caramel, a little hoppy. Aftertaste has a lot of spices again, a little bitterness and somewhat fruity. A very nice brew! Germany has some good quality beers, but keeps them hidden very well.

Pours a super cloudy burnt orange with a puffy white head.  Aroma is of citrus, mango and cloves.  complex.  Tastes of creamy mango, sweet with a touch of biterness in the finish.  Thick, but incredibly smooth mouthfeel.  This is a very unique beer, alcohol is well hidden, until it warms near the bottom of the glass

Biggish offwhite head. Hazy dark yellow body. Fruity citric oranges aroma with floral mealy notes. Dry-sweet oily oranges and wheat taste with floral herbal spicy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dry floral mealy fruity aftertaste with oily orangey notes. Lovely! Extremely drinkable, subtle and full of flavour. (0.5l bottle, Olympen, Oslo.)

Pours orange with a nice white head.  Aroma is citrus,, wheat,  yeast, spices, dough and florals.  Very complex.  Taste is sweet and a little bitter with clove and wheat coming through.  Very refreshing for 8.2, he alcohol is hidden extremely well.  There is a sticky finish.  Overall this is a great brew.

Poured a hazy orange brown with a fair amount of sediment at the bottom.  Large foamy off-white head with an orange tint.  Aromas of berries and fruit with some yeast.  Taste has good wheat flavors with fruit and a banana creamy texture.  Alcohol is a little too noticeable.  Finish has a slightly warming effect from the alcohol but with some good dark malt flavors.  Overall pretty good, but the alcohol is a little much.

New, brown slim bottle at the LCBO with a brewed and bottled by 10.071 (2 0722 2716) written on back label. Pours a hazy beige-orange colour with a nice frothy white head that has great retention and bubbly lace. Quite a spicy nose with also, apples, lemon, bananas, cloves and the wheat malt softening everything. Quite smooth for a high alcohol content with no burns felt and some decent stickiness. Wheat malt taste with lots of the other stuff found in the aromas. Very well-balanced and refreshing with the hoppy finish that is kind of dry. A wonderful alliance between the brewers to make a very fine beer.

500 ml bottle labelled "Schneider Tap 5". Poured hazy golden to orange colour with a thick white head. Malty aroma with citric notes accompanied with the usual banana. Flavour has elements of sweetness, wheat bread, citrus, banana and even bitter hops. Quite strong carbonation. Quite classy Weizen-Bock.

A: The pour is a quite hazy orange color with a fluffy off-white head on it.

S: The nose is quite impressive. Lots of citrus notes, sweet wheat, and of course the usual banana and clove notes. A few more sniffs give off a really intense floral hop aroma.

T: A nice sweet malt flavor along with plenty of fruitiness. Lots of oranges, bananas, and a bit of bubblegum and clove. A good yeast flavor as well.

M: The body is medium with a very plentiful level of carbonation.

D: Another delicious weizenbock. Easy to drink and plenty of good flavors and aromas.

500ml bottle.  A cloudy brown body with a frothy white head. Nice lace and retention.  Aroma had great bread and clove notes.  It had a hop profile that seemed both piney and floral.  Flavor seemed to have a great malt presence.  Strong bread and clove notes through out.  Bitter hops were present.  Overall mouth feel seemed moderate, I was hoping for a little more body but the beer was still good.

Appearance: Cloudy golden orange with a medium snow white head. Aroma: Nice yeast aroma at first, orange, lemon, slightly spicy, a little wood too. Nice! Flavour: Oranges, spicy, lots of tingle on the tongue, a tiny alcohol bite, sandalwood; pine, lots of yeast; just delicious!
Bottle, pours cloudy golden orange. Aroma of orange zest, citrus and spices. Flavour of spices, tangerine, citrus, wheat with a little hop bitterness on the finish. Excellent.

500ml bottle thanks from Winooski.
Appearance : Clear pale orange with medium thin and bubbly head.

Aroma : Quite malty with spicy and fruity hops. Some esters. Notes of bananas.

Taste : Fruity and spicy. Finish is quite spicy and mineral. Taste has nice notes of bananas.

Overall : Much less tasty than the Brooklyn version. Taste is very mineral even a bit metallic. Maybe something is wrong with this bottle. I have another one that I will crack open later. Still there are nice elements in this beer. A little bit too much spices but nice esters and malts. Rather drinkable even if a bit harsh on the finish cause of the spices and the alcohol bite. Get less metallic with time which is a good thing. Still a bit too spicy.
On draft at Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Hazy golden colored. Aroma and flavor are an uncomfortable combination of a weizen and a pale ale, two nice styles, but combining them just does not seem to work.

Bottle. An intriguing visual combination of murky yellow, light brown and beige. Forward aroma with big hits of lemon, nutmeg, clove, rainwater and malt. The flavour lives up to the teasing aroma with equal doses of nutmeg, lemon and orange peel, white pepper and a heavy alcohol bite. Nice.

hazy bright golden with a white head. smell is lemon candy with piney hoppiness, a lot of alcohol. hot alcohol, wheat, grapefruit taste, a light caramel touch. light mouthfeel for the gravity but smooth. very nice combination in which you can actually feel the brooklyn and schneider sides.

Poured hazy golden with a good-sized, soapy head. Great grassy aroma with a nice medium body and full feel in the mouth. Bitter but not overly so. Complex but not convoluted. Delicate carbonation. This beer was highly recommended to me and now I know why. Bravo.
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with off white head. Aroma of fruit and citrus. Flavour is almost aprocot like. The finish is smooth . a very decent beer !

Comprata al beer shop di Canneto il Lungo, 28 e 1/2, che ho scoperto recentemente; E¬í un prodotto egregio di schneider, insaporito dal dry hopping e quindi amarissimo, ma con un delicato profumo di rose che non riesco a decifrare. Notevolissima, da bere a litri e litri.

500ml Bottle: Wow, I had no idea this was a collaboration! My second collaborative beer, here¬ís hoping it¬ís as good as the other. Pours a hazy, opaque pumpkin with a fat white head. Awesome fresh hop aroma backed with spicy clove and bright, sour lemon. Somehow they¬íve really captured these ingredients well, incredible and inviting aromas. Thick and rich mouthfeel, lots of character, clings to the tongue as you sip. Certainly resembles that traditional Schneider weiss amped up with stronger caramel and definitely more citrusy hops. Refreshing and flavourful, great beer.
Una hopfenweisse cos¬í√®? Una birra straluppolata di frumento, non una birra di frumento col luppolo... per√≤ √® splendida.

2010 Bottle - Thanks dchmela!! - Pours a hazy burnt tan with a small white head...aroma is sweet and fruity, banana and pear, light spice, gritty grain, marshmallows...flavour is similar, tons of fruity malt, lightly sour grain, clove and cinnamon...finish is nicely clean and refreshing in spite of the gravity...very tasty stuff...

Bottle - 500ml. Nice, cloudy golden body with a fading off-white bubbly head. Wonderful, complex hoppy/yeasty aroma with coriander, citrusy, and vanilla hints. Malty/hoppy taste is very well balanced and hides the alcohol pretty well. It carries yeasty, fruity and coriander notes. Ends with a decent bittersweet finish and leaves a moderate warming feeling. Very good one!

Tap at Manderes.  Big nose of clove and banana.  Light golden pour with a white head that thins but stays around.  Flavor is full of clove and bananas foster.  There¬ís a lite booziness that adds to the palate.  Great feeling in the mouth.  Excellent beer.

Pours a dark cloudy amber with minimal head, aroma of hay, banana and bubblegum with a touch of alcohol.  Very smooth, medium carbonation leads to a wonderful spicy and citrus flavor along back nicely with a good touch of hops and a somewhat slight sour note, but the finish is very clean and  just glides down the throat.

500 mL bottle.  Fresh batch side-by-side with a 2-year-old bottle.  Colour is Hazybrown-gold, but the older bottle has a truckload of sediment.  The aroma is weizenbock meets imperial pilsner meets orange juice - very rich.  The hops have faded in the cellared version, but the fullness remains.  The flavour is full, sweet, and bitter, with tonnes of orange juice and a lovely, more-than-subtle bitterness throughout.  The wheat and yeast contribute to a full body.  Again, the hops have faded in the older bottle, but so has the slight alcohol flavour present in the new bottle.  Better fresh, but still worthy after two years.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a very cloudy light amber - some sediment floating around.  Aroma is absolutely fantastic.  Ripe fruits - apricots and plum, along with some light floral hops.  Alcohol comes through in strength on first taste but quickly recedes into a slightly bitter but mostly sweet taste.  Very full-bodied, feels almost syrupy in the mouth.  An interesting and fantastic beer.

500ml bottle 
8.2% ABV 
I tried this beer on June 15, 2010 after purchasing from one of my local LCBO outlets.  The beer poured a murky orange gold into the Erdinger World Cup glass with a thin off-white head.  The aroma was sweet wheat malt, bananas, and spices.  The mouthfeel was medium/full bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was sweet wheat malt, some light fruit, spices, and a bitter finish.

a funny little thing. very hop-forward at first nose, lots of resiny citrusy effects going on, with some biscuity malt undercurrents. first taste is equally hop heavy, but balanced -- lots of biscuity, doughy maltiness coming right behind the hops, plus more of what you¬íd expect with a yeast like this one -- banana and clove, of course, with some nutmeg in there too. that¬ís more in the finish, though, which doesn¬ít tend to linger. nor does the mouthfeel -- it¬ís surprisingly light, really. the sign in Commercial¬ís description reads "we¬íre hiding this down here because if you find out we have it, we won¬ít get any." well worth seeking out and tasting. great collab,

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy caramel brown, with an off-white head.  Most of the usual hefe-weisse aromas.  Banana, dough, cloves AND caramel, with the resiny, peachy citrus aroma of hops very much present.  Literally smells like a blend of hefe-weisse and IPA. My two favourite things combined.  Big IPA resinous, soapy hops out of the gate, which kind of overpower the hefe-weisse characteristics.  The hefe-weisse is there, but it¬ís all in the finish.  Faint citrus, yeast, and banana with a sweet citrus hop finish.  This is some exciting stuff, and well worth the money.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy light orange with a foamy white head. Aroma is, whoa hoppy. Nice aggressive noble hop note, very unweizen, though there is still a but of wheat that is in the background to the nice hoppiness. Spicy and hoppy, very up front. Flavor has a bit more of the wheat character, at least to start. The wheat, bubble gum and clove really start nicely but are pushed out by the hop notes that come out for the latter half.  Finishes spicy and quite assertive. Medium body and a softer carbonation. If I was rating this on style it wouldn¬ít do as well but I admit I am fascinated by the merger of the hops and traditional german styles

Bottle LCBO, Uptown Waterloo.  Lovely dark yellow hazy pour, foamy small white head.  Aroma of very sharp fruity and zest hops, with lots of yeast in three as well. Taste - tons of sharp fruity hops up front, great lively wheat body to back it up, substantial but not intrusive alcohol to complement.  A quenching hoppy wheat that packs a punch, tremendous.  But this if you see it, cannot believe we can get it right now at our local LCBO¬ís.

(bought at beers of europe) Strange  concept.   A beer cocktail between a wheat beer and a hop bomb , not something ive ever desired.   Aroma is strange all the customary wheat beer characters...banana. spices. baubblegum ..then grapefruity hops come along and are a bizarre mix to things mentiond.  It drinks down exactly like so.  WheAT beer and an IPA having a boxing match . Interesting drink . But oddball.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a very cloudy brownish gold with moderate-sized soapy white head.   Aroma is huge on banana, citrus and peaches with some subtle spices and yeast.  Flavour of bubblegum, banana, citrus and clove.  Lingering dry finish.  Active carbonation.  Very nice.
50 cl bottle, Mulmur, ON, Canada, via Jim. Apricot coloured, floral and smooth with a sweet breadiness.

Pours cloudy orange-yellow with moderate head, eventually vanishing unless roused; not at all weizen-like. Grassy hop aromas come through mixed with banana and cloves and perhaps some coriander.. Somewhat bitter upon first taste, however mellows out upon subsequent tastings, nice medium mouthfeel with phenolic flavours predominant throughout. Lingering bitterness in addition to the phenols on the finish. Nice beer, but in my opinion; out of balance. It is a new experience to have grassy hops and weizen yeast characteristics, so definitely worth a go. Tough to classify this one, more hop flavours shining through for a weizen bock. Very Interesting. Love it!

Bottle from LCBO. Quite a nice beer. Very unusual with the intense hops and the wheat. Great hop aroma with citrus and wild herbs. Wheat in the flavor with some banana and lots of cloves as well as hops. A cloudy gold colored beer with lots of yeast and sediment.

Bottle: Puts a really turbid gold ale in the flute with stiff tight pored cap, great retention massive lacing. Lively carbonation. Wonderful pungent nose: bananas, grapefruit, spice, some mustiness, bubblegum and a touch of fusel. Substantial body for a hefeweiss, rounded mellow character , Silken mouth feel, ... smooth as a fruit pudding with NO sharp edges at all! Big fruits and citrus up front are balanced with spicy tones and citrusy hop bittering, middle is pudding soft and mellow with substantial body with leafy NW hops and malt sweetness joining the liquid fruit cocktail. Light drying in the finish punctuated with bitter citrus.....light ¬íhop burn¬í in the after taste. Frikkin¬í awesome wheat!

500 ml bottle from the LCBO. pours murky beige with a small white head. aroma of tropical fruit, hefe forward yeast, dandilion fluff. the flavour is complex, i get bubble gum, tropical fruit, lingering wheaty hefeness(?), balanced but slightly bitter finish. hoppier then any other beer ive had that was made with a hefe strain. leaner mouthfeel then i was expecting. i like it but dont love it.

This beer will spawn lovers and haters alike. I for one am a lover because when it comes to beer styles I am one who likes it when beers push the boundaries and break the rules and I applaud the brewers who ask the question what if we did this? This is a Hop Heads Hefe! Now for the beer. So big floral and full. Meal in a glass kind of thing. Sometimes Hefe has those flavors that are astringent and cut through you. Not this one. All those wonderful weissen flavors and characteristics  and big hops to go with it. Absolutely one of my favorite beers. The alcohol is spot on. barely noticable and puts you where you want to be. Not for the faint at heart.

Deep orangish yellow pour with thin white head.  Aroma of fruity esters: peach, clove, banana, some pineapple.  A hint of clove and citrus, a bit yeasty.  Flavor is so smooth and delicious.  Fruity, with flavorful hop bitterness.  Mildly sweet, lots of peach and pear, Lightly doughy malts, nice wheat presence.  Full mouthfeel, soft carbonation.  Nice, long finish.  Really good beer, I think this is better than the Brooklyn version.

Ummmm.. Awesome!?!?! Pours a hazy orange colour with a short lived white head. The aroma is amazing, very heavy peach and pineapple notes, citrusy grapefruit notes, apricot, with some yeasty bits in there too. The flavour is again heavy on the peach and pineapple notes, grapefruit, bitter hops. Dry yeasty finish. An impressive beer, flavorful, with a high drinkability. TOP F¬íN NOTCH!!!!

Bottle.  In a weizen glass this covers a spectrum of hazy golden shades.  Nice thick yeasty head on top.  Full aromatic, dry hop aroma; banana, clove, peach, grapefruit, apricot, avocado.  Full bodied.  Big, big, big.  Flavour of citrus fruit with pleasant hop bitterness, clove, banana, apricot.  Medium length in the finish.

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Cool label, has the Schneider logo, not the Brooklyn one as pictured. Pours a very hazy gold with a small white head. The aroma is fantastic, loaded with hops yet with the yeasty characteristics of a weizen bock. Citrusy and peachy esters, with some sweet malt backing. Flavour is delicious, great sweetness upfront with the fruity esters, met quickly by some solid hop presence and a bitter finish. Rich maltiness. Lingering dry yeasty aftertaste. This stuff is so damn tasty, there¬ís a minor alcohol presence, but I¬íd never guess it¬ís 8.2%abv given how fast and easy it is to drink. The carbonation is also quite moderate for the style. It¬ís like some kind of hoppy donut in a glass. Fantastic stuff, definitely plan on buying  more as it¬ís priced extremely well as the cherry on top. I¬íve never had a wheat-based beer with so much hops.

Drank on day 2 of the 2010 Mondial de la Bi√®re. Beautiful misty blonde, small head. Semi dry hops aroma, sweet notes of peach. Taste of dry Saaz hops, pleasant malted wheat, aftertaste of fragrance grass. A nice creature!

Pours a little darker than most weissbier, a nice pale orange color.  Soapy white head, minimal lacing.  Really impressive and beautiful aroma of citrus and grass.  Crisp, full flavor, I taste lemon and hay.  Good creaminess in the palate, perfect lingering hops and well-balanced alcohol.  Really good.

Wonderfully floral almost hoppy nose that allows the more traditional wheat aromas to come through as well.  Taste is unique and light even.  Pour is beautiful as has been noted, looks more like an unfiltered IPA than a wheat.  Palate is a bit thin and even "spritzy" which was a bit disappointing but perhaps intentional?  Fun beer.

bottle - probably the prettiest pour I¬íve seen.  It started off like a pale lager, but as I poured more rigorously, the white head start to bubble up.  Meanwhile, the cloudiness lowered to what I can only compare to real honey, by sight.  Impressive so far.  Oddly enough, it smells like... wheat. I detect some citrus fruit and some hops.  Two flavors almost battling for dominance.  Pleasant aftertaste and quickly making me gassy.  Is indeed refreshing and I can imagine drinking this in the Fall on a picnic bench with lots of stringed lights.  Schneider, you did it again, BRAVO!

bottle shared with Brie in front of our new AC.  The aroma is bread and a hint of metallic hops.  The taste is banana, lemon, and some grassy metallic hops.  
Now it is a little warmer and I can really taste the alcohol.  This is a great brewer collaboration and a unique German beer.

Schneider & Sohn might very well be the best classic hefeweiss bier brewer in the world.  The Brooklyn Brewery has this energy to push a beer over the edge. Side-by-side, they are virtualy invisible. This "√úber-Weizen"  Hopfen-Weisse represents the classic weizen, pushed to the limit by the american way of brewing beer. It¬ís everything from M√ºnchen to the Red hook. Herbal-hoppiness, banana-fruity, dough-yesty, classic clove and bubble gum and a little american citrus taste. It¬ís the Beastie Boys live in Theresienwiese ...

Sampled at Mondial 2010. Clear golden with medium foamy white head. Aroma is fresh herbal hops, oily hops, wheat, bavarian yeast and sweet malt. Flavor is sweet malt, wheat, fresh herbal hops, bread with a sweet finish. Fizzy carbonation. Very refreshing and well made.

An imperial hopfen weisse!  Pours a muddy brown and yellow... not a particularly apetizing appearance, but the rest of this was solid.  Aroma is wheaty, sweet with some fusel alcohols.  Taste is sweet...perhaps not dry enough...but otherwise pleasant.  Wheaty, yeasty, banana and sweet, sweet, sweet, especially as it warms.
This beer was not what I expected when I drank it.  It is a dark, heavier beer not in my normal expectation of hefeweizen.

Bottle 50cl. A very cloudy yellow amber ale with nice head. Smell is deep and nice and feels a good body. Aroma is really interesting, well on wizen bock with IPA character. Hops is dense, floral and citrus like, many fruit aroma with a good weizen presence but not astringent at all. Quite sweet, very pleasant, hints of cloves, oranges and banana, good honey finish as well. Good stuff.
Bottle.  Pours an orange amber with nice off-white head.  Fruit, bready wheat, pepper, banana, bubblegum sweetness, and citrusy hops.  Interesting beer that works quite well, enjoyable.

Draught, Pivni, York. UK. Almost overlooked this on the bar! The perfect combination of US and German ¬ícraft¬í brewing. Deeply cloudy yellow/orange appearance. Tangy sweetness and spiciness is backed by cloves, banana and mango and the gorgeous wheat beer taste. Massive flavour, beautiful beer, one of my favourites of this year so far. Not one that I could take a lot of in one sitting, but one I would love to come back to again.

bottle - Pours hazy amber with an off-white frothy head. The aroma is very spicy and hoppy with hints of citrus and apricot. The flavor is quite peppery and hoppy, with hints of citrus, it has a somewhat "belgian" quality about it as well. An interesting brew, perhaps a little too hoppy for me.
Hazy orange with a huge head. Strong citric aroma with further notes of wheat, perfume and bubblegum. The flavour is fresh, sweet, salty, citric and highly enjoyable. A grand Weizen bock!

Pours hazy amber with a small head.
Aroma includes doughy wheat, with spicy, earthy hops and coriander. Quite herbal, somewhat peppery.
Flavours show a fair bit of malt, lots of bready wheat, huge amounts of the above hops along with hop resin. Somewhat harsh, both in solventy alcohol and hops.
Carbonation is too high.

Pours a hazy orange with a small lingering head.  The citrus and orange aroma hits immediately after the beer has been poured.  Some fruitiness, too.  Faint cloves also present in the aroma.  Flavor is orange, citrus, cloves, bubblegum, and finishes somewhat pepper-like.  Orange flavor lingers throughout this beer.  This is a very distinct weizen bock, and very enjoyable.
One of the dirtiest wheats I¬íve seen. Obviously, Brooklyn didn¬ít have to abide by any purity laws. Candy flavor is followed by soft wheats and barley. It¬ís okay. Rated 4/10/10

Schneider weisse tap 5 meine hopfenweisse. Bottle. Hazy Dark orange body with a medium  long lasting white head. Aroma is hops, lemon, fruit and wheat. Flavor is hops, oranges, cloves, wheat and spices. Great and cheap beer.

500mL Bottle purchased at Beers of the World for 3 dollars. Pours a super cloudy orange body with lots of yeast sediment particles. Huge fluffy bone white head. Aroma is clove, spices, yeast, booze, fruits and caramel. Flavor is very good banana, spices, hops, sweet, fruits and yeast. Great balance throughout. Alcohol is hidden well. Very good beer, I wish I had picked up a bunch of these for the price.

A- Body is a very hazy translucent golden hue. Pours with a 2-3 finger soapy white head that immediately fades to a thin collar and has good retention from there. Traces of lacing left all the way down the glass. The cloudiness is thick and dynamic.

S- A floral/ noble hop profile is soft yet the most dominant part of the nose. Behind this is a mild citrus fruit tone.

T- Soft flavor upfront of oranges with a hint of floral hop overtones. A a big dose of sweet, bready yeast comes through for the finish as well as the floral hops kick in more for the finish also and leave a very mild bite to them as a hint of citrus juice sticks around.

P- heavenly. A medium amount of soft bubbly carbonation compliments a silky smooth light to medium weight yeasty body with just a touch of juicy hop oils.

O- This is a great brew. The European version of this collaboration has a much softer, less aggressive, more noble character- though I do enjoy the boldness of the American version as well. The 8.2% is undetectable and this is a very drinkable, good brew.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-08-2010 00:53:34

Bottle under the name Schneider Weisse Tap 5 Meine Hopfenweisse. Pours a nice cloudy golden orange color, with a ton of yeast floaties and a nice frothy white head. Aroma is very summery with citric hops, wheat, typical spicy weissbier yeast, bubblegum and some clove. Flavor is of nice citric hops, some orange peel, bubblegum, banana, clove, wheat, spicy yeast and some tropical fruit. The body is medium with a fairly lively carbonation and quite a dry mouthfeel. Overall a really good Hefe Weizen, that blends style with the American IPA, quite succesfully!

As a comic book geek I¬ím a big fan of inter-company crossovers, and I¬íve always longed to see the beer equivalent of this. Well, it¬ís finally happened thanks to the German brewery G. Schneider & Sohn teaming up with New York¬ís own Brooklyn Brewery to create the ¬ìSchneider-Brooklyner Hopfen Weisse.¬î There¬ís a long story behind this team up, but basically the brewmasters of each brewery were fans of each other and decided to swap jobs to create two takes on the same beer. This particular beer is brewed in Germany using local hops as overseen by Garret Oliver of Brooklyn. The result is a very tasty, easy-to-drink beer that anyone would likely enjoy.POUR, COLOR AND AROMAIf I didn¬ít know better, I¬íd think this was an India Pale Ale from the complexion alone. It¬ís a shade of bright orange which is darker at the top than it is at the bottom. I swirled up the 500ml bottle to homogenize any sediment at the bottom, but I didn¬ít notice any in my glass. Not that the liquid is clear by any means, since it¬ís extremely murky.The head was a bit smaller than I anticipated, resembling something closer to a barley-based beer which was white, foamy, and creamy. It dissolved rather quickly and left almost no lacing on the glass, surprisingly.The aroma was very citrusy with lemon being the predominant ingredient. I did detect some spicy components [i.e. clove, nutmeg], but they were rather mild. Regardless, the smell was very inviting like a glass of freshly-squeezed juice.TASTEJust to set the record straight, Hopfen Weisse is actually a weizenbock, which is a form of a hefeweizen. It¬ís a wheat beer to be sure, but quite different due to its potency as well as its spicy kick. Upon my first swig of this beer I detected a very crisp, citrusy palate followed by a slightly dry, spicy backend. Lemon was very prominent, but it didn¬ít overwhelm the rest of the palate. In fact, it¬ís difficult to describe the taste here since it¬ís quite different from most beers I¬íve drank. I would describe the initial mouthfeel as juicy, sweet, and overall delectable, followed by a distinct different finish which is spicy, slightly dry, but rather clean as there is next to not aftertaste at all. Overall, it adds up to a very original and appealing flavor. Its uniqueness is tasty enough to satisfy but without the intensity of an overwhelming beer.FINISHWhether you¬íre a wheat beer fan or not, we can all agree that beers of this type are traditionally easier on the palate than most ales and lagers. Hopfen Weisse has a thick, soft, almost chewy mouthfeel. The flavor is indeed potent with spices, but they do not scare away the drinker. The end result is a very drinker-friendly, smooth beer that¬ís so tasty and so easy to drink it¬ís difficult to savor it in sips rather than gulps.BODYIf you¬íve been following my beer reviews with any consistency you know I¬ím not a big fan of imperial or potent beers mostly due to the fact the alcohol tends to upstage the flavor. However, in the case of Hopfen Weisse, this is a beer so tasty and light in the mouth that the alcohol content seems virtually non-existent. For a beer with an 8.2% ABV, I did not taste or notice the potency until long after I had finished an entire 500ml liter bottle. This is certainly forgivable considering that this is a weizenbock after all, and this beer deserves accolades for masking its potency so well.FINAL THOUGHTSWhile I might not consider Schneider-Brooklyner Hopfen Weisse one of my personal favorite beers of all time, I still have to admit it one of the most novel brews I¬íve even encountered. The price is a bit steep at $5 per bottle (a penny per milliliter), but in the end it¬ís definitely worth it. One of the few beers I would consider a ¬ìMust-drink!¬îNOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ouN3SQCDDgw

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2015 [4/10] Pours dirty orange with an inch of off-white head. Bubbles and gunge rage below. Aroma of orange, lemon, lime, kumquat, yeasty wheat, cloves,  kaffir lime leaves, cardamon pods, coriander seeds - wild stuff. Thick bready mouthfeel. Sweet fruit smoothy taste with big sour/ funky citric balance. Finish is cleansingly tart. Alcohol is dangerously well-integrated. Exciting and original but still has that German balance. Great beer. [ 4.4][7/15] The shock of the new, eh? I still like this a lot and the beer is quite recognizable from the description but the score isn¬ít.  [3.8]
Sneaky, innocent looking beer... not innocent at all. WOW - Dry hop + alcohol + wild spice and fruit. I bow down... Totally original? I think maybe so.

500 ml bottle. This one pours with a cloudy orange-peach body and a creamy white head. The aroma is nicely fruity and hoppy. A good variety of zesty orange, mango and other mixed citrus fruits combine with a loaf banana wheat bread. This combo works very well and makes for a pleasant scent. The body of the beer is fairly full and bready. Notes on the taste are also fairly straightforward like the aroma, but tasty and distinct nevertheless. Mixed citrus, apricot, light herb, and banana bread, with a dry, estery hop finish that lingers for a short while. Overall, this was nice wheat ale. Simple, yet unique in its own right.

From a 500ml bottle into a water glass.   Pours a hazy yellow with thick head.  Head dissipates quickly (almost) with a tiny bit of lacing.  Aroma of alcohol and banana with lots of yeast.  Mouthfeel is very good;  thick and tingly and creamy.  Taste is of alcohol and yeast.  Plenty of banana, cloves, grass and funk.  A good beer.  Higher abv than most weisses but pretty good stuff.

Bottle at a tasting: wheat, banana, clove, cardboard, sweetish malt, light bitterness, some fruity marmalade. weak acidity, dry finish, very good, i¬ím not a fan of wheat beers but this gets an almost barley wine character without losing the wheat beer profile.

Sampled in a 16.9oz. A really hoppy full bodied Hefe. Is not too dark like a bock but really a quality brew. Pours golden brown with a big frothy head. The malts are really quality in all sense of the word!

Sampled from a 16 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very murky orange-ochre color with a huge soapy yellow-white head that lingered and produced good lacing. The aroma was strong fruity hops with notes of orange, grapefruit and pineapple. The flavor was very sweet, tangy and tart with a delightful mix of grapefruit, pine and pineapple and undertones of wheat, yeast and pepper. The finish was long with notes of pineapple and wheat. Fairly full bodied. The alcohol was very well hidden. Incredible.

bottle 500 ml shared with JanneK EXP 16.01.10 hazy golden yellow white head lacing. Taste perfumed like fruity clove dash of banana,citrus. Balanced bitters and fruityness. Better now than the fresh one. Good aftertaste.

Interesting beer.  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a fair white head.  Scent  of citrusy hops and banana.  Flavor reflects both of those.  Great mouth feel.  the best way I can describe this is, quite obviously, as a cross between a classic German Heffe and an American IPA.  I enjoyed it.
500 ml bottle. Hazy golden body, white head. Nice combination of banana, wheat, refreshing hoppiness and some peppery phenols. Little alcohol present when warms. Not necessarily in a good way.
Unclear golden ale. Off white, short  head. Aroma is wheaty with herbal notes. Malty sweet. Bananas? Malty sweet flavour. Wheat. Tropical fruits? Dry finish.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2010 Bottle.  Aroma banana, wheat, sweet malts, and subtle hops.  Notes of honey and yeast.  Palate is lighter and refreshing.  Flavor brings out some noble hops.  Pretty damn good, but different take on a wheat beer.

Bottle, 50 cl - Hazy golden orange beer with a large disappearing head. Aroma is fruity with notes of oranges, white pepper and yeast. Flavor is fruity with spicy notes of oranges, coriander, mandarins, dried fruits and some hops. Very enjoyable and drinkable.

di colore giallo con la testa di notevoli dimensioni. Odore √® come ci si aspetta di malto, frumento e  luppolo. Il sapore √® molto dolce all¬íinizio con malto, frumento, chiodi di garofano, e anche un po ¬ídi miele.alla fine per√≤ risulta abbastanza luppolata....
Aroma-honey, herbal hops, wheat. Taste-sweet, wheat, oregano, with a strange minty hoppiness. Different.
Schneider weisse tap 5 meine hopfenweisse. Powerful Weiss beer. Get all the refreshment of wheat and grass in taste and smell, plus fruit to finish it off.

(bottle - 500 ml) Cloudy golden pour with a fizzy and thick white head. Wheat and a lot of sweet banana notes in the aroma. Some mild clove and other spices with a very light hop hint. Yeast and sweet malts at the start of the flavor with an underlying clove and banana taste. A dry and grainy finish comes in mixing with a mild hop bitterness. Alcohol is well hidden.

I tried a 500 ml bottle with the Schneider & Sohn markings.  This beer has a unique and inviting aroma of pineapple, lemon and orange citrus, and very generous Noble hop backbone.  It pours golden straw in color, cloudy, and replete with a large white head.  Palate entry is refreshingly light to medium-bodied, with lively carbonation and a pleasing citrus flavor with hints of the noted pineapple, but also banana and clove.  The finish is fairly long and dry.  ABV is high.  A very enjoyable Weizen.

500 ml bottle.  Pours an cloudy gold/yellow color with a sizeable head.   Smell is as expected malt, wheat, and nople hops.   The taste is very sweet at the start with malt, wheat, cloves, and even a bit of honey.  It ends with a little bitterness and makes for a very agreeable to drink beer.

Pours a hazy orange with thick white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of citrus hops, wheat, clove, slight banana, yeast, and grass.  Flavor was a little bit of a shock at first, but ended up very well.  Quite a nice brew, but a little overpriced and difficult to go back to very often.
50 cl bottle. Hazy orange body with big white head. Flavour is wheat, yeast, banana and hops.

Interesting beer here.  It¬ís one of those where the aroma seems out of place with the beer, yet the flavor is quite good.  The beer pours out a crystal clear golden yellow body with a tight white 1/2" head with quick dissipation.  Champagne like bubbles floating up from the bottom.  Aroma is burnt rubber, glue and noble hops with a soft fruit angle.  Flavor has lots of sweetness to it, almost apple-juice/honey like.  Floral bitterness also pops up in the flavor and it reminded me of what chewing on rose petals might be like.  Solid clove notes are also picked up in the flavor.  Not bad.
bottle - (asheft) hazy orange beer with a sticky white head. A lot of american hops aroma, citrus. Flavour is very bitter for a Weissbier. A Weissbier I like, nice mixture!

At Kleine Bierstube, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 060210.
Amber with white head. Aroma of hop spices. Flavor is wheat with bitter hops

A nice mashed bananas-and-allspice aroma.  Big oatmeal head, heavy sediment, medium-dark gold, bright blue and gold label.  Intake is a little chemical at first.  Tangy, moderate bitterness, a little phenolic, medium-light sweetness, tart citrus flavors.  Medium, silky mouthfeel with a nice little alcohol burn at the end.  Warms the esophagus.  Not bad, a little overpriced.
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2016 gold blond coloured body with a white head a yeasty spicy sweet hoppy aroma a spicy yeasty hoppy sweet fruity taste with a spicy bitter finish

Pours an orange-yellow haze with a thin head.  Smells of yeasty, wheat, and orange.  Tastes of wheat, banana, and citrus, with some bitterness at the end.  Nice body, some lacing.  The banana flavor is not doing it for me.  Otherwise has some good qualities.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Shared with wim at my home. A clear goldblond coloured beer with small white head. A yeasty hoppy aroma. Full palate bit sparkling. Finish is hoppy bitter, with a slight fruity hint.
Bottle. Dark golden colour with a white head. Aroma is hop, wheat, citrus. Flavour is sweet, hop, wheat, citrus, fruit. Full bodied nice beer.

Pours hazy yellow with a big white head.  Aroma is a blend of spicy yeasty aromas and citrusy hop, with some clove and banana coming through.  Flavor is a blend of malted wheat, light fruits, banana, clove, and a nice citrusy hop presence.  Good stuff.

Aroma is amazing, just tropical fruits assaulting the olfactory. A wee bit of soapiness, but acceptable. 
The flavours are remarkably sweet. A bit too much like a soapy, fruity bodywash or something. Kind of disappointing :(

500 ml bottle.  Pours a wonderfully cloudy orangish body with a one finger foamy white head that left some nice lacing.  Big yeasty nose with lots of banana, some light clove, and some breadiness.  The flavor is not quite as smooth as I was hoping for.  The banana softness that I like isn¬ít there, it¬ís more tilted toward the malt than the yeast I think.  It¬ís more sweet and has more caramel flavor than I prefer.  Finishes with a bit of spicy clove and a little too much alcohol heat.  Full bodied and thick with a heavy yeast slurry texture.  I remember liking the Brooklyn version quite a lot, not sure why this isn¬ít doing it for me.

It is unclear, warm golden with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of hops, citrus, oranges and yeast. The flavour has sweetness and notes of aromatic hops, oranges, yeast, light banana and clove and in the finish I find notes of grapefruit peel. Very different, well made, but very far from German.

Pours a dirty yellow straw color with a small white head. Lots of suspended yeast throughout the beer. The aroma is citrus with bready malt and a slight hop character. The flavor is yeast, lemon, bready malts and hops. I didn¬ít think this one was as complex as the Brooklyn version. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. Good drinkability.

Golden yellow color with large head, yeast is flying as a big bug-like bits in a glass, which hurts appearance a little; aroma of floral hops, fruitness more citrus than banana; mouthfeel is quite carbonated, but still pleasant and refreshing; flavor of banana and citrus and some hops giving an interesting twist to the taste. Great wheat; refreshing and not overly dominated by banana.

Bottle from the Lamar Whole Foods.  500 has a Schneider label and no Brooklyn markings other than listing Garrett Oliver as a brewer.  Pours a murky, dark yellow.  Very spicy aroma of yeast, oregano (Cavie ran to my spice rack to make sure!), pepper, banana, and orange.  Flavor is yeast, coriander, banana, citrus, hops, and a tinge of alcohol.

Bottle courtesy of Fratto. Cloudy orange pour with floaties galore. Aroma is harsh spice, such as oregano. Also lighter elements of banana and bubble gum. Taste has cheek tucking spice that holds through the finish. Dry spicy finish. This is oregano right? Cause it is almost overbearing in it¬ís intensity. Not well balanced in my opinion.

This one poured a murky straw yellow color with a pretty large white head. Aroma was very sweet candies, peaches, and some yeast. Flavor was sticky sweet, a little alcohol, some unrippened citrus fruits, and yeasty abana clove finish. A very interesting beer.

A: Pours a very cloudy muddy yellow brown color. You could pass it off as apple cider with a huge head. As I mentioned the head is thunderous. You can¬ít even come close to pouring the entire bottle into a hefe glass. The head is made of millions of tiny bubbles, that turns to an almost sea foam like character on top. The reason it got the 4 here is because of the lacing because lets be honest its kind of an ugly beer. Very few Hefe¬ís sport lacing and this baby has it from the top to the bottom of the glass. Sheets of lacing baby.

S: Bold smell. Tons of clove right up front and center. Buttered yeast rolls and mashed overripe banana round out the aroma of this bad boy.

T: Big tasting brew as well. The marriage is not quite there, but it is a nice tasting brew. If it could have somehow been pulled together a little better it would probably be a favorite of mine. As it stands it¬ís a beer with a lot of promise. As for the taste. Tons of cloves, and a hint of hops. There is a hop bite somewhere in the middle that takes you by surprise. Banana stands out as well. It¬ís a more complex version of your typical Hefe.

M: Light and bubbly, but the ABV lets you know its there.

Bottled. Cloudy amber, yeast is stable and settles in the bottom, lively carbonation, off-white lacing head. Wonderfull fresh Saphir aroma. Chewy and fullbodied, but  still dancing lightly on the palate despite its strength.
A new classic.
A vertical tasting against a 2 year old proves interresting. Citric hop notes decrease, ligt oxidized notes appear, but it gains a fascinating dryness which I usually ascociate with Orval. Alcohol is more evident but blends well with the flowery perfumed notes. I am looking forward to see how it develops further.

An unclear golden beer with no head. The aroma is floral hops & banana. The taste does some weird things to your mouth as the floral hops & banana taste collide to create one serious floral taste. It taste like medicine & sweet like something artificial was added. I like both these breweries but this did not work for me.

Bottle: &nbsp Dirty straw, cloudy, lively carbonation, large rocky white head, light lacing. &nbsp Wheaty nose, seems sweet, rather musty too. &nbsp Hints of alcohol and citrus rind. &nbsp Interesting combo on the tongue, initially wheaty but quickly turning into an earthy citrus rind like background. &nbsp Full bodied, bubbley mouthfeel. &nbsp Wheatiness appears again after the finish. &nbsp Better combo than I expected.

Bottle thanks to thirdeye11 from Lone Star Beverages in Carrollton, TX .  Nose is wheat, alcohol, fruits, clove and banana.  nice on the palate heavy flavor of banana and wheat.  Nice on the palate with a wheaty, clove flavor and a banana finish.
( 500ml bottle) pours clearish yellow with spare head. Nose of floral hops, honey, and chlorine? This is a very odd nose. Taste of sweet malt, apple, light bitter hops, perfume and florals.

This one is tasty...hoppy aroma with notes of banana, yeast and wheat. Flavor is light and refreshing, with citrus hops and fruity notes. Alcohol is well-hidden and the mouthfeel is quite carbonated. Delicious!

Light orange beer with big and blond head. Aroma is interesting, fruits, lemon, hops, yeast and some spices. In the flavour there are wheat, some pine needles, fruitfull hoppy bitterness, sometimes there are found sweet tropical fruits and in the end flavour is surprisingly dry and spicy. With yeast flavour is more balanced and spicy bitterness that was found without yeast is gone. Very nice and slippery to drink with nice carbonation. Weird but succesfull "fruith-hop-hefe" beer where my favourites beer styles combined greatly and outcome is succesfull.
Orange with big thick white head. Lots of lacing. Caramel, yeast, hops, wheat, and alcohol in the flavor. Really amazing beer.

Had this beer at Kafe Belgie as Schneider Hopfenweisse Tap 5. Hazy orange colored brew. Yeasty with some hops in the aroma. Flavor about the same. Enjoyable, but not outstanding. Could use some more distinctive hops.

Bought it in Venice as Schneider Hopfen-Weisse Tap 5; one of the best beers I¬íve tried recently.
A full-bodied weizen with the wonderful floral hints of the Brooklyn hops.
Aroma is citrus and vegetal notes, very fresh and inviting.
Taste is perfectly balance between the bitternes of the hops and the sweetness of the weizen malts; light carbonation that gives a very smooth sensation on the tongue; long lasting hoppy finish.
Give it a try!

Expressive nose of orange, coriander, green coconut milk curry, kaffir lime...a veritable potpourri of fruity and perfumy aromatics. Deep orange hue, cloudy, with a generous creamy beige head. Off-dry --though sweetish by impression; moderate acidity and slightly elevated bitterness. Very creamy, busy carbonation, medium bodied. A delight to savor -- would have been incredible with spicy food. 50 cl bottle, best before 16.01.10.
500 ml bottle.  Pours amber in colour with a decent head, lots of suspended yeast, cloudy.  Big aroma, super sweet, and lots of floral and citrus hop.  Same for flavour.  Really enjoyed this one.

50cl bottle from Alko. Pours cloudy yellow with a nice fluffy head. 
Aroma is wheat, some alcohol and some yeast. Quite sweet flavor of citrus, again slightly taste of alcohol in the finish. Oily feel, still very enjoyable.

Poured into a stein.  Golden with slight orange/brown tints with significant yeast haziness and a fairly thick 2 finger head.  Aromas of citrus and a little malt.  Taste is awesome.  More hoppy than i was expecting and the citrus tones were delicious.  Great blend of styles here with the increased hop taste.  Loved it.  Would definitely buy again

Yellow with brown hues, plenty of yeast haze. 4 cm white airy head that dissipates after a while, while leaving nice lacings on the glass.

Nice hop character in the nose - grapefruit, grass an resins, some pine-needles. Banana. Some yeast. Quite a lot of white pepper. Decent malt character beneath - white bread, wheat. Quite nice overall, but there are some notes that are slightly too assertive, not really harmonious.

The taste is not as impressive as the smell. Again, there are plenty of hops, but they are not as well defined as in the smell (grape, grass, floral notes). A rather sweet and juicy malty backbone mixes with a prominent spicy character (mostly white pepper). Some flavors of bubblegum, and of course banana. The finish is mildly bitter and dominated by a very sweet and sticky taste of alcohol, making the beer slightly perfumy. Faint mineral-notes, bread and hints of lemon lingers in the mouth.

Moderate body, plenty of carbonation but the bubbles are rather calm. Slightly chewy due to the alcohol.

This is a rather good beer, but for some reason it didn¬ít really do it for me. This one proves that more hops is not always better. It lacks balance, the flavors are not integrated with each other and the alcohol is too prominent.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

Poured from a larger bottle into a tulip pint glass to drink.  The beer had a cloudy, light sediment straw-gold color with a good-sized foamy and creamy white had that had good retention  and decent cling.  It had a sweet fruity, floral and citrus hops aroma with some banana components, a bit of yeast and orange, with some malt too.  It was a sweet, fruity beer with some banana and orange flavors, and a bit of underlying bitterness too.  A wet, slightly watery beer with good carbonation, and a lively mouthfeel.  One of, if not, the best I have had in this style.

Aroma of citrus, apples and yeast. Appearance is cloudy amber with medium white head. Flavor is surprisingly hopy and dry with hints of citrus and yeast. Weiz-beers are usually not my style but this beer is actually really good and has a similarity to an IPA.
Bottle. Clear gold pour with foamy white head. Delicious aroma of pine and floral hops, citrus, esters. Flavor is nice astringency up front, orange peel, esters, coriander. Nice lively mouthfeel.

0.5 l bottle, thanks Ismo E! Murky yellow brown color. The aromas of grapefruity-pineappley hops, clove, pepper and fruity tartness. Sweet, hoppy and phenolic flavor with complex hop flavor featuring lemon, grapefruit, pineapple and some herbal notes as well. Clove is very apparent in finish.Full bodied oily palate.  Weird medicinal (aspirin) and soapy note in the aroma and flavor. Very complex and original but not completely in balance, there are some very odd notes.

Large frothy head on top a slightly misty gold pour,hint of straw colour,aroma floral perfume like spice,wheat fruity,malt and green banana,flavour smooth banana yeast mourishing,spicyness lemon orange clove hint of grapefruit,finish smooth alround easy to drink very tasty.

Reviewed 8/22/2009 (Bottle):

Pours an opaque orange colored body with a small foamy white head, diminishing. Strong spicy and banana aroma. Alcoholy. Lemony aroma. Spicy taste, very strong. Creamy mouthfeel. Lemony, citrus taste. Some banana but not too strong.Not too shabby.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy what malty hoppy aroma. Fruity wheat malty hoppy flavor with some alcoholic hints. Has a warming wheaty hoppy bitter finish.

I always like the Schneider beers, but this is something different all together. 
Pours withe a nice rocky, slightly persistent and snow white head. Aromas of zest, grains and pretty hop notes. 
the palate has great intensity and a lingering sweet ginger bread character that is utterly appealing.
Too unbalanced and overly alcoholic for me.  Nice to look at but abit on the jarring side.  Would be better with less alcohol.

Dark yellow colored with medium sized white head, cloudy appearance. Rich hopped aroma with exotic fruits and rich spices, yeast and mild alcohol also come up. Medium bodied. Flavor is also richly hopped with grassy and fruity aroma with same exotic notes, alcohol comes up stronger here. Aftertaste dries strongly with mild alcohol and lemon. Nice and surprisingly easy to drink weizen bock, hops come up more nicely in aroma.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy dark yellow colour, creamy white head. Very pleasant fruity aroma (grapefruit, banana, pineapple?) with a whiff of floral hops and spices. The flavour is sweetish at first, with banana, yeast  and citrus fruits, and has a nicely warm and bitter hoppy finish. Very interesting.
Alcohol bite to it.  Hops are muted and at war with a weird Belgian-y yeast thing.  Just does not work for me.

Well, well, well... what on earth do we have here? I don¬ít know if the rumours are true in terms of this beer having U.S. hops provided by Brooklyn, but it does certainly have a slightly U.S. hop conc. Instantly on opening the bottle I¬ím greeted with big floral aromatics reminiscent of Simcoe, or Warrior type hops, big perfumed aroma, then behind it lie pineapple, loads of tropical fruit everywhere from classic citrus and quite sharp notes right down to mellow banana, melon, passion fruit... It actually looks the business - which is a big surprise to this less than enthusiastic Weiss beer drinker. Pours orange/blonde with a pinkish hue, nice creamy looking head, doesn¬ít sit massively high, but it does sustain itself and keeps a creamy inviting look to it. Flavour is surprisingly big and rich with more than a fare-share of complexity. Straight up I¬ím hit with a good hop smack, followed by soft and quite lush undertones of more tropical fruit, lemon, banana and melon make a reappearance then into some really quite obscure flavours from the hops consisting of what tastes like dental mouth wash, floral hops, some serious perfume, soap and then some more familiar flavours of grapefruit, orange peel and so on. Finish is commendably bitter for the style. My only true criticisms concern mouth feel, which could be a little bit more lush and less sharply carbonated, but all in all I¬ím not even that bothered by the average palate feel, however, I do feel that the weird free form breakdown in the middle of quite strange - verging on clinical - flavours threaten to swamp the positive points, the balance needs some serious attention and tweeking to score higher in my opinion, but at the end of the day all I can say is: I tried this beer at a total whim not expecting  much considering I¬ím not the biggest Weiss beer fan in the world (by a long shot!) but here I am actually whole heartedly enjoying this peculiar brew. Seems the answer to getting me into Weiss beer is pack the bugger full of hops. I may actually by a few more of these... As a last note, this beer reminds me of free form Jazz - an aquired taste and at times can sound like a racket, but there something most definitely accomplished in the playing that makes it something definitely worth paying attention to, and not ignoring. P.S. even the alcohol is relatively well hidden, what the f***k is going on here?!

Bottle. The aroma is very fruity (grapefruit), later on some sour smell appears, overall very refreshing. The white fizzy head stays not very long, the body is clear and orange. The taste is rather sour and medium fruity. The finish is light bitter. The body is dry and fizzy, the finish is more creamy. Carbonation is normal, the body is medium strong. A nice unusual beer.

0,5l bottle. Murky orange color with medium head. Hoppy and citric nose, a slight touch of sour milk, perhaps? Flavor is tremendous; weizen combined with brave usage of tasty hops makes a splendid and exciting new kind of brew. First time I had it was at Schneiders own pub i Munich, and it was (and still is) a great beer experience.

Bottle. Cloudy, orange color. Large white head. The aroma is pretty exciting, it smells fruits especially apricot, spices and yeast also some fragrance of soap.

The flavor offers citrus, hops, yeast, dough and also some banana. Bitterness is significantly higher compared to "normal" wheat beer. Clearly an interesting beer.

Pours a deep murky orange/brown, with a nose to die for.  Wafts of perfume, spice, banana, mango, toffee, just brilliant.  I could sit & sniff this all night like a sad twat.  The drinking though is slightly dissapointing for me, the palate is nice  full, there is some nice fruit & lots of perfume, but the alcohol keeps poking its nose in.  You think its going to develop into a full lush beer, but this slight dry acrid character keeps overpowering.  A shame, but my nose is in heaven.

courtesy of Laurent Mousson - fully cloudy dark orange colour with some chaotic head retention; aroma of glue, litchies and melon; solidly hoppy; solid but subtle carbonation; quite sticky, sweet with a decent bitterness, good malt body; long aromatic hoppy finish with more fruity notes and some warming alcohol touch - very good!

500ml: tulip: enjoyed with my bro... great beer.  Very light, bright and crisp.... loads of citrus and cloves, nice spice and sweet balance.  The carbonation was medium to high and helped carry this beer along.  Great warming esters on the finish... great reference to BK on this one...

Bottle. Poured a cloudy orange with a creamy white head. Floral aroma with a wheat and light malt background. The flavor found floral, citrus, wheat, and clove. Light to medium body, tingly carbonation, and a citrus and heat aftertaste.

Bottle. Hazy deep orange colour with a medium-sized off-white head. Hoppy aroma with notes of wheat, citrus and some other fruits. The flavour is wheat and fruity hops, with some citrus, spices and malt. Medium-bodied and high carbonation. Very interesting brew, but maybe not my favourite weizen.
Big full bodied beer. A treat to look with it¬ís yellow orange glow. Well carbonated with a heavy body. Very moreish with it¬ís medium bitter finish. Nicely done.

I like the look of this beer....a cloudy, hazy, funky looking beer.  Large white pillow top head and gritty lacing.  Hop, clove, banana, funk nose.  Chewy in the mouth and flavors that start sweet and floral and go sour and hoppy.  It has an edge.  Pretty good beer.

Poured clear at first, golden in colour, with a reasonable white head. Very interesting aroma. Hopped to a very American level of intensity, but with a more herbal German Hallertau edge. Lots of fruit: rich melon, mango, bubblegum, and spice. Flavour is fresh, hoppy, but not all that bitter, the banana wheat flavour helps to mellow it out. The alcohol is a bit much at first, but then recedes and you forget how strong this beer is. Finishes quite sweet. This is a very nice, super fruity wheat beer, almost Belgian in it¬ís unashamed strength and fruitiness. A bit unusual and not the kind of thing I¬íd drink every day, but great to try.

Draft and bottled.  Pours a copper white body with a white head.  Tropical fruit punch.  Lemon and coriander like esters.  Chewy gummy and a light bubble gum note.  Some lighter spices to boot.  Great beer!

Smells like banana, coriander, and cloves. Appearance of cloudy, unfiltered wheat that has a golden-orange color. Delightful flavors of alcohol, orange peel, and zesty but yet subtle hops; very tasty. This is an amazing weizen bock that shouldn¬ít be missed!

poured out gold with a bubbly head that fell rather quick. smell of citrus and pine.  oarnge is present in the aroma, but i didnt add anything to the beer.  the taste is sweet with a little hop flavor present with the forground and at the end of my palate.  not much aftertaste and there is lacing around the glass.  drinkabiltity is fair but i wouldnt want to drink this all night long.

0.5l bottle into weizen glass. Pours cloudy orange with a smaller (off white) head than most wheat beers. The prominent aroma is tangerines with caramel wheat malts and alcohol in the background. Sweet tangerines are again dominant on the tongue with touches of lemon citrus and spicy hops. The alcoholic presence comes through at the end. It is medium to full bodied with a rather sticky texture. Certainly an unusual take on the style (shouldn¬ít a weizen bock be dark?) but it is still largely successful in my opinion.

Bottle. Poured a murky orange with a small white head. First impressions are very good, very refreshing.  Nice amount of citrus, watermelon, grapefruit, coriander, vanilla, some hops(but not too many). Aroma is decent, finish is a little dry but good.  Carbonation is spot on too. Complex, refreshing and tasty.

Wonderful fresh aroma of pale malts followed quickly by pineapple peach and a zesty grassiness.  Dark orange-yellow color, big lasting head and splotchy lacing.  Quenching and lighter to medium bodied with a noticeable high alcohol finish and a subtle bitterness.  Crisp hop flavors, spicy and green.  The hops lead to a plush fruitiness that¬ís not quite all citrus.  Sweet doughy malt with some grainy grass and a faint alcohol push.

Cloudy Gold. Long, small head. Aroma: Wheat, herbs, grass. Flavor: Banana, caramel, spice. Sweet finish. 


 Hoppy for its style With complex flavors and aromas.  This is a very good and complex beer.

Pours a murky. Golden orange tinted color. Medium sized off white creamy head. Nose is banana apple pineapple, coriander, clove, clean linen. Taste is citrus hops, laundry detergent, banana creme and pine. Mouthfeel is lively smooth and medium weight. This is a damn good underrated beer.

Beer pours dark golden color with a totally retained off white colored head.  Aroma is compelling with notes of clove, orange peel, and sweet bread.  Flavor is intially sweet with some enjoyable spiciness in the finish.  If weizen bocks are supposed to be strong and dark, I am not sure this fits the style descpription.  It is an enjoyable beer in its own right, and I agree with KAaggie might more resemble a saison than anything else.
bottle.  orangish pour.  mostly white head.  aroma is well balanced between malt and hops.  Some nice fruit and spices.  Flavor is hoppy, yeast and some malty sweetness.  Enjoyable.

Bottle.Pours a rich, deep light cheddar orange with a springy aroma of cedar, orange peel, lemon zest, and light banana.  Flavor is buttery cedar with sour fruit peels in the finish.  Touches of old wood and clove round out each sip.  Thick, coating mouthfeel.  Fantastic beer; closer to a saison in taste and smell, in my opinion.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottle was poured at Saraveza...  Came out a cloudy, vibrant golden/yellow with a thick white head, greet retention.  Hoppy nose and a tart yeast quality to it.  The initial flavors of the brew were very hoppy and acidic with warming alcohol and sweet, citrusy esters to balance.

500 ml bottle. Pours bright gold and very hazy and yeasty with a nice foamy white head. Interesting nose-a bit hoppy, yeasty, some unknown spiciness. Taste is a bit hoppy, yeasty, and sweet, with the German bock yeast and alcohol coming through at the end. Nice full rich body.  I really like this beer-I¬íll go pick up more of these.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
sloghtly cloudy orange, smooth offwhite head.
very flowery, almost sour very strong hoppy aroma, also strong alc. in the aroma, some sourness.
sweet malty, slightly fruity, faint bitter from alc. very flavorfull stuff. a bit spicy too. fidelis83 described lots of flavors below, and i agree with almost all of them. i ddin¬ít really like this beer very much. too high ABV and too much strange flavors going on. like a strong belgian blonde.

Brooklyn collides with Germany and a cloudy golden plum results in a watery form filling a pint glass.  Well balance hopfenweisse is not to sweet balance with lemon and malt.  Finishes with a little chalky and a hint of alcohol.

Cloudy yellow colour, small white head, lots of lacing. Aroma is sweet and very hoppy with distinct notes of lemon, wheat and bananas. Flavour is also that full of lemon and hops, refreshing but with a bite, very enjoyable. The mouthfeel is crisp with small lively bubbles. This is like no other weissbier I¬íve tried and i like it!

Pours milky honey gold with a 3 finger pillowy white head that has decent retention. Aroma is citrus hops, floral hops, lemon oil, wheat, a little banana, a little sweet grass, some peppery yeast and sourdough, more citrus and a hoalthy dose of ethanol comes out as it warms. Flavor is sweet wheat, soap, overripe banana, lemongrass, orange and cranberry muffin, white grape juice, some bitterness and sweet floral notes. Finish is more soap, citrus, moderate bitterness, and weak bready notes. Palate is medium body, somewhat chalky, dry and has a slight ethanol burn. Overall it¬ís a good brew, but not what I was hoping for, a little too much soap and ethannol.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX. WOW...this caught me off-guard...Pours a cloudy orange with thick creamy head. Aroma of lots of citrus hops with a malty, fruity back bone. Flavor was a palate shock, take an IPA and pour it into a Hef.  Very light tartness, strong hop flavor with a sharp citrus and noticeable bitter, lots of malt and fruit, alcohol. Mouth feel is very soft but yet heavy, medium carbonation. Overall, really wasn¬ít sure how to rate this, completely different from any other beer I have tried.

Bottle. Pours murky yellow with a medium white head. Banana bread aroma and flavour, spicy yeast and some soapiness as well. The banana wears thin as the beer progresses and results in more citrus flavours than anything else. Slight spicy, hoppy finish. It¬ís OK but unfortunately the bottle has taken on some off flavours and a touch of acidity. Cheers to Stew & Chris for the bottle.
Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with large white head.Aroma of citrus and wheat.Flavor of passionfruits and banana,well balanced and hoppy type of bock beer.

Like a soapy apple-juice, this beer is either oxidized or naturally horrible. It tastes like  a green-apple scented dish washing detergent. At least they won¬ít need to clean the glass afterward. Bottle at Abraxas Lounge, Miami Beach. Kind of like the watered-down apple juice from the dispenser at the Holiday Inn Continental Breakfast. Caca.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours marmalade in colour, with initial frothy head, since dissipating. Extremely fruity on the nose, with citrus and banana predominating. Aromatic on the palate, almost perfumed, with hops and yeast surfacing through the citrus and banana, with hoppiness to an almost IPA degree. A very successful fusion of styles.
Bottle into Weihenstephaner glass. Pours hazy gold with thick white head. Strong hop aroma. Taste is hoppy yeasty wheat.

Bottle. Hazy radiant gold with a medium white head. Aroma is a rich and fruity blend of citrusy hop, banana ester, a little clove, yeast, and a little spice - like a fruit salad beer. Flavor has a lot of banana ester and orange-like hops, leading into a clove and lemon finish. Starts fairly sweet but finishes a bit dry and very clean. Throughout the profile, the hops are very well mated to the malt - Hallertauer is a great hop for this brew. Palate is pleasantly smooth and lively. A very impressive brew, and a style I look forward to exploring more. This one is particularly well balanced and definitely showcases the skill of both breweries.
Cloudy golden orange with a large white head. Aroma is wheat earth, hops, and roots. Taste is hops, yeast, earth and spices.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden brown with a short lived white head. Strong citrus and banana on the nose with a touch of spice. The flavour is quite fruity with orange, banana and passionfruit at the front and hops and mixed spice on the finish. A really interesting, tasty beer that would go down a treat at the end of a hot day sitting on a beach and watching the sun go down.

The aroma is a mixture of the citrus aroma of an IPA and the clover and banana aroma of a German Hefe. Appearance is golden, yet nearly opaque and unfiltered, almost in suspended animation. Flavor is full of banana, clover and some honey with an unexpected hop presence (for the style). The finish was a strange acidic display (lemon?) which was not pleasing for me. Almost cough drop like. Palate is bubbly and lively. Started out well, did not end well.

Courtesy of craftycarl21. Dark hazy peach pour with half finger white head. Aroma is hoppy with some citrusy yeasty wheat malt.I accidentially snorted a bit and got lots of dark fruit, banana esters, and a bit of lemony alcohol. Flavor is largely citrus oriented, with huge sweet citrus and herbal notes in the middle, finishing dry and yeasty. Wheat malt is fully evident. Palate is medium with a super dry, but clean finish. Yummasaurus-rex

Pours an extremely cloudy and muddy peach color with a small white head. Aroma has lots of citrus, apricot, banana, more hop than i was expecting, and some grainy malt. Flavor is quite nice; starts with an orange, grain, and grass combo, then shifts to a pure fruity nectar concept that ends with a massively dry finish. Really nice weizen bock- lighter than I expected, but exceptionally tasty.
Single bottle into a wheat glass.  A high quality strong wheat beer with great typical flavors and a hint of alcohol in the aroma.

Apperance: Golden orange with a small, beige, head.

Aroma: Wheat, Yeast, Grass, Cloves, Spices.

Flavor: Cloves, Banama, Sour wheat, Exotic fruit, White bread.
