Palate: Very smooth and balanced with plenty of carbonation making it a very drinkable beer. Goes down easy.

This is a very original take on a Weizenbock but a damn good one. One of the best beers i¬íve tried this year!
Hazy golden as a weis-beer should appear but with with great hop aroma and taste to counter its sweetness.

Aroma is of slightly hoppy, heavy wheat, lemony and lightly spiced cloves. Cloudy yellow with a quick head that dissipates. Taste is bitter citrus mostly with a touch of some flowery elements as well. Not much wheat or sweetness up front with just a touch at the end.

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Off white head. Aroma of citrus, fruits, spice and some herbs. Quite dense. Flavour of citrus, flowers, spice, sweetness and fruits. Medium to full bodied. Ends on a sweet and light bitter note. Fantastic weisse.

Cloudy yellowy golden body with lasting white head. Citrusy and light spicey hops on the nose then cloves. Taste is very similar, quite nice, the alcohol is only just warming, good carbonation and body. Wasn¬ít really expecting a lot and don¬ít really go for wheat beers but loved this.

If you haven¬ít had a good beer in a while, and this little bottle of joy crosses your path...don¬ít hesitate. A joyous taste explosion of hops, fruity sweetness and full bodied flavor. A great hefewiezen, and a brilliant pairing of america and germany

A Mes rate: bottle from the Bottle Stop, drunk at home.My god this is excellent. Straight from the off it looked the part in my Konig Ludwig glass. An amazing yellow gold colour with a good bright white head, plenty of lace and a plethora of bubbles streaking for the air. The aroma is good but not spectacular. It¬ís quite clearly the Schneiderweisse with a good helping of chewy US hops. The flavour is glorious however. Huge tangeriney hops blend miraculously with the estery weisse. I would have never expected that to work but it¬ís quite simply a thing of joy. My dinner has just been put in front of me by my lovely mrs and I¬ím seriously considering pouring some of this on it, it¬ís that good. It¬ís not complex, it¬ís certainly not anything shocking or outlandish but something just sits soooo bloody right. I¬ím having difficulty getting this rate out it¬ís slipping down so easily. Hang about, where the hell is the alcohol? 8.2 it¬ís drinks like a 4.1. Christ, I could get shouting at strangers drunk on this. The only thing giving it away is the warm belly glow I have going on. This is top draw, don¬ít let anyone tell you otherwise.

...500 ml bottle into Weihenstapan glass. Wow, holy shit, it this real?  I think this is possibly my highest rating.  I never liked hops, ever, in a wheat.  This is not a dunkel, this is not a bock.  This is straight up, wheat ale!  With a kick to your balls from behind.  Explosive flavors of citrus, on the nose and on the tongue. Then the hops come in,  tickle your taste buds, and blend perfectly with the prevalent citrus notes.  Somewhat of a piney tickle in the back of the throat, but not overwhelming.  On the swallow, goes down very fruity, hoppy, with a small alcohol bite at the very end.  I know this was very expensive, but definitely a treat.  A must try for a tastebud, hopped wheat extravangaza!!!!!!  Try it, if yopu can find it.  It was almost impossible here in AUS, thanx Purvis.
Bottle from De Bierkoning. Cloudy golden with a decent head. Strong citrussy hop aroma. The alcohol is noticeable, the banana fruit flavours blends well with the citrussy hops. A nice novelty.

Bottle at Winking Lizard Crosswoods location.  Chunky opaque orange pour with a big white head.  Yeasty aroma with some tart citrus and green olive.  Fruity and citrusy flavor with a bit of hop at the end.  I don¬ít like Weizenbocks, but I can drink this.
Cloudy dark yellow pour with a lacy bright white head. Some citrus notes are aparent on the nose. Great mouthfeel with a citrus flavor mixed in with a balanced wheat flavor.

Bottle. Cloudy golden body with a big white head. Lovely aroma of wheat, banana, citrus and lots of spicy hops. Flavour is sweet malty, banana, hops, citrus and clove. Its very well balanced and the spicy hops really gives an extra dimension to this style of beer. Cramy texture. Awesome beer.

Bottle at PIB. Nice amber pour with a medium sized white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, citrus fruits, clove. Flavor big on clove with some wheat, banana, and some maltiness. Medium bodied, alcohol hidden and very tasty.

500 ml bottle poured a cloudy amber with a small diminishing coarse off white head. Aromas of wheat, citrus, light carmel and a hint of earthiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of wheat, lemon, light carmel and a bit of earthiness with a crisp citrus finish.

Golden Orange colour, lots of banana & hops on the nose. Taste has a lot of alcohol. The palate has tonnes of cloves that also stick to the side of the tongue.
Very tasty little number.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 Pours hazy golden orange with a nice off white head,darker than most here¬ís.nose has masses of citrus with undertones of clove,banana &hop spice.palate translates well,a hint of malt sweetness,not so much in the traditional wit way.citrus notes dominate palate.finishes with medium floral hop bitterness and trademark hefe spicy phenolics.cracking beer,something I¬íd love to see more of!

This beer gets a high enthusiasm rating because it¬ís rare that I buy something on a lark and it turns out wonderfully.  Also I am a sucker for collaboration beers.  Nice thick white head, aroma of bread, banana, yeast, cream; flavors of the same.  A very nice beer that sits right at the convergence of weiss, bock and IPA.

Had to rate this one since it was the exact opposite of a belguim brew...
Hallertau slam of taste,the brew looks like peaking through a wonder concoction...Hops and wheat combined,
a masterpiece....
The Germans have these weissebiers
down to an art,anything else is a total
disapointment:(
The only thing i can say about this beer that i wasnt thrilled about was the palate, it kind of left my mouth stripped like vinegar, besides that, absolutely wonderful

Bottle. Poured a murky orange with a small white head. First impressions are very good, very refreshing. Nice yeasty notes. Nice amount of citrus, watermelon, grapefruit, lick of coriander, vanilla, some hops. Aroma is lovely, finish is a little dry but lovely. Sweetness is bob on. Carbonation is spot on too. Complex, refreshing and tasty.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow wiht a ncie whit head.  Aroma:  I am not one for Hefes normally, but this one smells beautiful.  The flavor is quite pleasant as well with a very obvious and delightful hop presence. Overall: one of the best hefes I have had.  Even if you don;t like hefes, give this a try!

Bottle. High and lasting fluffy white head. Hazy milky yellow body. Oranges lemon nut aroma Hops dominated oranges lemon flavor with a good deal of carbonation and a long bittersweet aftertaste. Refreshing.

Pours a thick cloudy orange with quite a bit of yeast sediment, fluffy white head.  Somewhat sweet, hoppy nose, some tropical fruit and yeast.  Really meaty banana flavor, interesting and robust.  Overly sweet banana actually.  Not a ton of spice to round it out.  I regret pouring all the yeast in.  Don¬ít knwo what to make of this one -- it tastes good, but it¬ís odd for the style I want to put it in.

This beer began with a vigorous, fluffy white head on top of a VERY cloudy body of medium gold colour.  The aroma was most enjoyable, even to my imperfect nose, with grassy and hoppy scents.  Taste was delicious; it tasted like "more", and the mouthfeel had a damned good bite to it.  Good finish, too.  Excellent beer.

On tap, Wurstkuche.  Pour is murky orange haze, with a below-average head size (for a wheat beer).  Aroma, however, is sublime:  fresh floral ¬ìwest coast¬î hops, with a hint of lemon-lime zest and herbs.  All anchored firmly by wheat and yeast notes.  Flavor starts with an assertive hop bite suggesting tangerine, balanced in the middle by textured wheat and other grain.  Finish puts a crisp and refreshing bitter touch on the traditional mildness of a hefeweizen.  Palate is an interesting sensation of smooth fullness matched with effervescence, which acts to lighten it.  All in all, this was an absolutely delicious hybrid drink, easily better than the previous Brooklyn-Schneider, and an unquestioned success.

On tap at The Rover, G√∂teborg, as Schneider & Brooklyn Hopfen Weisse. ABV was 8.2%. Deep golden to amber colour, hazy. Moderate creamy head. Hoppy sweetish aroma with notes of ripe berries. The flavour is sweet, hoppy and alcoholic - too sweet and alcoholic for me. Less bitter than expected.

Bottled:Pours muddy pale brown with a creamy head. Aroma is hops, yeast and pine apple. Thick mouth feel. Spicy, yeasty, fruity and flowery flavour. Some alcohol in the finish. A very drinkable Weizen Bock.

Bottle. Deep golden colour with a white head. Aroma: Fruity, spicy and hoppy nose.
Flavor: Malty, sweet, spicy, fruity, banana, oranges, grassy hops, a bit peppery, some alcohol, bitterness in the finish.
Dark golden orange with a thick lasting off white head.  Aroma is grapefruit hops, fruity toffee, caramel.  Taste is fruity, toffees, big citrus hops, lightly grassy.

Bottle.  Pour is murky dark yellow with frothy white head.  Aroma is pineapple, cloves, wheat, cinnamon, light hop, and orange.  Flavor is sharp an spicy with pineapple up front and peaches, clove, and wheat to follow.  Finish is sweet and wheat with lingering spicy notes.  I like this beer

very cloudy orange-tan. a - orange, banana, cinnamon, clove, sugar, oregano?!, bread, Parmesan cheese. t - very peppery, spicy, alcohol, lemon, cheese!. points for the really long hop finish. p -buttery creamy body. pleasant and interesting

Bottle.  Pours an average sized (for a Hefeweizen), fluffy, white, lasting head.  Clear, deep golden body with abundant yeast clouds and active C02 bubbles.  Looks fabulous!  Pleasant aroma of wheat malt and spicy, herbal noble hops.  Looks like they dry-hopped with Hallertauer.  A little bit of Bavarian countryside grass.  My only knock on the aroma is the presence of alcohol.  Smells a tad boozy.  Taste is first and foremost dominated by the yeast - dough, banana, a touch of bubble gum, clove, and vanilla.  Some citrus is also present in the flavor profile.  Like the aroma, my one gripe with the flavor is the boozy alcohol.  Not as bad as some 8%+ beers fall victim to, but still more than necessary.  Medium-light, creamy body with lively carbonation and a somewhat bitter finish.  Balanced though.  Overall a really good pale Weizenbock that could be stellar if the booziness were diminished.  I don¬ít think it necessarily needs to have less alcohol, but cooler fermentation temperatures would possibly help.
The Brooklyn version was better, but this is one of my favorite light-colored wheat beers ever nonetheless.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 Bottled at RBESG 08 ... Hazy orange ... lively fruity nose ... very light very fruity ... juicy and bubblegum... 3.6

TK2 bottle at home ... amber ... short lived white head ... light soapy lemon little yeast ... light pine hop ... quite bready... juicy ... some hop resins ... 3.5  

ok on to side by side with its Brother ...colour more yellow golden ... nose is softer and more soapy ...duller up front but seems to have more depth and a more complex finish ... I suspect this would be a bit easier to drink lots of  but it just doent seem to hit the spot quite so well. 3.6Tap at the brewery bar munich.... Hazy massive orage floral hop nose... Juicy fruits... Over fizzy... But its bloody crackin... Really this is alll should be bar its over fizxy... Im upping thid to 4..p


Bottle at home bbf 2009... Copper.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet caramel toffee cardboard nose... Soft sweet toffee fruit.. Soft malts.. Sweet fruits 3.4
Unclear dark golden with a medium white head. Heavy wheat aroma along with sweet fruits like mango and mandarine. Sweet wheaty flavor with a sharp alchohol leading to an alchohol bitter finish

Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of joss. It pours a really murky milky copper orange beer with a tall, nicely lasting white head which leaves a beautiful lacework. The aroma is extremely interesting, fresh and mindblowingly good. Yasmin, peach, apricot, vitamin tablets, yeast with a huge amount of blood orange and mango showing up which is accompanied by bittering hops. Wonderful taste. Reminiscent of Unibroue Trois Pistoles in a strange way- very fruity with a similar yeasty touch, though different in style and hop profile. Some marmite sneaking accompanied by wild strawberries, yasmin and mango. Sweet. The hops add a lot to this beer (dry hopping) which results in a relatively low bitterness. (Though high for the style of Wiezen Bock). Hops, tropical fruits an licorice in the finish. Schneider Aventinus is really overrated in my opinion- this Weizen Bock transcends the latter. Thanks a lot joss for this fantastic beer!
Skarpt markerad beska f√∂r att vara en vete√∂l som ramar in upplevelsen och fyller den till br√§dden med ett smakrikt fl√∂de av allt fr√•n apelsin till banan. Ett helt orangeri av dofter och aromer.

NIce hoppy beer that I do think I could have guessed was from a combination of East IPA and Aventinus. The hops are very nice in this beer and are all citrussy. Not that strong, but it does serve to kill a bit of the yeastiness of the Aventinus. It also takes some of the nicer flavors of Aventinus away. A good beer, but I wouldn¬ít say its better than either beer necessarily. Its just entirely different. Wish they sold it in sixers, but that seems to be a rare thing these days.

The look is golden orange in color with a decent white head.  The smell is hoppy, wheat, yeast, clove, fruits, little bit of gum, and slight spices.  The taste is sweet, hops, wheat, clove, and spices. Nice.

From the czech wheat beer festival, amasing american hop aroma, I never sniff something like this, hazy, golden, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full bread body, long finish, bitter, thick feel, lovely beer....i need another one
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Beautiful, luminous wheaty-tan body with a plush, thick, off-white cream topping. What strikes you first is the whack of fresh hops in the bouquet, quite unusual for the style. After further straining, sprinkles of banana and clove are there as well as a solid wheaty backbone. Citrusy hop flavors and tangerine wash over the palate, followed by the quickly dancing banana-clove pair. Alcohol is well crafted into the beer, but you quickly feel almost overwhelmed by it along with the combination of hops and phenols. Light soapy/sour banana finish.

Served in dimpled mug. Pours a cloudy orange. Sizable off-white head, with moderate lacing. Aroma of citrus (grapefruit and tangerine) with slight muskiness and mild alcohol. Excellent mouthfeel; effervescent with microbubbles of foamy head adding decisively to palate is primarily citrus, with tangerine flavor dominating. Lemon and white pepper in background, with minimal flavor of alcohol. A fine beer, and a credit to all parties involved.

Bottle, John¬ís Grocery in Iowa City. Tangerine pour, lots of just off-white foam, coming out of solution in attractive microbubbles. Very pleasant musky dried fruit aroma. Papaya, leather, lemon.  Peppery lemon sorbet flavor, pleasant medicinal touch, drying tannic finish. Delicate, bright and airy palate, without seeming overly carbonated. Lovely beer, a little dash of adventure while still firmly part of the Schneider tradition.

16.9 oz bottle.  I drink a LOT of beer, and this is the winner for the best beer I¬íve ever tried.  Pours a hazy orange with a gigantic orange head that threatens to overtake the entire beer.  Aroma is of pungent orange peels, fresh oranges, citrus, and ripe bananas.  Flavor is of floral and earthy hops, bananas, spices, orange peels, tangerines, and some slight yeast.  The alcohol is perfectly concealed.  I wasn¬ít expecting too much, but this completely blew me away.  I¬íll be surprised if I ever try a beer this good again.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
I had this with a good friend of mine. I had never finished this one myself. It¬¥s to stong  and heavy. I find this one little hard to rate. It¬¥s so different from other weisen. It¬¥s more strong, heavier taste from spices, candy, banana, vanilla, pineapple, grape and sweeeeet malt.
The brew is very hazy yellow. Head is rocky white. I had fun rating this. A new experience!

Opens with a mild gush, then pours thick-hazed golden with large chunks of sediment under a full, creamy, off-white head. (As I near the end of the 500ml bottle, the yeast becomes so thick as to turn the golden body a bizarre shade of septic tan, so I need to deduct an appearance-point.) Florals strike the nose first which actually pair well with fruity banana and yeasty dough  aromas. Creamy mouthfeel with a touch of spritz and astringence. Alcohol is undeniable in the flavor, accompanied by banana bread yeasts and sharp herbal hops. The overall flavor profile would be tart and fruity leading to a tart and spicy finish with a hint of bitterness. A very well-made beer due to an excellent collaboration.  ~~~~~~~~~~ Purchased August, 2007, Binny¬ís, Orland Park, IL, consumed June 2009.
Bottle. I don¬ít think beer is as good as any of the other Schneider brews. Flavor and aroma are decent but this is mediocre.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy straw with a huge foaming white head. Yeast, bread, soap on the nose.  Flavors of spice, some mango, melon. Nice hop bitterness. I am digging this guy.

Pours a hazy, pale golden color with, in my experience, little to no head. Spicy, yeasty aroma with a bitter, fruity bite to the taste. Hops and a subtle, sour banana note in the background. Ths would pair well with food, I suspect.

Poured from 500ml Bottle into Weizen glass.

Pours a creamy pale orange with glowing edges. It has a frothy pure white head that lasts the entire time you are drinking this beer. Aroma is heavy with spices, earthy hops, some banana and yeast. Flavor is light sweet and toasted malts, white pepper spice, light hopiness and ends with a fluffy bitterness. Its medium bodied beer with plenty of carbonation. I like the amount of spices that the flavor has and it ends up semi-dry. Very good beer.

CBF 2009. A very hopped weizen. Dark yellow and murky. White head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is coriander and hops, moderate malty, heavy yeasty. Flavor starts moderate sweet and bitter, finish heavy bitter. Dry texture. Lively carbonation.

now this was an exciting find.
aroma: 8.5
an incredibly lively blend of grapefruit, lemon, spicy hops, goseberry, raspberry.
appearane: 4
gold-to-amber-to-orange bright sunrise mix. slightly cloudy, small head, residue. someone described it as ¬ía lava lamp¬í..I couldn¬ít put it better.
Flavour 7.5
spritzy hops, yeasty, peppercorn and coriander give to a slight bitter tang
Palate 3.5

Immediate nose of bright Hallertauer hop spice (green peppercorn and a  little sage).  Earthy with some tropical fruit and round, polished wheat malt.  Finishes soft with a yeasty cream and lingering hop spice.  As complex as a wheat beer can get, and deftly balanced at that.   This version seem to be a little less aggresive in the bitterness department over past or fresh vintages.
Flaske: Flot stort skum p√• en uklar m√∏rkeorange √∏l. Ikke megen karbonering men en kraftig l√¶kker duft af humle. God kombination af hvede og humle og en meget drikbar √∏l. Godt samarbejde.

Bottle.  Pours OJ-yellow with a huge frothy white head and swirling, oozing clouds of sediment- like a lava lamp at first.  Hoppy orange, spicy yeast, banana, and honey in the nose.  Similar taste, but with some wheat and a little warming alcohol.  Nice smooth mouthfeel, finishes malty orange.
Aroma of burnt citrus greets the nose from the beginning of its dark, cloudy pour. The tangy, sour character suggests grapefruit, mango, pineapple, lemon,  and vanilla with a crisp hoppy finish.

I get a bit fed up with beer and food matching what i tend to enjoy and remember more is beer and situation or movie matches....i drunk this while watching a re-run of the Goonies on TV and what a fantastic pairing! The beer had a creamy and herbal palate that seemed to match the overtones of pirate buried treasure well. On the nose it was all cloves and nutmeg that i think went fantastically well with the 80¬ís wardrobe that the heroes and heroines were wearing. it didn¬ít look very good in the glass but that¬ís ok because neither does the cast! To top off a fantastic matched with a fantastic movie!

500mL bottle.  Slightly different label than that in the picture.  Pours a hazy, deep gold/rust color with a HUGE and fluffy light-tan head.  A rich, semi-floral, tropical fruit aroma that features some pineapple, mango, and banana scents in addition to some apricots, grapefruits, orange peels, lemons, coriander, clove, and some crisp wheatiness in the background.  Mild vanilla comes through as it warms.  Goes down medium-bodied and pretty creamy.  The flavor starts off with a yeasty, fruity tanginess.  Bananas and spices in the transition.  Some crisp, drying wheatiness at the very end.  Vanilla and hints of warming alcohol throughout.  Great brew.

Bottle. Golden colour with dense medium white head. Aroma grass, citrus, hoppy and weak notes of banana. Taste hopps, bananas and some exotic fruits. A littie hopp bite in the finish. A nice beer, but I frankly don¬¥¬¥ t think these hopp experiments make the weizen bocks better than the original ones.

Schneider & Brooklyner Hopfen-Weisse is a very cloudy dull gold beer with a thin, dense, white head that has good lacing. It has a fresh, fruity, spicy aroma with notes of lemon, orange, coriander and banana/clove. It is medium bodied; smooth and lively with a clean finish. It has a full, fruity wheat flavor with lots of spice. It¬ís chai-like. It¬ís a little sweet, a little bitter and incredibly drinkable-- even at 8.5% ABV-- Look out!
Aromas of malt and bananas .. perhaps some citrus notes. Afruity and and spicy taste and some malt and notes of citrus. A sem dry and bitter finish. Really nice indeed.

Bottle courtesy of Dedollewaiter. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Very yeasty. Powerfull bitter heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy biiet finish. Creamy palate. Excellent.
Aroma of malt, herbs, bananas and oranges. Spicey and fruity flavor with a refreshing finish.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, hops and malt.

500 ml bottle shared by Lubiere (merci!), served cold in a goblet. MA06/09.
App.:  Dirty orange-gold with lots of yeast flecks, ring of white head.
  
Aroma:  Pine, orange peel, pineapple, tropical fruits, tangy mango, apricot, a wicked fruit salad with hop backing.
  
Palate:  Medium body, fairly full but gentle effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Lots of the esters but also some great pine/resin/earthy hops, spiciness (coriander), slightly wooden, grapefruit; off-dry and so-so bitterness with a pleasant fruity-malt finish.

An absolute masterpiece, I love this beer.

[email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */¬ís Bar, Copenhagen. A foggy orangey-golden body, coated by a thin and dense offwhite head. Delicious, fresh hop aroma; sweet citrus, mango, apricot, flowers and grass, backed by a crisp wheat scent. Taste has a fine citric fruitiness, a clean and medium sweet wheat character. Notes of honey and fine fruity hoppiness. Well-bodied, smooth and extremely inviting. Amazing stuff!

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2009 500 ml bottle. Finland.
Dark orange colour with average white head. Fruits, banana, toffee/caramel, smoothiness and some alcohol and hints of smoke in aroma.
Rich, yeasty, fruity, hoppy and wheaty flavour with some alcohol present. Very enjoyable. Long-lasting hoppy aftertaste. I would like to try the other one, Brooklyner Schneider version...

At a tasting, thanks shachar. Murky somewhere between yellow and light orange colour,aroma of banana, tropical fruits, bubblegum, Strong pronounced bitterness with soapy perfumy notes and some alcohol coming through, strong and pleasant sour aftertaste starting strong but fading quite quickly. Very intresting and beautifully balanced beer.

500 ml bottle in weizen glass.  Opaque cloudy orange amber with lasting white head and lace.  Banana orange peel and hop pellet aroma.  Sweet honey peach flavor overwhelmed by tart hoppy finish with lingering bitterness like chewed grapefruit peel.  Medium body and medium low carbo make for nice mouthfeel.  I just don¬ít think it works.  Why hop a good weizen bock?  I don¬ít want a bitter tart weizen.  It doesn¬ít taste good.  I find it amazing that this is rated higher than Weihenstephaner Vitus.  Anyhow, that¬ís just me I guess. 

Had to change this from Brooklyn & Schneider.  Got ¬íem mixed up.

At a tasting, thanks Shahar, Nice hazy orange with a small to medium head, aroma of apricots, vanilla, marmalade balanced with some acidity and herbs, flavors of apricots with some wild herbs, some alcohol and some bitter herby finish, complexity is great, body is full, the beer is well balanced and mature.

Bottle. Hazy golden with small, white head. Citrus and dried banana? Nice body. Refreshing, too bad I only bought one. One of the better weizen I have had. The only big problem is that it is a bit strong but on the other hand it is a bock so I can/will accept it :-)

UPDATED: APR 14, 2013 Rerate: Aroma is a bit too much lemon and citrus, but the hops shine brighter on this one. Bottled Febr 2013, so it could be fresher? Lots of citrussy hops. Still only medium bitterness, so most of the hops are in aroma. Quite refreshing. Just the finish is a bit dry and it actually lacks some sweetness from the weizen. Decent beer.
Bottled. Cloudy golden color, thick slight off-white head. Aroma of slight banana, lots of grain, some yeast, bit hop. Sweet banana taste, with a bitter aftertaste. Really like a heavily hopped german weizen. 2.9
50cl bottle. Thanks to AndersAnd. Deep hazy orange with white head and lacings. Sweet and hoppy nose. Lots of wheat, yeast and American hops. Citrus, pine and wheat. Nice.

Gorgeous pour, truly "Imperial Weizen" look and color. Great aromas of pine, banana and citrus mingled with spices. Taste - HOLY WOW - did they ever tweak this batch for the brewer¬ís own likings!!! This is custom work. Rich yet crisp flavors, banana citrus cloves orange spruce - incredibly good. Unforgettable, I want a case of this - bottle is from New Beer on Chrystie in NYC.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Yellow hazy traditional Bavaraian brew with an hoppy New York attitude, my god what an beer.

First impression: strong notes of oranges. Golden, very hazy, lots of yeast (you can see it, taste it and smell it). Taste is strong, there is oranges and bitter hoppiness. Lively and sparkly. The high ABV comes through in a good warming way.

500 ml pours hazy tawny with a thick off-white head. Aroma of pithy ruby red grapefruit and aromatic piney hops. with currants and touch of ripe pineapple. Ripe grapefruit, wheat and currant dominate flavor with fruity esters infinish. Well balanced and innovative. Distinct from most traditional German-brewed weizens (with elements of SPF 45).
Hazy orange of color with a white head. An aroma of hops, wheat, sweet and citrus. A flavor of wheat, hops, citrus, sweets and a fresh finish.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2009 A hazy golden beer with a white head that leaves lace. Aroma is spicy hops, with a bready, yeasty, base and light fruit (banana). The flavor is a nice tart fruity weizen, kinda orangey, with more pronounced hop bitterness at the end, but not overwhelming. I¬ím not a weizen fan, generally, but this is a good beer!

Bottled. Aroma has yeast, pines, some spice and hops. Hazy, yellow coloured with an off-white head. The taste is slightly sweet, more bitter towards the finish. Quite dry. haz pine, some wheat and citrus. Medium bodied.

A hazy yellow weizen with a thick off white head. Aroma of interesting c-hops, pinhey and aromatic, with light bananas and pineapple. In mouth, a silken weizen, with fruity esters in beginning, followed by c-hops and grapefruits, well balanced and fruity. Wow! Shared with Probstk, May 5 2009.

The 2nd side of this pair. I was very hopeful for this beer, as I loved Brooklyn¬ís version. 50 CL bottle from Binnys (Orland Park, IL). Pours a glowing rich gold with hints of fiery orange, very hazy, with big bubbly offwhite head that sticks around well, laces. Aromas evident straight from the pour, pushing hearty wheat and fruity esters, banana, clove, lemon with a nice floral hop bouquet with light lemony citrus. Very inviting. Initial is a decent body, pushing banana and lemon, clove and fresh flaked wheat, fruity esters and cereal grains mixed well. Nice bitterness towards the finish, pushing some florals and citrus, balancing the earlier fruity banana esters. A bit strong really, but I really like this. Preaches a good bodied brew, good flavors, and a nice balance of hop and wheaty goodness. I think I liked the Brooklyn version a little more, but this brew is great also. Cheers!

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm) Cloudy orange/yellow colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, spicy nose with citrus, grass, yeast, banana, vanilla and coriander. Malty, fruity taste with notes of lemon, yeast and a touch of spices (coriander, clove), while grassy, floral hops give the finish a certain hop bite. Slightly above medium body, fairly sweet. Very interesting cooperation and a nice beer.

Wheaty-banana components plus crisp hop bitterness, much like a pale or ipa.  Sweet, fruity, like apricot mixed with a piney-resinous hop flavor.  But its got that more musty-earthy component from the german side.  Very drinkable, much like the aventinus.  Overall: Fruity, hoppy, banana-y, wheaty.  Nice.

500ml bottle that I had as a side by side with the Brooklyner-Schneider version..  Pours a very hazy deep straw color, almost the same apricot as the Brooklyn-Schneider version, but a touch lighter.  Medium white head.  Pineapple, cinnamon, citrus hops, touch of toast as this gets warmer.  Thin to medium bodied, lightly spicy, almost a touch of metal.  Nice light spicy finish. While this was tasty, I think the Brooklyn one was a hair better.  Both good though, and I¬íd certainly drink either again.

Bottle: Hazy yellow colour, with a big head. Aroma is werry fruity, citrus, banana and orange nice fruity/bitter nose in the end here!
Flavor had a weery nice smouth fruity/sweet mouth felling, this definitive German meets US in brewning. Werry nice mix this one. Thin to medium body, and a nice medium fruity/citrus mix in the end. This was a nice surprice!

interesting union of two different type of beer.the classic corn and fruity taste of hefe-weiss unites with the agrumes and wyith the bitterness of a pale ale.the result is a well-blanced beer,with a nice alcoholic taste on the end,but extremely drinkable at the same time

Bottle 500 ml. Copper hazy colour with a medium foam. The smell has tones of grassy hops. First taste is kinda weird, with tastes stretching all over the place. My first impression, is this a mix of an APA and a weissbier? It both has some sweetness and a distinct bitterness. The finish has some warm alcohol and something chemical to it. Im not entirely sure what to think of this beer. It feels very unbalanced with different tastes tugging in different directions. On the other hand it is a very interesting beer that got me thinking. I guess the grade is a compromise ;)

Hazy brow-yellowish with a huge white head quickly fading to a thin cap over the surface. Aroma is inviting with the best of two worlds (american hop juice, german wheat banana treat stuff.) Mouthfeel is medium and soapy. Flavour is very wheaty yet with a tropical fruit touch creating almost chemical/rubber notes. The finish is a nice blend blend between the two base components, light bitterness and a big satisfying sweetness ending on a dry note. Very drinkable (for it¬ís size) and really good actually.

Bottled. 
Hazy pale orange colour. Not as big head as expected, being a weizen(bock). Aroma is rich, there is mandarine, rubber, banana and orange peel to name some. Bit dry-ish feel to it already in aroma. Band-aid backbone in flavour, integrated with rubber and hop juice. Moussy mouthfeel with great effervescence. This is a great example of old and new in wonderful harmony. Stalwart weizenbock from my favourite wheat beer brewery in the world, spiced with rich amounts of hops the American way. The phenols and the hops seem to create a wonderful, yet bizzare-ish rubber/plastic flavour backbone that¬ís yummy for some and yuky for others. Bitterness is low, as recommended. This is really a dangerous brew. I¬ím glad I only bought one today. Burp.

Full, estery aroma with sweet banana and incense. That spicy, incense-like quality carries into the flavour making this quite a special beer. There¬ís also some tangy, tingling quality which really comes into its own in the aftertaste, can¬ít really pinpoint it but I¬ím guessing I¬íll remember the next time my girlfriend makes Indian curry...

I¬íve been thoroughly bored by most weisses as of late (although a decent dunkel could probably lift my brow a little) but this has been a great surprise. But then it is a weizen bock and I¬íve never been bored with them...

Oh, and as it warms more there are notes of bubble gum!

Bottle from Systembolaget, Karlstad.
Pours a cloudy yellow/orange color with a mediumsized white head. Aroma is nice; spicy/yeasty and fruity with notes of banana and citrus. Fresh, unusal and exciting. Flavour is spicy, there¬ís notes of grassy hops, citrus, apricot and some light banana. Almost a bit perfumey, but not in a disturbing way. Well hidden alcohol with a slightly bitter finish. Medium to full body with a rather oily mouthfeel, carbonation is maybe a bit lively. Gets better and better after a while in the glass, and it¬ís dangerously drinkable exactly as Aventinus. I think the latter one is slightly better though, even though I haven¬ít had it since March last year or so. Well made stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2016 500ml bottle  (Janoinen Lohi, Helsinki) (7-:4:7-:3:12=3.3--)
Rich toffee/caramel colour, small head. Sweet caramel and banana aroma from Schneider. Tons of nettles from Brooklyn. Perfumey palate, but also nettles retronasally. Quite alcoholic, but also perfumey in the taste. Still rather nettley. Not as good as Aventinus. Had a sip from someone else¬ís glass too - that was soapy and tasted of disinfectant - not good (so docking 1 point overall). 
Rerate: 500ml bottle (Alko) as Tap 5 - shared by Jari - thanks!
7 Massively hoppy aroma, sharp and fruity, reminded 
4 Turbid toffee, almost sahti-like. 
7 Sweet and fruity, plenty of bananas there, loads of bitter hops.
4 Full and smooth. Lovely bitter hoppy finish. A touch perfumey and soapy
14+ Wonderful balance, bitternesss huge, but nettles kept in check. Alcohol nowhere to be seen. Way way better than the Brooklyn one, IMHO.
Rerate: Tap (Hopfenreich, Berlin) (6:4:7:4:14=3.5) in 2016
Spicy banana aroma. A bit aggressive. Good wheaty body, shame about the aggressive aspects.

[2016-20090222] 500mL bottle. Lovely hoppy citrus aroma. Murky, light brown orange body with a long-lasting foamy white head and lots of floaties. Toasted yeast flavour has citrus lemon hops throughout. Medium body is a little bitter. Nice aroma.
(w/ jerc)

(Bottle) Dark orange and cloudy. Larger, dense and lightly tan coloured head. Strong pine aroma with fruitiness. Medium bodied and bit warming palate with medium carbonation. Fruitiness, banana, pine, bitterness and sweetness in taste. Banana and bitterness in aftertaste.

On tap at Wildeman. Wow. Another excellent team-up of two choice brewers. Grapefruit-colour body with thick head. Taste of wheat, hops, rice and sweet fruits. Quite nice and I could recognize both brewers in the flavours and texture. ABV is very high and very well-hidden. Goes down very well.

A very hazy golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. A very strong aroma of hop bitters with sweets of wheat and fruits. like banana¬ís with citrus. The taste is hop bitter with the sweets of a German Weisse. These taste are having a battle. In the aftertaste the bitterness of the American hops is predominating.

Sampled draught at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm. Pours out in a cloudy dark golden colour with a rich, sticky white foam. Fresh, fruity and fragrant aroma of spicy and floral noble hops, yeast, cloves, cookies, mild lemon and apricots. Medium to full-bodied with notes of yeast, cloves, oranges, apricots, fresh grassy and spicy hops with touches of dough and crackers. Long medium-bitter and hop aromatic finish of orange-peels, grass, mandarin, yeast and spices.

Awesome looking pour, cloudy amber body with a big soapy head. The aroma is stunning. This has got to be the best smelling beer I¬íve ever enjoyed...its the standard wheaty/banana goodness of a hefe, meets a bizarre, but wonderful citric/spiced cider fruitiness. Wow. Ok, the flavor is pretty good too - something like a toned down version of the aroma. Many of the standard hefe notes are present, the tropical/citrus hop flavors really add an extra kick. Medium bodied, relatively dry, and pretty refreshing for such a big beer. Mild alcohol warmth late  in the finish. This beer rules...I would like to see a lot more hopped up hefes after drinking this thing.

(Bottled) Opaque orange with a small, lightly lacy and partly lasting head. Very pleasant, exotic-fruity, citric-aromatic-hoppy nose with peppery-coriandery spiciness, and a touch of alcohol. The neutral flavor is wheaty-malty with orange-peel-fruitiness, but also some dull-ashy touches. Medium to full, slicky body with soft carbonation. Definitely an interesting hybrid, but unfortunately the somewhat dull flavor is no match for the great, hoppy aroma.

Dark, hazy, orange colour. Sweet citrusy aroma with strong hints of orange oil. Light texture, sweet on the tongue with lots of orange coming through which pairs well with the bitter (but fresh) hop finish.
pours a cloudy yellow with lots of sediment and a nice head a very sweet taste and a light dryness left on the palate

Bottle.
Pours solid looking beige with a dirt white head. Smells of weat and hops.
Surprisingly big body. It has some dryness like white wine to it.

Bottle. Look: Hazy golden, creamy white head. Smell: Candy banana, orange, hops, wheat, dry white wine, vanilla. Taste: Wheat, honey, fruity (citrus), nice hop bitterness in aftertaste. Overall: Big body for a wheat beer. Refreshing and deep flavor.

Bottle shared with ArmEd.  Aroma of bananas and vanilla offset with fruity hops - lemon and light hints of peach.  Appearance is cloudy yellowish orange with a nice foamy head and decent lacing.  Flavor is like a Weissbeir with a solid twist of hoppiness.  Nice combination.  Would love it if the ABV wasn¬ít quite so high.

On tap at In de Wildeman. Unclear yellow colour, white head. Aroma is of a typical Weizen with addition of strong hops: yeast, banana, wheat and citric menthol hoppiness. Flavour is ping-pong between banana sweetness and hoppy bitterness. Really interesting, but the flavours don¬ít blend in very well. Nevertheless, a thick and fullbodied beer with a good alcohol kick.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a cloudy slight orangey yellow with a medium white head and an aroma of caramel malts, amarillio hops and citrus. The flavour is a mostly citrus and hops with hints of caramel, salmiak, yeast, cream and coreander. A thickling hoppy bitter finish. Nice beer!

Pours a murky yellow-orange with good-sized head that fades to a thin layer.  Aroma is very complex with orange, lemon, yeast, and hops.  Smelled like a cup of OJ at first pour.  Upon sipping, gives a nice mix of citrus and hoppiness.  This beer was surprisingly complex but not overdone. I definitely enjoyed this one and wouldn¬ít hesitate to drink it again.

Hops abound from this brew. The scent is that of an IPA with lemon and peach.  Cloudy tan with a medium long-term head the pine and citrus flavors are up front, thinning into lemon wheat with farm yeast throughout.  

Reminds of a well hopped saison but with as definite touch of the unique.
Pours a think head that sticks around. A typical hefe weis aroma. Very strong hops flavor but surprisingly dosent drowned that wheat yeast flavor. I think hop heads will like this.
Pours hazy golden color with white head. Aromas of citrus, yeast and lots of hops. Hallertauer hop flavor with lemon and yeast and some biscuit. Very hoppy. Medium body with average carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy golden color, full white head. Citrusy, peppery hop aroma with distinct hefeweizen yeast and malt profile.  Taste of Belgium yeast, very straight forward with the hop presence letting you know this is no ordinary hefe, with subtle malt creaminess that is  biscuity and full. A  great take on the style that i will continue to buy.

Pours hazy orange with a huge white head and lots of floaties, great retention and some lacing. Aroma has lots of orange and orange peel with some malty sweetness, flavour develops fermented orange pulp and spicy hops. Sweet finish, not particularly lasting, with some hop bitterness. Light mouthfeel, moderate carbo.

Murky orangy brown with a fizzy orange/white head that stands tall then collapses quickly. Lots of floatables make this light colored beer very murky. Aroma is bready and citrusy, lots of lemon and orange. Flavor is very intense for a wheat beer, again citrus lemon/orange peel, herbal and a little spicy. Its kind of like drinking iced tea. Sweet fruity malts are balanced by strong bitterness in the end. Unusual for a wheat beer. Very tasty, full bodied and interesting.

Cloudy orange body, small white head with minimal lace, hoppy vegetable aroma, flavor is very hoppy, this like a German IPA, seriously, spicey orange rind hop flavor, big wheat wine body. alcohol is present but cool and soft, hops are a little edgy however, tastes very homebrew like when you don;t clean out the hop pellet trube too well and it flavors the beer with that spicey vegetable hop flavor, good and interesting, too hop forward for style though

2009-02-22. Murky dark pastel yellow with a good sized white head and some floaties. (3+) Aroma is surprisingly hoppy, light grassy notes, mild florals, light esters and pale malts. Flavour is similarly hoppy, with a moderate but prominent bitterness throughout, mild sweet malt with just a kiss of esters. (7+) Average to medium bodied palate is pleasantly carbonated. (3+) Pretty solid, bitterness is nice but I find myself looking for more yeasty/estery wheat beer notes. Still, rather nice. Bottle from Village Beer Market
A very unique weizenbock.  Cloudy as heck and near golden.  Great blend of wheat and hops.

500 ml bottle.  Murky, golden color with a large, fluffy white head.  Aroma of honey, grass, and some hops.  Flavor is nice and mellow.  Some notes of wheat, with some peppery spices as a compliment.  Finish is bready with some hop bite.  Nice beer.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2009 Hazy gold-orange with a nice fluffy white head. Nose has loads of wheat and citrus, but a nice sweet fruit to round it out, grape that reminds me of the Tsjeeses. Flavor is more bitter, peppery, and banana, notes of wheat and fruit through the moderate finish. A little over-carbonated for me, but this is definitely a special entry, especially that fruity nose.

500ml bottle pour into weizen glass.  Schneider version.  Pours dark gold with a huge head.  Very cloudy once you swirl and pour.  Aroma of banana, clove, citrus, and hop hop hop.  Flavor is sweet and spicy, but hoppy and bitter at the end.  Mouth is medium bodied, not noticing the alcohol too much.  Finish is slightly dry and bitter.

"damn that filthy mexican banana!" ... pours with a medium airy white foamy head .. has a dark amber body with swirls of sand in the desert .. some yeats and honey in the nose, very wheaty too .. has a pretty big bitterness profile, and is very clean in the mouth, i like it .. why is this version $5 and the brooklyn version is $17 ??? ..boner ... great lacing too ... the abv seems perfect ... an imperial hefe, if you will ...

bottle, thanks to bu11zeye. Murky dark gold with a huge off white head. Nice hoppy, spicy aromas with tart wheat. Light body with a frothy mouthfeel. Good yeasty, spicy citrusy flavors with bready pale and tart wheat malts. Really enjoyed this one.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: 500 ml. Fizzy orange-golden with a lasting half-inch of creamy meringue. Aroma is clean, spicy clove, pineapple, wheat with lemon zest, evergreen resin and slight banana. Flavor is earth-spiced pineapple, orange-banana, and wheat with a large, hop-resin and citrus finish. Sugary frosting on the glass. Light-medium body is acidic, mostly smooth, and hop-dry on the finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold, very thick and substantial off-white head. Aroma is wheat with touches of fruit and herbs. Flavor is again wheat and fruit, a little malt, no banana notes to speak of, which I was expecting. Dry and a little bitter on the finish.

500ml bottle at Toronado in SF.  Nicely done collabo between two legit breweries.  Pours a golden color with substantial white head.  Aroma of floral hops, wheat, and sweet malts.  Flavor is complex: sweet malt, wheatiness, banana, pineapple, coriander, clove, and a bitter hoppy finish.  Great balance.

Appearance: Murky gold, almost pea soup green. Very cloudy with a 1 inch white head.

Aroma:  Banana, clove, and latex.

Taste:  Clove, coriandor, spicy/bitter hops, pineapple and banana.

Mouthfeel:  Thick and full bodied.

Overall:  This brew tastes better than it smells.  I like the tropical notes in the taste, it helps balance out that yeasty clove business going on.  I can tell this is well crafted, but not my cup of.....beer.

Mild banana esters join with lemon citrus character and some tart wheat in the nose.  Opaque tan body is topped by a fizzy white, large bubbled head that reduces rapidly to a lasting cover with slight lace.  Strong banana esters in the flavour which is quite sweet up front before the tart wheat comes out along with fairly strong bitterness.  Mild iodine-like flavour appears in the aftertaste as it warms.  Very crisp carbonation to the refreshing medium light body.  Mild warming.  Feels a bit subdued for a weizen bock.  Weizen glass.  Just above fridge temperature.  Bottle.  Brewery Creek.  Aug-08.

Bottle shared by CapFlu.  Lightly foggy amber, thick white head.  Aroma is light alcohol, wheat, banana, yeast, tinge of a caramel sweetness.  Taste is a light wheat, banana, yeast, light alcohol, toffee like sweetness on the back end.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 The aroma jumps out first, a nice floral hop smell, followed by a fruity bubble gum flavor, banana, slight spicyness, malts.  Hazy yellow, with a hint of orange, less orange than would be typical for the style.  Highly carbonated, lots of bubbles, thick white foam, some particulate matter visible.  The flavor is sweet, malty, grainy, citrusy.  The finish is a decent amount of bittering hops, with a slight metallic taste which is just slightly off putting.  Slight alcohol burn at the end, unusual for this style (may account for slight metal taste).  Very good beer overall.
chira schiuma media discreta persistenzal naso √® luppolato e toglie molto le caratteristiche di una weizen che pero risulta piacevolmente beverina data dalla buona qualit√† dell¬íabbondante luppolo

Bottle...pours a beautiful dark orange color with good clarity and a massive, fluffy white head.  Immediately the hops on this hit with notes of fresh mint, banana, light malted wheat, clove and some light citrus...wonderful stuff.  Medium bodied...nice carbonation.  Starts with a bit of a citrus zest taste which leads to a massive amount of mint, some other herbal essences and some wheat on the finish.  Very good brew, one that I¬íll pick more up of for sure.

Bottle.  Murky, dark golden white pour with a small thin head that disippated quickly.  Aroma of wheat, banana, clove and herbal hops.  Flavor of wheat, banana, spice and a nice bitter dry hop finish.  Just a touh of alcohol in the finish; doesnt taste like 8.2%.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2009 500 mL into a Weihenstephaner weizen. Pours a muddy, translucent orange with a huge marshmallow cap that fades but leaves some nice lacing. Aroma of canned pineapple, floral hops, potpourri, bitter orange, and spice. Flavor is pineapple, spicy hops, yeast, and nutmeg but gets a little soapy. Finishes clean and dry. Crazy amount of alcohol for a weizen but it is mellowed out nicely.Overall, the Brooklyn version is far superior but this still kicks ass.

500ml bottle from Swolf3, thanks Steven. Gold color with a big white head. Lemony aroma, slightly sweet too. Sweet lemony flavor as well, maybe a little banana in the finish. Not bad, could drink this quite often.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text:
Sampled on 1/1/2009. This weizen bock pours a slightly hazy medium orange gold color from a 500ml bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head, with excellent retention and good lacing. The aroma is floral, banana, clove and caramel malt. A medium bodied weizen bock. The malts are caramel, cereal and sweet, with hints of banana and pineapple. The hops are spicy and floral. 
Lively carbonation, with lots of very small bubbles. Some melon and pear flavor in the middle of the taste. Touch of alcohol at the finish. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean, crisp and a little dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter with a touch of alcohol.

Bottle. Pours with a very murky yellow color. At the end all the sediments cause the beer to turn murky brown. Turned my wife of for sure. However the beer is very interesting: first off it pours with a gigantic head that quickly dissipates. Aroam is complex, I get citrus but also caramel and gingerbread spices. Flavor is more like citrus with a dry hops finish. I really enjoyed this one.

Pours with a huge, rocky, off-white head. Light brown body with good lacing from the head. Aroma of caramel, raisins, banana, toffee, vanilla, and a slight hop in the finish. Taste is alcohol, yeast, and raisins. Very rich but cut a bit by the dry mouthfeel. Light bubbles.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Pretty nice.  Complex.  Pours a huge mother head with floaties.  Flavor is just what it promises.  A wheat with hops.  Spicy flavor.  Quite nice.

Excellent weizen bock.  A hopped up version of Aventinus.  Cloudy and bright gold liquid with a decent head.  Excellent aroma.  Sweetly spicy and fruity.  Notes of banana clove and wheat combine with citric hops.  A whole lot of strength to the nose.  Flavor is sweet lemons and the spiced biscuit taste of good wheat.  Sudsy mouthfeel on this very refreshing beer.  Perfect for a hot summer day.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2017 Bottle, 8.2%. Spicy hop aroma. Cloudy orange colour, small floaties. Small stable white head. High carbonation. The flavour is spicy with a little soapy notes. 7 3 7 3 16

Bottle, 8.2%. 4 years past BB date - lagered in my own cellar. Still a good hop aroma, seems caramelly and grapefruity. Cloudy orange colour. Good white head, a bit fizzy, but OK stable. The flavour is nicely sweet with a good grapefruity hop note. Does not taste like wheat beer - which is the way I prefer it nowadays. Good mouthfeel with an isotonic feel in the finish. 7 3 8 4 16

Bottle, 8.2% - sorely missed for the last five years. Grassy and teaish hop aroma. Cloudy amber colour. Good stable white head. The flavour is hoppy and slightly soapy. Has a flowery aroma hop in the flavour and a yeasty finish. Does not taste 8.2% at all. Low carbonation for the style, and creamy mouthfeel. 7 3 7 3 15

I love the addition of hops to a wei√übier.  This makes a perfect combination for next summer.  It tastes much better as it warms.  A good balance of hoppiness and that yeasty banana and clove flavor that Bavaria knows how to brew well.

Bottle Pours out a hazy gold topped with a tall cream head. Aroma was great clove, spice, and light hops. Tast more of the hops and spice. Nice and thick. I have had a few and they are GREAT. I will have to save a few for later in the year.

Another winner from Schneider and Sohn.  A hoppy beer with a grassy pineapple kick.  Amazing aroma one of the best smelling beers I have ever tried.  Huge fizzy/frothy head.  I have never poured a beer that I could hear the fizziness like in a diet Coke.  Muddy clarity with medium to large particle floating.  Beautiful medium amber appearance.  Moderately astringent on the finish.  You can definitely taste the alcohol but it is not too overpowering.  The flavor was  a little too astringent for my taste.  Still a great beer even if over priced.
This smells pretty good. A little bit of hops. The flavor has a good bite. It doesn‚Äôt seem too wheaty. A good beer that doesn‚Äôt seem strong. Nice.

Bottle@Home, thanks DerDoppelbock. Lemon, banana and wheat aroma. Murky, yellow/orange color, beige head, good lace. Sweet, very bitter, tangerine, banana, grassy. Warming. Very flavourful, very different.

Bottle from South Bay Drugs.  Pours a cloudy deep golden color with a fizzy white head.  A ton of yeast sediment in the beer as well.  Nose was very fruity with pineapple, citrus and some farmhouse funk.  Flavor was very fruity and yeasty with the finish being light/ medium in body.

Bottle:  Dirty blonde color with many particles.  Large white/yellow head and decent lacing.  Nose is wheaty, floral, and a little earthy.  Tastes right on par with the aroma and adds a little bit of spiciness.  Some lingering bitters and perhaps just a bit soapy even.  Nice hoppy presence overall.  Thanks Jordan.

Bottle: Cloudy muddy orange/brown, thick white head and a firm sheet of lacing. The nose is fresh and herbal with tons of yummy ammoniaish minty hallertau. The flavor is sweet and intense with a distinct dusty hop note. Good. Interesting experiment with the high gravity and dry hopping on the hefe. I like!

Bottle from Der Doppelbock, thanks! Blonde with a touch of orange. Orange, banana and grapefruity hops in the aroma. Sharp oily citric grapefruity hopbitter flavor with banana notes, lingering on in the aftertaste. A surprisingly good combination, this American hopped hefeweizen.

bottle poured a golden in color with a thick two finger white head that retained rather well. aroma has sweet malt, fruity yeast, light sourness and funk, apple, hop touches, and some grass. mouth feel is light with active carbonation. flavor has schneider yeast interest, funk, light sweetness, minerals, and increasing bitterness. nice funk picks up and overall it is very clean.
(EBF 2008). Hazy apricot color, white head. Fruity apricot aroma, orange, pine apples, some wheat and pear notes. Fruity citrus flavor, pear, apricot, hoppy, grassy and some metal notes.
bottle, great orange julius cloudy orange color, head fills the weizen glass to the top, strong aroma of lemonheads and sour cherry, flavor is alcoholic lemoncello, finishes quite bitter

Draft at Friscos in Columbia, ND. Pours a hazy golden amber with a white head the dissipates to a wisp. Medium bodied with a some tickly carbonation. The wheat malt backbone is behind flavors of banana, white pepper, and some european hoppiness. Belgian phenols on the finish with a hint of alcohol. Comes across more Belgian than German. This sort of struggles for identity

Bottle from South Bay. Hazy medium amber in color upon pouring. Sweet aroma. I can detect some apple and yeast. Scent is also spiced with some hops. Mild yeast and spices up front. Quite hoppy for the style. Very interesting take on the style.

Bottle courtesy of rudolf - thanks, rudy! Pours a hazy golden-orange with a huge creamy white head, lots of little floaties, and very active carbonation. Luscious aroma of pineapple, lemon, pepper, and nice herbal hops. Crisp body that really refreshes the palate. Flavour is yeasty and spicey, with notes of clove and pepper, some lemon and pineapple, and a well-hopped finish that is herbal and a pit piney. I had the Brooklyn-brewed version a couple of weeks ago and haven‚Äôt entered my notes yet, but I recall enjoying it a bit more than this one. Still, this is very fine stuff - which isn‚Äôt a surprise, given the pedigree.

Bottle courtesy of yem25. Thanks man! The aroma is strong and hoppy, lots of lemon, pepper, and some light clove, light banana, earthy hops too. Pours a bright shade of orange/yellow with a nice creamy lasting head. Strong hoppy flavors up front. Lemon and citrus seem to be the strongest, followed by pepper. Some clovey spice comes in along with some pleasant banana notes and softer fruits as well. Hops come back and manifest themselves in the form of earthy, gritty pepper. Smooth drinking body with a nice dose of hops. An interesting and nice brew.
Large amount of sediment makes appearance pleasantly cloudy. Strong notes of pineapple and hops on the front end. Long, peppery finish. Refreshing flavor.

Amazing.  Nose of light fruits. Strong fruity flavors and hops.  Fun beer to drink a lot going on very refreshing spring or summer brew.  Also a lot cheaper than the brooklyn version being that more of this one was brewed.
Very cloudy golden orange color, thick white head. Nose of grassy citrus pine, outdoors on a clean fall day, some floral notes. Full on the palate with a slight banana taste. Some hops at the finish.

Bottle pours a cloudy honey lemon color with a thick foamy white head.  Powerful aroma of yeast, fruit, wheat, and some cedar.  Flavor starts slightly sweet but finishes on a more sour note.  Nice mixture of flavors along thet way though.  The 8.2% is well hidden.

Man... I can‚Äôt believe that I‚Äôve managed to forget rating this one after having it and rating it on the RBESG08 Grand tasting. I‚Äôve rated the ones directly before when I was entering all those beers and after it in my notebook but not this one. And it‚Äôs one of the most eloqent ones too... I wonder if there are more of them hidden in there... Poured an opaque ochre body with a medium sized head. Fruity nose with notes of ordinary honey and hop. Lovely fruitiness, sweet taste, noticable aroma hops. Light bitterness near the end. A very nice weizenbock.

Bottle. Dark cloudy yellow with swirled sediment poured in. Foamy thin white cloud on top. Strong aroma of soft hops. Soaring hop flavour with a sour malt and alcohol. A little spice burn on the tongue. lasting light pepper note. Not overly aggressive but beautifully balanced with strong hops. Very smooth and drinkable.

Bottled.
Hazy golden. Small, white head.
Loads of citrus; apricot and pineapples, in the aroma.
Very fruity and malty flavour. Some pepper ans slightly vinous.

I‚Äôve been a fan of Schneider-Weisse for a long time now...American brewers haven‚Äôt been able (IMO) to emulate that balance of hop and spice...so I was excited to try a collaboration involving this brewer and an American one.  And I was not disappointed, this beer offers the same balance of spice, hop, and fruit notes evident in other Schneider Weisse beers, but also offers some additional flavor notes.  The clove and malt in this beer is balanced a bit by banana (isoamyl acetate?) other fruitiness...and with more caramel than I remember from other Schneider Weisse beers.  Very good.

Appearance is amber or a dark gold.  Aroma is malt, with cloves and some fruit and banana notes.  Flavor is as I‚Äôve described above.  Mouthfeel is pretty thick, but not overly slick or sticky.

I would highly recommend this beer.  I bought this at Discount Liquor in Milwaukee, based on a very good employee recommendation.

Aroma of yeast, malt and citrus, cloudy golden/brown pours a big off-white head. Taste is pear, lemon, malt and yeast. Medium bodied, tongue tingle, man this is a great beer, but it seems to be a belgian strong?

 Thank You Torontoblue.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2009 Bottled. An unclear dark golden beer with a thin orange head. The aroma is powerfully wheaty and grassy hoppy combined with sweet malty notes as well as medium notes of mango and lighter notes of banana. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of wheat and fruit - mango and oranges, as well as medium notes of caramel and grass, leading to a dry wheaty finish. The alchohol tickles the tongue.

Bottle.  Pours a super cloudy dull light brown with a huge, foamy white head.  Aroma of freshly picked apples, Belgian yeast and light flowery hops.  Flavor of citrus (lemon and orange zest) and lots of ripe fruits.  Slightly spicy finish.  The aroma is better than the flavor, but this beer is still quite tasty.

Bottle. Nice aroma of sweet fruits (apple, some citrus, some banana) and sweet malt; A gentle, apple-based perfume. Flavor far less pleasing, weird bitter apples, bitter seeds, bleh, the hops and the yeast seem to really clash for me. Rather flimsy body, especially considering all the yeast in there, and harsh on the tongue. Unpleasant. Huge letdown after the aroma.

500ml from Vancouver, BC. Incredibly cloudy, hazy copper. Looks like a cloudy apple cider. nose like a belgian single, some hopes. Taste is has a wonderfully floral hop and bitter to compliment more normal german weisse flavor. ‚Äôcloudy‚Äô mouthfeel and a perfect finish. I like this a lot.

This beer looks like unfiltered cider, or creamed honey. The head is fizzy and dissipates quickly, and there¬ís a *ton* of stuff floating in it. Very mild aroma with crisp apples, cardamom and a bit of bubble gum. Flavor is (thankfully) not as sweet as a lot of weisse beers - no doubt partially thanks to the hops. Still sweet, with a bit of banana and fresh apple, yeast and hops. Good, but not something I¬íd have regularly.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Hoppy aroma, floral and grass, with green apple and some background spice. The flavor is very fresh and floral hoppy, with grass, citrus fruits, green apple, yeast, and clove spicyness. Nice dry hoppy finish. Very good.

Very cloudy orange, sizey, rocky white head. Wheaty, bubbleguma and banana aroma, with some herbal notes mixed in, too. Nicely (and oddly) savory flavor, with herbal notes being front and center. Nice dryish finish.

Poured a very cloudy orangeish amber with a tall fluffy white head.  Sweet aroma of banana and clove, estery, with some notes of piney hops.  Flavor is a balance between sweet and dry with flavors of the banana and clove coming through, backed up by pine and grapefruit rind hops.  Overall much more estery than the Brooklyn counterpart with less hops emphasis and more balance.  In the end, this one does indeed have more of a German taste to it, while Brooklyn‚Äôs tasted more like an American take on a German style.  I probably enjoyed the American version more, but both are fantastic beers.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2008 Draft at BSP.  pours hazy gold, white foamy head.  I thought it would be darker, as most beer in this style are DARK.  Sweet wheat, sugar, floral hops, delicious.  Lucous legs running down the long .5L Schneider glass.  Sweet malt, calming bitterness adds the ultimate marriage of balance.   Hints of banana flavor followed by bitterness.  Aroma of Amarillo and Hallertauer  hops.   Spectacular!  American style highly hopped, high bitterness in a wonderfully made German style wheat masterpiece.  whoo!  Tasty.  Big abv definitely adds to the finish.  8,5,8,5,18

50cl bottle.   My first IPA-weizenbock hybrid.   I can imagine this beer blowing minds over in Germany; they probably either hate it or think its the best innovation in brewing since the pilsner.   Anyway, lots of yeast sludge going on, almost chunky, but it works here.   Huge tropical smoothie and spicy herbal hop aroma.   Amazing how the tropical notes mix with the more spicy notes that I usually associate with german hops.   There is a hint of banana, but the dry-hopping dominates any yeast aromas.   The flavor is also very hop-dominated, with a firm hef malt backbone.   The traditional bavarian hefewiesse yeast flavors get lost in the cascade of spicy and tropical hops.   This really tastes like a hef-IPA.   Nothing like any weizenbock that I¬í;ve had before.   I feel bad for liking this so much, because it seems like such a bastardization of tradition, but if you like hefs and IPAs, this is an awesome combination.   Where the rich flavors of a more typical weizenbock might tire after a glass, the hops in this beer just draw you back for more.

hazy caramel a pour with a huge thick off white head. Really nice aroma, a great mix of pungent hops, wheat, roasty wheat, and some subtle caramel. The hops really come through in the flavor, when the beer was cold the hops were quite citric and were mingling very nicely with the banana, caramel, and bubblegum ester, it‚Äôs so nice! But as the beer warms the hops take over, and are flooding my taste buds with a soapy hoppy mess of an aftertaste. All in all thought much better than the Brooklyn version, the alcohol is well hidden in the Schneider version, its not an alcohol bomb like i thought the Brooklyn version was.

Opaque orange-yellow pour with lots of stuff floating around.  Like pulpy grapefruit juice  Nice white head.  Fruity aroma with bananas and apples.  Cloves and spices.  Very floral with additional malt notes.  Very flavorful.  Malty backbone with a lots of woody citrus.  Very dry with a touch of sourness.  Some spice cloves and yeast and a little bit of creamy chocolate throughout.  A touch of hops to finish.  Very complex and tasty.  Hides the alcohol very well.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy golden color with a large fluffy off white head with amazing retention.  The aroma is herbal, fruity (citrus and banana), spicy, and light malt.  The flavor is fruity (same as the nose), malty, light herbal, light yeast, and a mildly bitter finish.  Although not a style I generally drink, I found this to be interesting and mostly enjoyable.  Very smooth drinking with a light/medium mouthfeel.

500ml bottle.  (My bottle does not have the Brooklyn logo, but other than that the label is identical.)  Super fizzy and opaque.  Visible bits of yeast.  Lace is practically permanent.  Nose is mostly lemon and alcohol.  Has a nice bitter finish.

Very obviously a Schneider, with intense lemon, clove, and pepper in the nose and in the flavor.  Hazy gold, huge head, good lacing.  No surprise in the intense clove and pepper and citrus in the taste, although the bite was delightfully extreme.  Great surprise was the pronounced hoppiness and the bitter finish.  I need another to calibrate my ranking, but on a first try this was lovely.

[bottle--thanks, pivnizub!]
Potent pine hops aroma with some clove and notes of ginger and lemon and a little bit of vitamin. Murky light yellowish brown with a big rocky head that drops to a thick, bubbly cover that clings to the glass. Smooth, yet strong flavour of citrus hops with some pine, corriander. Significant sweetness that is balanced by an appropriate amount of bitterness which is unusual for this style (of course this beer is not really in any style). Warm with alcohol, but no ethanol flavour. Salty. Full body, high carbonation, lingering hops flavour.

Bottle from PP Bottle Shop. Pours a murky dull orange yellow hue with modest head. Nose is pine resin with a touch of bubblegum yeast, caramel, light fruits (pears, apricots), citrus, and spice. Taste is sweet fruits with a flavorful hop and spice backbone, sweet caramel malts and yeast hit midway along with fruit syrup, finishes drying with a hint of alcohol warming and pepper spice. Medium-bodied with smooth creamy texture and moderate carbonation. A well-balanced variant of a wheat, bursting with amazing aromas, hops accentuate the fruits and yeast, very impressive!
Mmm. Lots of wheat, fruit, citrus. This feels very traditional and much better than your average American. Well balanced and tasty.

Bottle 500 ml
 Appearance:  Mid hazed summer amber with large brisk white crown. Nose:  Strong , refreshing nose. Peach and mango, sweet green hops with sweet caramel dough like base. Late spiciness is noted. Very neat.8-  Flavor/Palate : Medium full bodied hoppy wheat. Citric , fruity hop character with slight dryness at finish. Not as wholesome rounded as one might wish to be. Green slightly metallic hops at finish with drying alcohol.. Long lasting spicy , peppery character stretched over. I wished be bit sweeter.

Bottle from Utobeer. Deep golden in colour with a huge, rocky white head. Aroma of yeast, plenty of spice including cloves and a hint of coriander, lemon and floral hops. Flavour was sweet, with some graininess, citrus fruit and plenty of hops, giving a hint of pine. Plenty of warming alcohol in the finish. An unusual take on wheat beer which was thoroughly enjoying.
Pours foggy pale golden orange with decent off white head. The nose is subtly sweet and fruit with a floral hop profile. The flavor is quite the same, and very easy drinking.
Hazy amber with medium off white head. Sweet fruity aroma with hoppy and wheaty notes. Hoppy flavor with wheaty and grapefruit notes.

Maybe it was just the light, but a beautiful gold body that faded to copper just underneath a good sized, flat topped head. Melons, lemon and banana backed up by yeasty wheat in the nose. Flavors of citrus, more banana and spice with a touch of bitterness along with smooth sweet malt and wheat.  You¬íd never guess that it was 8.2% unless it warms up a little.  Never cloying and a light body for such a flavorful beer. Time to go buy some more.  Fantastic.

nose is an attack of tropical fruits and yeast with character beyond that of a simple weizen.  with almost belgian qualities, the yeast brings a storm of cloudiness to the brew¬ís hue.  people talk about fruit notes in beer, and weizens specifically are spoken of having banana notes. well this isnt a note, its a pineapple the size of a football crushed and smothering you! wow! still, this is tempered with an interesting spicyness from the hops that doesnt present itself with typical bittering ideals.  in time the source of the spiciness reveals itself to be alcohol as well as hops, which begins its slow but pleasant burn.  this is one of the most well hopped weizens ive ever had, maybe #1 in that regard.  this is definately the best weizen ive ever sampled, the traditional style while comforting cant touch something of this caliber.  at minimum, this is the first hands down ¬í10¬í on aroma ive ever sampled.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2010 (bottle) hazy golden-orange colour with a cloud of hop particles in suspension and a firm white head, nice lacing. aroma is hop spices, tropical fruits and a hint of alcohol. flavour has a strong tropical fruitiness, most noticeably pineapple and passion fruit, lovely peppery and citric hop spices, fresh malts and light alcohol notes. dry, with a pleasant medium-bitter finish and light citric sourness, full bodied, smooth carbonation.
Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Juicy aroma with pineapple and apricot hops. Dry hop dominated flavour with the apricot dominating.

I was digging this.  Cloudy dirty blonde pour with fluffy head, some lacing.  Wonderful aroma of floral hops.  This beer was delectably fruity sweet and the hallertau floral-like bitter hops perfectly complemented it.  Bananas, citrus and flowers with a pleasant alcohol bite.  Heck yeah!  I need to get the other version now.

500 mL bottle.  Poured a hazy gold color with floating particles.  Poured into a dimpled mug.  Aroma was wheat and earthy/piney hops.  Flavor was citrus, slight banana and spice.  I absolutely loved this beer.  Solid wheat beer.

Cloudy, even murky, with an orange-gold color, thick white head. Rich wheat malt aroma, ahh, but with so much hop! Sweet, yeasty, banana, cloves, citrus. Never smelled anything quite like it before. Rich flavor, lots of wheat malt, sweet, with tons of bananas, alcohol, but infused with hops. Spices, lots of citrus and grapefruit. Amazingly complex. Tastes lighter than 8.2%. A very original beer that is almost but not quite perfect, very well done and tasty as hell. The hops are matched very well with the weizen. There are all kinds of fruits, and the hops really prick it up and make it less cloying than your usual weizen bock. Excellent stuff.

Pours a hazy, light gold in color.  Decent head on the pour.  Smell is wheat, but I‚Äôm getting quite a bit of clove in this as well.  You get a bit of the lemony banana flavor in the taste.  A little zing from the citrusy hops.  Decent mouthfeel and a pretty easy drinker for being 8.2%.

Bottle from Immy. Poured a murky gold, I like the yeast, its good for you, so I always throw it in. Easy drinking for an 8% brew, some banana,Hops, Citrus,and alcohol, Abit subdued for the alc% thats a plus for sure, a nice drink on a hot California night, refreshing, nice.

Bottle. Hazy and buff colored with a huge soap bubble head. Sharp and spicy citrus and bubblegum aroma. Tart, quenching, spicy and hoppy with citrus and some hints of vanilla and toasted bread. Well carbonated and full in body but still refreshing. Amazingly light in character for such a high strength beer. It has a lingering banana/citrus hop flavor that melds well with the mellow dry bitterness. This is an inspired and well executed ale.

Bottle. Hazy light amber beer with a whitish head. Nice hoppy aroma over wheat and light spice. Citrus hop flavor with wheat, spice, and light banana. Medium bodied. Lingering hops, spice, and light banana. Nice hoppy beer. It surprised me how good and enjoyable this beer is.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2010 Bottle.  Nice orange color, good head. Aroma is fruity, spicy and some hops maybe. Taste is spicy fruity, yeast, lemon and some bitterness in the aftertaste. Hoppy with some bananas. Dry as well. Smooth very easy to drink. Carbonation level is medium. No trace of the alcohol (8.2) what so ever. Overall a very enjoyable beer.

16.9 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a large, fluffy linen white head that is fed for several minutes by lots of tiny carbonation bubbles and lasts through two-thirds of the glass.  A few light-colored floaters at the bottom of the glass.  Very pleasant aroma of wheat, yeast, lemon and a bit of bubblegum. The flavor is wheat, yeast, lemon and orange.  Mildly bitter at the finish and slightly drier as well.  This is a thoroughly enjoyable summer beer, and I will be sure to be pick up a few more bottles before the summer ends.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold with medium off white head. Aroma is yeasty and somewhat hoppy and wheaty. Flavor has some alcohol, some light banana and lemon (very light) and comes to a fairly dry and lightly herbal finish. No big flavors here, except the alcohol which considering is actually strong  but well hidden at the same time. Interesting and good.

16.9 oz bottle(My bottle has different label)-Pours a murky orange with a nice tight white head. Aroma of wheat, hops, banana, and a little bit of alcohol. Taste of the same with more hops, spices, banana, and finishes with a light dryness. This medium bodied brew is very tasty and quite balanced. Can‚Äôt wait to try the 
Brooklyn version.

Bottle. Pours a clear, then hazy, then murky yellow-gold with a large mostly-lasting fizzy/frothy off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma of banana, spices, floral hops, yeast, citrus and sweet malt -- quite nice. Flavour of yeast, floral hops and alcohol (more hops and alcohol then I expected) along with spices, light banana and citrus. A decent light bitter alcoholic finish. Quite carbonated, almost too much so. Medium bodied. Very good, and quite interesting, I¬íll need to get more.

Pours hazy gold into the glass with a white head about 2 fingers thick that stays throughout.  Aroma is yeasty with some nice hop spice character coming through.  Flavor is powerful and yet delicate with nice wheat flavor and plenty of yeast.  This beer finishes nice and dry and is remarkably quenching despite its 8.2%abv.

Poured a lovely cloudy orange with a huge, lasting head. Spicy, sweet aroma. The hops are a little stronger than I would have expected - a nice surprise! Less dark malt character than the aventinus - nice and chewy and sweet, like a good barleywine except with the typical spice of a wheat beer. Good carbonation, thick body - milkshake-like! What a treat of a beer, even better than the Brooklyn-brewed sister beer. Many thanks to Ughsmash for the trade!

Poured into a Franziskaner weizen glass.  Huge off-white head froths up above the rim and leaves chunks of lacing.  Tons of sediment, mostly yeast, but some chill haze too.  Aroma is clove-dominated with some sweetbread malt, cinnamon, banana, and eggnog.  Flavor has a nice wheat malt and banana ester basis, with all kinds of spicy accents.  Obvious clove, nutmeg, and Hallertauer zestiness.  Some vanilla sweetness and citrus.  Tons of complexity, probably the deepest wheat beer I‚Äôve ever had.  Finish is dry with a light pithy bitterness that lingers.  Very drinkable for the 8.2% abv that you couldn‚Äôt have guessed was there.  Great beer.

Bottle courtesy of pivnizub ¬ó many thanks. 

Pours a very cloudy orange with a thick, long-lasting styrofoam head. Aroma jumps out of the glass, filling the room with orange blossoms: candy-store sweetness shot through with a blast of bright mint. Below is a touch of clove and Blackjack gum. In the mouth, a chewy body, unusual for a Weisse, with virtually no alcoholic heat. (It‚Äôs really 8.2 percent?) Complex layers of flavor run from vinous depths to a slightly bitter, lemon-pith finish. Very good, very brawny, perhaps lacking in nuance at this tasting.

(Bottle) Pours a muddy grayish brown colour. The aroma is floral and overripe fruity with tones of canned pineapple and some light citric tones. The flavour is sweet and light wheaty with a tropical backdrop of canned pineapple. Tiny hoppy and spicy. The mouthfeel is soft. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2010 Re-rate 12/4/10: Bottle at a tasting. Thanks Dagan. Hazy yellow. Aroma of hops, flowers, wheat, fruit esters and light spiciness. Flavor of fruits, wheat and bitter hops. Medium-bodied. Nice. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4
Re-rate 4/13/10: Bottle at a tasting. Thanks Dror. Slightly hazy golden. Aroma of wheat, some malt, fruity esters, light spiciness and hops. Sweetish wheaty flavor with caramel notes, some fruits, bread and a pleasant bitter hoppy finish. Medium-bodied. 7/3/7/4/14=3.6

Re-rate 5/18/09: Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Shachar!  Cloudy honey-orange color with a white head. Aroma of wheat, some tropical fruits, banana notes and some floral-herbal hops. Flavor has some wheat, fruits. flowery notes, citrus notes and lots of herbal hops bitterness in a lingering finish. Medium-bodied. A good refreshing beer. 7/3/7/4/15=3.6
