Flavor is crackery wheat, more of that wierd strong ester-solvents, hoppy grassy, leafy, garlic, a bit of cat-piss, - cloves in the finish.  Short aftertaste with a slight lingering bitterness.  This wasnt really pleasant, especially compared to some other impy weizens like Heavyweight, or Ramstein.  Meh.

Bottle: Pours a cloudy orange gold with a big fluffy white head that hardly moves, I¬íve got a solid inch of foam above the rim of the glass right now. Aroma, spicy, wheat, citrus, banana, yeasty. Flavor, wheat, spicy hops, some fruity notes, citrus, very smooth with some light bitterness to it. Spicy yeasty notes on the finish. This is really tasty.

Bottle pours very cloudy golden with a fluffy offwhite head that stays quite well and leaves a lot of lace.  Aromas of bannana, clove, a whole lot of yeast, and a good dose of Hallertauer hops at the back.  Full bodied for a hefe. And quite the alcoholic punch.  Easy to drink but a little warming after you finish.  Interesting and pretty tasty.  I did enjoy it..

20070801  500ml bottle.  Whoa, this is one ugly beer, a sort of sewage inspired greenish-beige, opaque, massive, speckled head of dirty beach foam (and that ain¬ít pretty).  Well, can¬ít say they ruined it with filtration!  Aroma is floral, lemony, lemongrass, ginger, mildly wheaty (banana), and mild band-aid notes.  Interesting and lively, but really it¬ís all over the place.  With temp, there¬ís some odd plasticy aroma emerging that reminds me of new carpet.  Huh.  The flavor is also hard to pin down.  At first, it seems mild, bland even, but mid-sip a smooth fruitiness butts in followed by a very nice floral/perfume/soap character that, thankfully, I ride through the swallow and into a lingering bitter finish.  The strong alcohol is very present with temp and from all angles with this stuff.  That¬ís not always a bad thing in my mind, but it¬ís not very refined either.  Decent enough stuff and worth the shot, but I won¬ít be going out of my way to spend $4 on another one.

From a 500 ml bottle, shared by joebrew, pours a hazy orange/amber brew with a thick white head the slowly dissolves to a good lacing and thin white head that has good retention. Aroma of rich, sweet yeast,  lime peel, some banana esters and grassy/pine hops. Taste is medium bodied and complex with many characters. Flavors picked up of sourdough bread, bananas, some sweet pink grapefruit, and mixed hard fruits. Finish has a slight soapy texture and a sweet grapefruit aftertaste with some lingering pine flavor. This is the first time I tried a hefeweizen with a pale ale/miild IPA character.

Both draft & bottle, ratings combined. I was really excited to go to the release of this beer at Zum. The place was packed and as approached the bar, I could see they were having typical Schneider problems with foam from the taps. After getting my serving in the proper glassware (it took a liter to get my .5 liter), the beer looks great. Upon closer inspection though, it really is 3 different beers. The first taste is just like a creamsickle. As you near the bottom, it¬ís straight up hop juice, and not in a good way. Clumps of everything abound. Now I just couldn¬ít weait for the bottled version. Although filtered a bit more than the draft, I found this to be horribly unbalanced, teetering between sweet and hops. The banana was there and not cloying, so that is good. The hops are there and too citrus juicy to be good. I¬ím guessingt if anyone had this beer without knowing who made it, the ratings wouldn¬ít be so good. I love the effort and the collaboration and really hope more brewers do this sort of thing, but this beer fell far short of the mark. Too bad.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2007 500 ml bottle from Secret Santa.  Pour is a cloudy dirty orange and yellow at the start, though when the remainder of the bottle was poured in, it took on more of a dirt brown appearance.  Big, long lasting, fluffy white head.  Aroma is bananas and cloves, yeast and some bright (zesty) hops.  An extremely fresh smelling beer.  Taste is orange citrus, wheat and a really nice citric hop bite to the finish.  Crisp, clean and super refreshing.  This just may be my new favorite Weizen.  More brewer collaboration, please.  Thanks Santa!

Pours an immensely bubbly with a huge, thick, foamy head.  Very spicy wheat aroma, alot of nutmeg, a little banana and other citrus.  The taste has a very sharp taste.  Very big wheat presence as is typical in actual German wheats.  Very bitter citrus flavor too that I thought was interesting.  Definitely quite spicy, some cinnamon and nutmeg kind of blend together to formulate the sweetness taste.  This was pretty well done.  Quite interesting, and a little different than most wheats, which was refreshing.

500ml - #800 - Aroma is pungent banana, bubblegum, clove, lemon and Euro hops.  Pours cloudy dark yellow with a big head and good lacing.  Flavor is spicy then bread dough, lemon and finishes with a healthy dose of bitter hops.  Palate is crisp and tart while still being incredibly smooth and creamy.  Unique and super tasty, this is a brew I wish was available all the time...  Hint hint

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2007 Wow this was a pleasant surprise. I¬ím not sure this is really a hefe, but don¬ít know what it should be under except wonderful. It poured dark hazy amber / copper with a dense off-white head. The aroma has sharp citrus, light banana, rich wheat, earthy yeast and a healthy dose of spicy hops. Full rich body at the beginning and then finishes thin and crisp with lively carbonation. The flavor begins with citrus, spicy hops, creamy wheat and dark toasted wheat. The finish is hoppier with a pleasing alcohol presence and a bitter / sourness aspect. This beer gets a huge thumbs up . I¬íve never tasted anything like it, but I will taste this one many times - a fantastic collaboration.

Rerate notes: After having a few on these I get more and more impressed. Very drinkable for an 8.2% beer, lots of pleasing hops and just enough of the wheat showing through to make itself known, but not overwhelming banana esters. This is quickly becoming a favorite. I¬íll be curious to see how this progresses with a little age.

Bottle. Pours a hazy burnt orange with a large off-white head that lasts leaving good lacing. Aroma of baked spiced apples, bananas, wheat, yeast, clove, bubblegum and spicy hops. Taste is dominated by harsh grassy and spicy hops at first then lends way to bananas, clove, wheat, and yeast. Medium full mouthfeel with a very harsh bitterness and slight warmth from alcohol. An amazing aroma but the flavor is covered up by young grassy hops.  Good but I wouldn¬ít buy it again.

appearance- cloudy apple cider, even cloudier. whole loota head, some lacing. aroma- fruit and bread, little apple scent. body- full feel, as expected, not as "chewy" as i would¬íve expected- think the hops evened out that wheat chew. alcohol is present but relatively hidden for 8+ %. flavor- wheat backround is minimalized by stronger hop bitterness even resin flavor than other wheats. Picture some sort of mixture betweeen a a german wheat and an APA. Main wheat flavors are present, but the subtle ones are lost. The main pale ale characters are there- hops/bitterness giving a pine flavor. even the color is a mixture- short of amber deeper than gold. All in all, i enjoyed. But I¬ím not sure if this is one i can drink a few of exclusively. But it is enjoyable to crack open one bottle and enjoy

murky greenish/brown(nasty but interesting) colored beer with a large off-white foamy head.  potent aroma of licorice, spices, banana, pink bubblegum and clove.  flavor is of banana, gum, and very unripe green hops that impart a biting bitter quality i¬ím not used to.  full bodied.  hint of alcohol in finish.  different than your usual hefe.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy light orange tinged gold with a soft head on top.  Nose is vanilla scented tropicalfruits with hops.  Flavor is very hoppy which dominates the weizen profile.  There is some unspiced banana bread here as well.  Nice creamy mouthfeel.  I was excited about trying this beer and I guess my expectations fell a bit short.  For me, less hops would have been more pleasing, but still enjoyed.

Luminescent orange pour of a thick and crazy haze.  Brilliant tropical nose of guava, golden kiwi and pineapple gets boozy and develops a canned attitude with a little warmth.  Tastes of green apple gum and cotton candy, bananas foster and esters.  A little toffee at the end.  Alcohol powers through with a sweet, vanilla vodka strength.  Dry hops finish with a resinous bite that meshes well with everything previous.  Ever so slight in cloying sweetness, more obvious for hotness.  Bombastic thickness of palate.  A bit much.  Refreshing and undeniably interesting, but far from perfect.

I¬ím not a big fan of any weisse beer, but I have found ONE that is indeed exceptional.  The nose on this is fantastic with a bit of cloves at the tail end of the nose but definately not too much.  I have never seen a color on beer quite like this, its a cloudy cocoa or mud like character.  It seems thin but does have quite a big dose of alc in it.  The hop character shows throughout and basically overpowers the clove taste that comes in at the end.  Good Beer!!

Bottle from pantanap; Nose of wheat, a bit of tartness, banana esters, spices, and some light hops; very cloudy yellowish gold with a big, but quick disappating goldish-white head; flavor is grainy yeast, hop bitterness, banana, peppery spices, and lemon. Great and different hefe!

Pours a light brown color into the Aventinus weizen glass.  The head formed a thick two inches, and was a thing of beauty.  The scent was a nice balance of hops and wheat with notes of citrus, grassy tones.  The taste was very complex with flavors flying all around.  The highlights were yeast, bread, wheat, citrusy hops and some nutmeg.  Perfect mouthfeel and finish.  German hefewiezens are not my favorite style, but this was tremendous.  I absolutely loved this beer.

Pours an unbel;ievably murky and hazy dark brownish color, with a huge head.  Great banana, clove, grapefruit, citrus, yeasty almost farmhouse like fuky spicyness on the nose.  Great creamy and carbonated mouthfeel with a nice dose of white pepper, as well as some banana, plenty of funky spicy grassiness, brown sugar and so much more.  This is a killer summer beer, packed with flavor, and super complex.  So complex that the 8 plus ABV is very well hidden, and could be dangerous.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: 500mL bottle.  Pours a murky brown color with a yellowish tinge; gorgeous, fluffy off-white head with perfect retention and lacing; a beautiful pour (to be expected from these fine folks).  Generous, grassy and herbal hop notes in the aroma, coupled with an ester and chewy malt base (overripe fruit and Belgian sugar); excellent combination of hops and hefeweizen character.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: dense, chewy clove and ester core, with a creamy banana presence and plenty of herbal / grassy hops lining the perimeter; perfect use of hops to accentuate what is already a wonderful thing.  My wife: "can we buy a lot of this?"  Lengthy, chewy clove and herbal finish.  I didn¬ít want this bottle to end.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2007 Pours with lots of carbonation and head.  Dirty looking beer: light brown and cloudy, looks like a chemistry experiment gone wrong. A spicy yet citric aroma, there is a lot of hop aroma here. Flavor has nutmeg and spicy wheat upfront with a big hop flavor afterwards. Very dry finish leaving a bitter taste behind. Reminds me of the Bells Wheat Project. Some mellowing may help this.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2009 Strong nutmeg and cinnamon aroma, banana¬ís and citrus, with some clove.  Pours cloudy dark orange with a HUGE fluffy white head.  So smooth, great citrus wheat flavor, yeasty, clove and nutmeg, a strong hop presence, more than you¬íd find in a hefeweizen normally, hints of some caramel and brown sugar hidden in there.  Pretty meaty, hefty beer, filling.  This is one the best hefeweizens i¬íve ever had.  Normally i¬íd go for a Schneider Edel-Weisse but this has all my favorite aspects of that beer, just X2.  Great Beer!

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2007 bottle from Liquor Outlet.  very hazy orange in color with a gigantic, swiss cheese like off white head.  Aroma is very hoppy, with spicy, citrus, banana, and light spice notes.  I also get hefe yeast, bread, and light suggestions of wheat in the nose.  Taste is also very hop forward- with floral, perfumy citrus and spicy hops intertwined with banana esters, and alot of wheat.  Hops contribute flavor and not that much bitterness.  Flavors become a bit muddled. Some moderate alcohol warm in the finish,not well hidden.  Body is medium to full, still somewhat refreshing although the alcohol is so high on this beer.  Pretty good, aroma is definitely much nicer than the flavor.

Cloudy, foamy weizen pour has a dark copper color and a rich fruity nose that is rounded out by floral hoppiness.  Palate is well-carbonated and approaching full-bodiness.  Flavor is an excellent pairing of the two styles with the wheat banana and clove upfront, subsiding into a lemony tartness, before a full-on hoppy dry finish.  This brew is a great concept and it appears to be nearly flawless in execution. I am partial to both styles and they are wonderfully blended in the hopfen-weisse.

Pours a lighter copper color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of spices, citrus, slight banana, caramel, sweet malts, and just a little bit of alcohol.  An extremely good aroma.  Light on the palate with citrus, nutmeg, and banana up front.  Finishes with a little hop character and some alcohol warming.  A truely amazing hefe.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2008 Bottle.  Hazy orange-gold color with a foamy white head. Nice aroma - somewhere between a hefeweizen and a triple.  It¬ís got a lot more complexity than a the average hefe.  Good full flavor, but light also.  I can¬ít believe it has 8% alcohol.  Really nice beer.  Rerate - much more floral than I remember.  Fresh and clean, but rich at the same time.  Well brewed.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2007 500 Ml Bottle-Hazy orange color w/a moderate white foamy head. This stuff was quite a combo, hard to compare it to anything else I¬íve ever had. Has a strong hop aroma, but the flavor is of a light floral hop & it mixes surprisingly well with the evedent Hefe flavors of bread dough/yeast, citrus, lime, & banana. You can taste them both in there along w/some flavors of apricott/figs, orange peel, & colander. Full, rich, chewy flavor; very complex w/some good carbonation. Had a lot going on & it all worked well. Very refreshing & easy to drink; alcohol was well hidden. This one¬ís a winner!

500 ml. bottle.  Poured a cloudy, almost murky amber/light brown color, like a bruised apple, with a misbehaved frothy, rocky head.  Rich yeasty aroma--banana, even some cream cheese, on top of shortbread/pastry malt, pear,  and pungent grassy hops.  Flavor at first sip was overwhelmingly boozy, though it settled down a bit to reveal an off-sweet golden muffin/quick bread malt character with a good dose of banana/cheese yeast and associated spice, some general fruit salad notes, and finishing with a pleasantly bitter and snappy vegetal hoppiness- like a raw green bell pepper.  Full yeasty mouthfeel, but lively carbonation also.  Struck me at first as a little "over the top" for a HW. I can¬ít stop thinking "this really doesn¬ít belong in my weizen glass."   However, I did think the "Heavy Weizen" by Southern Tier was really good, and I can¬ít stay too mad at any hop-loaded strong beer, even an experimental style-buster like this. I¬ím looking so forward to the complimentary Brooklyn/stateside version of this one!

An interesting concept, and a heavy, wonderful aroma coming off of this.  However, I don¬ít think I would buy it again.  There¬ís severe complexity going on here, and it just seemed a bit too much.  A good beer -- and damnit I do love those beers from Brooklyn -- but maybe best paired with a meal to bring out the full flavor.  Otherwise, it didn¬ít inspire me to finish the glass.

Wow only 9 ratings for this beer.  Must be fresh and new.  Pour is murky yellow-brown with a huge white head.  Aroma is floral with lots of piney hops and some pepper.  Flavor is more corrandier with some barnyard and clove.  Pleasing all the sences this is one to look for.  Probably the highest ABV for a hefe you will ever find but that does not get in the way of this wonderful liquid.

This ones a looker here. A big fluffy pillow head that is a thing of beauty. The nose is phenolic and hoppy. The palate is light considering this beers strength, but packed with exotic flavors, like banana and orange. I really dig the airy drinkability, much like champagne. Nice stuff, with a hoppy finish. It is the bomb.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 500 mL Bottle... the very first bottle tasted in Charlottesville, VA (which simply means I had lucky timing). Cloudy, orange-ish amber color with very large and long-lasting head. Aroma is pleasantly sweet... fruity, bubble-gum (in a good way). Taste is very hoppy and pepper, with some sweetness in the background. Finished smoother than is starts. Yeast is very much understated compared to Schneider¬ís solo Hefeweizen effort. Excellent beer.  Rerate 5.6.08 as part of a "vertical" with the Brooklyn version. Bottle from WFM Charlottesville. Dark hazy yellow with a medium/small head and good head retention. Aroma of citrus, stone fruit, honey, yeast and hops. Taste is wheat, yeast, banana and bubblegum. Damn good.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2007 Pours very murky yellowish-brown with a large foamy tan head. Huge aroma of fresh grassy/piny (almost perfume like) hops, with floral and fruity esters, lots of spice, noticeable alcohol, and just a hint of banana peel. Flavor is doughy upfront with very herbal (mint/basil) hops hitting mid-palate and lasting through the finish. Soft citrus zest throughout, leading to a bitter and spicy finish. Palate is medium, softly effervescent, warming but slightly prickly alcohol in the back of the throat, with a slight white pepper burn, a bit of clove, and grassy bitterness lingering though the very long finish.

On tap at Zum Schneider. Hazy yellow golden in color with a nice fluffy white head. Very hoppy and malty aroma. Citrusy, floral, banana and spicy clove notes.  Malty and hoppy flavor. Rich tasting. Fruity peppery notes. Finish is bitter. Sweet.  Medium bodied. Very nice. Drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2012 500 ml bottle.  Cloudy yellow-brown pour with a thick white head.  The aroma is fantastic... fresh noble hops with zesty citrus, flowers and herbs and a soft dankness set against wheaty citrus acidity, banana, melon and a soft clove and bubble gum character.  I could smell this beer all day.  A touch of black pepper that  becomes much more prominent as the beer warms up.  Flavour is of fresh wheaty spice, herbal/floral hops.  Rich texture, black pepper and soft clove/banana in back of all the hops.  Cotton candy/bubble gum sweetness as well.  You¬íll have to drink this one fresh because I don¬ít think the hop character will hold up for long, but it¬ís pretty awesome right now.  Alcohol is pretty evident, especially as the beer warms up a bit, but I¬íve got no complaints right now.

I¬íve had this so many time now and every time I find something else that I absolutely love about it.  Might be one of my favourites and is something that I¬íll pick up every single time I see it.  Other than the excessive muddiness of the pour there¬ís nothing I could imagine that would improve it.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2007 Insanely hopped for a hefeweizen, or even for any beer - smells like, in the immortal words of duff, pencil shavings and flowers, deeply, deeply concentrated. The foam touched my lips and it had the tingling of a hallertau bomb. Mmmm MMMM! Whoa, with the first sip the clash of a bit of sweet cotton candy and hoppy rings out at you, slightly bubblegum and huge clove from the yeast, with an amazing noble hop punch. Incredible inventive, unlike any beer I have ever tried. Flat out dry, yet with that cotton candy sweetness. This beer is a true chimera. Body, while cold, is extremely fizzy, and no traces of thickness (referring to mj¬ís post).
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2015 bottle at the brewery, 2015, it smells like acetone and dirty and rotting fruit with lingering off-notes of yeast / paint.  horribly dirty beer.

Ultra hazy dark gold, monster foamy off-white head.  Hopped up nose of peppery flroals and juicy citrus that sit on subdued waves of banana,vanilla clove, and the slightest hint of pear.  Flavor follows suit with more peppery citric hop tones that softly mingle with fruity banana and clove notes.  Medium bodied, prickly carbonation, drying bitter finish.  Wish more of the wheat character had been present, but otherwise a well made experiment....

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2007 Rating after two bottles: Pour was a paler shade of amber, not quite golden, nice initial head, darned hard to get this bottle into my Schneider Weizen glass, foam sucking required to do the job. Hazy body, pretty good lacing, although not among the best. The aroma was interesting, floral, resinous, weedy, grassy, phenolic. Flavor was like one might expect for a beer that builds off of a style not known for hopping and requiring some love and care to create a nice higher octane version: a little over the top on the hops. The fruity esters get killed in this beer by the uber hopping used, really making the wheaty aspects difficult to discern. The base malt is almost pilsner like with a touch of the wheat (or even rye, I could have believed) bitterness, firm noble hopping presence, floral notes, grass and weeds, dandelions, other resinous type hops (yet short of piney!), phenolic yeast biproducts. Alcohol is very soft, done nicely in that regard. Body is full, very grand indeed, enjoyable, hearty, a nice evening drink. If you like hefeweizens and uber/imperial pilsners, you¬íll dig this. Unfortunately, the imperial/strong aspects do drown out some of the finer gentle aspects of the hefe, which I do enjoy quite a bit normally. Great job, Brooklyn/Schneider, you accomplished what you targeted, just didn¬ít work for me personally. The imperial, double, uber Americans over here may dig it just for its boldness, however!
